original: @1b # // da ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyur lus bsrung ba'i man ngag gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: @1b # // da ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyur lus bsrung ba'i man ngag gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the esoteric instructions for protecting the body as the cause of mundane and transcendent feats are stated beginning with ‚Äúfirst,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'khor ba 'dir sems can rnams kyi lus la srog dang thur sel sdud pa'i rim pas 'byung bar 'gyur zhing skyed pa'i rim pas rab tu 'jug pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi dbang mdor bstan pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dir sems can rnams kyi lus la srog dang thur sel sdud pa'i rim pas 'byung bar 'gyur zhing skyed pa'i rim pas rab tu 'jug pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi dbang mdor bstan pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Just as the life-force and evacuative winds of sentient beings arise in the body in this world through the process of gathering and enter through the process of generation, in the same way, the BhagavƒÅn stated in the Concise Explanation of the Empowerment of the Root Tantra:üîΩIn the navel, lotus, heart, throat,

original: lte ba'i padma snying mgrin dang // dpral ba gtsug tor 'dam skyes la //
analyzed: lte ba'i padma snying mgrin dang // dpral ba gtsug tor 'dam skyes la //
translated: forehead, and crown lotuses,

original: sa chu me rlung stong pa rnams //
analyzed: sa chu me rlung stong pa rnams //
translated: earth, water, fire, wind, and space

original: sdud pas rab tu 'bab pa ni //
analyzed: sdud pas rab tu 'bab pa ni //
translated: are gathered and descend.üîΩThat which arises is entry,

original: 'byung 'gyur de ni 'jug pa dag / skyed pas 'jug ste sa la'o //
analyzed: 'byung 'gyur de ni 'jug pa dag / skyed pas 'jug ste sa la'o //
translated: and that which is generated is entry into the earth.

original: de bzhin du thur sel gyi nus pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du thur sel gyi nus pa ni /
translated: In the same way, the power of the evacuative wind

original: lte gsang nor bu'i chu skyes la //
analyzed: lte gsang nor bu'i chu skyes la //
translated: is in the lotuses of the navel, secret place, and jewel.üîΩThe body, speech, and mind descend,

original: lus ngang sems ni 'bab pa dag /'byung ba dang ni 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: lus ngang sems ni 'bab pa dag /'byung ba dang ni 'jug pa ste //
translated: arising and entering.

original: sdud dang skyed pa'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: sdud dang skyed pa'i rang bzhin can //
translated: The nature of the gathering and generation.

original: zhes so // rgyu de'i phyir dang por mtha' dag rgyal ba'i lus te phung po lnga la sogs pa'i lus ni dngos grub rgyu ru sngags pa dag gis yang dag bsrung bar bya ste /üîΩlus med na ni dngos grub med cing skye ba 'di la mchog gi bde ba ste zag pa med pa'i bde ba thob @2a * //
analyzed: zhes so // rgyu de'i phyir dang por mtha' dag rgyal ba'i lus te phung po lnga la sogs pa'i lus ni dngos grub rgyu ru sngags pa dag gis yang dag bsrung bar bya ste / lus med na ni dngos grub med cing skye ba 'di la mchog gi bde ba ste zag pa med pa'i bde ba thob @2a * //
translated: For that reason, first of all, the entire body of the Victor, that is, the body of the five aggregates, and so on, is to be properly protected by the mantrin as the cause of power.

original: par 'gyur pa 'ang med /
analyzed: par 'gyur pa 'ang med /
translated: If there is no body, there is no power, and there is no attainment of the supreme bliss, that is, the uncontaminated bliss, in this life.

original: de phyir lus kyi don gyi rgyur ni ste lus kyi don zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems te de bsrung ba'i rgyur ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su rtsa yi sbyor ba bsgom par bya /üîΩla la n'a dang ra sa n'a dag gi sbyor ba ni rtsa'i sbyor ba ste srog gi rlung dbu mar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de phyir lus kyi don gyi rgyur ni ste lus kyi don zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems te de bsrung ba'i rgyur ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su rtsa yi sbyor ba bsgom par bya / la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dag gi sbyor ba ni rtsa'i sbyor ba ste srog gi rlung dbu mar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of the body, that is, for the sake of the body, which is the bodhicitta, the yogas of the channels should be cultivated at each juncture of the day in order to protect the bodhicitta.üîΩThe yoga of lalanƒÅ and rasanƒÅ is the yoga of the channels, which is to cultivate the life-force wind in the central channel.

original: bshang ba dang gci ba'i rtsa'i sbyor ba thur sel ni dung can mar ro //
analyzed: bshang ba dang gci ba'i rtsa'i sbyor ba thur sel ni dung can mar ro //
translated: The yoga of the channels of feces and urine is the downward-voiding wind in the ≈õa·πÖkhinƒ´.

original: nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su dus sbyor bcu gnyis su rtsa'i sbyor ba 'di bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su dus sbyor bcu gnyis su rtsa'i sbyor ba 'di bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on this yoga of the channels in the twelve two-hour periods of the day and night.

original: 'di bsgoms pas lus 'grub ste lus grub par gyur na gzhan pa'i dngos grub 'jig rten pa mngag gzhug nyid du rab tu 'gyur ro zhes pa ste 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di bsgoms pas lus 'grub ste lus grub par gyur na gzhan pa'i dngos grub 'jig rten pa mngag gzhug nyid du rab tu 'gyur ro zhes pa ste 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: By meditating on this, the body is accomplished. When the body is accomplished, the other worldly accomplishments become the servant.

original: da ni stong pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i lam gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni stong pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i lam gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúemptiness,‚Äù he declares the path for accomplishing the supramundane accomplishments.

original: 'dir stong pa la ni du ba sogs lam bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas gzugs brnyan mtshams su bsgom par bya //üîΩgzugs brnyan ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs brnyan te de'i mthar thug par bsam mo //
analyzed: 'dir stong pa la ni du ba sogs lam bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas gzugs brnyan mtshams su bsgom par bya // gzugs brnyan ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs brnyan te de'i mthar thug par bsam mo //
translated: Here, in emptiness, one should meditate on the image at the end by the power of the stages of the path of smoke, etc., as will be explained.

original: mtshams de nas rtsa yi 'khor lo rnams su srog dang thur sel rlung ni brtan pa dag kyang byed pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams de nas rtsa yi 'khor lo rnams su srog dang thur sel rlung ni brtan pa dag kyang byed pa ste /
translated: The image is the image of all aspects. One should imagine that at the end of that, the winds of life and downward-voiding are stabilized in the channel cakras.

original: lte ba'i 'khor lo la rnal 'byor pas so //
analyzed: lte ba'i 'khor lo la rnal 'byor pas so //
translated: The yogi should do this at the navel cakra.

original: phyi nas zla ba @2b nges par 'gog pa ni gza' bzhin zhes pa sgra gcan bzhin du byed de /
analyzed: phyi nas zla ba @2b nges par 'gog pa ni gza' bzhin zhes pa sgra gcan bzhin du byed de /
translated: Then, the yogi should block the moon, like RƒÅhu, the moon‚Äôs enemy.

original: byang chub sems ni rnal 'byor pa yis so //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni rnal 'byor pa yis so //
translated: The yogi should block the bodhicitta.

original: srog dang thur sel dag phan tshun yang dag par sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor te de gang la yod pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang thur sel dag phan tshun yang dag par sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor te de gang la yod pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The union of the life and downward-voiding vƒÅyus is yoga. One who has that is a yogi.

original: byang chub sems ni 'pho ba'i skad cig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni 'pho ba'i skad cig go //
translated: Bodhicitta is the moment of transference.

original: 'gog pa ni nye bar zhi ba ste rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa 'gyur pa med par byed do //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni nye bar zhi ba ste rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa 'gyur pa med par byed do //
translated: Blocking is pacification. It is the cause of the absence of change.üîΩThen, whatever is desired arises in a few days.

original: de nas gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa dag ces pa ni rgyu mthun pa de las rnam par smin pa dang skyes bu byed pa dang dri ma med pa gang cung zad brjod par bya ba ma yin pa 'dod pa de ni nyin zhag 'ga' yis skye ba
analyzed: de nas gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa dag ces pa ni rgyu mthun pa de las rnam par smin pa dang skyes bu byed pa dang dri ma med pa gang cung zad brjod par bya ba ma yin pa 'dod pa de ni nyin zhag 'ga' yis skye ba
translated: Whatever is desired from that natural state‚Äîthe result of karmic ripening, the result of conscious effort, and the stainless‚Äîwhatever is not to be expressed arises in a few days.

original: 'di la thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di la thob par 'gyur /
translated: It will be obtained in this life.

original: nyin zhag 'ga' ni lo gsum dang phyogs gsum gyi dus kyi 'khor lo'i nyin zhag rnams te de dag gis so //
analyzed: nyin zhag 'ga' ni lo gsum dang phyogs gsum gyi dus kyi 'khor lo'i nyin zhag rnams te de dag gis so //
translated: Some days and nights are the days and nights of the Wheel of Time, which is three years and three half-months.

original: stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pas sbyangs pa'i phung po 'di dag gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pas sbyangs pa'i phung po 'di dag gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these heaps of purification through the liberations of emptiness and so forth, one attains the power of the Great Seal.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i lam gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i lam gyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the path for achieving the power of the Great Seal.

original: da ni nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pas dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba bslu ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pas dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba bslu ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to explain the deception of untimely death, he says day, etc.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid mthong ba de'i tshe nyi ma zla ba 'og pa ni g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i rtsa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid mthong ba de'i tshe nyi ma zla ba 'og pa ni g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i rtsa 'gog pa'o //
translated: Here, when the yogi sees the characteristics of untimely death, then the sun and moon are the left and right channels, which are blocked.

original: mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa la ste zhes pa ni sdud pa dang skyed pa'i bgrod pa la'o //
analyzed: mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa la ste zhes pa ni sdud pa dang skyed pa'i bgrod pa la'o //
translated: On the even and uneven paths means on the paths of gathering and giving birth.

original: dbu ma me la zhes pa ni sgra gcan dus med dbu ma'i rtsa la rab tu zhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: dbu ma me la zhes pa ni sgra gcan dus med dbu ma'i rtsa la rab tu zhugs par bya'o //
translated: The middle fire means that RƒÅhu should enter the middle channel, which is the time of the middle.

original: srog dang thur sel gnyis po dag kyang nyin zhag dang po song na ste dbu ma rab tu 'bab pa nyin zhag gcig song par gyur na /
analyzed: srog dang thur sel gnyis po dag kyang nyin zhag dang po song na ste dbu ma rab tu 'bab pa nyin zhag gcig song par gyur na /
translated: Also, the life and downward winds, having gone for one day,

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dus min 'chi ba bslu par 'gyur ro //üîΩsrog gis gang bar byas nas te dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa dbu ma'i sbyor ba'i srog gis lag pa dang bcas rkang pa'i mthe bo'i tshigs dang sen mo'i mthar gang bar byas nas gtsug tor la sogs pa'i 'khor lo drug la sangs rgyas lha mo 'jigs med lag
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dus min 'chi ba bslu par 'gyur ro // srog gis gang bar byas nas te dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa dbu ma'i sbyor ba'i srog gis lag pa dang bcas rkang pa'i mthe bo'i tshigs dang sen mo'i mthar gang bar byas nas gtsug tor la sogs pa'i 'khor lo drug la sangs rgyas lha mo 'jigs med lag
translated: the yogi/nis will deceive untimely death.

original: pa'i padma rnal 'byor pas ni bsgom par bya ste 'chang par 'gyur pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: pa'i padma rnal 'byor pas ni bsgom par bya ste 'chang par 'gyur pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Having filled with the life [wind], that is, having filled the five chakras with the life [wind] of the union of the central channel, together with the hand, up to the ankle and toe joints and the tips of the nails, the yogi/nis should meditate on the six chakras, such as the crown, with the goddesses of the buddhas, such as Locana, and so on, in the lotus of the hand, by the process of holding.

original: dus ma yin par 'chi ba bslu ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'chi ba bslu ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty of deceiving untimely death.

original: da ni thur sel zhes pa la sogs pas rlung nad la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni thur sel zhes pa la sogs pas rlung nad la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to state the pacification of wind disorders and so on, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares the downward-voiding [wind] and so on.

original: 'dir lus la lte ba dang gsang ba na sngar brjod pa rlung gis skyon byed pa'i rtsa brgyad cu ste de dag khams mnyam pa nyid byed pa'i slad du thur sel bskum na 'dod pa @3a * //
analyzed: 'dir lus la lte ba dang gsang ba na sngar brjod pa rlung gis skyon byed pa'i rtsa brgyad cu ste de dag khams mnyam pa nyid byed pa'i slad du thur sel bskum na 'dod pa @3a * //
translated: Here, in the navel and secret places of the body, there are eighty channels that cause the faults of wind. In order to equalize the elements, if the downward-voiding [wind] is contracted, it becomes desire.

original: zhes pa bde ba byed par 'gyur te sngags pa rnams kyis rlung gi nad gzir ba la sogs pa ma lus dag la'o //
analyzed: zhes pa bde ba byed par 'gyur te sngags pa rnams kyis rlung gi nad gzir ba la sogs pa ma lus dag la'o //
translated: This is the creation of bliss, for all the yogis in order to conquer the diseases of wind and so forth.

original: de bzhin du dpral ba dang gtsug tor la bad kan gyi skyon byed pa'i rtsa nyi shu ste de dag khams mnyam pa nyid byed pa'i slad du srog rtsol 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpral ba dang gtsug tor la bad kan gyi skyon byed pa'i rtsa nyi shu ste de dag khams mnyam pa nyid byed pa'i slad du srog rtsol 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, in the forehead and crown, there are twenty channels that cause the faults of phlegm. In order to equalize the elements, if the life [wind] is desired,

original: bad kan la 'gyur zhes pa ni bad kan gyi nad skyes par gyur pa na rnal 'byor pas srog dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: bad kan la 'gyur zhes pa ni bad kan gyi nad skyes par gyur pa na rnal 'byor pas srog dgag par bya'o //
translated: it becomes phlegm. When the disease of phlegm arises, the yogi should block the life [wind].

original: slar yang de dag gtong ba ma mkhris pa dag gi skyon la'o zhes pa ni mkhris pa'i nyes pa skyes par gyur pa na srog dang zur sel de dag phyi rol du gtang bar bya ste 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas phyi rol gyi rlung sh'i ta ces
analyzed: slar yang de dag gtong ba ma mkhris pa dag gi skyon la'o zhes pa ni mkhris pa'i nyes pa skyes par gyur pa na srog dang zur sel de dag phyi rol du gtang bar bya ste 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas phyi rol gyi rlung sh'i ta ces
translated: Again, one should expel them, in the case of the faults of bile.

original: pas gzung nas lce chung la lce bkod cing sdu ka la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi btung bar bya ste mkhris pa'i nad mtha' dag la'o //
analyzed: pas gzung nas lce chung la lce bkod cing sdu ka la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi btung bar bya ste mkhris pa'i nad mtha' dag la'o //
translated: When the faults of bile arise, one should expel those life and evacuative [winds] externally, by means of the procedure to be explained, and having grasped the external wind called ≈õa·π≠a, one should place the tongue on the uvula and drink the nectar of su·∏• and so forth, in the case of all illnesses of bile.

original: rtsa ni mgrin pa dang snying ga la mkhris pa'i skyon byed pa bzhi bcu ste de dag khams mnyam pa nyid byed pa'i slad du sbyor ba de bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ni mgrin pa dang snying ga la mkhris pa'i skyon byed pa bzhi bcu ste de dag khams mnyam pa nyid byed pa'i slad du sbyor ba de bya'o //
translated: There are forty channels in the throat and heart that create the faults of bile. One should perform that procedure in order to create the equilibrium of the humors.

original: steng dang 'og ni yang dag 'gog pa bde ba byed par 'gyur te 'dus pa dag dang rims la yang zhes pa ni 'dir gsang ba la 'dus pa byed pa'i rtsa bcu ste de dag khams mnyam pa nyid byed pa'i slad du steng dang 'og srog dang thur
analyzed: steng dang 'og ni yang dag 'gog pa bde ba byed par 'gyur te 'dus pa dag dang rims la yang zhes pa ni 'dir gsang ba la 'dus pa byed pa'i rtsa bcu ste de dag khams mnyam pa nyid byed pa'i slad du steng dang 'og srog dang thur
translated: The upper and lower are blocked, and one becomes happy.üîΩThe ten nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s that perform the secret union are the ten nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s. In order to balance the elements, the upper and lower prƒÅ·πáa and apƒÅna are blocked.

original: sel dag 'gog par 'dod de rims la yang 'dod do //
analyzed: sel dag 'gog par 'dod de rims la yang 'dod do //
translated: The upper and lower are blocked, and one becomes happy.

original: rgyu ci'i phyir zhe na gang zhig lte ba'i steng du srog gi rlung 'bab pa de las mtha' dag nad 'phrog ste /
analyzed: rgyu ci'i phyir zhe na gang zhig lte ba'i steng du srog gi rlung 'bab pa de las mtha' dag nad 'phrog ste /
translated: Why is that? The prƒÅ·πáa vƒÅyu that moves above the navel seizes all illnesses.

original: lte ba'i rtsa bar thur sel 'bab pas lte ba'i 'og tu nad mtha' dag 'phrog ste gzhan pa dag kyang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i rtsa bar thur sel 'bab pas lte ba'i 'og tu nad mtha' dag 'phrog ste gzhan pa dag kyang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: Since the apƒÅna vƒÅyu moves to the navel, it seizes all illnesses below the navel.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the section on the certainty of pacifying vƒÅyu and so on.

original: da ni bskum ste zhes pa la sogs pas lto ba'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i tsho ga'i man ngag gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bskum ste zhes pa la sogs pas lto ba'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i tsho ga'i man ngag gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to explain the intimate instruction of the section on pacifying stomach illnesses, [the text] says ‚Äúcontracted,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe lto bar dmu chu la sogs par gyur na de'i tshe bskum ste thur sel rlung ni 'og tu rnam pa gsum gyis lam du bgrod pa dag ces pa bshad ba dang gci ba dang khu ba'i lam du bgrong ba dag dang /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe lto bar dmu chu la sogs par gyur na de'i tshe bskum ste thur sel rlung ni 'og tu rnam pa gsum gyis lam du bgrod pa dag ces pa bshad ba dang gci ba dang khu ba'i lam du bgrong ba dag dang /
translated: Here, when ascites and so on occur in the abdomen, then the downward expelling wind is contracted and moves in the three paths below, that is, in the paths of feces, urine and semen.

original: srog nyid steng nas kyang bskum par bya ste bla ba dang nyi ma dang me'i lam du bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: srog nyid steng nas kyang bskum par bya ste bla ba dang nyi ma dang me'i lam du bgrod pa'o //
translated: The life force itself is contracted from above and moves in the paths of the head, sun and fire.

original: ji srid de dag yang dag phrad de me ni zhes pa lte ba'i me stobs dang ldan zhing lus kun la ni khyab par 'gyur pa 'di ni dmu chu skran dang gzhang 'brum nad rnams dag kyang ste chu'i lto ba la sogs pa rnams zla ba'i sbyor basüîΩ'joms pa ste /
analyzed: ji srid de dag yang dag phrad de me ni zhes pa lte ba'i me stobs dang ldan zhing lus kun la ni khyab par 'gyur pa 'di ni dmu chu skran dang gzhang 'brum nad rnams dag kyang ste chu'i lto ba la sogs pa rnams zla ba'i sbyor bas 'joms pa ste /
translated: As long as they meet correctly, the fire, that is, the fire of the navel, becomes powerful and pervades the entire body. This destroys ascites, tumors and hemorrhoids, that is, the diseases of the abdomen and so on.

original: dbugs lud dang ni @3b glo dang rnam pa gsum gyi dug brtan pa dang g-yo ba dang bcos ma dang / mig gi nad la sogs pa ste mgo bo'i nad kyang 'joms so //
analyzed: dbugs lud dang ni @3b glo dang rnam pa gsum gyi dug brtan pa dang g-yo ba dang bcos ma dang / mig gi nad la sogs pa ste mgo bo'i nad kyang 'joms so //
translated: It also destroys the three types of cough, asthma and poison, that is, stable, moving and artificial, and eye diseases and so on, that is, diseases of the head.

original: lto ba'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: lto ba'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: It is certain that the disease of the belly is completely pacified.

original: da ni mchan khung zhes pa la sogs pas 'chi ltas bslu ba'i slad du rtsa 'ching ba'i bcing ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni mchan khung zhes pa la sogs pas 'chi ltas bslu ba'i slad du rtsa 'ching ba'i bcing ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to deceive the signs of death, he explains the binding of the channels with the binding of the armpits, and so on.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas dbu mar nyin mtshan du srog gnas par ma nus na /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas dbu mar nyin mtshan du srog gnas par ma nus na /
translated: Here, when the yogi is unable to keep the life-force in the central channel day and night,

original: de'i tshe brjod pa'i bcing pa 'dis g-yon pa'i 'chi ltas la g-yas par srog rgyu bar byed cing g-yas pa'i 'chi ltas la g-yon pa rgyu bar byed pa zla ba phyed dang zla ba gcig gi bar du'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe brjod pa'i bcing pa 'dis g-yon pa'i 'chi ltas la g-yas par srog rgyu bar byed cing g-yas pa'i 'chi ltas la g-yon pa rgyu bar byed pa zla ba phyed dang zla ba gcig gi bar du'o //
translated: then, by this binding that is described, the life-force moves in the right channel of the left signs of death, and the life-force moves in the left channel of the right signs of death, for half a month or a month.

original: mchan khung g-yas nas g-yas min las ni nu ma dag kyang stobs ldan mnan te srog ni bkag pa las //
analyzed: mchan khung g-yas nas g-yas min las ni nu ma dag kyang stobs ldan mnan te srog ni bkag pa las //
translated: Having pressed the right breast from the right armpit, which is not the left, the life-force is blocked.

original: nu ma g-yas pa mnan pas g-yon pa'i rtsar 'bab cing mchan khung g-yon nas mnan pas g-yas pa'i rtsar 'bab po //
analyzed: nu ma g-yas pa mnan pas g-yon pa'i rtsar 'bab cing mchan khung g-yon nas mnan pas g-yas pa'i rtsar 'bab po //
translated: By pressing the right breast, the life-force moves in the left channel, and by pressing the left armpit, the life-force moves in the right channel.

original: de ltar zla ba phyed kyis kyang ni 'chi ster 'chi ltas 'phrog ste rnal 'byor ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa yis so zhes pa la rnal 'byor ni dgang ba dang dbyung ba dag gcig pa bum pa can te de dang ldan pa ni rnal 'byor ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zla ba phyed kyis kyang ni 'chi ster 'chi ltas 'phrog ste rnal 'byor ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa yis so zhes pa la rnal 'byor ni dgang ba dang dbyung ba dag gcig pa bum pa can te de dang ldan pa ni rnal 'byor ldan pa'o //
translated: Yoga is the unification of the inhalation and exhalation, the vase-breathing. Endowed with that is the yogi who is endowed with yoga.

original: 'phrog pa ni sel bar byed do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'phrog pa ni sel bar byed do zhes pa ste /
translated: Taking away is removing.

original: dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba bslu ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba bslu ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for deceiving untimely death.

original: da ni rgyab kyi zug rdu 'joms par byed pa gsungs pa rdo rje skyil krung du gnas rkang pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: da ni rgyab kyi zug rdu 'joms par byed pa gsungs pa rdo rje skyil krung du gnas rkang pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Now, he says the destroyer of the pain of the back, standing with the legs crossed in the vajra posture.

original: rdo rje skyil krung ni brla g-yas pa'i steng du rkang pa g-yon pa dang blag g-yon pa'i steng du rkang pa g-yas pa ste rkang pa de dag rgyab tu gnas pa'i dpung pa rdo rje bcings pa'i lag pa g-yon gyis rkang pa g-yon pa bzung zhing g-yas kyis
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung ni brla g-yas pa'i steng du rkang pa g-yon pa dang blag g-yon pa'i steng du rkang pa g-yas pa ste rkang pa de dag rgyab tu gnas pa'i dpung pa rdo rje bcings pa'i lag pa g-yon gyis rkang pa g-yon pa bzung zhing g-yas kyis
translated: The vajra posture is the left leg on top of the right thigh, and the right leg on top of the left thigh. Those legs are placed behind, and the left hand, which is a hand bound in the vajra fist, holds the left leg, and the right

original: rkang pa g-yas pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas pa'o //
translated: holds the right leg.

original: rkang pa de dag bzung ba lag pa'i padmo dag ni rgyab kyi zug rdul 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: rkang pa de dag bzung ba lag pa'i padmo dag ni rgyab kyi zug rdul 'joms par byed do //
translated: The lotus of the hands, holding those feet, destroys the pain of the back.

original: steng du rkang pa dang dang 'og tu mgo bo lus la bad kan nad rnams mtha' dag 'phrog par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: steng du rkang pa dang dang 'og tu mgo bo lus la bad kan nad rnams mtha' dag 'phrog par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: The feet above and the head below, the body carries off all phlegm diseases.

original: srog 'gog pa las nyin zhag 'ga' zhig gis ni rab 'khru gci ba'i nad dag nges par 'joms par byed /
analyzed: srog 'gog pa las nyin zhag 'ga' zhig gis ni rab 'khru gci ba'i nad dag nges par 'joms par byed /
translated: By stopping the life-force for a few days, one will certainly conquer the diseases of diarrhea and urine.

original: tho rangs ming med dag gis chu dang bral ba'i khar ni ste ma bkrus par so yi phreng ba dag la rab tu bdar ba ni mig rnams dag gi mig sman du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tho rangs ming med dag gis chu dang bral ba'i khar ni ste ma bkrus par so yi phreng ba dag la rab tu bdar ba ni mig rnams dag gi mig sman du 'gyur te /
translated: In the morning, with the ring fingers, on the teeth that are not washed, the row of teeth, one should rub the teeth with the paste of betel nut. It becomes an eye ointment for the eyes.

original: mig gi nad 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi nad 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will carry off eye diseases.

original: tho rangs chu yis gtor ba dag kyang mig gi nad 'phrog par @4a * //
analyzed: tho rangs chu yis gtor ba dag kyang mig gi nad 'phrog par @4a * //
translated: Also, sprinkling with water in the morning, carries off eye diseases.

original: 'gyur ro // gan rkyal nyal nas lte ba lag pa g-yon pas bzung ba gang yin pa de ni lag pa'i padma sa bzung ba dag ni ma zhu ba'i zug rdu 'joms pa ste srog rtsol dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // gan rkyal nyal nas lte ba lag pa g-yon pas bzung ba gang yin pa de ni lag pa'i padma sa bzung ba dag ni ma zhu ba'i zug rdu 'joms pa ste srog rtsol dang bcas pas so //
translated: The holding of the lotus of the hand destroys the pain of indigestion, together with the prƒÅ·πáƒÅyƒÅma.

original: 'bras rnams byung ba la ni ste /
analyzed: 'bras rnams byung ba la ni ste /
translated: In the case of the arising of boils,

original: 'bras dang skrangs 'bur la sogs ba byung ba'i dus su mar dang bcas pa'i tshva dang gos kyis bcings pa yis bdugs na 'phel ba 'joms par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'bras dang skrangs 'bur la sogs ba byung ba'i dus su mar dang bcas pa'i tshva dang gos kyis bcings pa yis bdugs na 'phel ba 'joms par byed pa nyid de /
translated: when boils, abscesses, etc. arise, by the application of salt with ghee and binding with cloth, the destruction of the increase is done.

original: de nas aarka'i 'o ma byugs pas kyang ngo ste /
analyzed: de nas aarka'i 'o ma byugs pas kyang ngo ste /
translated: Then, by the application of arka milk, also.üîΩIn the case of the arising of boils, etc.

original: 'bras la sogs pa 'byung ba la'o zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pa 'byung ba la'o zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule.

original: 'ga' zhig tshe na so srin zug rdu bcas gyur na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tshe na so srin zug rdu bcas gyur na /
translated: If at some time the toothache is accompanied by pain,

original: de'i tshe stag ldan gyi ni sa bon du ba sbu bas la sogs pa dag gis bzung na srin bu la sogs pa 'joms te stag ldan zhes pa kanda ka'i ri'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe stag ldan gyi ni sa bon du ba sbu bas la sogs pa dag gis bzung na srin bu la sogs pa 'joms te stag ldan zhes pa kanda ka'i ri'o //
translated: then, by holding the seeds of the tiger-possessor with the foam of cow dung, etc., the worms, etc. are destroyed. The tiger-possessor is the kandaka plant.

original: nad spyi nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: nad spyi nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for the general pacification of disease.

original: da ni lo zhes pa la sogs pas mdze nad nye bar zhi ba'i slad du cho ga gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni lo zhes pa la sogs pas mdze nad nye bar zhi ba'i slad du cho ga gsungs so //
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúyear,‚Äù he explains the rite for the complete pacification of leprosy.

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor chen po ste sngon du du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang srog rtsol gyis mi 'gyur pa bde ba'i skad cig bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor chen po ste sngon du du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang srog rtsol gyis mi 'gyur pa bde ba'i skad cig bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: This is the great yoga, which is the accomplishment of the moment of bliss that is unchanging through the signs of smoke, etc., and the life-force and exertion.üîΩHaving caused the bodhicitta to fall through union with the consort in the gathering of the mudra, the bodhicitta that falls together with bliss is blocked by the life-force and the downward-voiding [vƒÅyu].

original: phyag rgya dang rab tu 'dus pa la byang chub kyi sems ltung du bcug nas phyag rgya dang sbyar bas ltung ba'i byang chub kyi sems bde ba dang bcas pa de nyid srog dang thur sel dag gis 'gog pa las lo phyed kyis ni sngags pa rnams kyi
analyzed: phyag rgya dang rab tu 'dus pa la byang chub kyi sems ltung du bcug nas phyag rgya dang sbyar bas ltung ba'i byang chub kyi sems bde ba dang bcas pa de nyid srog dang thur sel dag gis 'gog pa las lo phyed kyis ni sngags pa rnams kyi
translated: In half a year, the mantra practitioner will become

original: mchog gi lus la dgar ba'i mdze 'phrog de las gzhan lta ci /
analyzed: mchog gi lus la dgar ba'i mdze 'phrog de las gzhan lta ci /
translated: the best of the best, and the leprosy of the body will be stolen.

original: gal te mdze ma sel na de'i tshe phyag rgya lo bcu drug ma bsten par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te mdze ma sel na de'i tshe phyag rgya lo bcu drug ma bsten par bya ste /
translated: If the leprosy is not removed, then at that time one should rely on a mudra who is sixteen years old.

original: rnal 'byor pas nyin zhag so sor sha'i bza' ba dang chang gi btung ba dang / zla ba drug gi nang du de'i skye gnas su bsrubs bas pa la byang chub kyi sems ltung ba rnam par bzung bar gyur na mdze'i nad 'phrog ste bum pa can gyi sbyor bas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas nyin zhag so sor sha'i bza' ba dang chang gi btung ba dang / zla ba drug gi nang du de'i skye gnas su bsrubs bas pa la byang chub kyi sems ltung ba rnam par bzung bar gyur na mdze'i nad 'phrog ste bum pa can gyi sbyor bas so //
translated: The yogi, every day, with the food of meat and the drink of beer, and in six months, by churning in her vagina, if he holds the bodhicitta that has fallen, he will steal leprosy, by the practice of the vase-breathing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di la the tshom med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di la the tshom med do //
translated: There is no doubt about this statement of the TathƒÅgata.

original: mdze 'phrog pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: mdze 'phrog pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
translated: Not only does he steal leprosy,

original: gzhan yang bdun cu'i lo yi rgya ba skra dkar bcas pa dag kyang phyag rgya dang 'dus pa la byang chub kyi sems ltung ba lo gnyis rab tu rdzogs nas nges par 'phrog go //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdun cu'i lo yi rgya ba skra dkar bcas pa dag kyang phyag rgya dang 'dus pa la byang chub kyi sems ltung ba lo gnyis rab tu rdzogs nas nges par 'phrog go //
translated: but also, with the union of the mudra, he will definitely steal the white hair and wrinkles of a seventy-year-old in two years, by the fall of the bodhicitta.

original: sbyor ba 'di nyid kyis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis nyin zhag 'ga' yis te /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di nyid kyis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis nyin zhag 'ga' yis te /
translated: By this very practice, the yogis, in a few days,

original: dus kyi 'khor @4b lo'i lo gsum dang phyogs gsum gyi nyin zhag rnams kyis lam dang sems ni rab tu 'grogs pa dag las de steng zhes pa rga ba rnam par nyams pa'i steng du phyag rgya'i dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor @4b lo'i lo gsum dang phyogs gsum gyi nyin zhag rnams kyis lam dang sems ni rab tu 'grogs pa dag las de steng zhes pa rga ba rnam par nyams pa'i steng du phyag rgya'i dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: By the days and nights of three years and three half months of the Wheel of Time, the path and mind are well joined, and on top of that, that is, on top of the aging and degeneration, there is the power of the seal.

original: mdze nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: mdze nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for the pacification of leprosy.

original: da ni srog rtsol gyi nges pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni srog rtsol gyi nges pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, the rule of prƒÅ·πáƒÅyƒÅma is stated.

original: 'dir sngags pas lus la srog rtsol bum pa can bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir sngags pas lus la srog rtsol bum pa can bya ste /
translated: Here, the mantrin should practice prƒÅ·πáƒÅyƒÅma, the vase-breathing, in the body.

original: snying ga de bzhin mgo bo dag ni ji srid me yis gdung bar 'gyur pa ste snying ga bsregs shing mgo po yang gdung bar 'gyur pa de srid du'o //
analyzed: snying ga de bzhin mgo bo dag ni ji srid me yis gdung bar 'gyur pa ste snying ga bsregs shing mgo po yang gdung bar 'gyur pa de srid du'o //
translated: As long as the heart and likewise the head are heated by the fire, that is, as long as the heart is burned and the head is heated,

original: de las steng du mi bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de las steng du mi bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: one should not do it above that. This is the rule.

original: gal te de las steng dag tu ni byed na bzang po'i padmar brgyal bar 'gyur te zhes pa lte ba'i padmar srog brgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de las steng dag tu ni byed na bzang po'i padmar brgyal bar 'gyur te zhes pa lte ba'i padmar srog brgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does it above that, one will faint in the good lotus, that is, the life will faint in the navel lotus.

original: ma bsdams pa'am stobs dag gis gtsug tor phyug cing phung po dag dang khams rnams rnam par spangs nas /
analyzed: ma bsdams pa'am stobs dag gis gtsug tor phyug cing phung po dag dang khams rnams rnam par spangs nas /
translated: But those who are not restrained, or who are weak, go to death, having abandoned the crown protuberance and the aggregates and constituents.

original: 'chi ba nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur pa gang yin pa de'i phyir phyag rgya 'grogs pa rab nyams skyes bu rnams kyi skye ba 'di nyid la ni srog rtsol bde 'bras ster ba med do //
analyzed: 'chi ba nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur pa gang yin pa de'i phyir phyag rgya 'grogs pa rab nyams skyes bu rnams kyi skye ba 'di nyid la ni srog rtsol bde 'bras ster ba med do //
translated: Therefore, for those people whose practice of the seal is weak, there is no bestowal of the fruit of the life-force.

original: srog rtsol gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: srog rtsol gyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the life-force.

original: da ni phyag rgya zhes pa la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyag rgya dang myang ba dang kha zas dang rgyu ba'i nges pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni phyag rgya zhes pa la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyag rgya dang myang ba dang kha zas dang rgyu ba'i nges pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚ÄúThe seal, etc.,‚Äù he teaches the determination of the seal, the kiss, the food, and the movement of the yogis.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag rgya gsungs pa ni bsgom pa'i don du rnal 'byor gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag rgya gsungs pa ni bsgom pa'i don du rnal 'byor gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa ste /
translated: Here, the Blessed One teaches the seal for the sake of meditation, the yogic seal.

original: chags pa zad pa'i don te rgyur nyin mtshan du bud med dang rol par gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chags pa zad pa'i don te rgyur nyin mtshan du bud med dang rol par gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the sake of the exhaustion of passion that he teaches the union with a woman day and night.

original: de bzhin du chang gi btung ba ni cung zad kha tshim par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chang gi btung ba ni cung zad kha tshim par byed pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the drinking of alcohol is for the sake of a little satisfaction,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: not like a pot, etc.

original: myos byed ni rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams la thar pa ster bar byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myos byed ni rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams la thar pa ster bar byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Alcohol does not become a giver of liberation for the lords of yoga.

original: de bzhin du kha zas byed pa ni 'dir kha zas thams cad bde ba'i don te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha zas byed pa ni 'dir kha zas thams cad bde ba'i don te /
translated: Likewise, the eating of food is here for the sake of the pleasure of all food.

original: gang cung zad kha zas byed pa de thams cad shin tu chung ba bde bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang cung zad kha zas byed pa de thams cad shin tu chung ba bde bar 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever is eaten is all very little, and it becomes pleasurable.

original: de'i phyir nyin zhag so so'i dus su ma zhu ba'i rgyur mi bya'o zhes pa ni kha zas kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyin zhag so so'i dus su ma zhu ba'i rgyur mi bya'o zhes pa ni kha zas kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it does not become a cause of indigestion at each daily time. This is the rule for food.

original: dpal ldan spyod pa ste rnal 'byor spyod pa dngos grub rgyur zhes pa dngos grub kyi rgyur te /
analyzed: dpal ldan spyod pa ste rnal 'byor spyod pa dngos grub rgyur zhes pa dngos grub kyi rgyur te /
translated: The glorious conduct, i.e., the conduct of yoga, is for the sake of power, i.e., for the sake of power.

original: de'i phyir mtshan mo dur khrod gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs par @5a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan mo dur khrod gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs par @5a * //
translated: Therefore, at night in the charnel grounds, in the dwelling places, etc.,

original: 'khyam pa dag rtsed mo'i don du ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'khyam pa dag rtsed mo'i don du ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don te /
translated: wandering is not for the sake of play. This is the meaning.

original: rnal 'byor gyi spyod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi spyod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the practice of yoga.

original: da ni kun spangs kyi rnal 'byor pa'i sman gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni kun spangs kyi rnal 'byor pa'i sman gsungs te /
translated: Now, the medicine of the yogi who has renounced everything is taught.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa'i kha na bar gyur na /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa'i kha na bar gyur na /
translated: Here, when the yogi has a problem with his mouth,

original: de'i tshe mi bskyed pa cung zad dro bar byas te khar bzung na kha'i nad zhi bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi bskyed pa cung zad dro bar byas te khar bzung na kha'i nad zhi bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, having made a little bit of heat, he should hold it in his mouth. The disease of the mouth will be pacified.

original: so yi zug rdu nyid kyi yang zhes pa ste yang yig las so srin gyi yang ngo //
analyzed: so yi zug rdu nyid kyi yang zhes pa ste yang yig las so srin gyi yang ngo //
translated: And also of the toothache, from the word also, also of the tooth worm.

original: gang gi tshe mgo bo na gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mgo bo na gyur na /
translated: When the head aches,

original: de'i tshe tho rangs mi bskyod pa rngub pa byas na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mgo yi nad 'phrog ste de bzhin nyid du chu ni rngubs pas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe tho rangs mi bskyod pa rngub pa byas na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mgo yi nad 'phrog ste de bzhin nyid du chu ni rngubs pas so //
translated: then, having made an inhalation of Akshobhya at dawn, the yogi's head disease is removed, just so, by the inhalation of water.

original: gang gi tshe rna ba na bar gyur pa de'i tshe gcin dro bar byas pa rna bar rab tu blugs pa dang / mig gi nad la grang mor byas pa mig tu rab tu blugs pas grangs bzhin du gnyis ka'i nad 'phrog ste gcin ni dro dang grang mo zhes so /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rna ba na bar gyur pa de'i tshe gcin dro bar byas pa rna bar rab tu blugs pa dang / mig gi nad la grang mor byas pa mig tu rab tu blugs pas grangs bzhin du gnyis ka'i nad 'phrog ste gcin ni dro dang grang mo zhes so /
translated: When the ear is sick, then warm urine is poured into the ear, and when the eye is sick, cold urine is poured into the eye, and the sickness of both is removed according to the number of times.

original: 'byung pos gzir la zhes pa 'byung po yi dags la sogs pas bzung ba la tsha ba gsum dang bcas pa'i mi bskyod pa brngubs na bde ba ster te /
analyzed: 'byung pos gzir la zhes pa 'byung po yi dags la sogs pas bzung ba la tsha ba gsum dang bcas pa'i mi bskyod pa brngubs na bde ba ster te /
translated: For one seized by a spirit, that is, by a ghost, etc., if one inhales Akshobhya with the three spices, it gives pleasure.

original: zos pa nyid la yang zhes pa sbrul gyis zos pa yang bde ba ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zos pa nyid la yang zhes pa sbrul gyis zos pa yang bde ba ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one is eaten, that is, even if one is eaten by a snake, it will give pleasure.

original: kha'i nad la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: kha'i nad la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for the pacification of mouth disease, etc.

original: da ni bshang ba zhes pa la sogs pas tshe 'phel ba'i don du bdud rtsi lnga'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bshang ba zhes pa la sogs pas tshe 'phel ba'i don du bdud rtsi lnga'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to increase life, he declares the yoga of the five nectars, beginning with feces.

original: 'dir ji ltar phyi rol de bzhin du lus zhes gsungs pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi rdzas lnga dang nang gi rdzas lnga gcig tu byas pa ni bdud rtsi lnga'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar phyi rol de bzhin du lus zhes gsungs pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi rdzas lnga dang nang gi rdzas lnga gcig tu byas pa ni bdud rtsi lnga'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: Here, the five external substances and the five internal substances are made into one, the preparation of the five nectars, because it is said, ‚ÄúJust as the external, so the internal.‚Äù

original: bdud rtsi lnga po de zos pas rnal 'byor pa rnams la tshe ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga po de zos pas rnal 'byor pa rnams la tshe ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By eating those five nectars, yogis will be granted long life.

original: phyi rol du bshang ba'i sgras rnams par snang mdzad stobs ldan stobs kyi zhag ste mu zir brjod do //
analyzed: phyi rol du bshang ba'i sgras rnams par snang mdzad stobs ldan stobs kyi zhag ste mu zir brjod do //
translated: Externally, the term ‚Äúfeces‚Äù refers to the bile of Vairocana, which is called ‚Äúsulfur.‚Äù

original: nang du ni bshang ba nyid de 'di dag cha mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ni bshang ba nyid de 'di dag cha mnyam pa'o //
translated: Internally, it is feces itself, and these are equal parts.

original: gcin ni phyi rol du khyab 'jug mi bdag ste bhrim ga r'a dz'a'i khu ba'o //
analyzed: gcin ni phyi rol du khyab 'jug mi bdag ste bhrim ga r'a dz'a'i khu ba'o //
translated: Externally, ‚Äúurine‚Äù refers to the juice of the king of bhringa, which is Vishnu.

original: nang du ni gcin nyid do //
analyzed: nang du ni gcin nyid do //
translated: Internally, it is urine itself.

original: khrag ni phyi rol du lhang tsher ro //
analyzed: khrag ni phyi rol du lhang tsher ro //
translated: Externally, ‚Äúblood‚Äù refers to the blood of a pig.

original: nang du ni bud med kyi me tog ste cha mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ni bud med kyi me tog ste cha mnyam pa'o //
translated: Internally, it is the flower of a woman, and these are equal parts.

original: khu ba ni phyi rol du dngul chu'o //
analyzed: khu ba ni phyi rol du dngul chu'o //
translated: Externally, ‚Äúsemen‚Äù refers to mercury.

original: nang du ni khu ba nyid de 'di dag cha mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ni khu ba nyid de 'di dag cha mnyam pa'o //
translated: Internally, it is semen itself, and these are equal parts.

original: mi yi sha na ni phyi rol du 'bras @5b bu gsum mo //
analyzed: mi yi sha na ni phyi rol du 'bras @5b bu gsum mo //
translated: The three fruits are externally in human flesh.

original: nang du ni rkang ste 'di dag kyang cha mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ni rkang ste 'di dag kyang cha mnyam pa'o //
translated: Internally, it is the shank. These are equal parts.

original: de ltar bshang ba cha gcig dang sha rkang pas dman pa'i cha dang khrag cha phyed dang khu ba rkang pa gcig ste //
analyzed: de ltar bshang ba cha gcig dang sha rkang pas dman pa'i cha dang khrag cha phyed dang khu ba rkang pa gcig ste //
translated: Thus, one part of feces, one part less of flesh and shank, half a part of blood, and one part of semen and shank,

original: 'di rnams gcig tu byas nas gcin gyis lan bdun gyi bar du bsgo bar bya ste yang dang yang du nyi ma la bskams nas so //
analyzed: 'di rnams gcig tu byas nas gcin gyis lan bdun gyi bar du bsgo bar bya ste yang dang yang du nyi ma la bskams nas so //
translated: having made these into one, it should be cooked seven times with urine, and again and again dried in the sun.

original: de nas nyin zhag so sor zho gnyis tsam gyi mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bcas pa zos na zla ba drug gi mtshams su tshe ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas nyin zhag so sor zho gnyis tsam gyi mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bcas pa zos na zla ba drug gi mtshams su tshe ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, eating two prasthas of ghee, honey, and so forth, every day, in six months, one will be granted long life.

original: lo ma dang / skyur ba dang / til mar dang / lan tshva dang / bud med dang sbyor ba spangs pa las so zhes pa ni bdud rtsi lnga'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma dang / skyur ba dang / til mar dang / lan tshva dang / bud med dang sbyor ba spangs pa las so zhes pa ni bdud rtsi lnga'i nges pa'o //
translated: By abandoning leaves, sour [foods], sesame oil, salt, and intercourse with women, this is the rule of the five nectars.

original: da ni bsam gtan bcas pas zhes pa la sogs pas me tog rngub pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bsam gtan bcas pas zhes pa la sogs pas me tog rngub pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúalong with concentration,‚Äù he teaches the inhalation of the flower.

original: 'dir bsam gtan ni dbu mar srog rab tu gzhug pa ste bsam gtan de dang bcas pa ni bsam gtan bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir bsam gtan ni dbu mar srog rab tu gzhug pa ste bsam gtan de dang bcas pa ni bsam gtan bcas pa'o //
translated: Here, meditation is the introduction of the life-force into the central channel. One who is endowed with that meditation is ‚Äúendowed with meditation.‚Äù

original: me tog ni bud med kyi rdul lo //
analyzed: me tog ni bud med kyi rdul lo //
translated: ‚ÄúFlower‚Äù is the female particle.

original: phyi rol tu ni skra'i rgyal po bhrim ga r'a dz'a ste /
analyzed: phyi rol tu ni skra'i rgyal po bhrim ga r'a dz'a ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOutside‚Äù is the king of hair, bh·πõ·πÖgarƒÅja.

original: de'i khu ba bud med kyi me tog dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i khu ba bud med kyi me tog dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Its juice is equal to the female flower.

original: bsam gtan bcas par me tog rngubs na bsam gtan bcas pa rnams kyi skra dkar dang bcas rga ba dang ni lus skyes rnams kyang zla ba drug gi mtshams su 'phrog ste rngub pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bcas par me tog rngubs na bsam gtan bcas pa rnams kyi skra dkar dang bcas rga ba dang ni lus skyes rnams kyang zla ba drug gi mtshams su 'phrog ste rngub pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: If one inhales the flower endowed with meditation, then the hair and wrinkles of those endowed with meditation and the body hairs are stolen at the end of six months. This is the rule of inhalation.

original: da ni sgron ma lnga gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sgron ma lnga gsungs te /
translated: Now, the five lamps are stated:

original: ba lang dang / khyi dang / so ldan dang / rta dang mi rnams kyi sha sbrang bu'i skyugs pa dang dang bsres pa ste /
analyzed: ba lang dang / khyi dang / so ldan dang / rta dang mi rnams kyi sha sbrang bu'i skyugs pa dang dang bsres pa ste /
translated: the flesh of cows, dogs, camels, horses, and humans mixed with bee vomit.

original: sbrang rtsi dang bsres pa'i sgron ma lnga zos pas mtha' dag nas ni 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang bsres pa'i sgron ma lnga zos pas mtha' dag nas ni 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
translated: By eating the five lamps mixed with honey, everything is stolen.

original: sbrang bu'i skyugs pa gzhan ni sbrang chang ste /
analyzed: sbrang bu'i skyugs pa gzhan ni sbrang chang ste /
translated: Another bee vomit is mead.

original: de dang bcas pa mtha' dag nad ni 'phrog par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bcas pa mtha' dag nad ni 'phrog par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: And all of that together will certainly remove the disease.

original: bud med me tog khu ba dag dang bsres pa ni sngar brjod pa'i phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: bud med me tog khu ba dag dang bsres pa ni sngar brjod pa'i phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid de /
translated: The flower juice of a woman, mixed with the above-mentioned external and internal substances,

original: lo gcig zos nas rga ba nges par sel bar byed do zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: lo gcig zos nas rga ba nges par sel bar byed do zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Having eaten for one year, it will certainly remove old age. This is the certainty mentioned above.

original: da ni rlung la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rlung la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, the pacification of wind and so on is mentioned:

original: rlung 'joms lan tshva skyur ba dag tu rab tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: rlung 'joms lan tshva skyur ba dag tu rab tu 'gyur te /
translated: Salt and sour are excellent for conquering wind.

original: mngar dang bska ba'i rdzas dag ni mkhris pa'i dgra'o //üîΩbad kan 'joms pa kha pa kun dang tsha ba gsum dang bcas pa ste sman rnams sam ni khu ba'am zhes pa zos @6a * //
analyzed: mngar dang bska ba'i rdzas dag ni mkhris pa'i dgra'o // bad kan 'joms pa kha pa kun dang tsha ba gsum dang bcas pa ste sman rnams sam ni khu ba'am zhes pa zos @6a * //
translated: Sweet and astringent substances are enemies of bile.

original: pa dang 'thungs pas so //
analyzed: pa dang 'thungs pas so //
translated: Having eaten or drunk the medicines or juices, the pacifier of phlegm is all the spices with the three hot things, or the cow's milk with the three hot things.

original: bad kan 'joms par yi 'o ma tsha ba gsum bcas dag ste ma he'i 'o ma sha ka ra dang bcas pa mkhris pa'i dgra'o //
analyzed: bad kan 'joms par yi 'o ma tsha ba gsum bcas dag ste ma he'i 'o ma sha ka ra dang bcas pa mkhris pa'i dgra'o //
translated: The conqueror of phlegm is the buffalo milk with sugar, which is an enemy of bile.

original: rlung 'joms dag kyang rnga mo'i 'o ma rgyam tsha dang bcas pa ste rnam gsum nad 'phrog pa yi 'o ma grangs bzhin du rgyam tsha la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan 'joms pa'o //üîΩde bzhin mar zhes pa ba'i mar ni rims dang bral ba rnams kyi rnam pa gsum gyi nad zhi bar byed do zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: rlung 'joms dag kyang rnga mo'i 'o ma rgyam tsha dang bcas pa ste rnam gsum nad 'phrog pa yi 'o ma grangs bzhin du rgyam tsha la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan 'joms pa'o // de bzhin mar zhes pa ba'i mar ni rims dang bral ba rnams kyi rnam pa gsum gyi nad zhi bar byed do zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The wind-destroying milk is also the milk of a camel together with rock salt. The three kinds of milk which carry off the disease are, in order, the milk together with rock salt, etc. which destroy wind, bile, and phlegm.üîΩLikewise, the ghee, i.e. the cow's ghee, of those who are free from fever pacifies the three kinds of disease. This is the rule.

original: da ni kha la sogs pa'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i don du bskol ba'i til mar la sogs pa gsungs pa dz'a t'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni kha la sogs pa'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i don du bskol ba'i til mar la sogs pa gsungs pa dz'a t'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to pacify diseases of the mouth, etc., he describes the boiled sesame oil, etc.

original: 'dir thams cad du chu ni rdzas kyi brgyad 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad du chu ni rdzas kyi brgyad 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, in all cases, the water is eight times the substance.

original: dz'a t'i'i 'dab ma'i brgyad 'gyur gyi chu rkang ba'i lhag mar dz'a t'i bskol ba'i khu ba'i chu cung zad dro bas kha nad zhi bar byed par 'gyur te so'i zug rngu nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: dz'a t'i'i 'dab ma'i brgyad 'gyur gyi chu rkang ba'i lhag mar dz'a t'i bskol ba'i khu ba'i chu cung zad dro bas kha nad zhi bar byed par 'gyur te so'i zug rngu nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The water, eight times the leaves of the Jati, in the remainder of the foot, with the water of the boiled juice of the Jati, slightly warm, will pacify the disease of the mouth, and also the pain of the teeth.

original: til mar ni til gyi til mar ro //
analyzed: til mar ni til gyi til mar ro //
translated: The oil is sesame oil.

original: dngos po'i chu ni ra'i gcin te de dang mnyam pa bskol ba'i til mar lhag ma la tsha ba gsum dang lan tshva rkang pa dang bcas pa'i cha shad tshos pa'i mjug tu rab tu sbyin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i chu ni ra'i gcin te de dang mnyam pa bskol ba'i til mar lhag ma la tsha ba gsum dang lan tshva rkang pa dang bcas pa'i cha shad tshos pa'i mjug tu rab tu sbyin te /
translated: The water of the substance is the urine of a goat. It is cooked with an equal quantity of oil, and at the end of the cooking, one part each of the three spices and salt with a leg are added.

original: de rna bar rab tu blugs pas rna ba yi ni nad dag 'joms so //
analyzed: de rna bar rab tu blugs pas rna ba yi ni nad dag 'joms so //
translated: When it is poured into the ear, it destroys the diseases of the ear.

original: de bzhin du mar ni ba lang gi mar te'o ma brgyad 'gyur dang bskol ba'i 'jug tu klu n'a ga ge sar dang dmar po gur gum ste de dag rkang pa'i cha shas sbyin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mar ni ba lang gi mar te'o ma brgyad 'gyur dang bskol ba'i 'jug tu klu n'a ga ge sar dang dmar po gur gum ste de dag rkang pa'i cha shas sbyin no //
translated: Similarly, the clarified butter is cow butter. It is cooked with eight times the quantity of milk, and at the end of the cooking, one part each of nƒÅga kesara, red sandal, and saffron are added.

original: mar 'di rngubs pas sna yi nad dag 'joms pa nyid do //
analyzed: mar 'di rngubs pas sna yi nad dag 'joms pa nyid do //
translated: By inhaling this clarified butter, it destroys the diseases of the nose.

original: kar ko t'i ste bandh'a ka ra ko t'i dang lang ga li dang / ain dr'i ni aindra ba ru n'i ste /
analyzed: kar ko t'i ste bandh'a ka ra ko t'i dang lang ga li dang / ain dr'i ni aindra ba ru n'i ste /
translated: Karakota, bandhaka karakota, langali, and indra are indravaruna.

original: tig t'a dang / bong bu'i chu dang bcas pa byugs pas 'bras kyi phreng ba 'phrog go zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: tig t'a dang / bong bu'i chu dang bcas pa byugs pas 'bras kyi phreng ba 'phrog go zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: By applying a paste of these with donkey urine, one steals the garland of leprosy. This is the conclusion.

original: mdor bsdus pa ste rgyas par gso ba'i bstan bcos las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ste rgyas par gso ba'i bstan bcos las shes par bya'o //
translated: This is the brief [explanation]; the extensive should be understood from the medical treatises.

original: da ni lag pa zhes pa la sogs pas rdo rje'i tsher ma nye bar zhi bar byed pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni lag pa zhes pa la sogs pas rdo rje'i tsher ma nye bar zhi bar byed pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares the pacification of the vajra thorn with ‚Äúhand‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe sdig pa'i nad kyi nye bar 'tshe ba byung na de'i tshe dang por tsha ba skye bar 'gyur zhing lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs rnams gdung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe sdig pa'i nad kyi nye bar 'tshe ba byung na de'i tshe dang por tsha ba skye bar 'gyur zhing lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs rnams gdung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, when the harm of the illness of sin arises, then first a fever arises and the joints of the hands and feet are inflamed.

original: mgo bo yang gdung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgo bo yang gdung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The head is also inflamed.

original: mtshan nyid 'di shes nas ting nge 'dzin dmigs @6b par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di shes nas ting nge 'dzin dmigs @6b par bya'o //
translated: Having understood this characteristic, one should visualize the samƒÅdhi.

original: de la 'di ni cho ga ste bug pa med pa'i khyim du tsha ba skyes pa rab tu zhugs nas lag pa gnyis po dag ni brla'i mthar thug par rab tu 'phyang bar bya zhing rkang pa'i padma mnyam pa dag byas te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni cho ga ste bug pa med pa'i khyim du tsha ba skyes pa rab tu zhugs nas lag pa gnyis po dag ni brla'i mthar thug par rab tu 'phyang bar bya zhing rkang pa'i padma mnyam pa dag byas te /
translated: The procedure there is as follows: Having entered into the house without a hole, the two hands should hang down to the end of the thighs, and the lotus of the feet should be made even.

original: srog gi rlung ni 'gog pa bum pa can bya'o //
analyzed: srog gi rlung ni 'gog pa bum pa can bya'o //
translated: The life-force wind should be stopped, and the vase [breathing] should be performed.

original: ji srid lus ni sa la rab tu ltung bar ma gyur pa de srid du ste tsha ba'i nad kyis sa la rab tu ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid lus ni sa la rab tu ltung bar ma gyur pa de srid du ste tsha ba'i nad kyis sa la rab tu ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as the body does not fall to the ground, that is, as long as the heat of the disease does not cause it to fall to the ground.

original: de nas ma ltung ba'i bar du yang dang yang du srog rtsol bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nas ma ltung ba'i bar du yang dang yang du srog rtsol bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Then, as long as it has not fallen, one should practice prƒÅ·πáƒÅyƒÅma again and again. This is the rule.

original: ji srid tsha ba dag ni grol bar yang ma gyur pa de srid du bya ste tsha ba grol bar gyur na mi bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid tsha ba dag ni grol bar yang ma gyur pa de srid du bya ste tsha ba grol bar gyur na mi bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: As long as the heat has not been released, one should practice. When the heat is released, one should not practice. This is the rule.

original: yang dang yang du ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i tsher ma can ni nges par 'joms te snying ga'i padmar zla ba'i gzugs can dri med ri bong can mtshungs sna tshogs yum ni bsgoms pas so zhes pa ni srog rtsol gyis zla
analyzed: yang dang yang du ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i tsher ma can ni nges par 'joms te snying ga'i padmar zla ba'i gzugs can dri med ri bong can mtshungs sna tshogs yum ni bsgoms pas so zhes pa ni srog rtsol gyis zla
translated: Again and again, by abiding in samƒÅdhi, one will certainly destroy the fear of death, which is like a thorn, by meditating on the moon-like stainless hare, the mother of variety, in the heart lotus.

original: ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdo rje padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa zhal gcig pa phyag gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdo rje padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa zhal gcig pa phyag gnyis pa ste /
translated: This is the moon mandala, on which is the single-faced, two-armed Vajrapadma, seated on a vajra and lotus seat.

original: padma dang mchog sbyin gyi phyag go zhes pa ni sdig pa'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: padma dang mchog sbyin gyi phyag go zhes pa ni sdig pa'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: The lotus and the boon-granting hand.

original: da ni sdig pa'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i don du sman gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sdig pa'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i don du sman gsungs te /
translated: Now, for the purpose of curing the disease of sin, the medicine is taught:

original: 'dir gang gi tshe sdig pa'i nad kyi mtshan ma tsha ba skyes pa dang lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs rnams gdung bar gyur na /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe sdig pa'i nad kyi mtshan ma tsha ba skyes pa dang lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs rnams gdung bar gyur na /
translated: Here, when the symptoms of the disease of sin, such as fever, arise, and the joints of the hands and feet are inflamed,

original: de'i tshe sran chung btags nas chu grang mos tsha bas rnam par bsnun pa'i mi rnams la byin na tsher ma 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe sran chung btags nas chu grang mos tsha bas rnam par bsnun pa'i mi rnams la byin na tsher ma 'joms par byed do //
translated: then, having ground mung beans, if one gives them to people afflicted with fever with cold water, the thorns are destroyed.

original: de bzhin du tsha ba'i mthar ni zhes pa nyin zhag gsum pa la tsher ma 'thon pa'i dus su sdig pa'i nad kyis shi ba'i thod pa ste ma rnyed na ji ltar rnyed pa bdar nas mi bskyod pa bsres pa'i skyes pa'i thod pa skyes pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du tsha ba'i mthar ni zhes pa nyin zhag gsum pa la tsher ma 'thon pa'i dus su sdig pa'i nad kyis shi ba'i thod pa ste ma rnyed na ji ltar rnyed pa bdar nas mi bskyod pa bsres pa'i skyes pa'i thod pa skyes pa dang /
translated: Likewise, at the end of the fever, on the third day, at the time when the thorns emerge, one should take the skull of one who has died of the disease of sin. If that is not available, one should take any available skull, mix it with Ak·π£obhya, and place it in the skull of a man.

original: bud med kyi thod pa bud med kyis 'thungs shing ma rnyed na ji ltar rnyed pa 'thungs pas 'jigs par byed pa 'am tsher ma can 'phrog ste /
analyzed: bud med kyi thod pa bud med kyis 'thungs shing ma rnyed na ji ltar rnyed pa 'thungs pas 'jigs par byed pa 'am tsher ma can 'phrog ste /
translated: A woman drinks from a skull-cup, and if she does not find one, she drinks from whatever is found.

original: tsha ba'i mthar thod pa ji ltar rnyed pas so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: tsha ba'i mthar thod pa ji ltar rnyed pas so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: At the end of the hot season, she drinks from whatever skull-cup is found.

original: 'dir sran chung la sogs pa mngon par bsngags pa'i slad du sngags su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir sran chung la sogs pa mngon par bsngags pa'i slad du sngags su 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the mantra is for the purpose of incanting beans and so on.

original: de yang dang por aom yig ste sngags kyang chu me rlung rnams dag gi sngon du aom yig ces pas thog mar aom yig go //üîΩchu zhes @7a * //
analyzed: de yang dang por aom yig ste sngags kyang chu me rlung rnams dag gi sngon du aom yig ces pas thog mar aom yig go // chu zhes @7a * //
translated: And that mantra is first the syllable Om, and the mantra is also the syllable Om at the beginning of water, fire, and wind.

original: pa ni pa sde'i yi ge gnyis pa chu'i khams te pha'o //
analyzed: pa ni pa sde'i yi ge gnyis pa chu'i khams te pha'o //
translated: Water is the second syllable of the pa group, the water element, the father.

original: me zhes pa 'og tu ra'o //
analyzed: me zhes pa 'og tu ra'o //
translated: Fire is ra below.

original: steng du ae yig ste chu me rlung 'di dag rnams gcig pa nyid ni phrem ste rjes su por nam mkha' thams cad la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir re //
analyzed: steng du ae yig ste chu me rlung 'di dag rnams gcig pa nyid ni phrem ste rjes su por nam mkha' thams cad la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir re //
translated: Above is the syllable e. These water, fire, and wind are one, which is tre, because they pervade all of space.

original: badzra snga ma kanda k'a rnams kyi ming ngo ;
analyzed: badzra snga ma kanda k'a rnams kyi ming ngo ;
translated: Vajra is the name of the first kandakas.

original: / de nyid kyis ni bsrung ba bya ste sran chung la sogs pa la lan bdun mngon par bsngags pa ji lta ba de bzhin nyid du de nyid kyis bsrung ba ste /
analyzed: / de nyid kyis ni bsrung ba bya ste sran chung la sogs pa la lan bdun mngon par bsngags pa ji lta ba de bzhin nyid du de nyid kyis bsrung ba ste /
translated: One should protect oneself with that, just as one would with seven repetitions of the mantra over beans and so forth.

original: mgo mgrin snying ga lte ba gsang ba dang sogs pa'i sgras gtsug tor te gnas drug po 'di rnams su thun gsum du bsrung ba bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: mgo mgrin snying ga lte ba gsang ba dang sogs pa'i sgras gtsug tor te gnas drug po 'di rnams su thun gsum du bsrung ba bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: One should protect oneself with that, in three sessions, in the six places, the head, throat, heart, navel, secret place, and so forth, that is, the crown protrusion. This is the rule.

original: 'dir sngags ni aom phrem bi shva m'a ta: badzra kanda k'a na n'a sha ya n'a sha ya sh'antim ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: 'dir sngags ni aom phrem bi shva m'a ta: badzra kanda k'a na n'a sha ya n'a sha ya sh'antim ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /

original: gzhan bsrung ba'i don du lha sbyin gyi sh'a ntim ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /

original: zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das ma sna tshogs yum gyi ste /

translated: This is of the Blessed Lady Vi≈õvamƒÅtƒÅ.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad las bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba la dran par bya'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad las bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba la dran par bya'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: One should remember it for the protection of oneself and others from all harms. This is the rule of the Blessed Lady.

original: sngags 'dis lan bdun mngon par bsngags pa'i sran chung chu grang mos btags pa btung bar sbyin zhing tsha bas shi ba'i thod pa mi bskyong bas  btags pa sbyin no //
analyzed: sngags 'dis lan bdun mngon par bsngags pa'i sran chung chu grang mos btags pa btung bar sbyin zhing tsha bas shi ba'i thod pa mi bskyong bas  btags pa sbyin no //
translated: One should give to drink a paste of mung beans, seven times enchanted with this mantra, mixed with cold water. One should give a paste of the skull of one who died of a fever, not of one who was not cured.

original: 'byung pos zin pa la tsha ba gsum dang bcas pa mi bskyod pas btags nas sbyin te sdig pa'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung pos zin pa la tsha ba gsum dang bcas pa mi bskyod pas btags nas sbyin te sdig pa'i nad nye bar zhi ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: For one seized by an elemental spirit, one should give a paste of the three hot spices mixed with unctuous substances. This is the rule for the pacification of sinful disease.

analyzed: da ni mnyam pa zhes pa la sogs pas nyi ma'i gdung ba zhi ba'i nges pa mdzad pa de 'dir gang gi tshe so ga lam du nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis bsregs par gyur pa de'i tshe mnyam pa dh'a dri zhes pa skyu ru ra'i 'dab ma'i phye
translated: Now, with ‚ÄúEqual,‚Äù etc., he composes a rule for the pacification of the torment of the sun. When, in the spring season, one is scorched by the sun‚Äôs rays, then one should take equal parts of dhatri leaves,

original: ma dang dh'a nya pa zhes pa ku stum bu ru ste de dang mnyam pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin tin ti r'i yi 'dab ma'i phye ma zhes pa ban dh'u li'i 'dab ma'i phye ma mnyam pa'o //
translated: And again, one should take equal parts of tinti·∏çi leaves, which are bƒÅ·πá·∏çhulƒ´ leaves.

original: de ltar thams cad cha mnyam par byas nas nyi zla reg pa zhes pa nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od zer gyis reg pa'i chu ni nges par dri ma dang bral ba zhes pa nya lci bas la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba rkang pa'i lhag mar
analyzed: de ltar thams cad cha mnyam par byas nas nyi zla reg pa zhes pa nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od zer gyis reg pa'i chu ni nges par dri ma dang bral ba zhes pa nya lci bas la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba rkang pa'i lhag mar
translated: Thus, having made everything equal, the water touched by the light rays of the sun and moon is definitely free from impurities, free from impurities such as fish, mud, and so on.

original: bskol bar bya zhes pa ni rdzas kyi brgyang 'gyur gyi chu blugs pa nas ji srid khu ba rkang pa gcig tu gyur @7b pa de srid du rdzas gsum po ba skol bar bya'o //

analyzed: bskol ba'i yul 'di la srang gis ni tshad ma yin te /

original: thams cad du bre'i tshad do zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du bre'i tshad do zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The measure is always one bre.

original: de'i khu ba rkang pa'i cha shas tsam ka ra dang bsres pa gzhan pa'i nyin zhag nas btung ste /
analyzed: de'i khu ba rkang pa'i cha shas tsam ka ra dang bsres pa gzhan pa'i nyin zhag nas btung ste /
translated: That liquid, the size of one part, mixed with sugar, is drunk on the next day.

analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'di yis zhag gsum du tho rangs kyi dus su'o //
translated: Thus, in this way, at dawn for three days.

original: so ga nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis bsregs pas 'chi ster 'phrog ste khams bdun song ba dag kyang ngo zhes pa spu dang pags pa la sogs pa songs ba ste kyang yig gis gzhan yang ngo zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: so ga nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis bsregs pas 'chi ster 'phrog ste khams bdun song ba dag kyang ngo zhes pa spu dang pags pa la sogs pa songs ba ste kyang yig gis gzhan yang ngo zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: The sun's rays in spring burn it, and it is taken away by death, and even those who have gone to the seven realms.

original: da ni gser la nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pas bcud len gzhan gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni gser la nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pas bcud len gzhan gsungs te /
translated: Now, he declares another elixir with gold, sun, etc.

original: 'dir lus la phyi rol gyi bcud len don du gnyer ba gang su zhig gis grub pa'i bcud len med na bcud len 'bring po 'di bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir lus la phyi rol gyi bcud len don du gnyer ba gang su zhig gis grub pa'i bcud len med na bcud len 'bring po 'di bya'o //
translated: Here, whoever seeks an external elixir for the body, if he does not have a perfected elixir, he should make this middling elixir.

analyzed: 'di'i cho ga gsungs pa ni gser la ste rnam par dag pa'i gser la nyi ma zhes pa zangs dang khab len lcags dang pa da las skyes zhis pa lhang tsher gyi lcag sdang lcags zhes pa rnon po ste so sor mnyam pa'i cha bzung ba 'di dag
translated: The rite for this is declared: gold, pure gold, sun, copper, magnet, and iron, born from padma, the whip of the iron scorpion, sharp, and of equal parts, these

original: rnams kyi cha dang gser mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi cha dang gser mnyam pa'o //
translated: are taken in equal parts with the gold.

original: m'a kshi ka yi phye ma rab tu btab pa kha phye ba'i gong bur rlung drag pos sdud par bya ste /
analyzed: m'a kshi ka yi phye ma rab tu btab pa kha phye ba'i gong bur rlung drag pos sdud par bya ste /
translated: The powder of mak·π£ika is well sprinkled, and the lump is opened by a strong wind.

original: ji srid du gser gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du gser gnas pa'o //
translated: As long as it remains gold.

original: de nyid ni sa bon te sa bon de phyed kyis zhes pa gser srang gnyis kyis dngul gyi chu srang bzhi'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni sa bon te sa bon de phyed kyis zhes pa gser srang gnyis kyis dngul gyi chu srang bzhi'o //
translated: That very thing is the seed. By half of that seed, with two tolƒÅs of gold, four tolƒÅs of silver.

analyzed: dri ma dag dang bral ba zhes pa ni lan bdun gyi bar du sbyad  bar byas pas te bsgongs pas srang ni drug tu bya'o //
translated: Free from impurities, by practicing up to seven times, by boiling, it should be made into six tolƒÅs.

original: de nas ba yi dar ba mar dang bral ba drag po'i rtse mo can gyis zhes pa mi bzad pa'i mes bsad nas bsad pa de ras kyis btsags te snyigs ma dor nas shin tu dang ba'i dangs ma gzung bar bya'o //

translated: Then, with the tip of a strong cloth wick free from ghee, having killed by the unbearable fire, having strained that killed one with a cloth, the pure essence should be taken, having discarded the dross.

original: dangs ma de nyid khab len gyi snod du gser gyi gong bu dang lhan cig bskol bar bya ste ji srid phyed kyi tshad du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dangs ma de nyid khab len gyi snod du gser gyi gong bu dang lhan cig bskol bar bya ste ji srid phyed kyi tshad du gyur pa'o //
translated: That very essence, together with a lump of gold, should be boiled in an iron vessel, as long as it becomes half the size.

original: de nas rab tu blangs te dag pa'i ka ra srang brgyad ces pa la de ni rgyal po la sogs pa ma yin pa rnams kyis zas yongs su 'ju ba'i dbang gis dgu la sogs pa dang bdun la sogs pa yang ngo //üîΩpho ba ris kyi phye ma ka ra'i drug cu rtsa bzhi cha @8a * //
analyzed: de nas rab tu blangs te dag pa'i ka ra srang brgyad ces pa la de ni rgyal po la sogs pa ma yin pa rnams kyis zas yongs su 'ju ba'i dbang gis dgu la sogs pa dang bdun la sogs pa yang ngo // pho ba ris kyi phye ma ka ra'i drug cu rtsa bzhi cha @8a * //
translated: Then, having taken it, eight palas of pure sugar. This is for those who are not kings, etc. Due to the power of complete digestion of food, nine, etc. and seven, etc.

original: yang de la bsre bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang de la bsre bar bya'o //
translated: Also, sixty-four parts of the flour of the stomach-covering should be mixed with it.

original: de nyid thams cad dus su bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid thams cad dus su bza' bar bya ste /
translated: That itself should be eaten at all times,

original: kha zas rnam spangs bgrod pa ji srid nyid du'o //
analyzed: kha zas rnam spangs bgrod pa ji srid nyid du'o //
translated: as long as one avoids food.

original: zla ba drug gis lha yi lus te skra dkar gnyer ma dang bral ba 'di yis 'chi med nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: zla ba drug gis lha yi lus te skra dkar gnyer ma dang bral ba 'di yis 'chi med nyid du 'gyur /

analyzed: 'dir btung ba la t'a ma b'u la bza' ba bsgrub ste t'a ma b'u la'i snyigs ma dor nas so //
translated: Here, the juice of the tƒÅmb≈´la is prepared as food, having discarded the dregs of the tƒÅmb≈´la.
