analyzed: de ni thams cad dus su bza' bar bya zhes pa ni dangs ma de nyid cho ga nges bza' bar bya ste /
translated: That itself should be eaten at all times means that very essence should be eaten according to the prescribed ritual.

original: gser gyi gong bus rnam par dman pa longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: gser gyi gong bus rnam par dman pa longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should enjoy the half-gold, which is inferior to the gold mass.

original: 'on kyang ji srid gong bu yod pa de srid de dang lhan cig tu ste phyi nas de dang bral ba dus thams cad du'o zhes pa ni bcud len gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji srid gong bu yod pa de srid de dang lhan cig tu ste phyi nas de dang bral ba dus thams cad du'o zhes pa ni bcud len gyi nges pa'o //
translated: However, for as long as the mass exists, for that long together with it; later, when separated from it, at all times. This is the rule for mercury.

original: da ni sngar brjod ces pa la sogs pas zan la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod pa'i don du gser phyed ldan gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sngar brjod ces pa la sogs pas zan la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod pa'i don du gser phyed ldan gsungs te /
translated: Now, he says half-gold for the purpose of enjoying food, etc., with the words now, the seed and so on.

original: sngar brjod sa bon rgyal po mnyam pa dag ste gzhan yang dngul cha la ni blugs pa phyed tsam mo //
analyzed: sngar brjod sa bon rgyal po mnyam pa dag ste gzhan yang dngul cha la ni blugs pa phyed tsam mo //
translated: The seed mentioned before is equal to the king, and also half of the silver part is poured in.

original: lan tshva skyur po dag gis mnyes nas rnam pa mang po'i sman gyis ji srid gcig nyid du 'gyur pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lan tshva skyur po dag gis mnyes nas rnam pa mang po'i sman gyis ji srid gcig nyid du 'gyur pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Having mixed with sour salt, with many kinds of medicine, for as long as it becomes one.

original: de nas mkhris pa skyur pos mu zi sogs dang da nad dang / shi l'a dag kyang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas mkhris pa skyur pos mu zi sogs dang da nad dang / shi l'a dag kyang zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, with sour bile, with realgar, etc., and with ≈õilƒÅ,

original: 'dir dngul chu gnas pa'i don du rdzas rnam pa gsum ni dngul chu dang mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir dngul chu gnas pa'i don du rdzas rnam pa gsum ni dngul chu dang mtshungs pa ste /
translated: Here, for the purpose of preserving the mercury, the three substances are equal to the mercury.

original: dngul chu dang lhan cig mkhris pa dang skyur gyis mnye bar bya ste /
analyzed: dngul chu dang lhan cig mkhris pa dang skyur gyis mnye bar bya ste /
translated: Mercury should be mixed with bile and sour substances.

original: ba lang gi mkhris pa 'am nya'i mkhris pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi mkhris pa 'am nya'i mkhris pa'o //
translated: Bile of a cow or bile of a fish.

original: 'bras bu skyur mo ji ltar rnyed pa b'i dza p'u ra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyur mo ji ltar rnyed pa b'i dza p'u ra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sour fruits such as jujube and so on.

original: mu zi dang da ra da dang shi l'a dang t'a la k'a dang sha sha ka dang k'a k'i dang ka shi sa dang tud th'a ka dang hee ma gi ri k'a ste /
analyzed: mu zi dang da ra da dang shi l'a dang t'a la k'a dang sha sha ka dang k'a k'i dang ka shi sa dang tud th'a ka dang hee ma gi ri k'a ste /
translated: Realgar, orpiment, mica, talc, mica, crow dung, mica, tutha, and hematite.

original: mu zi la sogs pa 'di dag ni nye ba'i dngul chu gnyis te dngul chu chen po gcig dang gsum ni dngul chur mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: mu zi la sogs pa 'di dag ni nye ba'i dngul chu gnyis te dngul chu chen po gcig dang gsum ni dngul chur mtshungs pa'o //
translated: These realgar and so on are the two secondary mercuries. One great mercury and three are equal to mercury.

original: de yis dngul gyi 'dab ma byugs pa nyin zhag gsum thab kyi 'og tu bzhag pa ni gser nyid du 'gyur te thab kyi mes smin pa dag go //
analyzed: de yis dngul gyi 'dab ma byugs pa nyin zhag gsum thab kyi 'og tu bzhag pa ni gser nyid du 'gyur te thab kyi mes smin pa dag go //
translated: That anoints a silver leaf, placed under a hearth for three days, becomes gold, ripened by the fire of the hearth.

original: phyed dang ldan pa ste gser gyi so zhes pa ste gser phyed can gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: phyed dang ldan pa ste gser gyi so zhes pa ste gser phyed can gyi nges pa'o //
translated: Half-endowed, that is, a golden tooth, is the rule of half-gold.

original: da ni rnon po zhes pa la sogs pas me tog bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni rnon po zhes pa la sogs pas me tog bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Now, the author explains the flower, beginning with ‚Äúsharp‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir me tog gi sgras dramma gzugs can gyi rdzas brjod de rnon @8b po dngul gyis bkang zhing brdungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir me tog gi sgras dramma gzugs can gyi rdzas brjod de rnon @8b po dngul gyis bkang zhing brdungs pa'o //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúflower‚Äù expresses a substance with form, which is sharp, filled with silver, and struck.

original: 'di ni de'i 'dab ma dag pa ste rnon po dang nam mkha' las skyes zhes pa lhang tsher de nyid dang / aa la zhes pa t'a la k'a dang / lan tshva zhes pa rgyam tsha dang ya baksh'a ra dang sardza ra sa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i 'dab ma dag pa ste rnon po dang nam mkha' las skyes zhes pa lhang tsher de nyid dang / aa la zhes pa t'a la k'a dang / lan tshva zhes pa rgyam tsha dang ya baksh'a ra dang sardza ra sa ste /
translated: This is its pure petal, which is sharp, born from space, the same as the thorn, the tƒÅla tree, salt, and yavak·π£ƒÅra and sƒÅrjarasa.

original: rnon po la sogs pa rim pa yis 'phel ba zhes pa ni cha gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang lnga dang drug gi bar du'o //
analyzed: rnon po la sogs pa rim pa yis 'phel ba zhes pa ni cha gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang lnga dang drug gi bar du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIncreasing in stages with sharp and so on‚Äù means one, two, three, four, five, and up to six parts.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu byas pa nyi ma ste zangs nyis 'gyur dag la ro mnyam byed pas dang po kong bu kha bsdams par bsreg ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu byas pa nyi ma ste zangs nyis 'gyur dag la ro mnyam byed pas dang po kong bu kha bsdams par bsreg ste /
translated: All of those combined are the sun, the copper doubled, made of equal parts, first heated in a closed crucible.

original: de nas kong bu kha phye bar nyi ma'i lhag mar gyur gyi bar du bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas kong bu kha phye bar nyi ma'i lhag mar gyur gyi bar du bsreg par bya'o //
translated: Then, it should be heated until the remainder of the sun is in an open crucible.

original: slar yang lan tshvas te tam ga na'i lan tshvas dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang lan tshvas te tam ga na'i lan tshvas dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, with salt, that is, with tamalaki salt, it will be purified.

original: de bzhin ba las byung ba la sogs kyis bran 'jam par 'gyur zhes pa la ba las byung ba ni ba'i dar ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin ba las byung ba la sogs kyis bran 'jam par 'gyur zhes pa la ba las byung ba ni ba'i dar ba'o //
translated: Likewise, with the juice of the cow, etc., it will become soft. The juice of the cow is the milk of the cow.

original: sogs pas ni aarka'i rtsa ba dang / badzra ka na ka'i rtsa ba dang / ae randai rtsa ba dang / kshi ra kanytsu k'a'i rtsa ba rnams btags nas zhag bdun gyi bar du mnan par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pas ni aarka'i rtsa ba dang / badzra ka na ka'i rtsa ba dang / ae randai rtsa ba dang / kshi ra kanytsu k'a'i rtsa ba rnams btags nas zhag bdun gyi bar du mnan par bya'o //
translated: With the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù, the root of arka, the root of vajra-kanaka, the root of eranda, and the root of kshira-kantaka are included. Having mixed them, it should be pressed for seven days.

original: de nas ji srid mnyen par gyur gyi du dar ba de la bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ji srid mnyen par gyur gyi du dar ba de la bkru bar bya'o //
translated: Then, as long as it becomes soft, that juice should be washed.

original: de nyid dngul la sum cha byin zhing bkang ba 'am bsnun pa dag kyang dag pa'i me tog nyid du 'gyur te me tog gi 'dab ma'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid dngul la sum cha byin zhing bkang ba 'am bsnun pa dag kyang dag pa'i me tog nyid du 'gyur te me tog gi 'dab ma'i nges pa'o //
translated: That very [juice] should be given a third part of silver, and it will be purified, that is, it will become a pure flower. This is the rule for the petals of the flower.

original: da ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mchod pa'i don du dri dang spos la sogs pa'i le tshe sbyar ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mchod pa'i don du dri dang spos la sogs pa'i le tshe sbyar ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to worship the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, the author teaches the combination of perfumes, incense, etc.

original: ae la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ae la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: [He says,] ela and so on.

original: 'dir dri'i bstan bcos las gsungs pa'i cho gas sbyangs pa'i rdzas rnams re mig nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi le tshe sbyar ba la dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dri'i bstan bcos las gsungs pa'i cho gas sbyangs pa'i rdzas rnams re mig nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi le tshe sbyar ba la dgod par bya ste /
translated: Here, the substances purified by the rite taught in the treatise on perfumery should be set down in a checkerboard with twenty-five squares.

original: re mig dang po la ae la'o //
analyzed: re mig dang po la ae la'o //
translated: In the first square, e.

original: gnyis pa la ga pur ro //

original: de ltar cha bcva brgyad kyis dril phyis su 'gyur te dril phyis kyi rdzas kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar cha bcva brgyad kyis dril phyis su 'gyur te dril phyis kyi rdzas kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, by eighteen parts, there is the ointment. This is the rule of the substances of the ointment.üîΩNow, the grid of the oil is stated for the purpose of the oil of maturation.

original: da ni smin pa'i til mar gyi don du til mar gyi re mig sbyar ba gsungs pa sngar zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sngar brjod pa'i dri'i le tshe sbyar ba'i rdzas kyi tshogs ma bzlog pa chu skyes zhes pa sen mo ste chu skyes bzhin du
analyzed: da ni smin pa'i til mar gyi don du til mar gyi re mig sbyar ba gsungs pa sngar zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sngar brjod pa'i dri'i le tshe sbyar ba'i rdzas kyi tshogs ma bzlog pa chu skyes zhes pa sen mo ste chu skyes bzhin du
translated: The collection of substances of the grid of the fragrance stated previously is not reversed, and lotus is the nail.

original: lus dang zhes pa shun pa dang gra nthi barnna dag kyang @10b ste de dag cha gsum byin nas dri'i le tshe sbyar ba'i rdzas lnga dang bcas pa /
analyzed: lus dang zhes pa shun pa dang gra nthi barnna dag kyang @10b ste de dag cha gsum byin nas dri'i le tshe sbyar ba'i rdzas lnga dang bcas pa /
translated: Body means bark and granthi, and those are divided into three parts, and the five substances are applied to the sesame oil,

original: rdzas bdun gyi cha bcva brgyad kyis 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas til mar smin par bya ste dri sna tshogs kyi til mar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas bdun gyi cha bcva brgyad kyis 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas til mar smin par bya ste dri sna tshogs kyi til mar du 'gyur ro //
translated: and with the eighteen parts of the seven substances, the sesame oil is ripened in the sequence that will be explained, and it becomes sesame oil of various fragrances.

original: til mar gyi le tshe sbyar ba'i rdzas nges pa'o //
analyzed: til mar gyi le tshe sbyar ba'i rdzas nges pa'o //
translated: The substances applied to the sesame oil are determined.

original: de bzhin du phye ma la sogs pa ste phye ma dag gi yul la gra nthi de bzhin zhes pa ni sen mo bzhin du rdzas lnga po rnams la granthi barnna ka sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phye ma la sogs pa ste phye ma dag gi yul la gra nthi de bzhin zhes pa ni sen mo bzhin du rdzas lnga po rnams la granthi barnna ka sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the powders, etc. - in the country of the powders, granthi means that granthi-var·πáa should be given to the five substances like nails.

original: lus dang ha ta btung ba bsgo ba la sbyin par bya bar 'gyur te kha bsgo ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: lus dang ha ta btung ba bsgo ba la sbyin par bya bar 'gyur te kha bsgo ba la yang ngo //
translated: Body means that it should be given to the injunction of drink and the injunction of speech.

original: shun pa po la gri nthi dung zhes ba rdzas bzhi'i cha gsum ni 'bras bu'i smin pa dang 'dab ma sbyar ba'i smin pa dang dang ba'i smin pa dang sogs pa las khyogs kyi smin pa 'chad par 'gyur pa la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: shun pa po la gri nthi dung zhes ba rdzas bzhi'i cha gsum ni 'bras bu'i smin pa dang 'dab ma sbyar ba'i smin pa dang dang ba'i smin pa dang sogs pa las khyogs kyi smin pa 'chad par 'gyur pa la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The three parts of the four substances are to be applied to the ripening of the fruit, the ripening of the leaf, the ripening of the flower, and so forth, to the ripening of the carriage.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas rab dbye sum cu dag gis dri la sogs pa'i sbyor ba sum cu legs spras rnam mang dri dang spos la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang khrus dang dril phyis la sogs pa rnams dri don du gnyer ba rnams kyis bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas rab dbye sum cu dag gis dri la sogs pa'i sbyor ba sum cu legs spras rnam mang dri dang spos la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang khrus dang dril phyis la sogs pa rnams dri don du gnyer ba rnams kyis bya'o //
translated: Thus, by the thirty divisions in the order of expression, the thirty preparations of scent and so forth are to be made by those who seek the goal of scent, with many kinds of preparations of scent and incense and so forth, and with bathing, rubbing, and so forth.

original: rdzas ji ltar gyur pas she na rnam par dag cing 'bras bu sbyar bas smin dang bsgos pa dang ni phug pa dag gis 'dod par gyur pas so zhes pa ste rdzas bsdu ba'i nges pa'o ;
analyzed: rdzas ji ltar gyur pas she na rnam par dag cing 'bras bu sbyar bas smin dang bsgos pa dang ni phug pa dag gis 'dod par gyur pas so zhes pa ste rdzas bsdu ba'i nges pa'o ;
translated: How is it that the substances are so? By the ripening of the pure and the fruit, the ripening of the infusion and the ripening of the piercing, they become desirable. This is the rule for collecting the substances.

original: / da ni dri bdug pas smin pa gsungs pa dang por brgyad cha zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / da ni dri bdug pas smin pa gsungs pa dang por brgyad cha zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the ripening by burning the scent is stated: First, the eighth part, and so forth.

original: 'dir dri'i sbyor ba la 'dab ma rnam pa gsum ste tha ma dang 'bring dang mchog go //
analyzed: 'dir dri'i sbyor ba la 'dab ma rnam pa gsum ste tha ma dang 'bring dang mchog go //
translated: Here, the application of incense is of three types: inferior, middling, and superior.

original: de la tha ma ni gla sgang dang shee lee ya dang a'u sh'i ra dang b'a la ka dang ka pingtha dang bi la ba dang m'u ra dang m'am si zhes pa ste rdzas 'di dag ni tha ma'o //
analyzed: de la tha ma ni gla sgang dang shee lee ya dang a'u sh'i ra dang b'a la ka dang ka pingtha dang bi la ba dang m'u ra dang m'am si zhes pa ste rdzas 'di dag ni tha ma'o //
translated: Among them, the inferior ones are: glang-gang, shai-le-ya, u-shi-ra, ba-la-ka, ka-ping-ta, bi-la-ba, mu-ra, and ma-tsi. These substances are inferior.

original: 'di dag gi dbang gis ni 'dab ma'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: 'di dag gi dbang gis ni 'dab ma'i dbang gis so //
translated: By their power, by the power of the leaves.

original: dang por bska ba ste aa ru ra'i phye ma bu ram gyis sbyar ba'i bdug par 'gyur te de 'dab ma'i brgyad chas dang bor nyin zhag gcig bdug par bya'o //
analyzed: dang por bska ba ste aa ru ra'i phye ma bu ram gyis sbyar ba'i bdug par 'gyur te de 'dab ma'i brgyad chas dang bor nyin zhag gcig bdug par bya'o //
translated: First, the astringent, which is a paste of yellow myrobalan fruit mixed with molasses, becomes the incense. With a quantity of that equal to one eighth of a leaf, one should first burn incense for one day and night.

original: de nas nyin zhag gnyis me tog bsgo ba byas nas nyin zhag gsum pa la 'bring po'i 'dab ma bsre bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nyin zhag gnyis me tog bsgo ba byas nas nyin zhag gsum pa la 'bring po'i 'dab ma bsre bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having made a flower garland for two days, on the third day one should burn the middling leaf.

original: de nas de'i nyis 'gyur dag ni drag po'i spos zhes pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma de'i nyis 'gyur dag ni drag po'i spos zhes pa ste rgya skyegs dang sa rdza ra sa dang shr'i b'a sa dang gu gu la dang kun du ru ka ste lngaüîΩpo @11a * //
analyzed: de nas de'i nyis 'gyur dag ni drag po'i spos zhes pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma de'i nyis 'gyur dag ni drag po'i spos zhes pa ste rgya skyegs dang sa rdza ra sa dang shr'i b'a sa dang gu gu la dang kun du ru ka ste lnga po @11a * //
translated: Then, twice that much is fierce incense. Twice the previous and later is called fierce incense. Five: lac, realgar, turmeric, guggula, and costus.

original: 'di dag bu ram gyi sbyar bas drag po'i spos su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag bu ram gyi sbyar bas drag po'i spos su 'gyur ro //
translated: These five, mixed with molasses, become fierce incense.

original: bska ba'i nyis 'gyur sbyin par bya ste 'dab ma'i rkang pa'i cha shas so //
analyzed: bska ba'i nyis 'gyur sbyin par bya ste 'dab ma'i rkang pa'i cha shas so //
translated: Twice the astringent is given, the part of the petal's foot.

original: 'dir 'bring po'i 'dab ma ni me tog gi sde dang tsandan dang aa ka ru dang 'bras bu'i sde dang sen mo dang shun pa'i sde dang khu ba'i sde dang ste de ltar nyin zhag gnyis drag po'i bdug pas bdug par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'bring po'i 'dab ma ni me tog gi sde dang tsandan dang aa ka ru dang 'bras bu'i sde dang sen mo dang shun pa'i sde dang khu ba'i sde dang ste de ltar nyin zhag gnyis drag po'i bdug pas bdug par bya ste /
translated: Here, the medium petal is the flower class, sandalwood, agaru, the fruit class, nail and bark class, and sap class. Thus, for two days, one should fumigate with fierce incense.

original: gcig gis bar du chod pa'i nyin zhag gnyis te me tog gis bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: gcig gis bar du chod pa'i nyin zhag gnyis te me tog gis bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: For two days, interrupted by one, one should fumigate with flowers.

original: phyi nas rdzas kyi tshad kyi bu ram dag kyang bdug pa dang lhan cig so ga nges par bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas rdzas kyi tshad kyi bu ram dag kyang bdug pa dang lhan cig so ga nges par bsreg par bya'o //
translated: Then, after that, the molasses, which is the substance, should be burned together with the incense, every day.

original: de nas so ga'i sbyor bdag las 'phel te dbyar rdzas kyi nyis 'gyur dang dgun sum 'gyur sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas so ga'i sbyor bdag las 'phel te dbyar rdzas kyi nyis 'gyur dang dgun sum 'gyur sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, the application of the molasses should be increased in the summer, twice the amount of the substance, and in the winter, three times.

original: de nas bu ram tshig par gyur pa ni dung zhes pa sen mo'i rkang pa'i cha shas bu ram dang lhan cig sngar brjod pa'i cho gas nyin zhag gnyis nges par bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bu ram tshig par gyur pa ni dung zhes pa sen mo'i rkang pa'i cha shas bu ram dang lhan cig sngar brjod pa'i cho gas nyin zhag gnyis nges par bsreg par bya'o //
translated: Then, when the molasses is burned, the conch, which is a part of the foot of the nail, should be burned together with the molasses, as described before, for two days.

original: de nas sbrang rtsi dang dkar po ste sha ka ra dag kyang rdzas dang mnyam pa gong bu'i bdug pa dang lhan cig nges par bsreg ste /
analyzed: de nas sbrang rtsi dang dkar po ste sha ka ra dag kyang rdzas dang mnyam pa gong bu'i bdug pa dang lhan cig nges par bsreg ste /
translated: Then, the honey and the white sugar should also be burned together with the incense, in equal amounts.

original: bdug pa ni kham bu'i dang po dang mjug tu 'bab zhig pa nges par bsreg go //
analyzed: bdug pa ni kham bu'i dang po dang mjug tu 'bab zhig pa nges par bsreg go //
translated: The incense should be burned at the beginning and end of the mango.

original: de bzhin du bu ram yang nyin zhag so sor kham bu gsum bsregs nas ngal bso bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bu ram yang nyin zhag so sor kham bu gsum bsregs nas ngal bso bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the molasses should be burned three times a day for each mango, and then rested.

original: nyin zhag so sor rdzas kyi brgyad cha'i sbos nges par bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag so sor rdzas kyi brgyad cha'i sbos nges par bsreg par bya'o //
translated: One should burn one eighth of the substance every day.

original: rnam pa gzhan du smin pas ni ma smin par 'gyur zhing lhag pas dri tshig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du smin pas ni ma smin par 'gyur zhing lhag pas dri tshig par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, by burning it will not be cooked, and by excess it will be smelly.

original: ma smin na skyur bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: ma smin na skyur bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: If it is not cooked, it will be sour. This is the rule.

original: gong gu zhes pa ni gong bu'i bdug pa ste le tshe sbyar ba las brjod pa'i ga pur dang bcas shing drag po'i rdzas spangs pa rdzas lnga sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyis sbyar bas gong bu'i bdug pa ste de nyid dung gi tshad de zhes pa ni
analyzed: gong gu zhes pa ni gong bu'i bdug pa ste le tshe sbyar ba las brjod pa'i ga pur dang bcas shing drag po'i rdzas spangs pa rdzas lnga sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyis sbyar bas gong bu'i bdug pa ste de nyid dung gi tshad de zhes pa ni
translated: The pellet incense is the incense of a pellet. From the combination of the described camphor and the five substances excluding the fierce substance, combined with honey and molasses, is the pellet incense. That itself is the size of a conch.

original: rdzas kyi rkang pa'i cha shes nges par bsreg go //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rkang pa'i cha shes nges par bsreg go //
translated: One should burn one quarter of the substance.

original: de la p'u ta ke sha dang dz'a ti phal dang ga pur dang lte ba dang gzhan le tshe sbyar ba las brjod pa mchog gi 'dab ma re byin nas ma la yin tsandan no //
analyzed: de la p'u ta ke sha dang dz'a ti phal dang ga pur dang lte ba dang gzhan le tshe sbyar ba las brjod pa mchog gi 'dab ma re byin nas ma la yin tsandan no //
translated: There, the best leaf is given from the combination of the described putake≈õa, jƒÅtiphala, camphor, and navel, and the other combination of the described supreme leaf.

original: yang ba zhes pa ni aa ka ru'o //
analyzed: yang ba zhes pa ni aa ka ru'o //
translated: The light one is agarwood.

original: g-yo ba zhes pa ni si hal ka'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes pa ni si hal ka'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoving‚Äù is ≈õa·πÖkha.

original: zla ba zhes pa ni ga pur te de dang ldan pa ni rdzas gsum mo /
analyzed: zla ba zhes pa ni ga pur te de dang ldan pa ni rdzas gsum mo /
translated: ‚ÄúMoon‚Äù is camphor. These three substances are combined.

original: de bzhin no zhes pa ni gong bu'i bdug pa dang mtshungs par sbrang rtsi dang @11b sha ka ra dang bcas pa nges par bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes pa ni gong bu'i bdug pa dang mtshungs par sbrang rtsi dang @11b sha ka ra dang bcas pa nges par bsreg par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust so‚Äù means that just as the incense is in a ball, so the honey and sugar are also to be burned together.

original: 'dir bu ram ni gong bu'i bu ram ste khu ba sngon du 'gro ba can ni ma yin no zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir bu ram ni gong bu'i bu ram ste khu ba sngon du 'gro ba can ni ma yin no zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Here, the molasses is in a ball, not in a liquid form, this is the rule.

original: de nas smin pa'i dri shes nas te smin pa mnyes pa 'di'i dris gal te lag pa'i mthil dmar por gyur na de'i tshe yongs su smin pa'o /
analyzed: de nas smin pa'i dri shes nas te smin pa mnyes pa 'di'i dris gal te lag pa'i mthil dmar por gyur na de'i tshe yongs su smin pa'o /
translated: Then, knowing the smell of ripeness, if the palm of the hand becomes red, then it is fully ripe.

original: ci ste ma smin na ji srid smin par ma gyur pa de srid du dkar po'i bdug pa bsreg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste ma smin na ji srid smin par ma gyur pa de srid du dkar po'i bdug pa bsreg par mi bya'o //
translated: If it is not ripe, then as long as it does not become ripe, one should not burn the white incense.

original: smin pa'i dri 'di ni me tog bzang po tsam pa ka la sogs pa dri zhim po rnams kyis nyin zhag 'ga' zhig ste /
analyzed: smin pa'i dri 'di ni me tog bzang po tsam pa ka la sogs pa dri zhim po rnams kyis nyin zhag 'ga' zhig ste /
translated: This smell of ripeness is just like the smell of good flowers such as jasmine.

original: phyogs kyi phyed dam phyogs gcig gi bar du bdug pa'i skyon spong ste de nas 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi phyed dam phyogs gcig gi bar du bdug pa'i skyon spong ste de nas 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The fault of smoking is removed by half or one quarter of the direction, and then one will desire it.

original: phyi nas 'bugs pa brgya yi cha shas 'bras bu gsum zhes pa ni dza' ti pha la dang kakkola dang yang na kakkola'i gnas su ae la dang 'khri shing gla rtsi'o //
analyzed: phyi nas 'bugs pa brgya yi cha shas 'bras bu gsum zhes pa ni dza' ti pha la dang kakkola dang yang na kakkola'i gnas su ae la dang 'khri shing gla rtsi'o //
translated: The three fruits, one hundredth part of the smoke, later, means that one should make one hundredth part of the smoke with an equal part of nutmeg, mace, or in the place of mace, cardamom and valerian.

original: zla ba zhes pa ni ga pur ro //
analyzed: zla ba zhes pa ni ga pur ro //
translated: The moon means camphor.

original: ma da zhes pa ni g'a rtsi ste 'di dag cha mnyam par byas nas brgya yi cha shas kyi dris 'bugs pa bya'o //
analyzed: ma da zhes pa ni g'a rtsi ste 'di dag cha mnyam par byas nas brgya yi cha shas kyi dris 'bugs pa bya'o //
translated: The mad means resin. Having made these equal parts, one should make one hundredth part of the smoke.

original: chang dang bcas pas zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i myos pa'i chad dang lhan cig 'bugs pa brgya yi cha shas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: chang dang bcas pas zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i myos pa'i chad dang lhan cig 'bugs pa brgya yi cha shas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Together with the alcohol means that one should give one hundredth part of the smoke together with the alcohol that will be explained, which is intoxicating.

original: chang ni 'bugs pa'i brgyad 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chang ni 'bugs pa'i brgyad 'gyur ro //
translated: The alcohol is eight times the smoke.

original: 'bugs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'bugs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for the smoke.

original: da ni dri rnams bslang ba'i don du chang gsungs pa shi gru zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dri'i bstan bcos las gsungs pa'i chogs rgya cher gang du chang la sogs pa smin pa ci 'dra ba de ni dri'i bstan bcos de nyid las shes par byaüîΩste 'dir yang mdor bsdus pas brjod do //
analyzed: da ni dri rnams bslang ba'i don du chang gsungs pa shi gru zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dri'i bstan bcos las gsungs pa'i chogs rgya cher gang du chang la sogs pa smin pa ci 'dra ba de ni dri'i bstan bcos de nyid las shes par bya ste 'dir yang mdor bsdus pas brjod do //
translated: Now, in order to explain the scents, he says ‚Äúbeer‚Äù and so on. Here, one should understand from that very treatise on scents what kind of beer and so on is produced in what place, and here it is expressed in brief.

original: shi gru'i chu zhes pa ni shi gru'i khu ba dang tshva ga m'u tra dang me tog bcud dang ces pa sbrang rtsi ste de dang mnyam pa ni tshad mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: shi gru'i chu zhes pa ni shi gru'i khu ba dang tshva ga m'u tra dang me tog bcud dang ces pa sbrang rtsi ste de dang mnyam pa ni tshad mtshungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWater of shigru‚Äù is the juice of shigru and tsabwa, and ‚Äúflower essence‚Äù is honey. Equal to that means equal in quantity.

original: me tog las skyes mthar zhes pa ni sbrang rtsi'i mthar thug par mas bskol bar bya'o //
analyzed: me tog las skyes mthar zhes pa ni sbrang rtsi'i mthar thug par mas bskol bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUp to the end of flower‚Äù means up to the end of honey, one should boil with milk.

original: de nas blangs te n'a ri ke la sogs par blugs nas so ba'i phung po'i dbus su zla ba gcig smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas blangs te n'a ri ke la sogs par blugs nas so ba'i phung po'i dbus su zla ba gcig smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having taken it up, having poured it into a nƒÅrikela and so on, it will ripen in a heap of chaff in one month.

original: ri dags dang mnyam chad dang lte ba 'bigs pa'o zhes pa ni mes smin pa'i mjug tu lte ba zhes pa gla rtsi dang ma gsungs kyang ga pur dang 'bras bu gsum ste /üîΩdes brgya'i cha shas 'bugs pa byis nas so ba de la gzhag par bya'o de nas dri'i dri 'bugs pa @12a * //
analyzed: ri dags dang mnyam chad dang lte ba 'bigs pa'o zhes pa ni mes smin pa'i mjug tu lte ba zhes pa gla rtsi dang ma gsungs kyang ga pur dang 'bras bu gsum ste / des brgya'i cha shas 'bugs pa byis nas so ba de la gzhag par bya'o de nas dri'i dri 'bugs pa @12a * //
translated: Although not mentioned, it is said to be musk, camphor, and the three fruits.üîΩHaving pierced a part of the hundred, one should place it in the mouth.

original: ldar brjod pa bya'o //
analyzed: ldar brjod pa bya'o //
translated: Then one should speak of the piercing of the smell of smell.

original: zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty.

original: dri'i bstan bcos thams cad las bdug pa smin pa la bdug pa'i 'khrul 'khor rnam pa gsum ni mnyam pa dang da ma ru'i rnam pa dang steng kham por gyi dbyibs can te dbus su sor mo gnyis kyi bug pa can /
analyzed: dri'i bstan bcos thams cad las bdug pa smin pa la bdug pa'i 'khrul 'khor rnam pa gsum ni mnyam pa dang da ma ru'i rnam pa dang steng kham por gyi dbyibs can te dbus su sor mo gnyis kyi bug pa can /
translated: In all treatises on smell, the three types of incense wheels for ripening incense are equal, the shape of a damaru, and the shape of an upper bowl, with a hole of two fingers in the middle.

original: sor mo drug pa ni tham ste bska ba dang drag po'i bdug pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sor mo drug pa ni tham ste bska ba dang drag po'i bdug pa'i don du'o //
translated: The six-fingered one is the tam, for the purpose of the incense of astringent and pungent.

original: 'bring po ni sor mo brgyad pa'i dbangs  te sen mod dang bu ram dang gong bu'i spos kyi don du'o //
analyzed: 'bring po ni sor mo brgyad pa'i dbangs  te sen mod dang bu ram dang gong bu'i spos kyi don du'o //
translated: The medium one is the eight-fingered one, for the purpose of the incense of senmod, molasses, and balls.

original: mchog ni sor mo bcu pa ste bsil ba'i spos kyi don du'o //
analyzed: mchog ni sor mo bcu pa ste bsil ba'i spos kyi don du'o //
translated: The best is ten fingers, for the sake of cool incense.

original: 'khrul 'khor 'di'i 'og tu bye ma dang bcas pa'i g-yo mo sgyed pu'i steng du byin nas tsha ba'i bye ma la bdug pa 'dzin pa byin te de'i steng du 'khrul 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor 'di'i 'og tu bye ma dang bcas pa'i g-yo mo sgyed pu'i steng du byin nas tsha ba'i bye ma la bdug pa 'dzin pa byin te de'i steng du 'khrul 'khor ro //
translated: Under this machine, having given a pan with sand on a tripod, one should give a holder for hot sand, and on top of that the machine.

original: 'khrul 'khor gyi steng du dri'i rdzas sor phyed kyi dpangs su rab tu byugs pa'i 'jim pa'i thod pa ste rdzas shin tu chud pa la n'a ri ke la byin nas bdug pa nges par bsreg par bya ste /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gyi steng du dri'i rdzas sor phyed kyi dpangs su rab tu byugs pa'i 'jim pa'i thod pa ste rdzas shin tu chud pa la n'a ri ke la byin nas bdug pa nges par bsreg par bya ste /
translated: On top of the machine, a clay pot smeared with fragrant substances half a finger high, and having given a wick soaked in oil, one should burn the incense.

original: dbyug gu gcig dang dbyug gu phyed du bdug pa'i tshad shes nas so //
analyzed: dbyug gu gcig dang dbyug gu phyed du bdug pa'i tshad shes nas so //
translated: Having understood the measure of burning for one gha·π≠ikƒÅ and half a gha·π≠ikƒÅ,

original: de nas thod pa blangs te spang leb kyi steng du gos byin nas gang gis du ba mi 'gro ba kha 'og tu phyogs par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas thod pa blangs te spang leb kyi steng du gos byin nas gang gis du ba mi 'gro ba kha 'og tu phyogs par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: then one should take the pot, give it cloth on a plank, and place it face down so that the smoke does not escape.

original: smin pa'i dus su yang thod pa dang 'khrul 'khor gyi bar du gsher ba'i gos kyis dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: smin pa'i dus su yang thod pa dang 'khrul 'khor gyi bar du gsher ba'i gos kyis dkri bar bya'o //
translated: At the time of ripening, one should also wrap the pot and the machine with a wet cloth in between.

original: zhes pa ni bdug pa smin pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdug pa smin pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for the ripening of incense.

original: 'bras bus smin pa ni ba'i dza p'u ra'i nang gi 'bras bu phyung nas pags pa yongs su bsgyur pa'i nang du dri'i rdzas rab tu gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bus smin pa ni ba'i dza p'u ra'i nang gi 'bras bu phyung nas pags pa yongs su bsgyur pa'i nang du dri'i rdzas rab tu gzhag par bya'o //
translated: As for the ripening of fruit, one should take out the fruit of the bael tree, and having completely removed the skin, one should place the fragrant substance inside.

original: phyi ro / du shing shun gyis dkris nas 'jim pas sor gcig gi dpangs su byug par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ro / du shing shun gyis dkris nas 'jim pas sor gcig gi dpangs su byug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having wrapped it in the bark of the tree, one should smear it with clay to the height of one finger.

original: phyi nas ba lang gi lci ba'i mes kha sbyor gyi sbyor bas smin par bya ste ji srid byug pa me'i mdog tu gyur pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: phyi nas ba lang gi lci ba'i mes kha sbyor gyi sbyor bas smin par bya ste ji srid byug pa me'i mdog tu gyur pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Then, with the union of the cow dung fire, one should ripen it until the smear has the color of fire.

original: de las lhag ni dra nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las lhag ni dra nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is more than that, the fragrance will be lost.

original: de nas me las byung ste bsil bar gyur pa'i 'dir ni lta ba la sogs pa rnams kyis sngar brjod pa'i cho gas dbug par bya ste 'bras bu smin pa'i nges pa'o /
analyzed: de nas me las byung ste bsil bar gyur pa'i 'dir ni lta ba la sogs pa rnams kyis sngar brjod pa'i cho gas dbug par bya ste 'bras bu smin pa'i nges pa'o /
translated: Then, having cooled it from the fire, one should pierce it with the previously mentioned procedure of looking and so on. This is the rule for the ripening of fruit.

original: 'dab ma sbyar ba'i smin pa la yang ste ke ta k'i'i 'dab ma rnams kyis snod byas nas nang du dri'i rdzas gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dab ma sbyar ba'i smin pa la yang ste ke ta k'i'i 'dab ma rnams kyis snod byas nas nang du dri'i rdzas gzhug par bya ste /
translated: The ripened fruit of the ketaka flower is also used: the petals are joined and the inner substance of the fragrance is placed inside.

original: lhag ma ni 'bras bu smin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni 'bras bu smin pa bzhin no //
translated: The rest is like the ripened fruit.

original: dang ba'i smin pa la gser ram dngul gyi bum pa'i nang la dri'i rdzas @12b dpangs sor gcig gis byugs pa zangs kyi snod dri'i chus phyed yongs su bkang ba la rkyal bar byed cing bskol ba nyams su myong ba ste ngang pa bzhin rkyal bar byed pas
analyzed: dang ba'i smin pa la gser ram dngul gyi bum pa'i nang la dri'i rdzas @12b dpangs sor gcig gis byugs pa zangs kyi snod dri'i chus phyed yongs su bkang ba la rkyal bar byed cing bskol ba nyams su myong ba ste ngang pa bzhin rkyal bar byed pas
translated: The ripened fruit of the lotus is like a golden or silver vase. The inner substance of the fragrance is smeared on the inside with a finger. A copper vessel is half filled with fragrant water and a wick is placed in it. It is heated and experienced.

original: ngang pa'i smin pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ngang pa'i smin pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is like a swan swimming, it is called the ripened fruit of the swan.

original: dbug pa la sogs pa ni sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: dbug pa la sogs pa ni sngar bzhin no //
translated: The piercing and so on are as before.

original: ngang pa'i smin pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: ngang pa'i smin pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the ripened fruit of the swan.

original: ngang pa'i smin pa dang zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir khyogs kyi smin pa la sogs pa brjod par bya ste 'dir dri'i bstan bcos las brjod pa'i rdzas rnam pa dgu'i nang nas dman pa'i 'dab ma rnams dag pa'i slad du las rnam pa brgyad de bkru ba
analyzed: ngang pa'i smin pa dang zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir khyogs kyi smin pa la sogs pa brjod par bya ste 'dir dri'i bstan bcos las brjod pa'i rdzas rnam pa dgu'i nang nas dman pa'i 'dab ma rnams dag pa'i slad du las rnam pa brgyad de bkru ba
translated: The text should also mention the ‚Äúswan‚Äôs beak‚Äù and so on, because the treatise on perfumery mentions nine substances.

original: dang dugs dang mnye ba dang brdung ba dang ; spang ba dang bdug pa dang bsgo ba dang dbug pa'o //
analyzed: dang dugs dang mnye ba dang brdung ba dang ; spang ba dang bdug pa dang bsgo ba dang dbug pa'o //
translated: The eight actions are washing, bathing, massaging, beating, rubbing, fumigation, anointing, and piercing.

original: de la bkru ba ni rtsa ba mos so //üîΩdugs ni khyogs kyi smin pas so //
analyzed: de la bkru ba ni rtsa ba mos so // dugs ni khyogs kyi smin pas so //
translated: Washing is with roots.üîΩBathing is with a swan‚Äôs beak.

original: mnye ba ni dri'i chus so //üîΩbrdung ba ni bu ram gyi chu la sogs pas so //
analyzed: mnye ba ni dri'i chus so // brdung ba ni bu ram gyi chu la sogs pas so //
translated: Massaging is with perfumed water.üîΩBeating is with sugar water and so on.

original: spang ba ni shi gru dang tsh'a ga m'u tra la sogs pas so //
analyzed: spang ba ni shi gru dang tsh'a ga m'u tra la sogs pas so //
translated: Rubbing is with shigru, chaga, and so on.

original: bdug pa ni bska ba dang drag po dag gis so //
analyzed: bdug pa ni bska ba dang drag po dag gis so //
translated: Fumigation is with astringent and pungent substances.

original: bsgo ba ni ke ta k'i la sogs pa'i me tog rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bsgo ba ni ke ta k'i la sogs pa'i me tog rnams kyis so //
translated: Anointing is with ketaka and so on.

original: dbug pa ni lte ba la sos pa'i rdzas rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dbug pa ni lte ba la sos pa'i rdzas rnams kyis so //
translated: Piercing is with substances that are inserted into the navel.

original: gla sgang la sogs pa ni dman pa'i 'dab ma rnams dang me tog gi tshogs la bkru ba dang bsro ba la sogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: gla sgang la sogs pa ni dman pa'i 'dab ma rnams dang me tog gi tshogs la bkru ba dang bsro ba la sogs pa bya ste /
translated: The sugar cane, etc., are like the inferior leaves, the collection of flowers, and so on.

original: brdung ba spangs nas so //
analyzed: brdung ba spangs nas so //
translated: One should avoid beating them.

original: de bzhin du shun pa'i tshogs dang 'bring po'i 'dab ma rnams dang rtsa ba'i tshogs dang shing gi tshogs dang / 'dab ma'i tshogs dang 'tsho ba'i tshogs la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shun pa'i tshogs dang 'bring po'i 'dab ma rnams dang rtsa ba'i tshogs dang shing gi tshogs dang / 'dab ma'i tshogs dang 'tsho ba'i tshogs la'o //
translated: Similarly, for the collection of barks, the collection of medium leaves, the collection of roots, the collection of trees, the collection of leaves, and the collection of living beings.

original: sen mo ni brdung ba'o //
analyzed: sen mo ni brdung ba'o //
translated: The nails are beaten.

original: pu tre ke sha ni sbyar ba'i smin pa'o //
analyzed: pu tre ke sha ni sbyar ba'i smin pa'o //
translated: Putrake≈õa is the ripening of the mixture.

original: lhag ma ni me tog gi tshogs bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni me tog gi tshogs bzhin no //
translated: The rest is like the collection of flowers.

original: 'bras bu'i tshogs dang khu ba'i tshogs dang zhu ba'i rdzas kyi tshogs la las ci yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i tshogs dang khu ba'i tshogs dang zhu ba'i rdzas kyi tshogs la las ci yang mi bya'o //
translated: For the collection of fruits, the collection of juices, and the collection of dissolving substances, one should not do anything.

original: brjod pa'i rdzas 'di rnams phye mar byas nas snod kyi khar gos kyi steng du phye ma sbyin no //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rdzas 'di rnams phye mar byas nas snod kyi khar gos kyi steng du phye ma sbyin no //
translated: Having ground these described substances, one should place the powder on the edge of the vessel on top of a cloth.

original: snod dri chus phyed gang ba sgyed pu'i steng du bzhag blang ba'i dugs kyis dugs bya ste ji srid phye ma rlon par gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: snod dri chus phyed gang ba sgyed pu'i steng du bzhag blang ba'i dugs kyis dugs bya ste ji srid phye ma rlon par gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: A vessel half filled with urine is placed on a tripod, and the patient is heated with a heating blanket until the powder becomes moist.

original: de nas blangs te mnye ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nas blangs te mnye ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Then, having removed it, he should be massaged, etc.

original: de bzhin du pu tra ke sha'i yang khyogs kyi dugs dang sen mo'i dugs kyi gnas su ba lang gi lci ba dang 'jim pas bskol ba dang rdung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du pu tra ke sha'i yang khyogs kyi dugs dang sen mo'i dugs kyi gnas su ba lang gi lci ba dang 'jim pas bskol ba dang rdung ba'o //
translated: Similarly, in the case of putrakƒìshi, the patient is heated with a blanket and heated with a nail heated with cow dung and clay.

original: bska ba'i chus bran pa ste lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bska ba'i chus bran pa ste lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He is sprinkled with astringent water, and the rest is as before.

original: @13a * // smin pa rnam pa lnga'i nges pa'i //
analyzed: @13a * // smin pa rnam pa lnga'i nges pa'i //
translated: The determination of the five types of ripeness.

original: lhag ma ni dri don du gnyer ba rnams kyis dri'i bstan bcos las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni dri don du gnyer ba rnams kyis dri'i bstan bcos las shes par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood from the treatises on scents by those who seek the meaning of scents.

original: da ni dri la sogs pa rnams kyis gsang ba gsungs pa gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni dri la sogs pa rnams kyis gsang ba gsungs pa gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the secret of scents, etc. is stated in secret, etc.

original: 'dir dri la sogs pa rnams bsil ba'i spos kyi smin pa'i dus su gsang ba ni dri la p'u ti sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dri la sogs pa rnams bsil ba'i spos kyi smin pa'i dus su gsang ba ni dri la p'u ti sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Here, the secret of scents, etc. is to give puuti to the scent, etc. at the time of ripening of cool incense.

original: ras sen mo g-yo ba zhes pa ni gsang ba ste 'dri spos kyis smin pa la skyur bar gyur pa'i dir rnams la spos sbyin par bya ste spos kyi sbyor ba byas nas so //
analyzed: ras sen mo g-yo ba zhes pa ni gsang ba ste 'dri spos kyis smin pa la skyur bar gyur pa'i dir rnams la spos sbyin par bya ste spos kyi sbyor ba byas nas so //
translated: The nail-trembling cloth is a secret, and one should give the incense to the women who are ripe with incense, having prepared the incense compound.

original: spos kyi spyir ba zhes pa ni spos kyis smin pa'i yul la gandha ra sa dang / sen mo dang si hal ka bu ram gyis sbyangs nas nyin zhag gcig gam nyin zhag gnyis te ji srid skyur ba nyid 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: spos kyi spyir ba zhes pa ni spos kyis smin pa'i yul la gandha ra sa dang / sen mo dang si hal ka bu ram gyis sbyangs nas nyin zhag gcig gam nyin zhag gnyis te ji srid skyur ba nyid 'dor ba'o //
translated: The incense-general is the country that is ripe with incense, and one should give the incense to the women there, having prepared the incense with nails, salt, and molasses, for one day or two days, until the sourness is removed.

original: de nas gong bu la sogs pa sbyin par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gong bu la sogs pa sbyin par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Then one should give the pill, etc. is a conclusion.

original: ci ste smin pa drag pos dri tshig par gyur na mtshan mo ri bong mtshan pa'i 'od zer gyis dri la reg par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste smin pa drag pos dri tshig par gyur na mtshan mo ri bong mtshan pa'i 'od zer gyis dri la reg par bya'o //
translated: If the ripe [woman] becomes burned by the strong incense, one should touch the incense with the moonlight of the rabbit-marked [moon].

original: de med na ji srid tshig pa'i skyon nye bar zhi bar gyur gyi bar du chu'i 'gram du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de med na ji srid tshig pa'i skyon nye bar zhi bar gyur gyi bar du chu'i 'gram du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If that is not available, one should place [the incense] on the bank of a river until the fault of burning is pacified.

original: dri rnams rnam par nyams pa'i rgyu brjod par bya ste 'dir ma dag pa dang dag pa'i rdzas rnams gcig pa nyid ni rnam par nyams pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: dri rnams rnam par nyams pa'i rgyu brjod par bya ste 'dir ma dag pa dang dag pa'i rdzas rnams gcig pa nyid ni rnam par nyams pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of the destruction of scents is to be stated. Here, the identity of impure and pure substances is the cause of destruction.

original: de bzhin du 'bru mar dang rlan dang bcas pa'i gnas dang sog ma dang 'gyur byed kyi rdzas dang bshad gci dang byi bas reg pa dang shin tu dro ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bru mar dang rlan dang bcas pa'i gnas dang sog ma dang 'gyur byed kyi rdzas dang bshad gci dang byi bas reg pa dang shin tu dro ba'i gnas so //
translated: Similarly, sesame oil, a damp place, straw, substances that cause transformation, urine and excrement, and a very hot place are the cause of destruction.

original: de bzhin bsil ba zhes pa tsandan dang du ru ska dang gu ru dang ri bong can ni gsang ba ste bu tra ke sha'i mjug tu bsil ba la sogs pa'i spos sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin bsil ba zhes pa tsandan dang du ru ska dang gu ru dang ri bong can ni gsang ba ste bu tra ke sha'i mjug tu bsil ba la sogs pa'i spos sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, sandalwood, duruka, guru, and ≈õa≈õin are secret, and at the end of putraka, one should offer cool incense, etc.

original: zhes pa ste smin pa'i mthar nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste smin pa'i mthar nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule at the end of ripening.

original: bsgo ba'i bya bar me tog gsang ba ste ji sri spos kyis skyon nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba'i bya bar me tog gsang ba ste ji sri spos kyis skyon nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The secret flower is for the act of ordering, and as long as the fault of incense is pacified.

original: 'bugs pa la zhes pa la 'bugs pa'i yul lag pur dang gla rtsi dang 'bras bu gsum dang ma da'i chang zhes pa gla rtsi'i chang gsang ba ste ji srid me tog bsgo ba'i skyon nye bar zhi bar gyur par ro zhes pa ste dri'i sbyor ba'i nges
analyzed: 'bugs pa la zhes pa la 'bugs pa'i yul lag pur dang gla rtsi dang 'bras bu gsum dang ma da'i chang zhes pa gla rtsi'i chang gsang ba ste ji srid me tog bsgo ba'i skyon nye bar zhi bar gyur par ro zhes pa ste dri'i sbyor ba'i nges
translated: This is the definitive statement on the application of scent.

original: pa'o // yang dag khrus sbyor la zhes pa ni khrus kyi yul gdon mi za bar ro //
analyzed: pa'o // yang dag khrus sbyor la zhes pa ni khrus kyi yul gdon mi za bar ro //
translated: In the case of in the application of bathing, the place of bathing is certainly

original: gsang ba zhes pa ni sbyin par bya ste khrus kyi rdzas kyi tshogs kyi nang du shun pa grantha barnna nags su rgyu ba dang bcas zhes pa ni pu @13b tra ke sha dang bcas pa ste cha gsum cha bcva lnga'i dbus su sbyin par bya'o zhes pa
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa ni sbyin par bya ste khrus kyi rdzas kyi tshogs kyi nang du shun pa grantha barnna nags su rgyu ba dang bcas zhes pa ni pu @13b tra ke sha dang bcas pa ste cha gsum cha bcva lnga'i dbus su sbyin par bya'o zhes pa
translated: secret, that is, it is to be given. In the midst of the collection of bathing substances, that is, in the midst of the collection of the substances for bathing, together with the bark of granthiana and varanasi, that is, together with purtrakesa, is to be given in the middle of the third or fifteenth part.

original: ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definitive statement.

original: dril phyis kyi sbyor ba la grantha barnna sbyin par bya ste cha ni khrus la ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dril phyis kyi sbyor ba la grantha barnna sbyin par bya ste cha ni khrus la ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: In the application of rubbing, granthiana is to be given, and the part is as in bathing.

original: dri'i le tshe sbyar ba'i cho ga gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dri'i le tshe sbyar ba'i cho ga gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the procedure of the application of the scent mandala.

original: da ni lta ba'i gtso bo'i dri gsungs pa chu skyes dag pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe rdzas gcig gis dri'i rgyal po bya bar 'dod na de'i tshe chu skyes dag pa zhes pa ni sen mo'o //
analyzed: da ni lta ba'i gtso bo'i dri gsungs pa chu skyes dag pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe rdzas gcig gis dri'i rgyal po bya bar 'dod na de'i tshe chu skyes dag pa zhes pa ni sen mo'o //
translated: Now, the chief smells are mentioned, beginning with ‚Äúpure lotus.‚Äù Here, when one wishes to make the king of smells with one substance, then ‚Äúpure lotus‚Äù is the nails.

original: de nyid ni spyir rnam pa bzhi ste glang po che'i rna ba dang rta'i rmig pa dang autpala'i 'dab ma dang ba da ra'i 'dab ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni spyir rnam pa bzhi ste glang po che'i rna ba dang rta'i rmig pa dang autpala'i 'dab ma dang ba da ra'i 'dab ma'o //
translated: That is generally of four kinds: like the ear of an elephant, like the hoof of a horse, like the leaf of an utpala, and like the leaf of a vadara.

original: de rnams la dri'i sbyor ba la glang po che'i rna ba dang rta'i rmig pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la dri'i sbyor ba la glang po che'i rna ba dang rta'i rmig pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Among them, for the application of smell, one should use the ear of an elephant and the hoof of a horse.

original: spos kyi sbyor ba la ba da ra dang autpala'i 'dab ma'o //
analyzed: spos kyi sbyor ba la ba da ra dang autpala'i 'dab ma'o //
translated: For the application of incense, one should use the leaf of a vadara and the leaf of an utpala.

original: 'dir yang ba da ra'i 'dab ma mchog ste de med na autpala'i 'dab ma la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang ba da ra'i 'dab ma mchog ste de med na autpala'i 'dab ma la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the leaf of a vadara is supreme. If that is not available, one should use the leaf of an utpala, etc.

original: dag pa ni dri'i bstan bcos las brjod pa'i cho gas bskol ba dang brdung ba dang bu ram dang bska ba'i chus bran pa dang phye mar byas pa dang 'bras bu gsum la sogs pas byug pa dang bsgos pa'i phyir dag pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni dri'i bstan bcos las brjod pa'i cho gas bskol ba dang brdung ba dang bu ram dang bska ba'i chus bran pa dang phye mar byas pa dang 'bras bu gsum la sogs pas byug pa dang bsgos pa'i phyir dag pa'o //
translated: Pure means pure by boiling, pounding, sprinkling with molasses and astringent water, making into powder, anointing with the three fruits, etc., according to the rites described in the treatises on scents.

original: de nyid gzhan pa'i rdzas kyis dman zhing dang rab dag dang zhes pa ni chang ste de dang rnam par bral ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan pa'i rdzas kyis dman zhing dang rab dag dang zhes pa ni chang ste de dang rnam par bral ba'o //
translated: That itself is inferior to other substances, pure, and excellent, which is beer, free from that.

original: dri yi chu yis btags zhes pa ni 'dir dri yi chu yi don du shin tu dang ba'i chu blangs nas ae la dang shun pa dang m'a si dang b'a la ka dang tsan dang rnams zho gnyis thum por bcings te chu bre brgyad la gzhug par bya'o
analyzed: dri yi chu yis btags zhes pa ni 'dir dri yi chu yi don du shin tu dang ba'i chu blangs nas ae la dang shun pa dang m'a si dang b'a la ka dang tsan dang rnams zho gnyis thum por bcings te chu bre brgyad la gzhug par bya'o
translated: Anointed with scented water means that here, having taken very clear water for the purpose of scented water, one should take two measures of cardamom, bark, masi, valaka, and chandana, and put them in eight drona of water.

original: // de nas rkang pa'i lhag mar bskol bar bya ste srid de'i chur gyur par ro //
analyzed: // de nas rkang pa'i lhag mar bskol bar bya ste srid de'i chur gyur par ro //
translated: Then, one should boil the remainder of the water until it becomes half the amount.

original: des dri gzhan yang brtag par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: des dri gzhan yang brtag par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: By that, one should also examine other scents. This is the rule.

original: spos kyis smin pa zhes pa ni sen mo dag pa btags pa de nyid bdug pas smin pa'i cho gas spos kyis smin pa'o //
analyzed: spos kyis smin pa zhes pa ni sen mo dag pa btags pa de nyid bdug pas smin pa'i cho gas spos kyis smin pa'o //
translated: The one who is ripe with incense is the one who is ripe with the rite of ripening by means of incense, which is the application of the pure nail.

original: bska ba drag po sbrang rtsi dang bcas lag skyes dag gis kham bu rim pas 'phel zhes pa la sbrang rtsi dang ka ra dang bcas pa bska ba'i kham bu gcig ste nyin zhag dang po la'o //
analyzed: bska ba drag po sbrang rtsi dang bcas lag skyes dag gis kham bu rim pas 'phel zhes pa la sbrang rtsi dang ka ra dang bcas pa bska ba'i kham bu gcig ste nyin zhag dang po la'o //
translated: The pomegranate increases gradually with astringent, strong, honey, and hand-grown. With honey and sugar, there is one pomegranate, on the first day.

original: kham bu'i thog ma tha mar sbrang rtsi dag dang dkar po nges par bsreg ste dang po spos las so //
analyzed: kham bu'i thog ma tha mar sbrang rtsi dag dang dkar po nges par bsreg ste dang po spos las so //
translated: At the end of the pomegranate, one should definitely burn honey and sugar, first from the incense.

original: zhes pa'i nges pa las dang por sbrang rtsi dang sha ka ra'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i nges pa las dang por sbrang rtsi dang sha ka ra'o //
translated: From the rule, first honey and sugar.

original: bar du bska ba'i spos kyi kham bu sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: bar du bska ba'i spos kyi kham bu sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In the middle, one should give the pomegranate incense.

original: slar yang kham bu'i mjug @14a * //
analyzed: slar yang kham bu'i mjug @14a * //
translated: Again, at the end of the pomegranate,

original: tu sbrang rtsi dang ka ra nges par bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: tu sbrang rtsi dang ka ra nges par bsreg par bya'o //
translated: one should definitely burn honey and sugar.

original: nyin zhag gnyis pa la me tog bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag gnyis pa la me tog bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: On the second day, one should order the flowers.

original: de ltar gcig gis bar du chod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gcig gis bar du chod pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is interrupted by one.

original: drag po'i spos kyis kham bu gnyis nyin zhag gnyis la nges par bsreg go //
analyzed: drag po'i spos kyis kham bu gnyis nyin zhag gnyis la nges par bsreg go //
translated: With strong incense, two apricots for two days.

original: sen mo'i kham bu gsum nyin zhag gsum gyis so //
analyzed: sen mo'i kham bu gsum nyin zhag gsum gyis so //
translated: With three apricots, three days.

original: de nas kham bu gnyis ni ka ra bsres pa dag ste zhes pa ni ma la ya'i kham bu gnyis nyin zhag gnyis la'o //
analyzed: de nas kham bu gnyis ni ka ra bsres pa dag ste zhes pa ni ma la ya'i kham bu gnyis nyin zhag gnyis la'o //
translated: Then, two apricots mixed with sugar, for two days.

original: g-yo ba'i gcig ste lcags dang ga pur dag gis yang ngo //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i gcig ste lcags dang ga pur dag gis yang ngo //
translated: One moving, with iron and camphor, again.

original: kham bu'i thog ma dang tha mar sbrang rtsi dang sha ka ra sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: kham bu'i thog ma dang tha mar sbrang rtsi dang sha ka ra sngar bzhin no //
translated: At the beginning and end of the apricots, honey and sugar, as before.

original: de ltar gcig gis bar du chos pas nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i spos kyis smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gcig gis bar du chos pas nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i spos kyis smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, with one in between, for twenty-four days with incense, it will ripen.

original: de nas nyin zhag bcus me tog bzang po rnams kyis bsgo nga byas nas de ji srid spos kyi skyon nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de nas nyin zhag bcus me tog bzang po rnams kyis bsgo nga byas nas de ji srid spos kyi skyon nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Then, for ten days, it should be infused with good flowers, until the fault of the incense is pacified.

original: dri yi chu yis bsres pa dag ces pa ni sngar gyi cho gas nyin zhag so sor dri'i chus bskol par bya'o //
analyzed: dri yi chu yis bsres pa dag ces pa ni sngar gyi cho gas nyin zhag so sor dri'i chus bskol par bya'o //
translated: Mixed with fragrant water, each day, with the previous method, it should be boiled with fragrant water.

original: chu grang mo sbyin par mi bya ste chu grang mos bsgyur par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu grang mo sbyin par mi bya ste chu grang mos bsgyur par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should not give cold water, because it would be changed by the cold water.

original: dri yi chu de yis bsres pa'i dri byas nas /
analyzed: dri yi chu de yis bsres pa'i dri byas nas /
translated: Having mixed that fragrant water,üîΩone should make a paste with that.

original: 'jim pa'i thod pa 'dzag pa min pa phyi rol nas spra tshil dang gos kyis bcings te brtan par kha bcad la de nyid ni gzhan shin tu che ba'i snod kyi rdza mar ro //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i thod pa 'dzag pa min pa phyi rol nas spra tshil dang gos kyis bcings te brtan par kha bcad la de nyid ni gzhan shin tu che ba'i snod kyi rdza mar ro //
translated: Having bound the outside of the pot with beeswax and cloth, one should firmly close the mouth.

original: yang na sa 'og tu ste de med na'o //
analyzed: yang na sa 'og tu ste de med na'o //
translated: If that is not available, then in the ground.

original: snod der bcug la steng nas bye ba sbyin par bya ste ji srid snod kyi mgrin pa'i mthar thug pa gang bar gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: snod der bcug la steng nas bye ba sbyin par bya ste ji srid snod kyi mgrin pa'i mthar thug pa gang bar gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: Having placed that pot there, one should give sand on top, as much as is necessary to fill the neck of the pot.

original: bye mas gang ba'i snod de la thun mong ba'i chu nyi mas dros pa sbyin no //
analyzed: bye mas gang ba'i snod de la thun mong ba'i chu nyi mas dros pa sbyin no //
translated: One should give common water warmed by the sun to the pot filled with sand.

original: snod de nyid nyi ma'i 'od la zla ba drug gi bar du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: snod de nyid nyi ma'i 'od la zla ba drug gi bar du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: That pot should be placed in the sun for six months.

original: de ltar zla ba drug gi nye bar sbyor bas smin par 'gyur te chu la gnas pa lte ba'i ga bo'i dri zhes pa ni dri'i rgyal po'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zla ba drug gi nye bar sbyor bas smin par 'gyur te chu la gnas pa lte ba'i ga bo'i dri zhes pa ni dri'i rgyal po'i nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, by the application of six months, it is ripened. The smell of the navel, which is located in the water, is the certainty of the king of smells.

original: da ni dri'i til mar gyi don dang me tog gi til mar gyi slad du til dag pa gsungs pa til zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dri til yongs su smin pa sar pa rnams yang dag par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: da ni dri'i til mar gyi don dang me tog gi til mar gyi slad du til dag pa gsungs pa til zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dri til yongs su smin pa sar pa rnams yang dag par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Now, in order to explain the sesame seed for the oil of smell and the sesame seed for the oil of flowers, the pure sesame seed is stated: sesame seed, etc. The sesame seed of smell should be taken as the ripe, new sesame seed.

original: 'dab ma bskol ba'i chu dag dang zhes pa 'dab ma ni aa mra'i 'dab ma'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma bskol ba'i chu dag dang zhes pa 'dab ma ni aa mra'i 'dab ma'o //
translated: The water of the boiled leaf, etc. The leaf is the leaf of the mango.

original: de bzhin du dzam bu dang ka pi tha dad ma du lung ga dang bil ba rnams kyi ste shing lnga'i 'dab @14b ma'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du dzam bu dang ka pi tha dad ma du lung ga dang bil ba rnams kyi ste shing lnga'i 'dab @14b ma'o ;
translated: Likewise, the leaves of the five trees, the jambu, the kapitha, the madhuka, and the bilva.

original: / de dag bskol ba'i chu ni 'dab ma'i chu ste nges ma nyes nas til rnams kyi sbun pa bsal ba ni dag pa dang po'o //
analyzed: / de dag bskol ba'i chu ni 'dab ma'i chu ste nges ma nyes nas til rnams kyi sbun pa bsal ba ni dag pa dang po'o //
translated: The water of the boiled leaf is the leaf water. The removal of the husk of the sesame seed, which is not spoiled, is the first purification.

original: de nas dra ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyi steng du gos byin nas de'i steng du til rnams snod gzhan gyis byibs nas bdug bar bya ste dag pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de nas dra ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyi steng du gos byin nas de'i steng du til rnams snod gzhan gyis byibs nas bdug bar bya ste dag pa gnyis so //
translated: Then, having given cloth to the top of the machine, having pressed the sesame seeds with another vessel on top of that, one should fumigate it. Those are the two purifications.

original: byugs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni 'bras bu gsum dri'i chus btags pa'i byug pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: byugs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni 'bras bu gsum dri'i chus btags pa'i byug pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: With ointments, etc. means that one should give an ointment of the three fruits mixed with perfumed water.

original: sogs pas ni nyi ma'i 'od kyis bskam par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pas ni nyi ma'i 'od kyis bskam par bya'o //
translated: By etc., one should dry it with the light of the sun.

original: de ltar til rnams dag byas nas phyi nas dza' ti la sogs me tog rnams kyis nyin zhag 'ga' zhig ste phyogs sam nyin zhag bcur bar chad med par bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar til rnams dag byas nas phyi nas dza' ti la sogs me tog rnams kyis nyin zhag 'ga' zhig ste phyogs sam nyin zhag bcur bar chad med par bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: Having thus purified the sesame seeds, one should then infuse them for a few days, for a fortnight or ten days, without interruption, with flowers such as jasmine.

original: ji srid bsgos pa rnams bsgos pa'i me tog gi dri 'dzin pa'i bar du ste de ni 'dod pa bsgos pa yin no //
analyzed: ji srid bsgos pa rnams bsgos pa'i me tog gi dri 'dzin pa'i bar du ste de ni 'dod pa bsgos pa yin no //
translated: As long as the infused flowers retain their fragrance, that is the desired infusion.

original: de nas til btsir ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyis ta li mar blangs nas mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas til btsir ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyis ta li mar blangs nas mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: Then, having taken sesame oil with a sesame seed press, the lord of men means the buyer.

original: mkhas pas mching bu'i snod du gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: mkhas pas mching bu'i snod du gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The wise one should place it in a quartz vessel.

original: til mar de ni khrus sam yan lag byug pa dag la myos byed me tog til mar nyid ni smin par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: til mar de ni khrus sam yan lag byug pa dag la myos byed me tog til mar nyid ni smin par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: That oil is for bathing or anointing the limbs. The oil of flowers is matured.

original: ci ste smin pa'i til mar byed par 'dod na de'i tshe til mar de nyid dri bzang po'i chu dang mnyam pa bskol bar bya ste ji srid til mar gyi dbu ba 'dor gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ci ste smin pa'i til mar byed par 'dod na de'i tshe til mar de nyid dri bzang po'i chu dang mnyam pa bskol bar bya ste ji srid til mar gyi dbu ba 'dor gyi bar du'o //
translated: If one wishes to make matured oil, then one should heat that oil itself together with fragrant water until the foam of the oil is gone.

original: de nas 'bogs pa'i dus su dri'i rdzas brgya cha'i dri'i chus btags pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'bogs pa'i dus su dri'i rdzas brgya cha'i dri'i chus btags pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, at the time of pouring, one should add a hundred parts of fragrant substances mixed with fragrant water.

original: phyi nas dbog par bya ste ji srid grangs par gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: phyi nas dbog par bya ste ji srid grangs par gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: After that, one should pour it until it becomes thick.

original: de nas gla rtsi la sogs pa'i 'bugs pa byin nas mchid bu'i snod du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gla rtsi la sogs pa'i 'bugs pa byin nas mchid bu'i snod du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then, having added the ingredients of musk and so on, it should be placed in a clay pot.

original: de nyid ma da'i chang rkang pa'i cha shas kyis bsres nas rgya skyegs kyi snod du nyi ma'i 'od kyis zhag bdun gsungs na gla rtsi'i til mar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid ma da'i chang rkang pa'i cha shas kyis bsres nas rgya skyegs kyi snod du nyi ma'i 'od kyis zhag bdun gsungs na gla rtsi'i til mar du 'gyur ro //
translated: That itself, mixed with a quarter part of fermented grain beer, should be placed in a lac vessel for seven days in the sun's rays. It becomes musk oil.

original: 'od ma'i dong par smin pa ni nye ma'i smin par 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'od ma'i dong par smin pa ni nye ma'i smin par 'gyur te //
translated: The ripening in the hollow of the bamboo becomes the ripening of the near bamboo.

original: de ltar byug pa la sogs pa ni 'od ma'i dong par smin zhing lte ba la sogs pas phug pa mchog gi byug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byug pa la sogs pa ni 'od ma'i dong par smin zhing lte ba la sogs pas phug pa mchog gi byug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the anointing, etc., ripens in the hollow of the bamboo, and the piercing with the navel, etc., becomes the supreme anointing.

original: de ltar cho ga sna tshogs pa dri'i bstan bcos las gsungs pa'i dri la sogs pa'i sbyar ba bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar cho ga sna tshogs pa dri'i bstan bcos las gsungs pa'i dri la sogs pa'i sbyar ba bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should make the application of the scents, etc., according to the various rites taught in the treatises on scents.

original: 'dri ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor bsdus pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dri ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor bsdus pa gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed Lord has taught the scents in brief.

original: dri'i rigs pa des pa'o //üîΩda ni sbrum ma rnams btsa' @15a * //
analyzed: dri'i rigs pa des pa'o // da ni sbrum ma rnams btsa' @15a * //
translated: The scents are of the nature of the elements.

original: ba'i don du thams cad sum cu rtsa bzhi'i 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
analyzed: ba'i don du thams cad sum cu rtsa bzhi'i 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
translated: Now, for the sake of the delivery of pregnant women, he teaches the yantra of the thirty-four.

original: sa 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe sbrum ma rnams btsa' ba'i dus phyi rol gyi pho nya mo'i skyon gyis mngal rengs par gyur na de'i tshe 'khrul 'khor 'di tshad kyi rgyab tu bri bar bya ste tshang ces pa ni bre'o //
analyzed: sa 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe sbrum ma rnams btsa' ba'i dus phyi rol gyi pho nya mo'i skyon gyis mngal rengs par gyur na de'i tshe 'khrul 'khor 'di tshad kyi rgyab tu bri bar bya ste tshang ces pa ni bre'o //
translated: The earth-holder, etc. Here, when the time of delivery of pregnant women is obstructed by the fault of an external messenger, then this yantra should be drawn on the back of a tortoise.

original: de'i rgyab tu re mig bcu drug byas nas re mig dang po las 'dzin te bdun no //
analyzed: de'i rgyab tu re mig bcu drug byas nas re mig dang po las 'dzin te bdun no //
translated: Behind that, having made sixteen squares, the first square is the holder of the lotuses, that is, seven.

original: gnyis pa la nyi ma ste bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la nyi ma ste bcu gnyis so //
translated: The second is the sun, that is, twelve.

original: gsum pa la zla ba ste gcig go //
analyzed: gsum pa la zla ba ste gcig go //
translated: The third is the moon, that is, one.

original: bzhi pa lam nu ste bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa lam nu ste bcu bzhi'o //
translated: The fourth is the twin, that is, fourteen.

original: lnga pa la mig ste gnyis so //
analyzed: lnga pa la mig ste gnyis so //
translated: The fifth is the eye, that is, two.

original: drug pa la 'dod pa ste bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: drug pa la 'dod pa ste bcu gsum mo //
translated: The sixth is the desire, that is, thirteen.

original: bdun pa la nor te brgyad do //
analyzed: bdun pa la nor te brgyad do //
translated: The seventh is the wealth, that is, eight.

original: brgyad pa la drag po ste bcu gcig go //
analyzed: brgyad pa la drag po ste bcu gcig go //
translated: The eighth is the fierce one, that is, eleven.

original: dgu pa la rgyal po ste bcu drug go //
analyzed: dgu pa la rgyal po ste bcu drug go //
translated: The ninth is the king, that is, sixteen.

original: bcu pa la me zhe pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bcu pa la me zhe pa gsum mo //
translated: The tenth is the fire, that is, three.

original: bcu gcig pa la phyogs zhes pa bcu'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa la phyogs zhes pa bcu'o //
translated: The eleventh is the direction, that is, ten.

original: bcu gnyis pa la 'byung ba zhes pa lnga'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la 'byung ba zhes pa lnga'o //
translated: The twelfth is the element, that is, five.

original: bcu gsum pa la bug pa zhes pa dgu'o //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa la bug pa zhes pa dgu'o //
translated: The thirteenth is the hole, that is, nine.

original: bcu bzhi pa la drug pa drug go //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa la drug pa drug go //
translated: The fourteenth is the six, that is, six.

original: bcva lnga pa la tshes zhes pa bcva nga'o //
analyzed: bcva lnga pa la tshes zhes pa bcva nga'o //
translated: The fifteenth is the lunar day, that is, fifteen.

original: bcu drug pa la chu gter dag ces pa ni bzhi ste mtha' yi re mig bcu drug pa la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu drug pa la chu gter dag ces pa ni bzhi ste mtha' yi re mig bcu drug pa la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The sixteenth is the ocean, that is, four.

original: re mig bzhi pa la gnas pa'i aom ka 'di rnams kyi grangs gcig tu bsdus pa ni chu yi gter dang rtse mo can zhes pa sum cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: re mig bzhi pa la gnas pa'i aom ka 'di rnams kyi grangs gcig tu bsdus pa ni chu yi gter dang rtse mo can zhes pa sum cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The number of these OMs and KAs in the fourth square is thirty-four, called ‚Äúthe treasure of water‚Äù and ‚Äúthe peak.‚Äù

original: thams cad du dpal ldan 'khor lo mtha' dag ni tshad kyi rgyab tu bris nas 'khrul 'khor 'di rab tu btsa' bar 'gyur pa'i dus su sbrum ma rnams la bstan par bya zhes pa ste mngal 'gro ba'i nges pa'o ;
analyzed: thams cad du dpal ldan 'khor lo mtha' dag ni tshad kyi rgyab tu bris nas 'khrul 'khor 'di rab tu btsa' bar 'gyur pa'i dus su sbrum ma rnams la bstan par bya zhes pa ste mngal 'gro ba'i nges pa'o ;
translated: All of this, the glorious wheel, is written on the back of the measure. This wheel should be shown to pregnant women at the time of the birth of the child. This is the rule for conception.

original: / da ni mngal la sogs pa byis pa'i rgyud gsungs pa rnal 'byor ma rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / da ni mngal la sogs pa byis pa'i rgyud gsungs pa rnal 'byor ma rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the sequence of the child in the womb, etc., is stated: ‚Äúthe yoginƒ´s,‚Äù etc.

original: 'dir sa yi steng du rab gsal rnal ;'byor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi gang yin pa de dag ni brgyad pa brgyad kyi ma mor rab tu grags so //
analyzed: 'dir sa yi steng du rab gsal rnal ;'byor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi gang yin pa de dag ni brgyad pa brgyad kyi ma mor rab tu grags so //
translated: Here, the sixty-four yoginƒ´s who are well known on the surface of the earth are well known as the eight mothers of the eight classes.

original: de dag gi nang nas mngal zhes bya ba sum 'gyur dgu zhes pa ni nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: de dag gi nang nas mngal zhes bya ba sum 'gyur dgu zhes pa ni nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: Among them, the one called ‚Äúwomb‚Äù is nine times three, that is, twenty-seven.

original: nyin zhag ces bya bcu'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag ces bya bcu'o //
translated: The one called ‚Äúday‚Äù is ten.

original: bcu gcig pa zla ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa zla ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The eleventh is called the month.üîΩThe other fifteen are called the five groups of three.

original: gzhan ni lnga pa gsum zhes pa bcva lnga ni lo zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa gsum po de dag byis pa 'dzin te mtha' dag sa yi steng du'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni lnga pa gsum zhes pa bcva lnga ni lo zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa gsum po de dag byis pa 'dzin te mtha' dag sa yi steng du'o //
translated: The sixty-three are called the child-bearer, and all are on the surface of the earth.üîΩThe womb is the pain of the embryo, and the pain of the birth-place at the time of birth.

original: mngal du zug rngu dang ni rab tu @15b btsa' ba'i dus su skye gnas la yang zug gzer byed pa nyid ces pa ni 'dir mngal zhes bya ba rnams kyi nang nas bcva lnga ni mngal bzung ba'i nyin zhag nas brtsams te nyin zhag bcva lnga'i bar du
analyzed: mngal du zug rngu dang ni rab tu @15b btsa' ba'i dus su skye gnas la yang zug gzer byed pa nyid ces pa ni 'dir mngal zhes bya ba rnams kyi nang nas bcva lnga ni mngal bzung ba'i nyin zhag nas brtsams te nyin zhag bcva lnga'i bar du
translated: Here, among the wombs, fifteen are the womb-holders, starting from the day of conception up to fifteen days.

original: mngal du zug rdu rab tu byed do //
analyzed: mngal du zug rdu rab tu byed do //
translated: In the womb, they cause pain.

original: de nas dgu ni zla ba dgu'i bar du rab tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: de nas dgu ni zla ba dgu'i bar du rab tu 'gro'o //
translated: Then, nine are for nine months.

original: rab tu btsa' ba'i dus su gcig go //
analyzed: rab tu btsa' ba'i dus su gcig go //
translated: One is at the time of birth.

original: nu ma'i 'o ma 'phrog pa gnyis te mngal zhes bya ba rnams kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: nu ma'i 'o ma 'phrog pa gnyis te mngal zhes bya ba rnams kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Two are for taking away the milk of the breasts. This is the rule for the wombs.

original: skyes pa rnams la byis pa'i rgyud du 'gyur te nyin zhag dbang dang zla ba lo yi rab dbye las zhes pa la 'dir byis pa'i rgyud ces pa ni ma mos gzir ba rnams kyi byis pa gso ba'o //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams la byis pa'i rgyud du 'gyur te nyin zhag dbang dang zla ba lo yi rab dbye las zhes pa la 'dir byis pa'i rgyud ces pa ni ma mos gzir ba rnams kyi byis pa gso ba'o //
translated: Here, the channels of the child are the children of those who are oppressed by the demoness.

original: de la nyin zhag ces bya ba rnams la 'chad par 'gyur pa'i gtor ma sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: de la nyin zhag ces bya ba rnams la 'chad par 'gyur pa'i gtor ma sbyin par bya ste /
translated: There, the so-called days are the days on which the oblation should be given, as will be explained.

original: byis pa skyes pa rnam pa skyes pa'i nyin zhag nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byis pa skyes pa rnam pa skyes pa'i nyin zhag nas brtsams te /
translated: The children who are born begin to be oppressed on the day of their birth.

original: nyin zhag drug cu'i bar du rang rang gi nyin zhag la gzir bar byed pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag drug cu'i bar du rang rang gi nyin zhag la gzir bar byed pa rnams la'o //
translated: They are oppressed on their own days until the sixtieth day.

original: zla ba re re'i dbang gis bcu gcig po rnams la zla ba bcu gcig gi bar du'o //
analyzed: zla ba re re'i dbang gis bcu gcig po rnams la zla ba bcu gcig gi bar du'o //
translated: By the force of each month, they are oppressed for eleven months.

original: de nas bcva lnga po rnams la lo bcva lnga'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de nas bcva lnga po rnams la lo bcva lnga'i bar du'o //
translated: Then, by the force of each fifteen-day period, they are oppressed for fifteen years.

original: de'i steng du byis pa gzhon nu nyid med de lo bcu drug pa la khu ba 'dzag pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du byis pa gzhon nu nyid med de lo bcu drug pa la khu ba 'dzag pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: After that, there is no childhood, because the semen is emitted in the sixteenth year. This is a rule.

original: da ni ma rungs pa lnga gsungs pa ma rungs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni ma rungs pa lnga gsungs pa ma rungs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the five wicked ones are declared, beginning with ‚Äúwicked‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir sa'i steng du dga' ba la sogs pa'i tshes kyi dbye bas tshes lnga po rnams kyi mtshams su gzhon nu rnams te nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis tshigs mtshams dag la yang dag gnas so //
analyzed: 'dir sa'i steng du dga' ba la sogs pa'i tshes kyi dbye bas tshes lnga po rnams kyi mtshams su gzhon nu rnams te nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis tshigs mtshams dag la yang dag gnas so //
translated: Here, on the earth, the divisions of the lunar days such as the first day of the bright fortnight, by the divisions of the lunar days, the five lunar days, at the junctures, the youths, by the power of the qualities of the nature of space and so on, are perfectly situated at the junctures.
