original: de dag rang gi tshes la 'jigs gyur byis pa 'dzin par byed de thams cad thun mong gi gtor mas byis pa nges par gtong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag rang gi tshes la 'jigs gyur byis pa 'dzin par byed de thams cad thun mong gi gtor mas byis pa nges par gtong bar mi byed do //
translated: They terrify their own lunar days, and the children are seized. They do not release the children with the common bali offering.

original: rgyal po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The king is the Tibetan.

original: de dag zhi ba'i don du 'dri ni rnam mang dkyil 'khor khrus dang sbyin sreg gi bya ba 'chad par 'gyur pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur zhes pa ni ma rungs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de dag zhi ba'i don du 'dri ni rnam mang dkyil 'khor khrus dang sbyin sreg gi bya ba 'chad par 'gyur pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur zhes pa ni ma rungs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: For the sake of their pacification, the many kinds of ablutions, the ma·πá·∏çala ablutions, and the rites of burnt offerings, which will be explained, are the pacification of the wicked.

original: da ni mngal zhes bya ba rnams kyis gzir ba'i sbrum ma rnams kyi /
analyzed: da ni mngal zhes bya ba rnams kyis gzir ba'i sbrum ma rnams kyi /
translated: Now, by the ones called ‚Äúwomb‚Äù and so on, the pregnant women are afflicted.

original: sman gsungs pa ru rta zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sman gsungs pa ru rta zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The medicine is said to be turmeric, etc.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe sbrum ma rnams kyi mngal na bar gyur na de'i tshe sman ni ru rta dang au shi ra dang / ka se ru dang ta ka ra'i rtsa ba dang autpala'i rtsa ba dang padma ge @16a * //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe sbrum ma rnams kyi mngal na bar gyur na de'i tshe sman ni ru rta dang au shi ra dang / ka se ru dang ta ka ra'i rtsa ba dang autpala'i rtsa ba dang padma ge @16a * //
translated: Here, when a pregnant woman is in labor, then the medicine is turmeric, ushira, kaseru, the root of taka, the root of utpala, and lotus stamen.

original: sar te rdzas 'di dag bsil ba'i chu yongs su dangs pas btags shing rdo rje yis ni bsngags pa dag kyang zhes pa la /
analyzed: sar te rdzas 'di dag bsil ba'i chu yongs su dangs pas btags shing rdo rje yis ni bsngags pa dag kyang zhes pa la /
translated: These substances are ground with pure cool water and also praised with the vajra.

original: aom a'a:h'um aa mu k'a y'a garbha sh'u lam ha ra ha ra sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um aa mu k'a y'a garbha sh'u lam ha ra ha ra sv'a h'a /
translated: O·πÉ ƒÅ·∏• h≈´·πÉ. May such and such a woman's womb be released, released!

original: zhes pa ni sngags te 'dis mngon par bsngags nas mngal gyi zug rdul rab sbyin zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags te 'dis mngon par bsngags nas mngal gyi zug rdul rab sbyin zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: This is the mantra. Having praised with this, the pain of the womb is given, it is certain.

original: de bzhin du mngal ni rengs na na ku la'i spu brgyad dang gtsug phung can gyi ste rma bya'i mjug ma bzung nas bsil ba'i chus btags te mngon par bsngags nas snga ma bzhin du sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngal ni rengs na na ku la'i spu brgyad dang gtsug phung can gyi ste rma bya'i mjug ma bzung nas bsil ba'i chus btags te mngon par bsngags nas snga ma bzhin du sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, if the womb is stiff, having taken the feathers of a peacock and the tail of a tuft-bearer, ground with cool water, praised, and given as before.

original: 'o ma phrogs pa rnams 'o ma'i shing gi 'og tu khrus bya'o //
analyzed: 'o ma phrogs pa rnams 'o ma'i shing gi 'og tu khrus bya'o //
translated: Those who have stolen milk should bathe under a milk tree.

original: ba'i 'o mas gang ba'i kham phor bdun dang 'o ma'i zan gyi gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i 'o mas gang ba'i kham phor bdun dang 'o ma'i zan gyi gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should offer a bali of seven potfuls of milk and milk-rice.

original: zhes pa ni mngal zhes bya ba rnams kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mngal zhes bya ba rnams kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for those called ‚Äúwomb-born.‚Äù

original: da ni 'o ma zhes pa la sogs pas nyin zhag ma rnams kyi cho ga gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni 'o ma zhes pa la sogs pas nyin zhag ma rnams kyi cho ga gsungs te /
translated: Now, the rule for the lunar days is stated beginning with ‚Äúmilk‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir nyin zhag bcu'i nang du bzung ba'i byis bzhi pa'i don du'o ma dang mar dang thug pa dang zan dang zho dang bu ram dang bcas pa'i gtor ma nyin zhag ma rnams dag la sbyin par bya ste khrus dang spos ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir nyin zhag bcu'i nang du bzung ba'i byis bzhi pa'i don du'o ma dang mar dang thug pa dang zan dang zho dang bu ram dang bcas pa'i gtor ma nyin zhag ma rnams dag la sbyin par bya ste khrus dang spos ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, for the sake of the child who has been held for ten days, one should offer a bali with milk, ghee, porridge, rice, curd, and molasses on the lunar days. Bathing and incense will be explained.

original: nyin zhag ma rnams kyi mtshan mo gsum du gtor ma'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag ma rnams kyi mtshan mo gsum du gtor ma'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for the three nights of the lunar days.

original: da ni sman pa zhes pa la sogs pas zla ba zhes bya ba rnams kyi cho ga gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sman pa zhes pa la sogs pas zla ba zhes bya ba rnams kyi cho ga gsungs te /
translated: Now, the rule for the lunar mansions is stated beginning with ‚Äúphysician‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir zhag bcu'i rjes la zla ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhag bcu'i rjes la zla ba'o //
translated: Here, after ten days, it is the lunar mansions.

original: de nas zla ba bcu gcig gi bar du zla bar skyes pa rnams zhi ba'i don du ma mo rnams la gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zla ba bcu gcig gi bar du zla bar skyes pa rnams zhi ba'i don du ma mo rnams la gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, for eleven months, one should offer sacrificial cakes to the MƒÅt·πõs for the sake of pacifying those born in the lunar asterisms.

original: smin pa'i zas lnga tha dad ces pa ni mar gyi smin pa ste p'u ri k'a dang ghri ta p'u ra dang so ma li dang se ba l'i dang ba ta ka ces pa ste lnga tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: smin pa'i zas lnga tha dad ces pa ni mar gyi smin pa ste p'u ri k'a dang ghri ta p'u ra dang so ma li dang se ba l'i dang ba ta ka ces pa ste lnga tha dad pa'o //
translated: The five ripened foods separately means the ripened butter, namely, p≈´rikƒÅ, ghrƒ´tap≈´rikƒÅ, somalƒ´, sevƒÅlƒ´, and vƒÅtƒÅka, which are five separate [foods].

original: zas gzhan zho dang bu ram dang bcas pa po li ka dang mo da ka dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: zas gzhan zho dang bu ram dang bcas pa po li ka dang mo da ka dag kyang ngo //
translated: Other foods are curd and molasses, as well as p≈´rikƒÅ and modaka.

original: dri zhes pa tsandan dang dri bzang po'i me tog dang til gyi til mar ram mar gyi me dang bkru ba dag kyang 'dab ma rnams kyis zhes pa ni aa shvadtha la sogs pa shing 'o ma can lnga'i 'dab ma rnams kyis te cung zad bskol ba'i chu
analyzed: dri zhes pa tsandan dang dri bzang po'i me tog dang til gyi til mar ram mar gyi me dang bkru ba dag kyang 'dab ma rnams kyis zhes pa ni aa shvadtha la sogs pa shing 'o ma can lnga'i 'dab ma rnams kyis te cung zad bskol ba'i chu
translated: The scent is sandalwood, fragrant flowers, sesame oil, or butter lamps, and bathing. The leaves are the leaves of the five milky trees such as the a≈õvattha. The slightly boiled water

original: dro ba dang bcas pas byis pa la khrus bya ste zhag lnga'i bar du thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: dro ba dang bcas pas byis pa la khrus bya ste zhag lnga'i bar du thams cad bya'o //
translated: with heat should be used to bathe the child. All of this should be done for five days.

original: khrus kyi mjug tu byis pa la bdug pa sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: khrus kyi mjug tu byis pa la bdug pa sbyin par bya ste /
translated: At the end of the bath, one should give incense to the child.

original: ba lang gi so dang lug gi rva dang ri dags kyi spu dang mi'i sen mo dang skra dang @16b sprul gyi shun pa 'di dag gcig tu byas nas drag po'i sol bas spos so //
analyzed: ba lang gi so dang lug gi rva dang ri dags kyi spu dang mi'i sen mo dang skra dang @16b sprul gyi shun pa 'di dag gcig tu byas nas drag po'i sol bas spos so //
translated: Cow's horn, sheep's horn, deer's hair, human nail, hair, and snake skin, having made these into one, one should burn them with fierce charcoal.

original: lha'i gtor ma la ni sngar brjod pa'i dri dang spos la sogs pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i gtor ma la ni sngar brjod pa'i dri dang spos la sogs pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In the divine bali offering, one should give the previously mentioned scents, incense, and so forth.

original: phyogs bzhi dang grong gi dbus su'o zhes pa nges pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi dang grong gi dbus su'o zhes pa nges pa ste /
translated: In the four directions and in the center of the village, thus is the rule.

original: byis pa zla skyes rnams ni rgyas pa'i don du mtha' dag brjod pa rnams kyang gtor ma dag la'o //
analyzed: byis pa zla skyes rnams ni rgyas pa'i don du mtha' dag brjod pa rnams kyang gtor ma dag la'o //
translated: For children born in the months, for the sake of prosperity, all of these are also in the bali offerings.

original: da ni bza' ba lnga zhes pa la sogs pas lo can ma rnams kyi cho ga gsungs te 'dir zla ba bcu'i steng du zla ba gnyis ni 'dir lor gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: da ni bza' ba lnga zhes pa la sogs pas lo can ma rnams kyi cho ga gsungs te 'dir zla ba bcu'i steng du zla ba gnyis ni 'dir lor gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Now, beginning with the five foods, he explains the rite of the lunar days. Here, in addition to the ten months, two months are taken as a year.

original: de nas lo bcva lnga'i bar du lor skyes pa ma mos gzir ba rnams zhi ba'i don du lo can ma rnams la gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lo bcva lnga'i bar du lor skyes pa ma mos gzir ba rnams zhi ba'i don du lo can ma rnams la gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, for fifteen years, one should offer a sacrificial cake to the females of the year for the sake of pacifying the afflictions of those born in the year of the female earth-hare.

original: bza' ba lnga zhes pa ni yung ba la sogs pa rnams kyis zan ser po dang dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po dang ljang khur byas pa ste 'di dag ni bza' ba lnga'o //
analyzed: bza' ba lnga zhes pa ni yung ba la sogs pa rnams kyis zan ser po dang dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po dang ljang khur byas pa ste 'di dag ni bza' ba lnga'o //
translated: The five foods are yellow, white, red, black, and green rice made with turmeric, etc. These are the five foods.

original: bca' ba lnga zhes pa smin pa'i zas sngar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bca' ba lnga zhes pa smin pa'i zas sngar brjod pa'o //
translated: The five vegetables are the ripe foods mentioned above.

original: chu la rgyu ba nya sha dang sha dang dri la sogs pa sngar brjod pa dang chang dang sngar brjod pa'i spos la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chu la rgyu ba nya sha dang sha dang dri la sogs pa sngar brjod pa dang chang dang sngar brjod pa'i spos la sogs pa ste /
translated: The five liquids are fish, meat, and the previously mentioned scents, etc., and the previously mentioned wine, etc.

original: thams cad smyig ma'i snod du bzhag pa nas mar me dang bcas pa'i gtor mas lan gsum bya ba par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad smyig ma'i snod du bzhag pa nas mar me dang bcas pa'i gtor mas lan gsum bya ba par bya'o //
translated: All of these should be placed in a bamboo vessel, and one should perform the sacrificial cake three times with a lamp.

original: phyogs zhes pa nyin zhag bcur phyogs bcu'i char te dbang po nas dbang ldan gyi mthar thug pa dang 'og dang steng du gtor ma ste grong gi dbus dang lam gyi bzhi mdor sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs zhes pa nyin zhag bcur phyogs bcu'i char te dbang po nas dbang ldan gyi mthar thug pa dang 'og dang steng du gtor ma ste grong gi dbus dang lam gyi bzhi mdor sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The directions are the ten directions, from Indra up to Isana, below and above, and the offerings are to be given in the middle of the village and at the crossroads.

original: byis pa lor ni skyes pa rnams dag rab tu gsal bar sa la rgyas pa'i slad du mi yi dbang zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa lor ni skyes pa rnams dag rab tu gsal bar sa la rgyas pa'i slad du mi yi dbang zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The lord of men is the child born a year ago, and the yearlings are the children born a year ago, in order to make them grow well on the earth.

original: lo can ma rnams mchod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: lo can ma rnams mchod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for worshipping the yearlings.

original: de ltar mngal nas lo ni lnga pa gsum zhes pa ni lo bcva lnga'i mthar thug par rnal 'byor ma drug cu rtsa gsum po rnams nges par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngal nas lo ni lnga pa gsum zhes pa ni lo bcva lnga'i mthar thug par rnal 'byor ma drug cu rtsa gsum po rnams nges par mchod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the three five-year-olds are the fifteen-year-olds, and the thirty-six yoginis are to be worshipped.

original: gzhan du na byis pa rnams zhi ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na byis pa rnams zhi ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the children will not be peaceful, etc.

original: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma rnams mchod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma rnams mchod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for worshipping the yoginis.

original: da ni ma mos bzung ba rnams kyi skyon gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni ma mos bzung ba rnams kyi skyon gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the characteristics of the faults of the consorts are stated:

original: yan lag ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe byis pa ma mos bzung bar gyur na de'i tshe de'i yan lag rkyong bar 'gyur pa dang mig na bar 'gyur pa dang kha dang lag pa dag dang / rkang pa dag ni kha dang lag pa rkang pa ste ser po nyid @17a * //
analyzed: yan lag ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe byis pa ma mos bzung bar gyur na de'i tshe de'i yan lag rkyong bar 'gyur pa dang mig na bar 'gyur pa dang kha dang lag pa dag dang / rkang pa dag ni kha dang lag pa rkang pa ste ser po nyid @17a * //
translated: The limbs are the eyes, mouth, hands, and feet.üîΩThe urine is yellow, and heat arises.üîΩVomiting, dryness, and fainting occur.

original: du yang 'gyur pa dang gcin ni kha dog ser por 'gyur pa dang tsha ba skye bar 'gyur pa dang / skyug par 'gyur pa dang skam pa dang brgyal bar 'gyur pa ste ma mo'i skyon gyi mtshan ma 'di dag rnams shes par gyur nas byis pa de dag dang yang gi sgras gdug pa'i gdon gyis bzung ba rnams la dkyil 'khor dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa bya'o
analyzed: du yang 'gyur pa dang gcin ni kha dog ser por 'gyur pa dang tsha ba skye bar 'gyur pa dang / skyug par 'gyur pa dang skam pa dang brgyal bar 'gyur pa ste ma mo'i skyon gyi mtshan ma 'di dag rnams shes par gyur nas byis pa de dag dang yang gi sgras gdug pa'i gdon gyis bzung ba rnams la dkyil 'khor dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa bya'o
translated: Having understood these signs of the faults of the mƒÅtrs, for those children and also those possessed by the evil grahas, one should perform the ma·πá·∏çala, homa, and so on.

original: // rnam pa gzhan du gtor ma ma byin na ni gtong bar mi 'gyur te rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis 'byung ba las skyes ma mo sngar brjod pa dag gis zhes pa ste gso ba'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩda ni drug cu rtsa bzhi ma rigs ldan mas bzung ba'i 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa gang gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir drug cu rtsa bzhi ma rigs ldan ma ni mngal dang nyin zhag dang zla ba dang lo'i mtshams su rnal 'byor ma thams
analyzed: // rnam pa gzhan du gtor ma ma byin na ni gtong bar mi 'gyur te rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis 'byung ba las skyes ma mo sngar brjod pa dag gis zhes pa ste gso ba'i mtshan nyid do // da ni drug cu rtsa bzhi ma rigs ldan mas bzung ba'i 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa gang gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir drug cu rtsa bzhi ma rigs ldan ma ni mngal dang nyin zhag dang zla ba dang lo'i mtshams su rnal 'byor ma thams
translated: Otherwise, if the bali is not offered, they will not depart. The previously mentioned mƒÅt·πõkƒÅs born from the elements by the power of their natural qualities are the characteristics of healing.

original: cad kyi mtshams so so la khyab par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'o //
analyzed: cad kyi mtshams so so la khyab par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'o //
translated: Now, the characteristics of death held by the sixty-four-year-old yoginƒ´ are stated: ‚ÄúWhose‚Äù and so on. Here, the sixty-four-year-old yoginƒ´ is present with the nature of pervading each juncture of all yoginƒ´s in the junctures of the womb, day and night, month, and year.

original: des bzung ba'i byis pa'i yan lag thams cad dkar por 'gyur pa dang 'brum pa shin tu phra mo nyungs kar dang skye tshe tsam du 'gyur pa dang mgrin pa lus dang bcas pa 'khyog por 'gyur ba dang kha'am gsang ba'am bshang lam dag las khrag 'dzag parüîΩ'gyur ba ste ;
analyzed: des bzung ba'i byis pa'i yan lag thams cad dkar por 'gyur pa dang 'brum pa shin tu phra mo nyungs kar dang skye tshe tsam du 'gyur pa dang mgrin pa lus dang bcas pa 'khyog por 'gyur ba dang kha'am gsang ba'am bshang lam dag las khrag 'dzag par 'gyur ba ste ;
translated: All the limbs of the child held by that [demoness] will become white, and very small boils will appear, the size of mustard seeds and salt grains. The throat and body will become crooked, and blood will flow from the mouth, the secret place, or the anus.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid mthong nas yul de la mchod pa bya ba min te gal te byed na de'i tshe sngags pa rmongs pa rnams chags pa las chung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid mthong nas yul de la mchod pa bya ba min te gal te byed na de'i tshe sngags pa rmongs pa rnams chags pa las chung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having seen such characteristics, one should not make offerings to that place. If one does so, then at that time the deluded mantrins will become even more attached.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gang gi phyir de ni 'chi bar 'gyur te nges par lha dang mi dang lag 'gro rnams kyis bsrung bar nus pa min pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gang gi phyir de ni 'chi bar 'gyur te nges par lha dang mi dang lag 'gro rnams kyis bsrung bar nus pa min pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because that [demoness] will die, certainly unable to be protected by gods, humans, or nagas.

original: 'chi ba'i mtshan ma'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mtshan ma'i nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the signs of death.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor la mchod pa byas pas bde ba byed pa gsungs pa klu zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir klu la sogs pa rnams kyis gzir ba rnams ni klu la sogs pa rnams 'chad bar 'gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor la mchod par byas pas bde baüîΩbyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor la mchod pa byas pas bde ba byed pa gsungs pa klu zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir klu la sogs pa rnams kyis gzir ba rnams ni klu la sogs pa rnams 'chad bar 'gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor la mchod par byas pas bde ba byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: by worshipping the ma·πá·∏çala of the nƒÅgas, etc., which will be explained.

original: 'di dag gis mtshan nyid du ma 'byung po'i rgyud las brjod pa shes par bya ba dag ni 'di nyid du 'chad par 'gyur pa'i phyag rgya bcing ba las ji snyed cig go //
analyzed: 'di dag gis mtshan nyid du ma 'byung po'i rgyud las brjod pa shes par bya ba dag ni 'di nyid du 'chad par 'gyur pa'i phyag rgya bcing ba las ji snyed cig go //
translated: Those things that are to be known from the tantras of the various characteristics that are not mentioned here are as many as are explained by the binding of the mudrƒÅ that will be explained.

original: da ni ma rungs pa rnams mchod pa'i don du dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor gyi gnas @17b gsungs pa ma rungs pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ma rungs pa rnams mchod pa'i don du dkyil 'khor ni grong gi phyi rol du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ni ma rungs pa rnams mchod pa'i don du dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor gyi gnas @17b gsungs pa ma rungs pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ma rungs pa rnams mchod pa'i don du dkyil 'khor ni grong gi phyi rol du 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, the ma·πá·∏çala and the site of the ma·πá·∏çala are taught for the purpose of worshipping the wicked: ‚Äúthe wicked, etc.‚Äù Here, the ma·πá·∏çala for the purpose of worshipping the wicked is outside the town.

original: de nyid du shing gcig gi gnas dang dur khrod dang ni lha mchog khang pa dag gam ste lha khang stong pa dang chu bo 'dus pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: de nyid du shing gcig gi gnas dang dur khrod dang ni lha mchog khang pa dag gam ste lha khang stong pa dang chu bo 'dus pa rnams su'o //
translated: In that very place, in the abode of a tree, in a charnel ground, or in a temple of the supreme deity, i.e., an empty temple, or at the confluence of rivers.

original: khru gang dag gam gnyis dang bzhi zhes pa ni 'dir 'byor pa dang rjes su 'tsham par dkyil 'khor khru gcig pa'am khru gnyis pa'am khru bzhi pa nas brtsams te khru stong pa ji srid pa de srid du slob dpon gyis bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: khru gang dag gam gnyis dang bzhi zhes pa ni 'dir 'byor pa dang rjes su 'tsham par dkyil 'khor khru gcig pa'am khru gnyis pa'am khru bzhi pa nas brtsams te khru stong pa ji srid pa de srid du slob dpon gyis bri bar bya'o //
translated: One cubit, two, four, etc. Here, in accordance with one's wealth, the master should draw the mandala beginning with one cubit, two cubits, four cubits, up to one thousand cubits.

original: dgu dang bcu gsum mi bdag ces pa ni 'dir lha dgu rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni khru gcig go //
analyzed: dgu dang bcu gsum mi bdag ces pa ni 'dir lha dgu rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni khru gcig go //
translated: Nine, thirteen, lord of men. Here, the measure of the mandala of the nine deities is one cubit.

original: bcu gsum rnams kyi khru gnyis so //
analyzed: bcu gsum rnams kyi khru gnyis so //
translated: Of the thirteen, two cubits.

original: mi bdag ces pa bcu drug rnams kyi khru bzhi'o zhes pa nas brtsams te nyi shu lhag pa'i brgya phrag bcu drug rnams kyi khru stong gi mthar thug par bri bar bya ste 'byor pas so //
analyzed: mi bdag ces pa bcu drug rnams kyi khru bzhi'o zhes pa nas brtsams te nyi shu lhag pa'i brgya phrag bcu drug rnams kyi khru stong gi mthar thug par bri bar bya ste 'byor pas so //
translated: Of the lord of men, i.e., the sixteen, four cubits. Beginning from this, up to sixteen hundred cubits, one should draw [the mandala] according to one's wealth.

original: 'dir dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi dbus su rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo'am padmar 'gyur te dkyil 'khor gyi phyed kyi cha shas so //
analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi dbus su rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo'am padmar 'gyur te dkyil 'khor gyi phyed kyi cha shas so //
translated: Here, in the center of all ma·πá·∏çalas, there is an eight-spoked wheel or lotus, which is one-half of the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: sgo ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i brgyad cha'o //
analyzed: sgo ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i brgyad cha'o //
translated: The door is one-eighth of the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: sgo yi phyed kyis kha khyer dang do shal gyi sa'o //
analyzed: sgo yi phyed kyis kha khyer dang do shal gyi sa'o //
translated: The ledge and the garland are one-half of the door.

original: kha khyer gyi phyed kyis rtsig pa'i re kh'a lnga dang rin chen snam bu'o //
analyzed: kha khyer gyi phyed kyis rtsig pa'i re kh'a lnga dang rin chen snam bu'o //
translated: The five lines of the wall and the jeweled ledge are one-half of the ledge.

original: sgo'i tshad kyis sgo khyud dang logs dang 'gram mo //
analyzed: sgo'i tshad kyis sgo khyud dang logs dang 'gram mo //
translated: The door frame, the side walls, and the corners are the size of the door.

original: rta babs ni sgo las sum 'gyur ro zhes pa ste dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: rta babs ni sgo las sum 'gyur ro zhes pa ste dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: The pediments are three times the size of the door. This is the definition of the ma·πá·∏çala.üîΩNow, the hearth for pacifying is described:üîΩRound, two cubits across, and one cubit deep,üîΩwith a rim,üîΩand a lotus with eight petals.

original: da ni zhi ba'i thab gsungs pa zlum po zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i thab khung rnams kyi nang nas zhi ba la zlum po'i thab gzung bar bya ste de nyid cha gsum zhes pa ni rgyar ma tho gnyis dang zabs su mtho
analyzed: da ni zhi ba'i thab gsungs pa zlum po zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir 'chad par 'gyur pa'i thab khung rnams kyi nang nas zhi ba la zlum po'i thab gzung bar bya ste de nyid cha gsum zhes pa ni rgyar ma tho gnyis dang zabs su mtho
translated: Here, from among the hearths that will be explained, one should take the round hearth for pacifying. That is two cubits across and one cubit deep.

original: gcig go // padma dkar po'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni snying po'i nang du rdul tshon dkar pos padma dang kha khyer gyi steng du padma'i phreng ba dang phyi rol gyi 'og tu padma'i 'dab ma rnams te /
analyzed: gcig go // padma dkar po'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni snying po'i nang du rdul tshon dkar pos padma dang kha khyer gyi steng du padma'i phreng ba dang phyi rol gyi 'og tu padma'i 'dab ma rnams te /
translated: The nature of the white lotus means that inside the center one should make a lotus with white powder, and on the rim one should make a garland of lotuses, and outside below one should make lotus petals.

original: de ltar dkar po'i tshon rnams dag gis bkang ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar dkar po'i tshon rnams dag gis bkang ba'o //
translated: Thus it is filled with white powder.

original: de nas padma dkar po'i lte ba dang 'dab ma rnams la tshon lnga dag gis lha rnams kyi mtshan ma bya ste rang phyogs rigs kyi dbang gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs kyi dbang gis so //üîΩrdo rje dbus dang zhes pa ni 'dir 'chad @18a * //
analyzed: de nas padma dkar po'i lte ba dang 'dab ma rnams la tshon lnga dag gis lha rnams kyi mtshan ma bya ste rang phyogs rigs kyi dbang gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs kyi dbang gis so // rdo rje dbus dang zhes pa ni 'dir 'chad @18a * //
translated: Then, on the center and petals of the white lotus, one should make the signs of the deities with the five powders, by the power of one's own family, by the power of the family of the five transcendent lords.

original: par 'gyur pa las las thams cad la rdo rje'am zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur pa las las thams cad la rdo rje'am zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra in the center means that here it is said in the following explanation, For all activities, the vajra.

original: padma'i lte ba la rdo rje sngon po ste rnam par shes pa'i phung pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i lte ba la rdo rje sngon po ste rnam par shes pa'i phung pa'o //
translated: On the center of the lotus is a blue vajra, the aggregate of consciousness.

original: shar gyi 'dab ma la ral gri nag por 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis 'du byed do //
analyzed: shar gyi 'dab ma la ral gri nag por 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis 'du byed do //
translated: On the eastern petal is a black sword, the compositional factors by the power of the family.

original: lhor rin chen dmar po ste tshor ba'o //
analyzed: lhor rin chen dmar po ste tshor ba'o //
translated: In the south is a red jewel, which is feeling.

original: g-yon te byang gi 'dab ma la padma dkar po 'dab ma brgya pa ste 'du shes so //
analyzed: g-yon te byang gi 'dab ma la padma dkar po 'dab ma brgya pa ste 'du shes so //
translated: On the left, that is, on the petal in the north, is a white lotus with a hundred petals, which is perception.

original: nub tu 'khor lo'i mtshan ma ser po ste gzugs kyi phung po'o //üîΩme'i 'dab ma la gri gug nag po ste rlung ngo //
analyzed: nub tu 'khor lo'i mtshan ma ser po ste gzugs kyi phung po'o // me'i 'dab ma la gri gug nag po ste rlung ngo //
translated: In the west is a yellow wheel, which is the form aggregate.üîΩOn the petal in the southeast is a black flaying knife, which is wind.

original: padma'i 'dab ma la gnas lha min zur du ste bden bral du lcags kyu dmar po ste me'o //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma la gnas lha min zur du ste bden bral du lcags kyu dmar po ste me'o //
translated: On the petal in the southwest, that is, in the corner of the asuras, is a red hook, which is fire.

original: rlung du rdo rje zhags pa ser po ste sa'o //
analyzed: rlung du rdo rje zhags pa ser po ste sa'o //
translated: On the petal in the northwest is a yellow vajra lasso, which is earth.

original: drag po'i 'dab ma dag la ste dbang ldan du rtse gsum dkar po ste chu'i khams so //
analyzed: drag po'i 'dab ma dag la ste dbang ldan du rtse gsum dkar po ste chu'i khams so //
translated: On the petals in the northeast, that is, in the corner of Rudra, is a white trident, which is the water element.

original: dbus kyi rdo rje ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig nam mkha'i khams so //üîΩshar gyi sgor ral gri nag po ste khro po phrag dog rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi rdo rje ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig nam mkha'i khams so // shar gyi sgor ral gri nag po ste khro po phrag dog rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra in the center is the space element together with consciousness.üîΩAt the eastern gate is a black sword, which is the wrathful Vajra Jealousy.

original: lho'i sgor rdo rje dbyug pa dmar po ste khro po 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
analyzed: lho'i sgor rdo rje dbyug pa dmar po ste khro po 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
translated: At the southern gate is a red vajra club, which is the wrathful Vajra Passion.

original: chu ru ste nub kyi sgor be con ser po ste khro bo gti mug rdo rje'o //üîΩbyang gi sgor thob dkar po ste khro bo nga rgyal rdo rje'o //
analyzed: chu ru ste nub kyi sgor be con ser po ste khro bo gti mug rdo rje'o // byang gi sgor thob dkar po ste khro bo nga rgyal rdo rje'o //
translated: At the western gate, which is the water direction, is the yellow mace, which is the wrathful Delusion Vajra.üîΩAt the northern gate is the white hook, which is the wrathful Pride Vajra.

original: dbus su rdo rje sngon po ni khro bo'i rgyal po zhe sdang rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje sngon po ni khro bo'i rgyal po zhe sdang rdo rje'o //
translated: In the center is the blue vajra, which is the king of wrathful ones, the wrathful Hatred Vajra.

original: sems kyi zhes pa la sogs pa nas don du 'di dag mdzod ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sems kyi zhes pa la sogs pa nas don du 'di dag mdzod ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the lines beginning with ‚Äúmind‚Äù up to ‚Äúplease do this for me‚Äù is easy to understand.

original: da ni gdon gyis zin pa rnams kyi khrus kyi cho ga gsungs pa bum pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs rnams su bum pa brgyad ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rin chen dang bcas te rin po che lnga
analyzed: da ni gdon gyis zin pa rnams kyi khrus kyi cho ga gsungs pa bum pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs rnams su bum pa brgyad ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rin chen dang bcas te rin po che lnga
translated: Now, the ritual for bathing those who are seized by spirits is stated, beginning with ‚Äúvase,‚Äù and so on. Here, in the directions of the ma·πá·∏çala, there are eight vases endowed with the characteristics to be explained, along with jewels, and endowed with the five jewels

original: dang bcas pa 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sman la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩ'dab ma zhes pa ni 'o ma'i shing gi yal 'dab po //
analyzed: dang bcas pa 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sman la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o // 'dab ma zhes pa ni 'o ma'i shing gi yal 'dab po //
translated: and the medicines, and so on, to be explained.üîΩ‚ÄúPetals‚Äù are the branches of the milk trees.

original: padma'i kha ste de dag gis so //
analyzed: padma'i kha ste de dag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúLotus mouths‚Äù are their petals.

original: de bzhin du som btang ba'i kham phor ni bdun gyis zhes pa ni kham phor bdun gyis so ;
analyzed: de bzhin du som btang ba'i kham phor ni bdun gyis zhes pa ni kham phor bdun gyis so ;
translated: Likewise, seven times with a mouthful of water from the pot, means with seven mouthfuls of water.

original: / chu dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pas zhes pa ni de dag dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: / chu dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pas zhes pa ni de dag dang bcas pa ste /
translated: With water, the five nectars, etc. means together with those.

original: chu dang 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram shing gi khu ba dang dri'i chu ste 'di dag gis gang pa'i kham phor bdun gyis rim pa bzhin du bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram shing gi khu ba dang dri'i chu ste 'di dag gis gang pa'i kham phor bdun gyis rim pa bzhin du bkru bar bya'o //
translated: With a mouthful of water, milk, curd, butter, honey, sugarcane juice, and perfumed water, one should wash in order with seven mouthfuls.

original: de nas bum pa brgyad dang rgyal ba dang rnam par @18b rgyal ba'i bum pa dag gis te slar yang gi sgra las so //
analyzed: de nas bum pa brgyad dang rgyal ba dang rnam par @18b rgyal ba'i bum pa dag gis te slar yang gi sgra las so //
translated: Then, with the eight vases and the vases of victory and complete victory, again.

original: nyungs kar sogs kyis nges par bya ba ces pa ni dang por ba'i rnam lnga'i gong bu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: nyungs kar sogs kyis nges par bya ba ces pa ni dang por ba'i rnam lnga'i gong bu rnams kyis so //
translated: One should perform the rite with mustard seed, etc. means first with the five ambrosias.

original: de nas 'bar ba'i rtsa'i thab rnams dang nyungs kar la sogs pa dang zan gyi gong bu rnams kyis te 'di dag gis bya ba par bya'o ;
analyzed: de nas 'bar ba'i rtsa'i thab rnams dang nyungs kar la sogs pa dang zan gyi gong bu rnams kyis te 'di dag gis bya ba par bya'o ;
translated: Then, with the blazing channels, the hearth, mustard seed, etc., and the lumps of food, one should perform the rite with these.

original: / de nas dri la sogs ba rnams kyis mchod pa dang de bzhin du rab tu gnas pa byas nas dkyil 'khor du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: / de nas dri la sogs ba rnams kyis mchod pa dang de bzhin du rab tu gnas pa byas nas dkyil 'khor du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having made offerings with perfumes and so forth and likewise having performed the consecration, one should be admitted into the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: der dbang bskur byin nas te dkyil 'khor gyi bum pa'i chus chu la sogs pa'i dbang bskur ba byin nas de nas zhi ba'i bsreg bya sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: der dbang bskur byin nas te dkyil 'khor gyi bum pa'i chus chu la sogs pa'i dbang bskur ba byin nas de nas zhi ba'i bsreg bya sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having given the empowerment there, having given the empowerment of water and so forth with the water of the ma·πá·∏çala vase, then one should perform the pacifying burnt offering.

original: 'o ma zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'o ma zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Milk and so forth are easy to understand.

original: gzhan gang zhig ma brjod pa de thams cad ni dbang gi le'u las brjod pa'i cho gas slob dpon gyis bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gang zhig ma brjod pa de thams cad ni dbang gi le'u las brjod pa'i cho gas slob dpon gyis bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Whatever else is not mentioned, all of that should be done by the master with the procedure described in the chapter on empowerment. This is the determination.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las bcud len la sogs pa dang byis pa'i rgyud kyi mdor bsdus pa chen po ste drug pa'o /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las bcud len la sogs pa dang byis pa'i rgyud kyi mdor bsdus pa chen po ste drug pa'o /
translated: In the Stainless Light, a commentary on the root tantra of the Concise King of Tantras, the Wheel of Time, there is a great summary of the elixir and so forth and the Tantra of the Child, the sixth.

original: // / dus kyi 'khor lo bde ba che //
analyzed: // / dus kyi 'khor lo bde ba che //
translated: The Wheel of Time is great bliss.

original: 'gro ba'i mgon la phyag 'tshal te //üîΩrang gzhan lta ba dag la gzhung //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mgon la phyag 'tshal te // rang gzhan lta ba dag la gzhung //
translated: Having paid homage to the protector of beings,üîΩI will expand upon the texts

original: cung zad gsungs pa rnam rgyas bya //
analyzed: cung zad gsungs pa rnam rgyas bya //
translated: That slightly explain our and others‚Äô views.

original: da ni mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las 'jam dpal gyis bsdus pa rang dang gzhan gyi lta ba'i 'dod ba'i rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa bdag med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las 'jam dpal gyis bsdus pa rang dang gzhan gyi lta ba'i 'dod ba'i rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa bdag med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, from the Supreme Original Buddha, taught the presentation of the assertions of our and others‚Äô views, beginning with ‚Äúselflessness.‚Äù

original: 'dir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis rnam par dpyad na 'jig rten gyi dngos grub kyi slad du lta ba thams cad kyi grub pa'i mtha' mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis rnam par dpyad na 'jig rten gyi dngos grub kyi slad du lta ba thams cad kyi grub pa'i mtha' mtshungs so //
translated: Here, when analyzed by the conventions of the world, all philosophical positions are the same in terms of worldly accomplishments.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dngos po gang dang gang gis ni //
analyzed: dngos po gang dang gang gis ni //
translated: Whatever things

original: mi rnams yid ni yang dag sbyar //
analyzed: mi rnams yid ni yang dag sbyar //
translated: Correctly engage the minds of people,

original: des de'i rang bzhin nyid 'gyur te //
analyzed: des de'i rang bzhin nyid 'gyur te //
translated: They become the nature of that,

original: sna tshogs gzugs kyi nor bu bzhin //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs kyi nor bu bzhin //
translated: Like a jewel with various forms.

original: zhes pa ste dngos po'i rnam par brtag pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ste dngos po'i rnam par brtag pa mtshungs so //
translated: The analysis of things is the same.

original: de bzhin du khams dang dbang po la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang dbang po la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa yang mtshungs so //
translated: Likewise, the analysis of the elements, faculties, and so on is the same.

original: tha snyad can byed pa po dang byed pa la sogs pa yang mtshungs te sangs rgyas pa dang mu stegs pa dag la bye brag med do //üîΩstong pa nyid kyi de kho na la ni bye brag yod dang de de yang bdag med ces pa la @19a * //
analyzed: tha snyad can byed pa po dang byed pa la sogs pa yang mtshungs te sangs rgyas pa dang mu stegs pa dag la bye brag med do // stong pa nyid kyi de kho na la ni bye brag yod dang de de yang bdag med ces pa la @19a * //
translated: The conventional, such as the agent and action, are the same, without distinction between Buddhists and non-Buddhists.

original: sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa ste /
translated: But in the reality of emptiness, there is a distinction, and that is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúSelflessness . . .‚Äù

original: bdag med ni rnam pa gnyis te gang zag gi bdag med dang chos kyi bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med ni rnam pa gnyis te gang zag gi bdag med dang chos kyi bdag med pa'o //
translated: Selflessness is twofold: the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa ni rnam pa gsum ste lus dang ngag dang yid kyi'o //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa ni rnam pa gsum ste lus dang ngag dang yid kyi'o //
translated: The fruitions of karma are threefold: those of body, speech, and mind.

original: srid pa gsum zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'o //
translated: The three realms are the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: dus kyi 'gro ba zhes pa ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro dang mi dang lha ma yin dang lha rnams kyi 'gro ba ste 'gro ba drug go /
analyzed: dus kyi 'gro ba zhes pa ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro dang mi dang lha ma yin dang lha rnams kyi 'gro ba ste 'gro ba drug go /
translated: The migrations of time are the migrations of the six realms: hell beings, hungry ghosts, animals, humans, demigods, and gods.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste de las dngos su yang dag 'byung ba ni 'gro ba drug po rnams so //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste de las dngos su yang dag 'byung ba ni 'gro ba drug po rnams so //
translated: The twelve links of dependent origination are the direct source of the six migrations.

original: rig byed bden pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam dang 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rig byed bden pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam dang 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The four noble truths are the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the path, and the truth of cessation.

original: gnyis kyis bsgyur pa'i dgu zhes pa bcva brgyad ni ma 'dres pa sangs rgyas chos rnams te 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis bsgyur pa'i dgu zhes pa bcva brgyad ni ma 'dres pa sangs rgyas chos rnams te 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
translated: The eighteen are the eighteen unmixed qualities of the Buddha, which will be explained in the following verses.

original: phung po lnga zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: phung po lnga zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The five aggregates are form and so forth.

original: / sku gsum zhes pa ni chos kyi sku la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / sku gsum zhes pa ni chos kyi sku la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three bodies are the dharmakƒÅya and so forth.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The innate body is the fourth.

original: de bzhin nyid du bems po ma yin stong pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa pra phab pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du bems po ma yin stong pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa pra phab pa lta bu'o //
translated: Suchness is not inanimate, and emptiness endowed with all supreme aspects is like a mirror.

original: bdag med la sogs pa 'di dag gang du zhes pa theg pa gsum du ston pa pos brjod pa de ni rab tu gsal zhing nges bar rdo rje can gyi bstan pa ste sangs rgyas pa'i lta ba'i dbang gis sems can gyi bsam pas so //
analyzed: bdag med la sogs pa 'di dag gang du zhes pa theg pa gsum du ston pa pos brjod pa de ni rab tu gsal zhing nges bar rdo rje can gyi bstan pa ste sangs rgyas pa'i lta ba'i dbang gis sems can gyi bsam pas so //
translated: The one who teaches these, selflessness and so on, in the three vehicles, that one is the very clear and certain teacher of the vajra holder, by the power of the Buddhist view, by the thought of sentient beings.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the assertion of the TathƒÅgata.

analyzed: da ni tshangs pa dang khyab 'jug gi 'dod pa gsungs pa gang du zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: Now, BrahmƒÅ and Vi·π£·πáu‚Äôs assertions are stated beginning with ‚Äúwhere.‚Äù

original: 'dir gzhung gang du rig byed rang byung ste ma byas pa nam mkha' lta bu dang kha dang lag pa rkang pa sogs kyang skye bo'i skye gnas te zhes pa tshangs pa'i kha ni bram ze'i skye gnas dang / lag pa rgyal rigs kyi skye gnas dang /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung gang du rig byed rang byung ste ma byas pa nam mkha' lta bu dang kha dang lag pa rkang pa sogs kyang skye bo'i skye gnas te zhes pa tshangs pa'i kha ni bram ze'i skye gnas dang / lag pa rgyal rigs kyi skye gnas dang /
translated: Here, in whatever scripture the self-arisen Vedas, which are unmade and like space, and also the mouth, hand, foot, and so on, are the birthplaces of people, the mouth of BrahmƒÅ is the birthplace of the brahmin, the hand is the birthplace of the k·π£atriya, the foot is the birthplace of the vai≈õya, and the anus is the birthplace of the ≈õ≈´dra.

original: sogs pa'i sgras brla gnyis ni rje'u rigs skye gnas dang ; rkang pa dag ni dmangs rigs kyi skye gnas dang / aa shva me dha dag las gzhan pa mchog gi chos med ces pa ni 'dir mtho ris sgrub par byed pa la aa shva me dha'i mchod sbyin las gzhan pa mchog gi chos yod pa ma yin no zhes pa de ni tshangs pa'i bstan par 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras brla gnyis ni rje'u rigs skye gnas dang ; rkang pa dag ni dmangs rigs kyi skye gnas dang / aa shva me dha dag las gzhan pa mchog gi chos med ces pa ni 'dir mtho ris sgrub par byed pa la aa shva me dha'i mchod sbyin las gzhan pa mchog gi chos yod pa ma yin no zhes pa de ni tshangs pa'i bstan par 'gyur ro zhes
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThere is no supreme Dharma other than the a≈õvamedha sacrifice‚Äù means that there is no supreme Dharma for attaining high status other than the a≈õvamedha sacrifice.

original: pa la sogs pa ni @19b tshangs pa'i 'dod pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa ni @19b tshangs pa'i 'dod pa nges pa'o //
translated: This is the assertion of BrahmƒÅ.

original: 'dir de'i nang du 'dus pa klu'i chos khyab 'jug gi 'dod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir de'i nang du 'dus pa klu'i chos khyab 'jug gi 'dod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the assertion of the nƒÅgas, who are included among them, is as follows.üîΩThe assertion of Vi·π£·πáu is as follows.

original: byed pa po yod pa dang bdag yod pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las yod pa dang dus yod pa dang sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yod pa dang / snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan yod pa dang stong pa nyid ni mnyam pa'i chos nyid yod de gcig tu gyur pa la sogs pas mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa dang /
analyzed: byed pa po yod pa dang bdag yod pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las yod pa dang dus yod pa dang sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yod pa dang / snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan yod pa dang stong pa nyid ni mnyam pa'i chos nyid yod de gcig tu gyur pa la sogs pas mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa dang /
translated: The existence of an agent, the existence of a self, the existence of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, the existence of time, the existence of the natures of earth and so on, the existence of the qualities of sattva and so on, and the existence of emptiness, the equality of the nature of things, are not seen by one who is absorbed in oneness and so on.

original: byed po dag ba dang mi dge bas byas pa'i 'bras bu ster bar byed pa'i rgyu yod do //
analyzed: byed po dag ba dang mi dge bas byas pa'i 'bras bu ster bar byed pa'i rgyu yod do //
translated: The existence of a cause that bestows the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions is clearly and definitely taught.

original: zhes pa ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par bstan te dus kyi 'khor lo 'dir khyab 'jug dag gi'o zhes pa ni khyab 'jug pa'i 'dod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par bstan te dus kyi 'khor lo 'dir khyab 'jug dag gi'o zhes pa ni khyab 'jug pa'i 'dod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the wheel of time, which is of Vi·π£·πáu. This is the assertion of the followers of Vi·π£·πáu.

original: da ni dbang phyug gi 'dod pa gsungs pa lam drug ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sngar brjod pa'i khyab 'jug gi 'dod pa dang lhan cig lam drug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni dbang phyug gi 'dod pa gsungs pa lam drug ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sngar brjod pa'i khyab 'jug gi 'dod pa dang lhan cig lam drug la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the assertion of ƒ™≈õvara is stated: the six paths, and so on. Here, together with the assertion of Vi·π£·πáu stated previously, there are the six paths, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha gsum po ni gzugs gcig ste //
analyzed: lha gsum po ni gzugs gcig ste //
translated: The three gods are one form.

original: tshangs pa khyab 'jug dbang phyug che zhes pa'i nges tshig las so //
analyzed: tshangs pa khyab 'jug dbang phyug che zhes pa'i nges tshig las so //
translated: From the etymologies of Brahma, Vishnu, and Mahesvara.

original: byed pa po dang bdag dang las dang dus dang rang bzhin dang yon tan dang stong pa nyid zhig pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste mtha'i gnas skabs las so //
analyzed: byed pa po dang bdag dang las dang dus dang rang bzhin dang yon tan dang stong pa nyid zhig pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste mtha'i gnas skabs las so //
translated: The agent, the self, action, time, nature, quality, and the dharma of emptiness cessation is nirvana, from the final state.

original: di dag dang lhan cig lam drug la sogs pa rnams rig par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: di dag dang lhan cig lam drug la sogs pa rnams rig par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: These, together with the six paths, etc., should be known, is the conclusion.

original: 'dir lus la lam drug rnams zhes pa ni yul drug po rnams la 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lus la lam drug rnams zhes pa ni yul drug po rnams la 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Here, the six paths in the body are the entry into the six objects.

original: de nyid lnga dang zhes pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de nyid lnga dang zhes pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams kyi tshogs so //
translated: That itself is the five, is the collection of the elements of space, etc.

original: mchog gi go 'phang zhes pa ni drug pa ye shes kyi khams so //
analyzed: mchog gi go 'phang zhes pa ni drug pa ye shes kyi khams so //
translated: The supreme state is the sixth, the element of wisdom.

original: ma lus pa zhes pa ni khams thams cad gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa zhes pa ni khams thams cad gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'o //
translated: The entirety is all the elements mixed into one.

original: yang yig las gzhan no //
analyzed: yang yig las gzhan no //
translated: The other is from the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: sngags kyi lus zhes pa ni a'a li k'a li'i bdag nyid can te sngags kyi de nyid do //
analyzed: sngags kyi lus zhes pa ni a'a li k'a li'i bdag nyid can te sngags kyi de nyid do //
translated: The mantra body is the reality of mantra, which is the nature of Alikali.

original: rig ces pa ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rig ces pa ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The knowledge is the reality of desire, such as joy.

original: bdag ces pa ni bdag gi de kho na nyid rtag pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ces pa ni bdag gi de kho na nyid rtag pa'o //
translated: The self is the reality of the self, which is eternal.

original: dam pa'i zhi ba nyid ces pa ni zhi ba'i de nyid de thams cad du khyab pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i zhi ba nyid ces pa ni zhi ba'i de nyid de thams cad du khyab pa'o //
translated: The supreme peace is the reality of peace, which is all-pervading.

original: gzugs spangs pa de'i rnam gsum gnas na gnas pa ni gong bu la gnas pa dang tshig la gnas pa dang gzugs la gnas pa ste /üîΩlus dang ngag dang sems kyi rnam @20a * //
analyzed: gzugs spangs pa de'i rnam gsum gnas na gnas pa ni gong bu la gnas pa dang tshig la gnas pa dang gzugs la gnas pa ste / lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rnam @20a * //
translated: The one who abides in the three abodes, having abandoned form, abides in the aggregate, abides in speech, and abides in form.

original: par rtog pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: par rtog pa'i chos can no //
translated: The one who has the nature of conceptual thoughts of body, speech, and mind.

original: rnam gsum gnas na gnas pa de'i sbyor dang zhes pa ni skye ba'i dus su lam drug la sogs pa 'di dag rnams sbyor ba ste 'dus pa dang / 'chi ba'i dus su gtong ba'i dngos te de rnams rnam par 'brel lo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam gsum gnas na gnas pa de'i sbyor dang zhes pa ni skye ba'i dus su lam drug la sogs pa 'di dag rnams sbyor ba ste 'dus pa dang / 'chi ba'i dus su gtong ba'i dngos te de rnams rnam par 'brel lo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The one who abides in the three abodes, their union and so forth, at the time of birth, these six paths and so forth are united, and at the time of death, they are released. This means they are connected.

original: thig le'i dbye bzhi pa nyid dang zhes pa ni 'dir khu ba thig le'i dbye ba ste 'dzag pa'i bde ba'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid de nyid zhi ba nyid do //
analyzed: thig le'i dbye bzhi pa nyid dang zhes pa ni 'dir khu ba thig le'i dbye ba ste 'dzag pa'i bde ba'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid de nyid zhi ba nyid do //
translated: It is the bindu of semen, which is just peace.

original: mtha' dag lus la gnas pa zhes pa ni rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag lus la gnas pa zhes pa ni rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba la khyab pa'o //
translated: It is located in the entire body, pervading the animate and inanimate.üîΩThe division of the twelve knots is as follows: Here, the twelve houses located in the bodies of living beings are called ‚Äúknots.‚Äù

original: bcu gnyis mdud pa'i dbye ba ste zhes pa ni 'dir srog chags rnams kyi lus la gnas pa'i khyim bcu gnyis po rnams mdud pa'i sgras gsungs te khyim bcu gnyis po 'di rnams kyi dbye ba ni lo dang bgrod pa dang dus gsum dang dus bzhi dang dus
analyzed: bcu gnyis mdud pa'i dbye ba ste zhes pa ni 'dir srog chags rnams kyi lus la gnas pa'i khyim bcu gnyis po rnams mdud pa'i sgras gsungs te khyim bcu gnyis po 'di rnams kyi dbye ba ni lo dang bgrod pa dang dus gsum dang dus bzhi dang dus
translated: The division of those twelve houses is years, paths, the three times, the four times, the six times,üîΩthe months, directions, days, hours, minutes, and breaths.

original: drug dang / zla ba dang phyogs dang nyin zhag dang chu tshod dang chu srang dang dbugs te 'di thams cad grub pa'i mtha' gang du rab tu gyur pa de ni nges par zhi ba pa'i bstan pa'o //
analyzed: drug dang / zla ba dang phyogs dang nyin zhag dang chu tshod dang chu srang dang dbugs te 'di thams cad grub pa'i mtha' gang du rab tu gyur pa de ni nges par zhi ba pa'i bstan pa'o //
translated: All of that is the doctrine of the ≈öƒÅ·πÉkhya, which is well known.

original: zhes pa ni zhi ba pa'i 'dod pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhi ba pa'i 'dod pa nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the assertions of the ≈öƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: da ni 'jig rten rgyang pa na pa'i 'dod pa gsungs pa dbang phyug ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten rgyang pa na pa'i 'dod pa gsungs pa dbang phyug ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the assertions of the Lokayatas are stated beginning with ‚ÄúGod‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir lus can rnams la dbang phyug med pa dang byed pa po med pa dang las kyi rnam par smin pa dag kyang med pa dang / yon tan yul rnams zhes pa ni yon tan snying stobs la sogs pa dang yul dri la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lus can rnams la dbang phyug med pa dang byed pa po med pa dang las kyi rnam par smin pa dag kyang med pa dang / yon tan yul rnams zhes pa ni yon tan snying stobs la sogs pa dang yul dri la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, there is no God for embodied beings, there is no creator, there are no effects of actions, and there are no qualities and objects.

original: 'byung ba'i tshogs zhes pa ni sa la sogs pa ste de dag longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshogs zhes pa ni sa la sogs pa ste de dag longs spyod pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúcollection of elements‚Äù refers to earth and so on, and they are enjoyed.

original: 'byung ba'i tshogs de med pa na ste shi ba'i mthar las kyi 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshogs de med pa na ste shi ba'i mthar las kyi 'bras bu med do //
translated: When that collection of elements does not exist, that is, at the end of death, there is no effect of actions.

original: aa ru ra dang bu ram la sogs pa yang dag par sbyor ba las chang gi nus pa bzhin 'byung ba rnams yang dag par sbyor ba'i nus pa ste de med pa na 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa ni
analyzed: aa ru ra dang bu ram la sogs pa yang dag par sbyor ba las chang gi nus pa bzhin 'byung ba rnams yang dag par sbyor ba'i nus pa ste de med pa na 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa ni
translated: Just as the potency of beer from the correct combination of myrobalan, molasses, and so on, there is the potency of the correct combination of the elements. When that does not exist, there is no body in a subsequent world.

original: gsal bar lha yi bla ma phur bu'i bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsal bar lha yi bla ma phur bu'i bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The clear one should be known as the doctrine of the deity-guru Kƒ´laya.

original: 'jig rten rgya nga phan pa'i 'dod pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgya nga phan pa'i 'dod pa nges pa'o //
translated: The desire of the worldly is the definite benefit.

original: da ni kla klo stag gzig rnams kyi 'dod pa gsungs pa byed po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni kla klo stag gzig rnams kyi 'dod pa gsungs pa byed po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the desire of the barbarians, Persians, etc. is stated with ‚Äúthe creator,‚Äù etc.

original: 'dir byed po rahma na sa rgyu ba g-yo ba dang mi rgyu ba brtan pa'i dngos po mtha' dag bskyed cing stag @20b gzig rnams kyi zhes pa kla klo gos dkar po can rnams kyi thar pa dag gi rgyu rahma na de mnyes pa las nges par mi
analyzed: 'dir byed po rahma na sa rgyu ba g-yo ba dang mi rgyu ba brtan pa'i dngos po mtha' dag bskyed cing stag @20b gzig rnams kyi zhes pa kla klo gos dkar po can rnams kyi thar pa dag gi rgyu rahma na de mnyes pa las nges par mi
translated: Here, the creator, Ra·∏•man, generates all things, moving and unmoving, and the Persians, etc., the barbarians who wear white clothes, are the cause of liberation. Ra·∏•man, when pleased, definitely makes them

original: rnams mtho ris dang / ma mnyes pa las dmyal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa de ni rahma na yi bstan pa ste bya ba ni sngar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rnams mtho ris dang / ma mnyes pa las dmyal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa de ni rahma na yi bstan pa ste bya ba ni sngar brjod pa'o //
translated: humans and gods; when displeased, he makes them hell beings. That is the doctrine of Ra·∏•man. The action was stated previously.

original: stag gzig gi 'dod pa des pa'o //
analyzed: stag gzig gi 'dod pa des pa'o //
translated: That is the desire of the Persians.

original: da ni zad byed pa rnams kyi 'dod pa gsungs pa dus gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir zad byed pa'i grub pa'i mtha' smra ba la rdzas dang rnam grangs dag gis rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ni zad byed pa rnams kyi 'dod pa gsungs pa dus gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir zad byed pa'i grub pa'i mtha' smra ba la rdzas dang rnam grangs dag gis rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, the assertion of the annihilationists is stated: ‚ÄúThe three times, etc.‚Äù Here, the annihilationists‚Äô tenets are expressed in terms of the permanent and the impermanent in terms of substance and enumeration.

original: de la dus gsum nyid dang zhes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la dus gsum nyid dang zhes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe three times‚Äù are the past, the future, and the present.

original: rdzas ni drug ste zhes pa ni srog dang gang zag dang dus dang nam mkha' dang bsod nams dang sdig pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas ni drug ste zhes pa ni srog dang gang zag dang dus dang nam mkha' dang bsod nams dang sdig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSubstance‚Äù is sixfold: life, person, time, space, merit, and sin.

original: 'di dag gi nang nas srog dang dus dang nam mkha' ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi nang nas srog dang dus dang nam mkha' ni rtag pa'o //
translated: Among these, life, time, and space are permanent.

original: tshig dgus bsgrubs dang zhes pa ni srog dang srog ma yin pa dang zag pa dang sngom pa dang spangs pa dang bcings pa dang thar pa dang 'gro ba dang 'ong pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dgus bsgrubs dang zhes pa ni srog dang srog ma yin pa dang zag pa dang sngom pa dang spangs pa dang bcings pa dang thar pa dang 'gro ba dang 'ong pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nine terms‚Äù are life, non-life, defilement, restraint, abandonment, bondage, liberation, going, and coming.

original: srog ni drug gi lus la cha shas so //
analyzed: srog ni drug gi lus la cha shas so //
translated: Life is a part of the six bodies.

original: zhes pa ni sa'i lus la cha shas dang chu'i lus la cha shas dang me'i lus la cha shas dang rlung gi lus la cha shas dang / nags kyi bdag po'i lus la cha shas dang 'bru'i lus la cha shas so zhes pa ste lus drug la srog rnams kyi cha shas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa'i lus la cha shas dang chu'i lus la cha shas dang me'i lus la cha shas dang rlung gi lus la cha shas dang / nags kyi bdag po'i lus la cha shas dang 'bru'i lus la cha shas so zhes pa ste lus drug la srog rnams kyi cha shas so //
translated: The body of earth has parts, the body of water has parts, the body of fire has parts, the body of wind has parts, the body of the lord of the forest has parts, and the body of grain has parts.

original: gzhan ni yod pa'i lus lnga zhes pa ni kha zas can gyi lus dang 'od kyi lus dang rang bzhin can gyi lus dang / brdzus skyes kyi lus dang mtha'i lus so zhes pa ni srog rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni yod pa'i lus lnga zhes pa ni kha zas can gyi lus dang 'od kyi lus dang rang bzhin can gyi lus dang / brdzus skyes kyi lus dang mtha'i lus so zhes pa ni srog rnams kyi'o //
translated: The other five bodies are the body of food, the body of light, the natural body, the body of miraculous birth, and the final body.

original: brtul nyugs sngom pa 'gro dang ye shes spyod pa dag gi dbye ba rnams zhes pa la zad byed pa rnams kyi brtul zhugs ni lnga ste /
analyzed: brtul nyugs sngom pa 'gro dang ye shes spyod pa dag gi dbye ba rnams zhes pa la zad byed pa rnams kyi brtul zhugs ni lnga ste /
translated: The ascetic vows, the vows of conduct, and the divisions of the conduct of wisdom.

original: dang po 'tshe ba med pa dang gnyis pa bden par smra ba dang gsum pa byin pa len pa dang bzhi pa tshangs par spyod pa dang lnga pa yongs su bzung ba thams cad yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: dang po 'tshe ba med pa dang gnyis pa bden par smra ba dang gsum pa byin pa len pa dang bzhi pa tshangs par spyod pa dang lnga pa yongs su bzung ba thams cad yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: The first is non-violence; the second is speaking the truth; the third is taking what is not given; the fourth is chastity; the fifth is giving up all possessions.

original: sdom pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: sdom pa ni lnga ste /
translated: The vows are five:

original: spyod lam gyi sngom pa dang / skad kyi sngom pa dang yongs su tshol ba'i sngom pa dang blangs pa mi 'dor ba'i sngom pa dang nye bar rab tu gnas pa'i sngom pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam gyi sngom pa dang / skad kyi sngom pa dang yongs su tshol ba'i sngom pa dang blangs pa mi 'dor ba'i sngom pa dang nye bar rab tu gnas pa'i sngom pa'o //
translated: the vow of deportment, the vow of speech, the vow of thorough search, the vow of not giving up what has been taken up, and the vow of close application.

original: 'gro ba'i dbye ba ni lnga ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dbye ba ni lnga ste /
translated: The divisions of going are five:

original: dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang mi dang lha dang thar pa'i 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang mi dang lha dang thar pa'i 'gro ba'o //
translated: the going of hell beings, animals, humans, gods, and the liberated.

original: @21a * // ye shes kyi dbye ba ni lnga ste /
analyzed: @21a * // ye shes kyi dbye ba ni lnga ste /
translated: The divisions of wisdom are five:

original: blo gros dang thos pa dang mtshams dang yid kyi yongs su tshol ba dang mo'i ye shes so //
analyzed: blo gros dang thos pa dang mtshams dang yid kyi yongs su tshol ba dang mo'i ye shes so //
translated: the wisdom of intelligence, hearing, reflection, mental search, and meditation.

original: spyod pa'i dbye ba ni bcu gsum ste /
analyzed: spyod pa'i dbye ba ni bcu gsum ste /
translated: The divisions of practice are thirteen:

original: brtul zhugs kyi dbye ba lnga dang / sngom pa'i dbye ba lnga dang / lus kyi gsang ba dang / ngag gi gsang ba dang sems kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs kyi dbye ba lnga dang / sngom pa'i dbye ba lnga dang / lus kyi gsang ba dang / ngag gi gsang ba dang sems kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: The five divisions of spiritual discipline, the five divisions of vows, the secret of the body, the secret of speech, and the secret of mind.

original: zhes pa 'di dag ni mchod 'os pa rnams kyis thar pa'i don du rab tu brjod do //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di dag ni mchod 'os pa rnams kyis thar pa'i don du rab tu brjod do //
translated: These are well-spoken by the venerable ones for the sake of liberation.

original: srog ni lus kyi tshad de dpag tu med pa'i srid pa dag gis rtag pa'i srog gis thar pa'o //
analyzed: srog ni lus kyi tshad de dpag tu med pa'i srid pa dag gis rtag pa'i srog gis thar pa'o //
translated: Life is the measure of the body. With immeasurable existences, the eternal life is liberation.

original: grub pa'i mtha' gang du thar pa'i tshad ni 'jig rten gsum gyi steng du gdugs kyi rnam pa dpag tshad 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa lnga par nges par brjod pa de ni rgyal ba rnams kyi bstan pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' gang du thar pa'i tshad ni 'jig rten gsum gyi steng du gdugs kyi rnam pa dpag tshad 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa lnga par nges par brjod pa de ni rgyal ba rnams kyi bstan pa'o //
translated: In whatever philosophical system, the measure of liberation is said to be the top of the three worlds, with the form of an umbrella, forty-five hundred thousand leagues. That is the teaching of the victors.

original: zhes pa ni zad byed pa'i 'dod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zad byed pa'i 'dod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the assertion of the desire for the end of existence.

original: da ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi 'dod pa rigs pas rnam par dpyad nas sun dbyung bar gsungs pa rig byed ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rigs pas rnam par dpyad na rig byed ni rang byung ma yin no //
analyzed: da ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi 'dod pa rigs pas rnam par dpyad nas sun dbyung bar gsungs pa rig byed ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rigs pas rnam par dpyad na rig byed ni rang byung ma yin no //
translated: Now, having analyzed the assertions of the tƒ´rthikas with reasoning, he says, ‚ÄúThe Vedas,‚Äù and so on. Here, when analyzed with reasoning, the Vedas are not self-arisen.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: smras pa / rig byed kyi sgras don rjod par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rig byed kyi sgras don rjod par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is said: because the sound of the Vedas expresses meaning.

original: 'di sgra gang zhig don gyi rjod byed yin pa de ni mgrin pa dang rkan la sogs pa'i rtsol bas bskyed pa gang yin pa de'i phyir rang byung ma yin pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'di sgra gang zhig don gyi rjod byed yin pa de ni mgrin pa dang rkan la sogs pa'i rtsol bas bskyed pa gang yin pa de'i phyir rang byung ma yin pa 'grub bo //
translated: Whatever sound expresses meaning is produced by the effort of the throat, palate, and so on. Therefore it is established that it is not self-arisen.

original: ci ste 'di ni rig byed kyi sgra ma yin te gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: ci ste 'di ni rig byed kyi sgra ma yin te gzhan nyid do //
translated: But if it is said, ‚ÄúThis is not the sound of the Vedas; it is something else.

original: 'di ni rna ba'i bug pa'i nang du sgra'i don thams cad dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur cing rtag pa de'i mngon par gsal bar byed pa'o zhes 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni rna ba'i bug pa'i nang du sgra'i don thams cad dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur cing rtag pa de'i mngon par gsal bar byed pa'o zhes 'grub po zhe na /
translated: This is the manifestation of the permanent sound that is mixed as one with all the meanings of sound inside the cavity of the ear,‚Äù it is established.

original: de'i phyir smra pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smra pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'dir gal te rig byed sgra'i don thams cad dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid kyis gnas shing rtag pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dir gal te rig byed sgra'i don thams cad dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid kyis gnas shing rtag pa yin na /
translated: If the eternal sound of the Vedas were to exist as a single entity mixed with all the meanings of the words,

original: de'i tshe bum pa zhes brjod par gyur pa na rna ba'i bug pa'i nang du ca cor rtogs par bya bar 'gyur te de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe bum pa zhes brjod par gyur pa na rna ba'i bug pa'i nang du ca cor rtogs par bya bar 'gyur te de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: then when the word ‚Äúpot‚Äù is uttered, the word ‚Äúnoise‚Äù would be understood inside the ear. But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa'i sgra gzhan khyab par byed pa yod pa'i dam bca' ba 'di ni don med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa'i sgra gzhan khyab par byed pa yod pa'i dam bca' ba 'di ni don med pa'o //
translated: Therefore this thesis that the eternal sound pervades everything is meaningless.üîΩIf the meaning were not different, then if the sound and the meaning were identical, then when the word ‚Äúfire‚Äù is uttered, why wouldn‚Äôt one‚Äôs mouth be burned?

original: don ni tha dad min na gal te sgra dang don dag gcig nyid yin pa de lta na me'i sgra brjod pa dag gis rang gi kha cis mi sreg / de'i phyir rig byed ni rtag pa nyid ma yin zhing don dang lhan cig gcig nyid ma yin
analyzed: don ni tha dad min na gal te sgra dang don dag gcig nyid yin pa de lta na me'i sgra brjod pa dag gis rang gi kha cis mi sreg / de'i phyir rig byed ni rtag pa nyid ma yin zhing don dang lhan cig gcig nyid ma yin
translated: Therefore it is established that the Vedas are not eternal and the meaning is not identical with the sound.

original: no zhes grub ste gzhan pa @21b ci ;
analyzed: no zhes grub ste gzhan pa @21b ci ;
translated: What else is there to say?

original: 'dir gang gi tshe kla klo rnams kyis rig byed kyi chos bsgribs par gyur pa na rig byed med par gyur pa de'i tshe tshangs pa'i gdong bzhi dag gis sngon ni rig byed sgra dag gis kyang don ni rab tu gsal bar byas te dbang po phyugs suüîΩgyur zhes pa la sogs pa'i klog gis so //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe kla klo rnams kyis rig byed kyi chos bsgribs par gyur pa na rig byed med par gyur pa de'i tshe tshangs pa'i gdong bzhi dag gis sngon ni rig byed sgra dag gis kyang don ni rab tu gsal bar byas te dbang po phyugs su gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'i klog gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the past, the meaning was clearly expressed by the sounds of the Vedas, but now the senses have become cattle.‚Äù

original: zhes zer ba thos so //
analyzed: zhes zer ba thos so //
translated: This is what was heard.

original: de'i phyir don gzhan dang rig byed gzhan zhes grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gzhan dang rig byed gzhan zhes grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that there is a different meaning and a different Veda.

original: de'i phyir ston pa po tshangs pa yod de rig pa'i yul dang ma 'ongs don dang 'das pa dag la ston pa po grub ste gyur zhes pa'i klog las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ston pa po tshangs pa yod de rig pa'i yul dang ma 'ongs don dang 'das pa dag la ston pa po grub ste gyur zhes pa'i klog las so //
translated: Therefore, the teacher Brahma exists. The teacher is established in the object of knowledge, the future, and the past, from the reading of ‚Äúbecame.‚Äù

original: khas klog pa las byas par grub po /
analyzed: khas klog pa las byas par grub po /
translated: It is established that it was composed from the reading of the Vedas.

original: de'i phyir rig byed nam mkha' mtshungs min 'dir ni gnas kyi dbye ba dag las kha yis rab brjod byas pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rig byed nam mkha' mtshungs min 'dir ni gnas kyi dbye ba dag las kha yis rab brjod byas pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the Vedas are not like space, but are expressed by the mouth from the divisions of the abodes here.

original: rigs pas gnyis skyes kha yis bklags pa nyid tshe ba ste kun du 'gro ba gzhan rnams klog pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pas gnyis skyes kha yis bklags pa nyid tshe ba ste kun du 'gro ba gzhan rnams klog pa'o //
translated: The Vedas are read by the twice-born, and the other texts are read by the rest of the people.

original: gang phyir dmangs la sogs pa'i rigs ni kun 'gro min pa'i rig byed 'di dag klog dang 'gro ba min //
analyzed: gang phyir dmangs la sogs pa'i rigs ni kun 'gro min pa'i rig byed 'di dag klog dang 'gro ba min //
translated: The Vedas are not read by the people of the lower castes, because the Vedas are not for them.

original: de phyir shes rab mkhas par gyur pa'i mi rnams dag la rig byed dag ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mdor bsdus pas rig byed byas par 'grub pa ste rgya cher tshad ma'i bstan bcos las shes par bya'o zhes bya ba 'jam dpal gyi nges
analyzed: de phyir shes rab mkhas par gyur pa'i mi rnams dag la rig byed dag ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mdor bsdus pas rig byed byas par 'grub pa ste rgya cher tshad ma'i bstan bcos las shes par bya'o zhes bya ba 'jam dpal gyi nges
translated: Therefore, the Vedas are not a valid means of knowledge for the wise, who are learned. This is the brief summary of the proof that the Vedas are not valid. It should be known in detail from the treatise on logic.

original: pa'o // da ni bram ze la sogs pa rnams kyi skye gnas sngar brjod pa sun dbyung ba brjod par bya ste 'dir tshangs pa'i kha ni bram ze rnams kyi skye gnas te de las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: pa'o // da ni bram ze la sogs pa rnams kyi skye gnas sngar brjod pa sun dbyung ba brjod par bya ste 'dir tshangs pa'i kha ni bram ze rnams kyi skye gnas te de las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes grag go //
translated: Now, the previously stated origin of the Brahmins and others will be refuted. Here, it is said that the mouth of Brahma is the origin of the Brahmins, because they are born from that.

original: de bzhin du dpung pa ni rgyal rigs rnams kyi skye gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpung pa ni rgyal rigs rnams kyi skye gnas so //
translated: Similarly, the arm is the origin of the Kshatriyas,üîΩthe thigh is the origin of the Vaishyas,üîΩand the foot is the origin of the Shudras.

original: sogs pa'i sgras brla gnyis ni rje rigs rnams kyi skye gnas so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras brla gnyis ni rje rigs rnams kyi skye gnas so //
translated: The two thighs are the birthplaces of the k·π£atriyas.üîΩThe two feet are the birthplaces of the ≈õ≈´dras.

original: rkang pa gnyis ni dmangs rigs rnams kyi skye gnas te de ltar rigs bzhi'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis ni dmangs rigs rnams kyi skye gnas te de ltar rigs bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four castes.

original: rigs bzhi po 'di dag gi mtha' ni rigs lnga pa ste /
analyzed: rigs bzhi po 'di dag gi mtha' ni rigs lnga pa ste /
translated: The fifth caste, the untouchables, is beyond these four castes.

original: gdol pa de dag rnams kyi skye gnas gang yin ni re zhig bram ze rnams kyis mi shes so zhes pa las gzhan pa ci /
analyzed: gdol pa de dag rnams kyi skye gnas gang yin ni re zhig bram ze rnams kyis mi shes so zhes pa las gzhan pa ci /
translated: The brahmins do not know where their birthplace is.

original: 'dir tshangs pa'i kha las bram ze rnams skyes pa ni bden par grags go //
analyzed: 'dir tshangs pa'i kha las bram ze rnams skyes pa ni bden par grags go //
translated: It is well known that the brahmins were born from the mouth of BrahmƒÅ.

original: de'i phyir bdag gis dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis dri bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will ask him.

original: bram ze mo rnams kyang de las skyes par gyur tam ci /
analyzed: bram ze mo rnams kyang de las skyes par gyur tam ci /
translated: Did the brahmin women also arise from that place?

original: gal te gyur na de'i tshe sring mor 'gyur te skye gnas gcig las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir @22a * //
analyzed: gal te gyur na de'i tshe sring mor 'gyur te skye gnas gcig las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir @22a * //
translated: If so, they would be his sisters, because they were born from the same birthplace.

original: ro ; / de bzhin du rgyal rigs la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: ro ; / de bzhin du rgyal rigs la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The same would be true of the k·π£atriyas and so on.

original: de'i phyir sring mo dang lhan cig bag ma ji ltar byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir sring mo dang lhan cig bag ma ji ltar byed /
translated: Therefore, how could one marry his sister?

original: ci ste byed na de'i tshe kla klo'i chos la zhugs so //
analyzed: ci ste byed na de'i tshe kla klo'i chos la zhugs so //
translated: If you do, then you have entered the religion of the barbarians.

original: kla klo'i chos la zhugs na rigs nyams te rigs nyams pa las dmyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kla klo'i chos la zhugs na rigs nyams te rigs nyams pa las dmyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you enter the religion of the barbarians, your family line will be broken. And if your family line is broken, you will go to hell.

original: zhes pa ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rigs pa'o //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: gzhan yang rnam par dpyad par bya ste 'dir gal te skye dgu rnams gcig gis bskyed pa yin na de'i tshe rigs bzhir ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par dpyad par bya ste 'dir gal te skye dgu rnams gcig gis bskyed pa yin na de'i tshe rigs bzhir ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, this should be investigated: If all people are produced by one, then how can there be four castes?

original: dper na pha gcig gi bu bzhi bzhin te de dag ni rigs so so so so ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na pha gcig gi bu bzhi bzhin te de dag ni rigs so so so so ma yin no //
translated: For example, four sons of one father are not of different castes.

original: de bzhin du rigs rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs rnams kyang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the castes are not different.

original: ci ste tshangs pa'i kha la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad na /
analyzed: ci ste tshangs pa'i kha la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad na /
translated: If you say that they are different because of the differences of BrahmƒÅ‚Äôs mouth and so on,

original: de'i tshe de nyid rigs pas mi 'thad de ji ltar au dum b'a ra'i 'bras bu rtsa ba dang rked pa dang rtse mo las skyes pa rnams tha dad med pa de bzhin du skye dgu rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid rigs pas mi 'thad de ji ltar au dum b'a ra'i 'bras bu rtsa ba dang rked pa dang rtse mo las skyes pa rnams tha dad med pa de bzhin du skye dgu rnams kyang ngo //
