translated: then that is not reasonable. Just as the fruit of the udumbara tree is not different whether it grows from the root, the middle, or the top, in the same way, all people are not different.

original: gzhan yang dkar po dang dmar po dang ser po dang nag po'i kha dog gi dbye bas tha dad pa ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang dkar po dang dmar po dang ser po dang nag po'i kha dog gi dbye bas tha dad pa ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: Moreover, we do not see any difference in color, such as white, red, yellow, or black.

original: de bzhin du khams dang dbang po dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang rigs pa dang lung la sogs pa'i dbye ba ma mthong ba gang yin pa de'i phyir rigs nges pa med pa'o zhes grub po //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang dbang po dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang rigs pa dang lung la sogs pa'i dbye ba ma mthong ba gang yin pa de'i phyir rigs nges pa med pa'o zhes grub po //
translated: Similarly, we do not see any difference in terms of elements, faculties, happiness, suffering, reasoning, scriptures, and so on. Therefore it is established that there is no certainty of class.

original: de bzhin du aa shva me dha la sogs pa'i mchod sbyin gyi 'bras bu shu kas sun phyung ba 'di lta ste /üîΩmchod sdong bcad cing phyugs bsad de //
analyzed: de bzhin du aa shva me dha la sogs pa'i mchod sbyin gyi 'bras bu shu kas sun phyung ba 'di lta ste / mchod sdong bcad cing phyugs bsad de //
translated: Similarly, the result of the a≈õvamedha and other sacrifices is refuted by ≈ö≈´ka:üîΩCutting down the sacrificial post, killing the sacrificial animal,

original: khrag 'dam byas nas mtho ris su //
analyzed: khrag 'dam byas nas mtho ris su //
translated: making a mud of blood,

original: gal te 'gro ba de lha na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba de lha na /
translated: if one goes to heaven

original: dmyal bar gang gis 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dmyal bar gang gis 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: by what will one go to hell?

original: zhes pa shu ka'i tshig tu rab tu grags so //
analyzed: zhes pa shu ka'i tshig tu rab tu grags so //
translated: This is well known as the words of ≈ö≈´ka.

original: de'i phyir rig byed rang byung ma yin zhing kha la sogs pa skye bo'i skye gnas dang aa shva me dha las gzhan pa mchog gi chos med pa ma yin te tshangs pa'i 'dod pa thams cad rnams par dpyad na don med pa'i rab tu smra ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rig byed rang byung ma yin zhing kha la sogs pa skye bo'i skye gnas dang aa shva me dha las gzhan pa mchog gi chos med pa ma yin te tshangs pa'i 'dod pa thams cad rnams par dpyad na don med pa'i rab tu smra ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the Vedas are not self-arisen, and it is not the case that there is no supreme Dharma other than the birth of a person such as Kala, or the Ashva-medha.  When all the desires of Brahma are analyzed, they are utterly meaningless.

original: khyab 'jug pa'i 'dod pa ni dbang phyug dang lhan cig sun dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyab 'jug pa'i 'dod pa ni dbang phyug dang lhan cig sun dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: The desires of Vishnu should be refuted along with those of Ishvara.

original: da ni dbang phyug gi 'dod pa sun dbyung ba gsungs pa gal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni dbang phyug gi 'dod pa sun dbyung ba gsungs pa gal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the refutation of the desires of Ishvara is stated:

original: 'dir gal te thams cad byed pa po dbang phyug yod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'dir gal te thams cad byed pa po dbang phyug yod par gyur na /
translated: Here, if everything were Ishvara, the agent,

original: de'i tshe longs spyod pa po yang gzhan ma yin te ji ltar gzhan gyis khur ba zos pas gzhan skom pas 'chi bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe longs spyod pa po yang gzhan ma yin te ji ltar gzhan gyis khur ba zos pas gzhan skom pas 'chi bar 'gyur /
translated: then at that time, the experiencer would not be different.  How could another, having eaten the food, be quenched by thirst and die?

original: de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gis byed pa de ni byed pa po @22b ste gang bya ba de ni las so //
analyzed: gang gis byed pa de ni byed pa po @22b ste gang bya ba de ni las so //
translated: The agent is that by which it is done.  The action is that which is to be done.

original: las byas pa de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa po ni las byed pa po'o //
analyzed: las byas pa de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa po ni las byed pa po'o //
translated: The experiencer of the result of the action is the agent of the action.

original: las med na byed pa po mi 'grub ste dper na bum pa byed pa'i phyir bum pa mkhan no //
analyzed: las med na byed pa po mi 'grub ste dper na bum pa byed pa'i phyir bum pa mkhan no //
translated: If there is no action, the agent is not established, just as a potter is so called because he makes a pot.

original: de bzhin du gang gis las byed pa de ni byed pa po zhes rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gis las byed pa de ni byed pa po zhes rigs so //
translated: In the same way, it is reasonable that one who performs an action is the agent.

original: smras pa / dbang phyug rang dbang du las kyi byed pa po min te rab tu sbyor ba po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / dbang phyug rang dbang du las kyi byed pa po min te rab tu sbyor ba po yin no zhe na /
translated: Objection: ƒ™≈õvara is not the agent of action independently, but he is the employer.

original: smras pa / 'dir gal te las byed pa po ma yin na de'i tshe kun nas thams cad byed pa po zhes pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir gal te las byed pa po ma yin na de'i tshe kun nas thams cad byed pa po zhes pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In response, if he is not the agent of action, then it is meaningless to say that he is the employer of all.

original: 'dir gal te byed pa po bskul bar gyur pa na las byed na de'i tshe byed pa po'i gzhan dbang nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir gal te byed pa po bskul bar gyur pa na las byed na de'i tshe byed pa po'i gzhan dbang nyid do //
translated: In response, if the agent performs action when he is impelled, then the agent is dependent.

original: gang gi gzhan dbang nyid du gyur pa des 'gal ba'i las byas par gyur na rab tu sbyor ba pos ji ltar tshar gcod par byed /
analyzed: gang gi gzhan dbang nyid du gyur pa des 'gal ba'i las byas par gyur na rab tu sbyor ba pos ji ltar tshar gcod par byed /
translated: If he is dependent, then if he performs an action that is contrary to his nature, how can the employer punish him?

original: rang dbang nyid med par rang dbang nyid du dbang phyug gis khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rang dbang nyid med par rang dbang nyid du dbang phyug gis khyab pa'o //
translated: Without independence, he pervades as independent.

original: de ltar byed pa por smra ba rnams la las kyi 'bras bu med par grub ste de ltar yang ma yin no /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa por smra ba rnams la las kyi 'bras bu med par grub ste de ltar yang ma yin no /
translated: Thus, for those who propound an independent agent, the effect of action is established as nonexistent. But that is not so.

original: de'i phyir dge dang mi dge'i 'bras ster byed po dbang phyug 'ga' yang med de srog chags las ni dor nas so zhes pa ste byed pa po med par rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge dang mi dge'i 'bras ster byed po dbang phyug 'ga' yang med de srog chags las ni dor nas so zhes pa ste byed pa po med par rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa grub bo //
translated: Therefore, there is no independent God who gives the effect of virtue and nonvirtue, since the effect of action is not relinquished by the living being. Thus, the enjoyment of the effect of one‚Äôs action is established without an agent.

original: da ni rang dbang gi byed po gzhan la ltos pa nyid du gsungs pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ni gal te mkha' la ste nam mkha' la sa la sogs pa'i rdul phran rnams byed po'i dang por yod pa min no //
analyzed: da ni rang dbang gi byed po gzhan la ltos pa nyid du gsungs pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ni gal te mkha' la ste nam mkha' la sa la sogs pa'i rdul phran rnams byed po'i dang por yod pa min no //
translated: Now, in order to state that an independent agent is dependent on another, it is said, ‚ÄúHere, if the particles of earth, etc., in space, i.e., in the sky, are not the first existent of the agent,‚Äù then,

original: de'i tshe rdzas dag med pa la ni sna tshogs mi byed de yul dang rnam par bral ba cha med pa la thams cad byed po ji ltar yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe rdzas dag med pa la ni sna tshogs mi byed de yul dang rnam par bral ba cha med pa la thams cad byed po ji ltar yod /
translated: since there is no substance without them, the various things are not made. Since they are devoid of object and partless, how can all be the agent?

original: yul dang rnam par bral ba byed po 'di yi sgrub byed kyi tshad ma mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa med pa gang yin pa de'i phyir rdzas yang dag par sbyor ba nyid las rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba dang sna tshogs thams cad du 'gyur gyi
analyzed: yul dang rnam par bral ba byed po 'di yi sgrub byed kyi tshad ma mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa med pa gang yin pa de'i phyir rdzas yang dag par sbyor ba nyid las rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba dang sna tshogs thams cad du 'gyur gyi
translated: The proof of this agent, which is devoid of object and action, is not by valid knowledge of direct perception or inference. Therefore, all moving and unmoving things arise from the right combination of substances.

original: / byed pa po'i 'dod pas ma yin las kyi gzugs zhes pa ni rigs pa ste byed pa po'i 'dod pa dgag pa'o //
analyzed: / byed pa po'i 'dod pas ma yin las kyi gzugs zhes pa ni rigs pa ste byed pa po'i 'dod pa dgag pa'o //
translated: The form of karma is logical, the refutation of the desire of the agent.

original: da ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gsungs pa yang dag sbyor ba las zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dngos po thams cad kyi yang dag par sbyor ba las 'byung ba ni 'di thob nas 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /üîΩyang dag sbyor ba las zhes pa ni zla ba'i 'od zer dang yang dag par sbyor ba las chu @23a * //
analyzed: da ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gsungs pa yang dag sbyor ba las zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dngos po thams cad kyi yang dag par sbyor ba las 'byung ba ni 'di thob nas 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste / yang dag sbyor ba las zhes pa ni zla ba'i 'od zer dang yang dag par sbyor ba las chu @23a * //
translated: Now, the statement of dependent origination is ‚Äúfrom the right combination‚Äù and so on. Here the arising of all things from the right combination is that when this is obtained, that arises.

original: shel las chur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shel las chur 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the right combination‚Äù means that from the right combination of the light rays of the moon, water arises from the crystal.

original: kyang yig gis me shel las mer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyang yig gis me shel las mer 'gyur ro //
translated: The word also means that fire arises from the fire crystal.

original: me long las dngos po dang yang dag par sbyor ba las dngos po'i gzugs brnyan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me long las dngos po dang yang dag par sbyor ba las dngos po'i gzugs brnyan du 'gyur ro //
translated: From a mirror, a reflection of an object arises from the conjunction of the mirror and the object.

original: gzhan gyis skyur ba zos pa'i yang dag par sbyor ba las gzhan gyi lce 'dzag par 'gyur te skyur ba'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis skyur ba zos pa'i yang dag par sbyor ba las gzhan gyi lce 'dzag par 'gyur te skyur ba'i rgyu las so //
translated: From the conjunction of the saliva of one person and the saliva of another, the saliva of the second person flows from the first person‚Äôs mouth.

original: khron pa la sogs pa rang gi sgra'i yang dag par sbyor ba las sgra brnyan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khron pa la sogs pa rang gi sgra'i yang dag par sbyor ba las sgra brnyan du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the conjunction of a sound and a well, an echo arises.

original: dag pa'i sa bon las sa dang chu la sogs pa'i yang dag par sbyor ba las myu gur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag pa'i sa bon las sa dang chu la sogs pa'i yang dag par sbyor ba las myu gur 'gyur ro //
translated: From the conjunction of earth, water, and so on, a sprout arises from a pure seed.

original: khab len las zhes pa ni khab len gyi rdo'i yang dag par sbyor ba las lcags kyi thur ma g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khab len las zhes pa ni khab len gyi rdo'i yang dag par sbyor ba las lcags kyi thur ma g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the conjunction of a magnet and iron, an iron needle moves.

original: 'dod pas dngos po 'di dag la dngos por 'gyur pa ci yang min no //
analyzed: 'dod pas dngos po 'di dag la dngos por 'gyur pa ci yang min no //
translated: In these examples, nothing that is real arises from anything that is real.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa ste 'di ni srid pa gsum gyi gnas su su zhig gis kyang sprul pa min no zhes pa ste rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba grub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa ste 'di ni srid pa gsum gyi gnas su su zhig gis kyang sprul pa min no zhes pa ste rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba grub pa'o //
translated: The power of things is not created by anyone in the three worlds. This is the establishment of dependent origination.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gang gi phyir rgyu med na 'bras bur mi 'gyur pa de'i phyir rgyu yod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu med na 'bras bur mi 'gyur pa de'i phyir rgyu yod do //
translated: ‚ÄúSince an effect does not occur without a cause, a cause exists.

original: des na dbang phyug la sogs pa grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: des na dbang phyug la sogs pa grub bo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, ƒ™≈õvara and so on are established.‚Äù

original: smras pa / 'dir rgyu las 'bras bur 'gyur pa gang yin pa de ci 'bras bu yod pa'am med pa yin /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir rgyu las 'bras bur 'gyur pa gang yin pa de ci 'bras bu yod pa'am med pa yin /
translated: We reply, here what becomes an effect from a cause, does that effect exist or not exist?

original: rgyu la yod pa ni 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu la yod pa ni 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which exists as a cause does not become an effect.

original: bum pa yod pa'i sa la sogs pa ni rgyur 'gyur par mi 'gyur te yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa yod pa'i sa la sogs pa ni rgyur 'gyur par mi 'gyur te yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Clay and so on that exist as a cause of a vase do not become a cause because they exist.

original: med pa ni 'bras bur mi 'gyur te med pa'i phyir rus sbal gyi spu bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa ni 'bras bur mi 'gyur te med pa'i phyir rus sbal gyi spu bzhin no //
translated: That which does not exist does not become an effect because it does not exist, like the hair of a turtle.

original: de bzhin du snam bu'i snal ma la sogs pa rnams rgyur gyur par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du snam bu'i snal ma la sogs pa rnams rgyur gyur par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the threads of a woolen cloth and so on do not become a cause.

original: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid ni 'bras bur mi 'gyur te phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid ni 'bras bur mi 'gyur te phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of both does not become the effect, because they are mutually contradictory.

original: gang yod pa de ni med pa ma yin zhing gang med pa de ni yod pa ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yod pa de ni med pa ma yin zhing gang med pa de ni yod pa ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which exists does not not exist, and that which does not exist does not exist. Because they are contradictory.

original: de'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu yod pa dang 'bras bu med pa dang 'bras bu yod pa dang med par mi 'gyur ro zhes grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu yod pa dang 'bras bu med pa dang 'bras bu yod pa dang med par mi 'gyur ro zhes grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the effect does not exist, does not not exist, and does not both exist and not exist in the cause.

original: smras pa / 'dir rgyu bkag pas 'bras bu yang bkag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir rgyu bkag pas 'bras bu yang bkag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Objection: Here, since the cause is refuted, the effect is also refuted.

original: gnyis ka bkag pa'i phyir thams cad med par grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis ka bkag pa'i phyir thams cad med par grub bo zhe na /
translated: Since both are refuted, it is established that everything is nonexistent.

original: smras pa / 'dir thams cad med pa ma yin te gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir thams cad med pa ma yin te gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Here, everything is not nonexistent because it depends on another.

original: 'dir rgyu la rgyu nyid gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu la ltos nas yongs su @23b brtags pa ste 'bras bu yang rgyu la ltos nas so //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu la rgyu nyid gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu la ltos nas yongs su @23b brtags pa ste 'bras bu yang rgyu la ltos nas so //
translated: Here, that which is the nature of the cause is imputed in dependence on the effect, and the effect is imputed in dependence on the cause.

original: de ltar gzhan ltos pa'i phyir gnyis ka yang rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan ltos pa'i phyir gnyis ka yang rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since they depend on another, it follows that both are causes.

original: gnyis ka rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu med de de med na rgyu med do //
analyzed: gnyis ka rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu med de de med na rgyu med do //
translated: Because both are causes, there is no effect. If that does not exist, there is no cause.

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu la ltos ba'i phyir nges pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te nges pa med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu la ltos ba'i phyir nges pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te nges pa med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the cause depends on the effect, it follows that there is no certainty. Because there is no certainty, it follows that there is no cause.

original: de'i phyir dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu thams cad nges pa med pa nyid dang rgyu ma yin pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu thams cad nges pa med pa nyid dang rgyu ma yin pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that all causes such as God are uncertain and not causes.

original: smras pa / rgyu dang 'bras bu ni ltos pa can grub pa ma yin te rgyu gang yin pa de nyid rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid ni 'bras bu nyid du grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu dang 'bras bu ni ltos pa can grub pa ma yin te rgyu gang yin pa de nyid rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid ni 'bras bu nyid du grub bo zhe na /
translated: Objection: Cause and effect are not established as mutually dependent, because whatever is a cause is a cause, and whatever is an effect is an effect.

original: smras pa / 'dir khyod kyi 'dod pa las grub cing bdag gi las ma yin pa ni shin tu mi bzad pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir khyod kyi 'dod pa las grub cing bdag gi las ma yin pa ni shin tu mi bzad pa'o //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says: Here, your assertion is established, not mine. This is extremely unreasonable.

original: gal te khyod kyi 'dod pa las grub na de'i tshe bdag gi yang 'dod pa las khyod kyi yod pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gi med par grub ste rig pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi 'dod pa las grub na de'i tshe bdag gi yang 'dod pa las khyod kyi yod pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gi med par grub ste rig pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you establish your thesis, then my thesis is established, namely, that what exists for you does not exist for me, because you have abandoned reason.

original: smras pa / yid ches lung las dam tshig 'di //üîΩdam tshig ma grub dam tshig ces //
analyzed: smras pa / yid ches lung las dam tshig 'di // dam tshig ma grub dam tshig ces //
translated: Objection: This is a rule of scripture, not of reasoning.üîΩReply: You do not obtain the expression ‚Äúrule of scripture‚Äù

original: brjod pa dag ni mi 'thob ste //
analyzed: brjod pa dag ni mi 'thob ste //
translated: when the rule is not established.

original: bstan bcos rig pa rnams kyis gsungs zhes dang / 'ga' zhig gi tshe rigs pa brjod pa smras pa /
analyzed: bstan bcos rig pa rnams kyis gsungs zhes dang / 'ga' zhig gi tshe rigs pa brjod pa smras pa /
translated: And some say, ‚ÄúThe treatises say that reason is stated at some times.‚Äù

original: 'dir nye par len pa'i rgyu las thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir nus pa'i rgyu nus pa can las 'bras bu yod pa grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir nye par len pa'i rgyu las thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir nus pa'i rgyu nus pa can las 'bras bu yod pa grub po zhe na /
translated: Here, since all things do not arise from a cause that is a substantial entity, an existent effect is established from a cause that is a substantial entity.

original: smras pa / 'dir khyod kyi gtan tshigs ni don med do //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir khyod kyi gtan tshigs ni don med do //
translated: Reply: Here your reason is meaningless.

original: ji ltar gal te khyod kyi phyogs sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa de'i tshe bdag gi phyogs kyang sgrub par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar gal te khyod kyi phyogs sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa de'i tshe bdag gi phyogs kyang sgrub par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If you obtain the characteristic of establishing your position, then my position is also established.

original: ci ste khyod kyi phyogs sun 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa de'i tshe bdag gi phyogs kyang sun 'byin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste khyod kyi phyogs sun 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa de'i tshe bdag gi phyogs kyang sun 'byin par 'gyur te /
translated: But when you have a reason that refutes your opponent‚Äôs position, then my position is also refuted.

original: dper na me 'di ni gnyis ka sreg par byed kyi gcig ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me 'di ni gnyis ka sreg par byed kyi gcig ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, fire burns both, but not just one.

original: 'dir dper na sgra smra ba po rnams kyis dam bca' ba ni sgra rtag pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dir dper na sgra smra ba po rnams kyis dam bca' ba ni sgra rtag pa'o ;
translated: Here, for example, the sound theorists make an assertion: ‚ÄúSound is permanent.‚Äù

original: / gtan tshigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: / gtan tshigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not a body.‚Äù

original: dpe gang zhe na nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: dpe gang zhe na nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: What is the example? ‚ÄúLike space.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar nam mkha' lus can ma yin pa nyid kyis rtag pa de bzhin du sgra yang yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar nam mkha' lus can ma yin pa nyid kyis rtag pa de bzhin du sgra yang yin no //
translated: Because just as space is permanent by not having a body, so is sound.

original: de'i phyir sgra rtag par grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra rtag par grub bo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, sound is established as permanent.

original: smras pa / 'di ni dam bca' pa ma @24a * //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ni dam bca' pa ma @24a * //
translated: We reply: This is not an assertion.

original: yin te ; gzhan yang smra bar 'gyur pa sgra mi rtag go //
analyzed: yin te ; gzhan yang smra bar 'gyur pa sgra mi rtag go //
translated: Moreover, there is another statement: ‚ÄúSound is impermanent.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs gang zhe na byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang zhe na byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is the reason? ‚ÄúBecause it is produced.‚Äù

original: dpe gang zhe na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dpe gang zhe na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: What is the example? ‚ÄúLike a pot.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar bum pa sa dang dbyig gu dang 'khor lo dang skud pa dang skyes bu'i rtsol bas byas pa de bzhin du sgra yang mgrin pa dang rkan la sogs pa'i rtsol bas bskyed pa de'i phyir sgra mi rtag par grub po //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar bum pa sa dang dbyig gu dang 'khor lo dang skud pa dang skyes bu'i rtsol bas byas pa de bzhin du sgra yang mgrin pa dang rkan la sogs pa'i rtsol bas bskyed pa de'i phyir sgra mi rtag par grub po //
translated: Because sound is produced by the effort of the throat, palate, etc., just as a pot is produced by clay, a stick, a wheel, string, and the effort of the potter, therefore sound is established as impermanent.

original: des na zol gyi gtan tshig tsam las 'bras bu 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na zol gyi gtan tshig tsam las 'bras bu 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the result is not established from mere deceptive reasoning.

original: gang gis ji lta ba de bzhin du brjod pa de ni tshad mar 'gyur gyi zol gyi gtan tshigs las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis ji lta ba de bzhin du brjod pa de ni tshad mar 'gyur gyi zol gyi gtan tshigs las ni ma yin no //
translated: That which is expressed just as it is becomes valid knowledge, but not from deceptive reasoning.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs don med do //
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs don med do //
translated: Thus, reasoning is pointless.

original: gzhan yang bsgrub bya rnams kyis dam bca' ba dang 'gal pas gtan tshigs ni sgrub byed du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'dir gang gi dus na dam bca' ba yod pa de'i dus na gtan tshigs med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsgrub bya rnams kyis dam bca' ba dang 'gal pas gtan tshigs ni sgrub byed du mi 'gyur ro // 'dir gang gi dus na dam bca' ba yod pa de'i dus na gtan tshigs med do //
translated: Moreover, because the thesis is contradicted by the probandum, the reasoning does not become a proof.üîΩHere, when the thesis exists, the reasoning does not exist.

original: gang gi dus na gtan tshigs yod pa de'i dus na dam bca' med do //
analyzed: gang gi dus na gtan tshigs yod pa de'i dus na dam bca' med do //
translated: When the reasoning exists, the thesis does not exist.

original: des na dam bca' med pa'i gtan tshigs 'di gang gi yin te /
analyzed: des na dam bca' med pa'i gtan tshigs 'di gang gi yin te /
translated: Therefore, whose is this reason that has no thesis?

original: cig car ba'i chos can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car ba'i chos can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the subject of an inference.

original: gang gi dus na pra yig yod pa de'i dus na ti yig dang dzny'a yig med do //
analyzed: gang gi dus na pra yig yod pa de'i dus na ti yig dang dzny'a yig med do //
translated: When the syllable pra is present, the syllables ti and j√±a are not present.

original: de bzhin du pa yig dang ra yig dang aa yig ste pra yig gi ji lta ba bzhin du yi ge yi ge'i'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du pa yig dang ra yig dang aa yig ste pra yig gi ji lta ba bzhin du yi ge yi ge'i'o //
translated: Similarly, the syllables pa, ra, and a are like the syllable pra.

original: ma skyes pa'am shi ba'i bus bya ba byed par mi nus te de bzhin du gtan tshigs kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'am shi ba'i bus bya ba byed par mi nus te de bzhin du gtan tshigs kyis kyang ngo //
translated: A son who is unborn or dead is not able to perform an action, and in the same way, a reason is not able to prove a thesis.

original: de'i phyir rgyu la brten nas 'bras bur mi 'gyur te rgyu med pa las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu la brten nas 'bras bur mi 'gyur te rgyu med pa las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, an effect does not arise in dependence on a cause, because it is established from a noncause.

original: rgyu med pa las zhes pa ni rgyu dang byed pa zhes pa don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las zhes pa ni rgyu dang byed pa zhes pa don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom a noncause‚Äù means that a cause and an agent are not different objects.

original: de ltar rgyu las 'bras bur mi 'gyur te rgyu med pa las kyang 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu las 'bras bur mi 'gyur te rgyu med pa las kyang 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, an effect does not arise from a cause, and an effect does not arise from a noncause.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu ni rang las ma yin gzhan las ma yin gnyis ka las ma yin rgyu med pa can yang ma yin no zhes grub ste byed pa po dang byed pa rtag pa sun dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu ni rang las ma yin gzhan las ma yin gnyis ka las ma yin rgyu med pa can yang ma yin no zhes grub ste byed pa po dang byed pa rtag pa sun dbyung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the effect does not exist from itself, does not exist from another, does not exist from both, and does not exist without a cause.

original: da ni bdag sun dbyung ba gsungs pa gal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gal te bdag ni kun du 'gro na gnyen dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: da ni bdag sun dbyung ba gsungs pa gal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gal te bdag ni kun du 'gro na gnyen dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhes pa ni /
translated: Now, the refutation of the self is stated beginning with ‚ÄúIf the self is all-pervading,‚Äù and so on. Here, if the self is all-pervading, how could the suffering of separation from loved ones be experienced?

original: 'dir gal te bdag thams cad du 'gro bde gcig pur gyur na de las gnyen dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal du @24b mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'dir gal te bdag thams cad du 'gro bde gcig pur gyur na de las gnyen dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal du @24b mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Here, if the self were all-pervading and singular, then the suffering of separation from loved ones would not occur.

original: sems can gcig gi sdug bsngal gyis sems can thams cad sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te bdag thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gcig gi sdug bsngal gyis sems can thams cad sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te bdag thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the suffering of one sentient being would cause suffering for all sentient beings, because the self is all-pervading.

original: ci ste bdag du ma yin na de'i tshe bdag du ma rnams thams cad du 'gro ba nyid med do //
analyzed: ci ste bdag du ma yin na de'i tshe bdag du ma rnams thams cad du 'gro ba nyid med do //
translated: But if the self is manifold, then at that time the many selves do not have all-pervasiveness.

original: gal te 'di ni rtag par gyur na 'dod pa'i mda' yis bsnun pa'i gnas skabs nyid du cis rab 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir rtag pa gang yin pa de la gnas skabs gzhan med de rnam par 'gyur pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni rtag par gyur na 'dod pa'i mda' yis bsnun pa'i gnas skabs nyid du cis rab 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir rtag pa gang yin pa de la gnas skabs gzhan med de rnam par 'gyur pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, whatever is permanent has no other state because it is free from transformation.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i mda' yis bsnun pas 'dod pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa bcu po 'dir ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i mda' yis bsnun pas 'dod pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa bcu po 'dir ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be in these ten states of desire, being struck by the arrow of desire?

original: de'i phyir bdag ni mi rtag par rtogs par bya ste rnam 'gyur dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni mi rtag par rtogs par bya ste rnam 'gyur dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the self should be understood as impermanent because it is endowed with transformation.üîΩIf it were endowed with activity, how could it go to sleep?

original: gal te bya ba dang bcas par gyur na gnyid log dus su 'di ni rmongs pa nyid du ci ltar 'gro zhes pa ni 'dir sad pa'i dus su sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid kyi bya ba dang bcas shing /
analyzed: gal te bya ba dang bcas par gyur na gnyid log dus su 'di ni rmongs pa nyid du ci ltar 'gro zhes pa ni 'dir sad pa'i dus su sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid kyi bya ba dang bcas shing /
translated: Here, at the time of being awake, it is endowed with activity characterized by the state of being awake.

original: dang yig las rtag pa yang yin na de'i cho ga nyid log pa'i dus su bya ba dang bral ba rmongs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gro / de ltar nges par mtha' gcig tu rnam par dpyad na bdag 'di ni kun tu 'gro bar 'gyur pa ma yin
analyzed: dang yig las rtag pa yang yin na de'i cho ga nyid log pa'i dus su bya ba dang bral ba rmongs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gro / de ltar nges par mtha' gcig tu rnam par dpyad na bdag 'di ni kun tu 'gro bar 'gyur pa ma yin
translated: Thus, if one analyzes this self in this way, it is definitely not omnipresent,

original: zhing khyab bdag gtso bo rtag pa yang ma yin la bya ba dang bcas pa yang ma yin no zhes grub po //
analyzed: zhing khyab bdag gtso bo rtag pa yang ma yin la bya ba dang bcas pa yang ma yin no zhes grub po //
translated: nor is it the permanent, all-pervading, supreme lord, nor is it endowed with activity.

original: da ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab gsungs pa bdag med ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rten cing 'bral par 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni 'gog pa las skye ba dang skye ba las 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab gsungs pa bdag med ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rten cing 'bral par 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni 'gog pa las skye ba dang skye ba las 'gog pa'o //
translated: Now, the BhagavƒÅn Buddha‚Äôs statement ‚ÄúPhenomena are selfless‚Äù and so on is stated here. Dependent origination is the arising of phenomena from cessation and the arising of cessation from arising.

original: de ltar 'gog pa'i chos rnams la bdag med de bdag gi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'gog pa'i chos rnams la bdag med de bdag gi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, in phenomena that are cessation, there is no self because there is no ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: skye ba'i chos rnams 'byung ba yod de slar yang skye ba 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos rnams 'byung ba yod de slar yang skye ba 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In phenomena that arise, there is arising because they again take up birth.

original: 'di dag ni kha thon la sogs pa'i dpas grub ste 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni kha thon la sogs pa'i dpas grub ste 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
translated: These are established by the evidence of recitation, etc., and will be discussed in the course of the explanation.

original: dge dang mi dge'i 'bras bu yod de zhes pa ni skye ba'i chos rnams la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu yod pa'o //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge'i 'bras bu yod de zhes pa ni skye ba'i chos rnams la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu yod pa'o //
translated: The result of virtue and nonvirtue exists means that the phenomena of origination have the result of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: 'gog pa'i chos rnams la med pas na byed pa po yis rnam par dman te byed pa po dang bral ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos rnams la med pas na byed pa po yis rnam par dman te byed pa po dang bral ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Since they do not exist for the phenomena of cessation, the agent is deficient, meaning that it is devoid of an agent.

original: 'gog pa'i chos kyi tshogs 'gro ba po med do //üîΩma @25a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos kyi tshogs 'gro ba po med do // ma @25a * //
translated: The collection of phenomena of cessation has no goer.

original: lus pa ni mtha' dag go //
analyzed: lus pa ni mtha' dag go //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù means without remainder.

original: thar pa'i slad du 'gro ba yod de gzhan dag ste gzhan ni de'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa'i slad du 'gro ba yod de gzhan dag ste gzhan ni de'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is going for the sake of liberation, but not for others, because it is said, ‚ÄúOthers have a different nature, etc.‚Äù

original: 'ching ba yod de bcings pa med zhes pa ni 'dir skye ba'i chos rnams la 'ching ba yod do //
analyzed: 'ching ba yod de bcings pa med zhes pa ni 'dir skye ba'i chos rnams la 'ching ba yod do //
translated: There is bondage, but not the bound means that here, for the phenomena of origination, there is bondage.

original: 'gog pa'i chos rnams la bcings pa med do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos rnams la bcings pa med do //
translated: For the phenomena of cessation, there is no bound.

original: dngos po dngos med dag kyang yod de skad cig rnam bral rang bzhin med pa dag gi srid pa yod ces pa ni 'dir dngos po dang dngos po med pa gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa rang bzhin med cing rdzas kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral pa
analyzed: dngos po dngos med dag kyang yod de skad cig rnam bral rang bzhin med pa dag gi srid pa yod ces pa ni 'dir dngos po dang dngos po med pa gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa rang bzhin med cing rdzas kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral pa
translated: Things and nonthings exist. The existence of things devoid of moments and devoid of intrinsic reality is said to exist. Here, things and nonthings are mixed into one, devoid of intrinsic reality, and free from the conception of substantial things.

original: pra phab ba dang mtshungs pa skad cig rnam bral te skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'i dngos po ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du yod do //
analyzed: pra phab ba dang mtshungs pa skad cig rnam bral te skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'i dngos po ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du yod do //
translated: Devoid of moments, free from arising and disintegration, things exist for the purpose of the buddhas turning the wheel of Dharma.

original: 'di dag bdag gi ste gdon thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i tshig gang yin pa de ni lha dang gdengs can rnams kyis gdon bcas tshig gis 'joms mi 'gyur 'dir dper na gdon gyis bzung ba'i gyad kyis gdon las grol ba'i gyad gzhom par mi nus so
analyzed: 'di dag bdag gi ste gdon thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i tshig gang yin pa de ni lha dang gdengs can rnams kyis gdon bcas tshig gis 'joms mi 'gyur 'dir dper na gdon gyis bzung ba'i gyad kyis gdon las grol ba'i gyad gzhom par mi nus so
translated: These are mine. The words of complete freedom from all evil spirits cannot be destroyed by the words of evil spirits with evil spirits. Here, for example, a wrestler seized by an evil spirit cannot be defeated by another wrestler seized by an evil spirit.

original: // de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i gdon gyis bzung bas rnam par rtog pa'i gdon las grol ba gzhom par mi nus so //
analyzed: // de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i gdon gyis bzung bas rnam par rtog pa'i gdon las grol ba gzhom par mi nus so //
translated: Likewise, one who is seized by the demon of discursive thought cannot be cured of the demon of discursive thought.

original: bdag med pa la sogs pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa la sogs pa grub pa'o //
translated: This is the establishment of selflessness, etc.

original: 'di ni mdor bsdus pas gsungs pa ste rgyas par lud rgya chen po las shes par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bsdus pas gsungs pa ste rgyas par lud rgya chen po las shes par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is stated in brief; it should be known in detail from the great treatise. This is the conclusion.

original: da ni bye brag smra ba dang mdo sde pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i 'dod pa sun dbyung ba gsungs pa gang zhig de nyid ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir mu stegs sangs rgyas pa gang dag phyogs yongs su 'dzin to ;
analyzed: da ni bye brag smra ba dang mdo sde pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i 'dod pa sun dbyung ba gsungs pa gang zhig de nyid ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir mu stegs sangs rgyas pa gang dag phyogs yongs su 'dzin to ;
translated: Now, the refutation of the assertions of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, SautrƒÅntikas, and YogƒÅcƒÅras is stated: ‚ÄúWhatever is grasped as reality, etc.‚Äù Here, the tƒ´rthikas and Buddhists grasp their own positions.

original: / rang gi phyogs 'dzin pa des gzhan gyi phyogs 'dzin par byed par 'gyur te byis pa'i blo can de dag rnams kyis de'i chos kyis sam de'i chos mi mthun pas so //
analyzed: / rang gi phyogs 'dzin pa des gzhan gyi phyogs 'dzin par byed par 'gyur te byis pa'i blo can de dag rnams kyis de'i chos kyis sam de'i chos mi mthun pas so //
translated: By grasping their own positions, they cause others to grasp other positions, because those childish ones, by that dharma or by that dharma‚Äôs opposite,

original: 'dir bye brag smra ba gang zhig de nyid gang zag ces bya lus la gnas par smra ba de ni rang bzhin dag gis nyams zhes nga ni 'dir gal te gang zag gi nang du 'dus pa skye ba'i cha shas can gyi gang zag yod na de'i tshe
analyzed: 'dir bye brag smra ba gang zhig de nyid gang zag ces bya lus la gnas par smra ba de ni rang bzhin dag gis nyams zhes nga ni 'dir gal te gang zag gi nang du 'dus pa skye ba'i cha shas can gyi gang zag yod na de'i tshe
translated: If the person is included in the aggregates,

original: rang bzhin brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin brjod par bya'o //
translated: then its nature should be stated.

original: ci shes pa'i rang bzhin nam mi shes pa'i rang bzhin yin gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de lta na mi rtag ste 'dir bum pa'i shes pa 'gag pa na snam bu'i shes pa 'byung bar @25b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci shes pa'i rang bzhin nam mi shes pa'i rang bzhin yin gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de lta na mi rtag ste 'dir bum pa'i shes pa 'gag pa na snam bu'i shes pa 'byung bar @25b 'gyur ro //
translated: Is the nature of the person that which knows or is it that which does not know? If it is the nature of that which knows, then it is impermanent, because in this world, when the consciousness of a pot ceases, the consciousness of a cloth arises.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag go //
translated: Therefore it is impermanent.

original: ci ste mi shes pa'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe mi shes pa la bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa rig pa med do //
analyzed: ci ste mi shes pa'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe mi shes pa la bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa rig pa med do //
translated: But if the nature of the person is that which does not know, then that which does not know is not aware of pleasure, pain, and so on.

original: des na bye brag smra ba de ni de'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyad na nyams so //
analyzed: des na bye brag smra ba de ni de'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyad na nyams so //
translated: Therefore, when the nature of the person is analyzed, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika is refuted.

original: 'dir khur khur pa'i gang zag yod de rtag par yang bdag mi smra zhing mi rtag par yang bdag gis mi smra'o zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi le'u las rgyu cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir khur khur pa'i gang zag yod de rtag par yang bdag mi smra zhing mi rtag par yang bdag gis mi smra'o zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi le'u las rgyu cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, the person who is the bearer of the burden exists, but the Lord has said, ‚ÄúI do not say that the self is permanent, nor do I say that it is impermanent.‚Äù This will be explained at length in the chapter on gnosis.

original: kun rdzob dag gis don ni smra ba po yang don dam ma rig med pa dag tu 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dag gis don ni smra ba po yang don dam ma rig med pa dag tu 'dod pa'o //
translated: The proponent of objects is one who does not know the ultimate, the body of gnosis, and who asserts that it does not exist.

original: 'dir kun rdzob kyis sngon po las sogs pa'i don 'dzin pa'i don smra ba po ni nyams so //
analyzed: 'dir kun rdzob kyis sngon po las sogs pa'i don 'dzin pa'i don smra ba po ni nyams so //
translated: Here, the proponent of objects, who apprehends objects such as blue, is refuted.

original: ji ltar zhe na don dam pa ye shes kyi sku ma rig ste mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med pa dag tu 'dod pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na don dam pa ye shes kyi sku ma rig ste mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med pa dag tu 'dod pas so //
translated: How so? Because he does not know the ultimate, the body of gnosis, and asserts that it does not exist, like the son of a barren woman.

original: de bzhin du smra pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du smra pa /
translated: The proponent of objects is refuted in the same way.

original: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
translated: Space and the two cessations

original: 'dus ma byas gsum rtag pa ste //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gsum rtag pa ste //
translated: Are the three unconditioned phenomena that are permanent.

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All conditioned phenomena are momentary.

original: bdag gis stong zhing byed po med //
analyzed: bdag gis stong zhing byed po med //
translated: They are empty of self and have no creator.

original: dbang skyes blo ni rnam med kyis //
analyzed: dbang skyes blo ni rnam med kyis //
translated: The mind that arises from the sense faculties is without aspects.

original: phra rab bsags pa dngos su rig / kha che'i gzhung gi chu gter gyi //
analyzed: phra rab bsags pa dngos su rig / kha che'i gzhung gi chu gter gyi //
translated: The Sautrantikas hold that the atoms are directly perceived,

original: bye brag smra ba'i gzhung 'dod 'gyur //
analyzed: bye brag smra ba'i gzhung 'dod 'gyur //
translated: and that the ocean of the Vaibhashika texts is a source of distinctions.

original: shes pa rnams bcas skyed byed ni //
analyzed: shes pa rnams bcas skyed byed ni //
translated: The consciousnesses are produced together.

original: dbang po'i spyod yul snang ba min //
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul snang ba min //
translated: The object of the sense faculties is not an appearance.

original: nam mkha' mo gsham bu dang mtshungs //
analyzed: nam mkha' mo gsham bu dang mtshungs //
translated: Space is like the son of a barren woman.

original: 'gog pa dag ni nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: 'gog pa dag ni nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: Cessation is like space.

original: 'du byed bems po yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'du byed bems po yod ma yin //
translated: Compounded things are not inert matter.

original: dus gsum rjes 'gro dag kyang med //
analyzed: dus gsum rjes 'gro dag kyang med //
translated: Nor do they follow the three times.

original: thogs pa med pa'i gzugs yod min //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i gzugs yod min //
translated: There is no form that is unobstructed.

original: zhes pa mdo sde pa yis rig / ces so //
analyzed: zhes pa mdo sde pa yis rig / ces so //
translated: This is known by the Sautrantikas.

original: des na thogs pa med pa'i gzugs dus gsum rig par byed pa po gal te mar me rnal ba dang mtshungs pa yin na de'i tshe thogs pa med pa'i gzugs med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thogs pa med pa'i gzugs dus gsum rig par byed pa po gal te mar me rnal ba dang mtshungs pa yin na de'i tshe thogs pa med pa'i gzugs med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the unobstructed form that is the knower of the three times is similar to a burning lamp, then at that time, because there is no unobstructed form, omniscience would not exist.

original: sku bzhi ma gtogs pa nyi cho ba'i skus sangs rgyas nyid du mi gyur ro //
analyzed: sku bzhi ma gtogs pa nyi cho ba'i skus sangs rgyas nyid du mi gyur ro //
translated: And buddhahood would not exist except for the four bodies.

original: 'dir thogs pa med pa'i skud dang bral ba'i sangs rgyas ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i du 'phrul ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir thogs pa med pa'i skud dang bral ba'i sangs rgyas ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i du 'phrul ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, a buddha who is devoid of the unobstructed body would not display emanations in all aspects.

original: thams cad kyi skad kyi gsung du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi skad kyi gsung du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He would not have speech in all languages.

original: gzhan gyi sems mkhyen par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems mkhyen par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He would not know the minds of others.

original: lha'i mig la sogs pa thams cad dang 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mdo sde pa'i 'dzin pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: lha'i mig la sogs pa thams cad dang 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mdo sde pa'i 'dzin pa'i skyon no //
translated: The divine eye and so forth would all be fruitless. This is the fault of the SautrƒÅntika position.

original: da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi 'dzin pa'i skyon gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi 'dzin pa'i skyon gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the fault of the YogƒÅcƒÅra position is stated:

original: srid gsum mtha' dag rnams par shes pa nyid du smra pa yang rnam par shes pa 'dod par @26a * //
analyzed: srid gsum mtha' dag rnams par shes pa nyid du smra pa yang rnam par shes pa 'dod par @26a * //
translated: It is said that the entire three existences is consciousness itself.

original: byed ces pa ste smras pa /
analyzed: byed ces pa ste smras pa /
translated: The statement is made:

original: yan lag can zhes bya ba med //
analyzed: yan lag can zhes bya ba med //
translated: There is no so-called possessor of parts.

original: phra rab rdul rnams yod pa min //
analyzed: phra rab rdul rnams yod pa min //
translated: There are no subtle particles.

original: rmi lam nyams su myong ba bzhin //
analyzed: rmi lam nyams su myong ba bzhin //
translated: Like the experience of a dream,

original: dmigs pa med par rab tu snang //üîΩgzung dang 'dzin pa rnam grol ba'i //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par rab tu snang // gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam grol ba'i //
translated: The objectless appears.üîΩConsciousness, free from apprehended and apprehender,

original: rnam par shes pa don dam yod //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don dam yod //
translated: Exists ultimately.

original: ces pa rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung //
analyzed: ces pa rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung //
translated: This is the text of the Yogacaras.

original: rgya mtsho'i pha rol phyin rnams sgrogs //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i pha rol phyin rnams sgrogs //
translated: They proclaim the other shore of the ocean.

original: de'i phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par shes pa rnam par dpyad pas bral ba'i phyir rnam par shes par smra ba po nyams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par shes pa rnam par dpyad pas bral ba'i phyir rnam par shes par smra ba po nyams so //
translated: Therefore, because consciousness is free from the nature of being one or many, the proponent of consciousness is defeated.

original: 'dir khams gsum pa ni rnam par shes pa tsam mo //
analyzed: 'dir khams gsum pa ni rnam par shes pa tsam mo //
translated: Here, the three realms are consciousness only.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa las gzhan phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rang gzugs med na de'i tshe 'dzin pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la phyir rol gyi gzugs ji ltar gzung ba'i rang bzhin gyis rab tu snang /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa las gzhan phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rang gzugs med na de'i tshe 'dzin pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la phyir rol gyi gzugs ji ltar gzung ba'i rang bzhin gyis rab tu snang /
translated: If there is no external object that is a different entity from consciousness, then how does the form of an external object appear to the eye consciousness that apprehends it?

original: smras pa / ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis so zhes na /
analyzed: smras pa / ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis so zhes na /
translated: It is said that it is due to the power of the latent propensities of ignorance.

original: smras pa / ci ma rig pa 'di khams gsum pa'i mtshan nyid can ma yin nam /
analyzed: smras pa / ci ma rig pa 'di khams gsum pa'i mtshan nyid can ma yin nam /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt ignorance characterized by the three realms?

original: gal te ma rig pa khams gsum pa'i mtshan nyid can ma yin na de'i tshe 'khor ba las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa khams gsum pa'i mtshan nyid can ma yin na de'i tshe 'khor ba las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If ignorance does not have the characteristic of the three realms, then it would have the characteristic of transcending cyclic existence.

original: de ltar na 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the perfection of wisdom, but it is not like that.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa 'di ni 'khor ba'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa 'di ni 'khor ba'i bag chags so //
translated: Therefore, this ignorance is the instinct for cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba la yang srid pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid de srid pa gsum ni khams gsum mo //
analyzed: 'khor ba la yang srid pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid de srid pa gsum ni khams gsum mo //
translated: Cyclic existence also has the characteristic of the three existences, and the three existences are the three realms.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa tsam ste de ltar ma rig pa rnam par shes pa tsam dang rnam par shes pa tsam de'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa tsam ste de ltar ma rig pa rnam par shes pa tsam dang rnam par shes pa tsam de'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: Moreover, they are consciousness only. Thus, if ignorance is consciousness only and consciousness only is its nature,

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa dang bral ba med de rnam par shes pa ni ma rig pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa dang bral ba med de rnam par shes pa ni ma rig pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then because it is its nature, it is not free from ignorance, because consciousness is mere ignorance.

original: ci ste khams gsum pa rnam par shes pa tsam ma yin na de'i tshe dam bca' ba nyams te khams gsum pa tsam du ma grub po //
analyzed: ci ste khams gsum pa rnam par shes pa tsam ma yin na de'i tshe dam bca' ba nyams te khams gsum pa tsam du ma grub po //
translated: But if the three realms are not consciousness only, then your thesis fails, because the three realms are not established as mere consciousness.

original: da ni skad cig 'jig pa dang skye ba'i skyon gsungs pa 'di ni chos rnams skad cig ma gcig la 'jig pa dang skye bar 'gyur pa gang yin pa de cig gnas pa med par ram //
analyzed: da ni skad cig 'jig pa dang skye ba'i skyon gsungs pa 'di ni chos rnams skad cig ma gcig la 'jig pa dang skye bar 'gyur pa gang yin pa de cig gnas pa med par ram //
translated: Now, the error of the momentariness of destruction and origination is stated. That which is the momentariness of the destruction and origination of things is not a state of abiding.

original: gal te gnas pa med par 'jig pa dang skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe ri bong gi rva la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gnas pa med par 'jig pa dang skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe ri bong gi rva la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If destruction and origination were without abiding, then even a rabbit‚Äôs horns would have them.

original: ci ste skyes pa las gnas shing gnas pa las 'jig ste zhig pa las skye ba de ltar na gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang skye ba rnams gcig nyid med de mtshan nyid tha dad pas rtogs par bya'o//
analyzed: ci ste skyes pa las gnas shing gnas pa las 'jig ste zhig pa las skye ba de ltar na gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang skye ba rnams gcig nyid med de mtshan nyid tha dad pas rtogs par bya'o//
translated: But if abiding arises from origination, destruction from abiding, and origination from destruction, then abiding, destruction, and origination are not the same, because they are understood to have different characteristics.

original: 'dir gang gi dus na gnas pa yod pa de'i dus na skye ba dang @26b 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi dus na gnas pa yod pa de'i dus na skye ba dang @26b 'jig pa med do //
translated: At the time when abiding exists, origination and destruction do not exist.

original: gang gi dus na 'jig pa yod pa de'i dus na skye ba dang gnas pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi dus na 'jig pa yod pa de'i dus na skye ba dang gnas pa med do //
translated: At the time when destruction exists, origination and abiding do not exist.

original: gang gi dus na skye ba yod pa de'i dus na gnas pa dang 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi dus na skye ba yod pa de'i dus na gnas pa dang 'jig pa med do //
translated: At the time when origination exists, abiding and destruction do not exist.

original: dus zhes pa ni skad cig go //
analyzed: dus zhes pa ni skad cig go //
translated: ‚ÄúTime‚Äù means a moment.

original: gal te dus gcig la yin na skye ba dang rga ba dang 'ching ba rnams gcig pa nyid do zhes pa las gzhan pa ci 'dir gang du skad cig gcig la chos kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa de ci //
analyzed: gal te dus gcig la yin na skye ba dang rga ba dang 'ching ba rnams gcig pa nyid do zhes pa las gzhan pa ci 'dir gang du skad cig gcig la chos kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa de ci //
translated: If it is at the same time, then birth, aging, and death are the same. What else is there to say?

original: chos snga ma 'gags pa las sam 'on te ma 'gags pa'i chos las chos phyi ma skye /
analyzed: chos snga ma 'gags pa las sam 'on te ma 'gags pa'i chos las chos phyi ma skye /
translated: Does a subsequent dharma arise from a prior dharma that has ceased or from a prior dharma that has not ceased?

original: gal te 'gags pa'i chos can las skye na de'i tshe 'gags pa'i mar me las mar me gzhan skye'o //
analyzed: gal te 'gags pa'i chos can las skye na de'i tshe 'gags pa'i mar me las mar me gzhan skye'o //
translated: If it arises from a prior dharma that has ceased, then a subsequent flame arises from a prior flame that has ceased.

original: ci ste ma 'gags pa las skye na de'i tshe ma 'gags pa'i mar me las mar me skye ba bzhin du de las gzhan skye'o //
analyzed: ci ste ma 'gags pa las skye na de'i tshe ma 'gags pa'i mar me las mar me skye ba bzhin du de las gzhan skye'o //
translated: If it arises from a prior dharma that has not ceased, then a subsequent flame arises from a prior flame that has not ceased.

original: de ltar skyes pas las skye bas na mar me'i phreng ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phreng bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar skyes pas las skye bas na mar me'i phreng ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phreng bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it arises in this way, the continuum of consciousness is like the continuum of a flame.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa snga ma ma 'gags pa las gzhan skye ba brjod par mi nus te 'gags pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa snga ma ma 'gags pa las gzhan skye ba brjod par mi nus te 'gags pa las kyang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it cannot be said that a subsequent consciousness arises from a prior consciousness that has ceased or from a prior consciousness that has not ceased.

original: 'dres pa las kyang ma yin te de dag phan tshun 'gal bas gcig pa nyid med do //
analyzed: 'dres pa las kyang ma yin te de dag phan tshun 'gal bas gcig pa nyid med do //
translated: Nor is it from a mixture, because they are mutually exclusive and so are not the same.

original: de'i phyir dbu ma pas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbu ma pas smras pa /
translated: Therefore, the Madhyamikas say:

original: rnam pas shes pa don dam yod //
analyzed: rnam pas shes pa don dam yod //
translated: Consciousness is ultimately existent.

original: de yang mkhas rnams mi 'dod de //
analyzed: de yang mkhas rnams mi 'dod de //
translated: But the learned do not assert that,

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang // bral bas nam mkha'i padma bzhin //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang // bral bas nam mkha'i padma bzhin //
translated: Because it is devoid of the nature of one and many, like a sky flower.

original: yod min med min yod med min //
analyzed: yod min med min yod med min //
translated: It is not existent, not nonexistent, not existent and nonexistent,

original: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid min pa'ang min //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid min pa'ang min //
translated: Nor is it not the identity of both.üîΩThe Madhyamikas know

original: mtha' bzhi rnam par grol ba yi //üîΩde nyid dbu ma pa yis rig ces so //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi rnam par grol ba yi // de nyid dbu ma pa yis rig ces so //
translated: Thatness, free from the four extremes.

original: gang zhig phyogs nyams de ni ma nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig phyogs nyams de ni ma nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has lost a position gains it.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang zhig snying rje stong nyid gnyis su med pa smra ba ste 'dir gang gi snying rje dmigs pa med cing rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa dus gsum yongs su shes pa'i slad du dus
analyzed: gang zhig snying rje stong nyid gnyis su med pa smra ba ste 'dir gang gi snying rje dmigs pa med cing rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa dus gsum yongs su shes pa'i slad du dus
translated: One who speaks of nondual compassion and emptiness. Here, compassion is without reference point and free from discursive thought, and emptiness is endowed with the most sublime of manifestations. In order to fully understand the three times, one must understand the three times in terms of the three kinds of time.

original: gsum du 'jug ba'o /
analyzed: gsum du 'jug ba'o /
translated: and third, it is entered.

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the Buddhist philosophical tenet systems.

original: da ni snga ma'i las nye bar longs spyod pa dang / da ltar gyi la sogs pa la dgag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni snga ma'i las nye bar longs spyod pa dang / da ltar gyi la sogs pa la dgag pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the refutation of the enjoyment of former karma and of present karma, etc. is stated:

original: skye bo zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang dag gi 'dod pa las sngar byas pa'i las rnams skye bo bo longs spyod cing skye ba 'di la byas pa rnams ni skye ba gzhan la'o zhes so //
analyzed: skye bo zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang dag gi 'dod pa las sngar byas pa'i las rnams skye bo bo longs spyod cing skye ba 'di la byas pa rnams ni skye ba gzhan la'o zhes so //
translated: The assertion of some that the karma previously done is enjoyed by the person and that what is done in this life is in another life.

original: gal te de lta yin na de'i tshe las ni 'jig par mi 'gyur te mi rnams skye dang skye ba gzhan dag gi las kyi 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa'i @27a * //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na de'i tshe las ni 'jig par mi 'gyur te mi rnams skye dang skye ba gzhan dag gi las kyi 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa'i @27a * //
translated: If that is so, then karma would not perish, because people would enjoy the fruit of karma in other lives.

original: phyir ro ; / de ltar na dpag med srid pa dag gis 'khor ba las ni 'byung bar 'gyur pa med cing thar par 'jug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir ro ; / de ltar na dpag med srid pa dag gis 'khor ba las ni 'byung bar 'gyur pa med cing thar par 'jug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there would be no liberation from cyclic existence by immeasurable lives, and there would be no entry into liberation.

original: 'di dag stag gzig rnams kyang nges par 'dod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di dag stag gzig rnams kyang nges par 'dod par 'gyur te /
translated: These assertions of the tƒ´rthikas would certainly be accepted.

original: 'o na kyang gzhan pa'i rigs kyis rab tu dman pa'o zhes pa la kla klo stag gzigs rnams kyi 'dod pa ni mi shi ba dag mtho rigs sam dmyal bar mi'i lus 'dis bde ba'am sdug bsngal longs spyod der hma na'i nges pas las so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na kyang gzhan pa'i rigs kyis rab tu dman pa'o zhes pa la kla klo stag gzigs rnams kyi 'dod pa ni mi shi ba dag mtho rigs sam dmyal bar mi'i lus 'dis bde ba'am sdug bsngal longs spyod der hma na'i nges pas las so zhes pa'o //
translated: But still, it is inferior due to the other type is said. The assertion of the barbarians, the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas, is that when humans die, they enjoy happiness or suffering with this human body in heaven or hell, because of the certainty of karma.

original: de'i phyir gzhan pa'i rigs kyis rab tu dman pa'o zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan pa'i rigs kyis rab tu dman pa'o zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is inferior due to the other type is said. That is the certainty.

original: da ni tshu rol mdzes pa'i 'dod pa su na  dbyung ba gsungs pa gal te 'byung ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gal te sngar brjod pa sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams gcig tu gyur pas aa ru ra dang bu ram dang dh'a ta
analyzed: da ni tshu rol mdzes pa'i 'dod pa su na  dbyung ba gsungs pa gal te 'byung ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gal te sngar brjod pa sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams gcig tu gyur pas aa ru ra dang bu ram dang dh'a ta
translated: Now, to state the assertion of the LokƒÅyatas, he says, if the elements, etc. Here, if the previously mentioned elements such as earth become one, then the taste of myrobalan, sugar, and dhatri

original: k'i yang dag par sbyor ba las chang gi nus pa bzhin du mi rnams kyi dbang po dang bcas pa'i sems 'brug na de'i tshe sa la sogs pa gcig tu gyur pa'i shing rnams la 'byung ba yang dag pad sbyor ba las dbang po dang bcas pa'i semsüîΩsu ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: k'i yang dag par sbyor ba las chang gi nus pa bzhin du mi rnams kyi dbang po dang bcas pa'i sems 'brug na de'i tshe sa la sogs pa gcig tu gyur pa'i shing rnams la 'byung ba yang dag pad sbyor ba las dbang po dang bcas pa'i sems su ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: Just as the potency of beer arises from the correct combination of the ingredients, why wouldn‚Äôt a mind possessing sense faculties arise from the correct combination of earth and so on?

original: ci ste brtan pa 'di rnams la skye bo'i nus pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste brtan pa 'di rnams la skye bo'i nus pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that people do not have the capacity to produce these stable things,

original: de'i tshe 'byung ba yang dag par sbyor ba'i nus pa zhes pa mchog tu rdzun no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'byung ba yang dag par sbyor ba'i nus pa zhes pa mchog tu rdzun no //
translated: then the potency of the correct combination of elements is utterly false.

original: de'i phyir tshu rol mdzes pa'i tshig 'di dag ni mi rnams dag la bde ba'i 'bras bu ster min lam nyams so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshu rol mdzes pa'i tshig 'di dag ni mi rnams dag la bde ba'i 'bras bu ster min lam nyams so zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, these words of CƒÅrvƒÅka are not a path that grants the fruit of happiness to people.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa sun dbyung ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa sun dbyung ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the refutation of LokƒÅyata.

original: da ni zad byed pa'i 'dod pa sun dbyung ba gsungs pa srog ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gal te zad byed pa'i 'grub pa'i mtha' las srog ni rtag pa ste de yang lus kyi tshad do zhes grub po zhe na /
analyzed: da ni zad byed pa'i 'dod pa sun dbyung ba gsungs pa srog ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gal te zad byed pa'i 'grub pa'i mtha' las srog ni rtag pa ste de yang lus kyi tshad do zhes grub po zhe na /
translated: Now, the desire to exhaust it is refuted: If the life force is permanent,

original: de'i tshe lus kyi cha shas lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa bcad par 'gyur na nyams par 'gyur ram ci /
analyzed: de'i tshe lus kyi cha shas lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa bcad par 'gyur na nyams par 'gyur ram ci /
translated: how could it be impaired when a part of the body, such as a hand or foot, is cut off?

original: bcad pa'i lus kyi cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcad pa'i lus kyi cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no part of the body that is cut off.

original: rtag pa dag ni lus kyi mthu las phra mo bzung ba las phra mor 'gyur zhing lus sbom po bzung ba las sbom por yang ni rab tu 'gyur ram ci zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dag ni lus kyi mthu las phra mo bzung ba las phra mor 'gyur zhing lus sbom po bzung ba las sbom por yang ni rab tu 'gyur ram ci zhes pa'o //
translated: Or, if the permanent life force becomes subtle due to the subtlety of the body‚Äôs power and becomes gross due to the grossness of the body‚Äôs power, how could it be permanent?

original: 'dir gang zhig rtag pa de ni rnam par 'gyur pa can ma yin la gang zhig rnam par 'gyur pa can de ni rtag pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gang zhig rtag pa de ni rnam par 'gyur pa can ma yin la gang zhig rnam par 'gyur pa can de ni rtag pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Here, whatever is permanent is not subject to change, and whatever is subject to change is not permanent.

original: smras pa / rdzas dang rnam grangs dag la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes brjod par 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / rdzas dang rnam grangs dag la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes brjod par 'gyur /
translated: Objection: It is said that substance and enumeration are permanent and impermanent.

original: smras pa / ji ltar gser dang rna rgyan dag rtag @27b pa dang mi rtag pa de bzhin du rdzas dang rnam grangs dag la srog gi rdzas rtag pa dang rnam par 'gyur pa mi rtag pa zhes kyang brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar gser dang rna rgyan dag rtag @27b pa dang mi rtag pa de bzhin du rdzas dang rnam grangs dag la srog gi rdzas rtag pa dang rnam par 'gyur pa mi rtag pa zhes kyang brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Response: Just as gold and earrings are permanent and impermanent, so it is said that the substance of life is permanent and the transformation of life is impermanent.

original: de bzhin du grub pa'i mtha' smras pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du grub pa'i mtha' smras pa /
translated: Thus the proponent of tenets says:

original: la lar srog ni stobs ldan zhing //
analyzed: la lar srog ni stobs ldan zhing //
translated: In some places life is powerful,

original: la lar las ni stobs ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: la lar las ni stobs ldan 'gyur //
translated: in some places karma is powerful.

original: de ltar srog dang las dag la //
analyzed: de ltar srog dang las dag la //
translated: Thus life and karma

original: khon ni sngon du bcings pa'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: khon ni sngon du bcings pa'o zhes pa ste /
translated: are bound by the prior afflictions.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don smras pa ni la lar zhes pa thar pa'i yul la srog ni stobs dang ldan te ye shes 'ba' zhig gi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don smras pa ni la lar zhes pa thar pa'i yul la srog ni stobs dang ldan te ye shes 'ba' zhig gi stobs kyis so //
translated: The meaning of this verse is stated: In some places, in the domain of liberation, life is powerful, by the power of wisdom alone.

original: la lar te 'gro ba bzhi'i 'khor ba'i yul la las stobs dang ldan te mi shes pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: la lar te 'gro ba bzhi'i 'khor ba'i yul la las stobs dang ldan te mi shes pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: In some places, in the domain of the four types of transmigration in samsara, karma is powerful, by the power of ignorance.

original: de ltar srog dang las dag la yang khon na ni sngon thog ma med pa'i dus su bcings pa'o zhes grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar srog dang las dag la yang khon na ni sngon thog ma med pa'i dus su bcings pa'o zhes grub bo //
translated: Thus, if life and action are bound, then it is established that they are bound from beginningless time.

original: de ltar rdzas skye ba dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid ni rang gi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir te rnam pa gzhan du grub pa med do zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rdzas skye ba dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid ni rang gi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir te rnam pa gzhan du grub pa med do zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o zhe na /
translated: Thus, the substance that is the nature of arising and destruction is endowed with its own qualities, and it is not established in any other way. This is the conclusion.

original: smras pa / rdzas dang rnam grangs dag gcig nyid dam gzhan nyid /
analyzed: smras pa / rdzas dang rnam grangs dag gcig nyid dam gzhan nyid /
translated: We say: Are substance and enumeration the same or different?

original: 'dir gal te gcig nyid yin na de'i tshe rdzas dang rnam grangs dag la dbye ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir gal te gcig nyid yin na de'i tshe rdzas dang rnam grangs dag la dbye ba med do //
translated: Here, if they are the same, then there is no distinction between substance and enumeration.

original: ci ste gzhan nyid yin na de'i tshe rdzas med par rnam grangs su 'gyur te skud pa med pa'i snam bcu mthong bar 'gyur pa de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan nyid yin na de'i tshe rdzas med par rnam grangs su 'gyur te skud pa med pa'i snam bcu mthong bar 'gyur pa de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But if they are different, then enumeration would be without substance, and one would see a cloth without yarn. But that is not so.

original: de bzhin du rigs dang / gsal bdag la yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa yang dag par sbyor ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs dang / gsal bdag la yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa yang dag par sbyor ba'i skyon no //
translated: Similarly, there is the error of correctly applying permanence and impermanence to the self of class and manifestation.

original: 'dir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gcig pa nyid ni med de pha tshun 'gal ba'i phyir te mi 'dra ba dang 'dra ba dag bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gcig pa nyid ni med de pha tshun 'gal ba'i phyir te mi 'dra ba dang 'dra ba dag bzhin no //
translated: Here, the permanent and the impermanent are not the same, because they are mutually contradictory, like the dissimilar and the similar.üîΩIn the same way, who is liberated from the actions of sa·πÉsƒÅra, abides in the world, and goes to the abodes of happiness.

original: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i las las grol ba gang zhig 'jig rten steng na gnas pa bde ba dag gi gnas su 'gro zhes pa ste zad byed pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las srid pa gsum ni gcig nyid de gnyis su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i las las grol ba gang zhig 'jig rten steng na gnas pa bde ba dag gi gnas su 'gro zhes pa ste zad byed pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las srid pa gsum ni gcig nyid de gnyis su med do //
translated: In the philosophy of the followers of the annihilationist doctrines, the three existences are one, not two.

original: des na srid pa gsum po 'di ni thog ma dang tha ma med cing skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba thams cad rdo rje'i rang bzhin te nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na srid pa gsum po 'di ni thog ma dang tha ma med cing skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba thams cad rdo rje'i rang bzhin te nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, these three existences are without beginning or end, free from arising and perishing, and all have the nature of a vajra, never to be destroyed.

original: gal te srid pa 'di 'jig par 'gyur na de'i tshe gzhan srid pa gsum med pa'i phyir srog chags thams cad gang du gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te srid pa 'di 'jig par 'gyur na de'i tshe gzhan srid pa gsum med pa'i phyir srog chags thams cad gang du gnas par 'gyur /
translated: If this existence were to be destroyed, then since another three existences would not exist, where would all living beings abide?

original: rgyu des na 'di ni rtag pa ste srog kyang rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na 'di ni rtag pa ste srog kyang rtag pa'o //
translated: For that reason, this is permanent, and life is also permanent.

original: 'khor ba las grol bar gyur na thar pa dpag tshad 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa bde ba'i gnas gang zag dang @28a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba las grol bar gyur na thar pa dpag tshad 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa bde ba'i gnas gang zag dang @28a * //
translated: If one is liberated from samsara, then liberation is established as a place of pleasure, 45,000 yojanas in size, where one goes without a person.

original: bral bar 'gro'o zhes pa grub po zhe na /
analyzed: bral bar 'gro'o zhes pa grub po zhe na /
translated: In response to that, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: smras pa / 'dir 'jig rten gsum phra rab dag gis bskyed pa yin gyi phra rab med par ma yin la yang yig las thar pa yang ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir 'jig rten gsum phra rab dag gis bskyed pa yin gyi phra rab med par ma yin la yang yig las thar pa yang ngo //
translated: Here the three worlds are generated from subtle particles, but not without subtle particles. Also, liberation is like that.

original: de lta na ji ltar rtag par 'gyur te gang zhig phra rab dag gis bkod pa ni rtag tu zhes pa dus kun du rtag pa ste brtan par yang mi 'gyur te sdud pa'i dus kyi dbang gis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ji ltar rtag par 'gyur te gang zhig phra rab dag gis bkod pa ni rtag tu zhes pa dus kun du rtag pa ste brtan par yang mi 'gyur te sdud pa'i dus kyi dbang gis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, how could it be permanent? That which is arranged by subtle particles is not permanent, that is, it is not stable, because it is destroyed by the power of the time of dissolution.

original: de 'jig pa las grub pa rnams kyang 'jig pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa grub pa ni rigs pa las te gzhan pa ci /
analyzed: de 'jig pa las grub pa rnams kyang 'jig pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa grub pa ni rigs pa las te gzhan pa ci /
translated: Also, from the destruction of that, the elements do not arise. That is established by reasoning. What else is there?

original: 'dir sngar brjod pa'i srog gi lus kyi cha shas drug po rnams kyi nang nas nags kyi bdag po rnams kyi srog ste /
analyzed: 'dir sngar brjod pa'i srog gi lus kyi cha shas drug po rnams kyi nang nas nags kyi bdag po rnams kyi srog ste /
translated: Here, from among the six parts of the body of life mentioned previously, the life of the lords of the forest is the life of the body of the elements.

original: ci nags kyi bdag po so so lus gcig gi bde ba'am sdug bsngal las kyi dbang gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci nags kyi bdag po so so lus gcig gi bde ba'am sdug bsngal las kyi dbang gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Is the life force of the forest animals experienced by the power of karma of each individual body?

original: ci ste du mas yin /
analyzed: ci ste du mas yin /
translated: Or is it by many?

original: smras pa / srog gcig gis gang zag gcig 'dzin te /
analyzed: smras pa / srog gcig gis gang zag gcig 'dzin te /
translated: He said: One life force holds one person.

original: gang gi mthus nags kyi bdag po rnams dang 'brul sogs pa rnams la srog ces pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: gang gi mthus nags kyi bdag po rnams dang 'brul sogs pa rnams la srog ces pa'i ming ngo //
translated: By whose power are the forest animals and so on called life force?

original: gal te srog med na de'i tshe rkang 'thung zhes pa ji ltar grub srog med pa'i shing skam la sogs pa rnams ni chu 'thungs nas me tog la sogs pa dus su byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes grub po zhes na /
