analyzed: gal te srog med na de'i tshe rkang 'thung zhes pa ji ltar grub srog med pa'i shing skam la sogs pa rnams ni chu 'thungs nas me tog la sogs pa dus su byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes grub po zhes na /
translated: If there is no life force, then how could a tree be established as a life force? Dry trees and so on that lack life force do not drink water and do not produce flowers and so on in a timely way.

original: smras pa / 'dri gal te gang zag so so la srog so sor re re yod na de'i tshe bur shing gi dbyig pa dum bu dum bur byas pa las dum bu du mar 'gyur te de dag gi nang nas dum bu gcig ni rtag tu srog dang bcas pa ste
analyzed: smras pa / 'dri gal te gang zag so so la srog so sor re re yod na de'i tshe bur shing gi dbyig pa dum bu dum bur byas pa las dum bu du mar 'gyur te de dag gi nang nas dum bu gcig ni rtag tu srog dang bcas pa ste
translated: If for each person there is a separate life force, then when a sugarcane stalk is cut into many pieces, it would become many life forces. Among them, one piece would always have a life force.

original: las kyi dbang gis bkum nas rab tu zhugs pas so //
analyzed: las kyi dbang gis bkum nas rab tu zhugs pas so //
translated: Because of the power of karma, they are killed and fall to the ground.

original: 'ga' zhig ni nges yongs su btang ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni nges yongs su btang ba'o //
translated: Some are completely abandoned.

original: rigs pas rnams par dpyad na de ltar yang mi 'thad de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pas rnams par dpyad na de ltar yang mi 'thad de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: When analyzed with reasoning, that is also untenable. Why is it so?

original: gang gi phyir slar yang de dag sa la btsugs nas dum bu so so la myu gu la sogs pa mthong ba de'i phyir nags kyi bdag po rnams kyi myu gu la sogs pa rnams kyi nus pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin no zhes grub po zhes pa
analyzed: gang gi phyir slar yang de dag sa la btsugs nas dum bu so so la myu gu la sogs pa mthong ba de'i phyir nags kyi bdag po rnams kyi myu gu la sogs pa rnams kyi nus pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin no zhes grub po zhes pa
translated: Because, again, when they are planted in the ground, sprouts and so on are seen on each individual piece. Therefore it is established that the power of sprouts and so on of the lords of the forest is the nature of things.

original: ni zad byed pa sun dbyung ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: ni zad byed pa sun dbyung ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment that refutes the annihilationists.

original: rgya che du mar tshad ma'i bstan bcos du ma dang dbu ma pas mu stegs pa rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' sun dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgya che du mar tshad ma'i bstan bcos du ma dang dbu ma pas mu stegs pa rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' sun dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: In many extensive ways, the treatises on pramana and the Madhyamikas refute the tenets of the tirthikas.

original: gang zhig kun rdzob pa ma don dam pa sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang mtshungs pa de ni sun dbyung bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni dus kyi 'khor lo dang po'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa ye shes slad du dus kyi 'khor los sa la @28b bstan par rab tu gsal mdzad pa //
analyzed: gang zhig kun rdzob pa ma don dam pa sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang mtshungs pa de ni sun dbyung bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni dus kyi 'khor lo dang po'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o // zhes pa la sogs pa ye shes slad du dus kyi 'khor los sa la @28b bstan par rab tu gsal mdzad pa //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the Bhagavat Buddha of the first wheel of Dharma.

original: 'jam dang sra dang gzhan pa'i bag chags stobs kyis skyes bu rnams kyi sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste //
analyzed: 'jam dang sra dang gzhan pa'i bag chags stobs kyis skyes bu rnams kyi sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste //
translated: Thus, in order to attain gnosis, the Kalachakra Tantra clearly teaches that the mind follows the force of habitual tendencies of smoothness, hardness, and so on.

original: sems ni nges par dngos po'i tshon gyis nye bar gzhag pa dag las shel bzhin tshon ldan nyid 'gyur pa //
analyzed: sems ni nges par dngos po'i tshon gyis nye bar gzhag pa dag las shel bzhin tshon ldan nyid 'gyur pa //
translated: The mind is definitely colored by the colors of things, like a crystal that becomes colored by the colors of the things placed next to it.

original: gang yin de phyir rang gzhan rigs su gyur pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang rnal 'byor ba yis sun mi dbyung //
analyzed: gang yin de phyir rang gzhan rigs su gyur pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang rnal 'byor ba yis sun mi dbyung //
translated: Therefore, the yogi should not refute any phenomenon that is of the same class as the mind.

original: chos ni sems can phan pa yul dang rnam par bral ba dag ste chos min dag kyang gnod pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni sems can phan pa yul dang rnam par bral ba dag ste chos min dag kyang gnod pa'o //
translated: Dharma is that which benefits sentient beings, and non-Dharma is that which harms them.

original: 'tshe ba'i rig byed tshad ma can ni bde ba'i 'bras bu mi ster dus kun du ni sdug bsngal ster //
analyzed: 'tshe ba'i rig byed tshad ma can ni bde ba'i 'bras bu mi ster dus kun du ni sdug bsngal ster //
translated: The violence of the Vedas, which is not productive of happiness, is always productive of misery.

original: dam pa'i byams ldan rmongs pa'i tshig las mchog gi bde ba byed cing sems can de la rjes su chags //
analyzed: dam pa'i byams ldan rmongs pa'i tshig las mchog gi bde ba byed cing sems can de la rjes su chags //
translated: The love of the good, which is not productive of happiness, is always productive of happiness.

original: de phyir sems can don ni gcig pu dag dang mi bdag yid kyis rang bzhin med pa bsgom par bgyis //üîΩlha mi'i bla ma nga ni mtho ris 'jig rten dag tu dbang po sa steng du ni 'khor los sgyur //
analyzed: de phyir sems can don ni gcig pu dag dang mi bdag yid kyis rang bzhin med pa bsgom par bgyis // lha mi'i bla ma nga ni mtho ris 'jig rten dag tu dbang po sa steng du ni 'khor los sgyur //
translated: Therefore, the king should cultivate the thought of the unreality of the self, which is the only means of benefiting all creatures.üîΩI am the lord of gods in heaven, of men on earth, and of the Nagas in the nether world.

original: sa 'og dag gu klu yi rgyal po gdengs can rigs kyis btud dang kun du 'gro dang mchog nga ste //
analyzed: sa 'og dag gu klu yi rgyal po gdengs can rigs kyis btud dang kun du 'gro dang mchog nga ste //
translated: I am the king of kings, the lord of all, the highest of the high.

original: ye shes sangs rgyas thub dbang 'gyur med mchog dang khyab bdag rnal 'byor rnams kyi rdo rje rnal 'byor dang // rigs byed aom gyi yi ge gtsang ma dag ste rgyal po dngos po kun gyis bdag la skyabs su song zhes pa ni skyabs kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes sangs rgyas thub dbang 'gyur med mchog dang khyab bdag rnal 'byor rnams kyi rdo rje rnal 'byor dang // rigs byed aom gyi yi ge gtsang ma dag ste rgyal po dngos po kun gyis bdag la skyabs su song zhes pa ni skyabs kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The knowledge, the Buddha, the Lord of Sages, the supreme unchanging, the all-pervading lord, the vajrayoga of the yogis, the pure syllable Om of the yoginis, the king, the refuge for me in all things.

original: da ni nyi ma'i shing rtas phyag byas pa //
analyzed: da ni nyi ma'i shing rtas phyag byas pa //
translated: Now, having bowed to the sun-chariot,

original: khyod ni ma dang khyod ni pha ste khyod ni 'gro ba'i bla ma khyod ni gnyen dang grogs bzang yang //
analyzed: khyod ni ma dang khyod ni pha ste khyod ni 'gro ba'i bla ma khyod ni gnyen dang grogs bzang yang //
translated: You are the mother, you are the father, you are the guru of beings, you are the relative, the good friend,

original: khyod ni mgon po khyod ni byed po phan dang sdig 'phrog khyod ni go 'phang phan sum tshogs pa yang //
analyzed: khyod ni mgon po khyod ni byed po phan dang sdig 'phrog khyod ni go 'phang phan sum tshogs pa yang //
translated: You are the protector, you are the creator, you take away benefit and harm, you are the excellent state of benefit and prosperity.

original: khyod ni 'ba' zhig gnas dang khyod ni yon tan mchog gi gnas te skyon rnams bcom pa khyod nyid do //
analyzed: khyod ni 'ba' zhig gnas dang khyod ni yon tan mchog gi gnas te skyon rnams bcom pa khyod nyid do //
translated: You alone are the abode, you are the abode of supreme qualities, you are the conqueror of faults.

original: khyod ni dman pa rnams kyi mgon dang yid bzhin nor bu rgyal ba'i dbang po khyod la bdag skyabs mchi //
analyzed: khyod ni dman pa rnams kyi mgon dang yid bzhin nor bu rgyal ba'i dbang po khyod la bdag skyabs mchi //
translated: You are the protector of the lowly, the wish-fulfilling jewel, the lord of the victorious ones, to you I go for refuge.

original: zhes te nyi ma'i shing rtas bla ma'i phyag gis bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal la bstod nas zhabs gnyis po spyi por byas te slar yang rang gi stan la 'khod do //
analyzed: zhes te nyi ma'i shing rtas bla ma'i phyag gis bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal la bstod nas zhabs gnyis po spyi por byas te slar yang rang gi stan la 'khod do //
translated: Thus, S≈´ryaratha, having praised Bhagavat Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ with the homage of his guru, placing his two feet on the crown of his head, again took his seat.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las rang dang gzhan gyi lta ba rigs pas rnams par dpyad pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste bdun pa'o /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las rang dang gzhan gyi lta ba rigs pas rnams par dpyad pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste bdun pa'o /
translated: This concludes the seventh chapter in the Stainless Light commentary on the KƒÅlacakra Tantra, the root of the tantras of Unexcelled Yoga, called ‚ÄúThe Great Summary of the Analysis of Our and Others‚Äô Views with Reasoning.‚Äù

original: // / nang gi le'u'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so //
analyzed: // / nang gi le'u'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so //
translated: The commentary on the Inner chapter is complete.

original: @29a * // dpal dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩbsod nams ye shes kyis sprul bcom ldan 'das ni gdul dka'i sems can rnams kyis rtag tu ni //
analyzed: @29a * // dpal dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal lo // bsod nams ye shes kyis sprul bcom ldan 'das ni gdul dka'i sems can rnams kyis rtag tu ni //
translated: Homage to glorious KƒÅlacakra.üîΩThe Bhagavat, who is an emanation of merit and wisdom, is always seen

original: 'jigs byed 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs dang skye bo mkhas pa rnams kyis dregs dang bral bar mthong //
analyzed: 'jigs byed 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs dang skye bo mkhas pa rnams kyis dregs dang bral bar mthong //
translated: by difficult-to-tame sentient beings in a terrifying, frightening form, and by the wise as free of arrogance.

original: gang zhig kho na'i gsung ni sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i sems kyi dbang gis kun gyi sgra //
analyzed: gang zhig kho na'i gsung ni sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i sems kyi dbang gis kun gyi sgra //
translated: The speech of the one who is the sole lord of the minds of sentient beings,

original: gzhan gyi rna bar son pas dam pa'i lam ni yang dag ston par mdzad pa de la 'dud //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rna bar son pas dam pa'i lam ni yang dag ston par mdzad pa de la 'dud //
translated: is heard by others, and thus reveals the path of the holy ones.

original: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //
translated: The body endowed with the supreme of all aspects,

original: sku ni mos pa sna tshogs las //
analyzed: sku ni mos pa sna tshogs las //
translated: arises from various aspirations,

original: rang rang bsam pas sems can gyis //
analyzed: rang rang bsam pas sems can gyis //
translated: and is seen by sentient beings according to their individual thoughts.

original: mthong ba sprul pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mthong ba sprul pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the emanation body.

original: gang zhig sems can kun gyi sgras //
analyzed: gang zhig sems can kun gyi sgras //
translated: The one who manifests himself through the sounds of all sentient beings,

original: rdzu 'phrul bdag nyid rab gsal byed //üîΩsems can bsam pa'i dbang gis 'di //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul bdag nyid rab gsal byed // sems can bsam pa'i dbang gis 'di //
translated: and is the nature of miracles,üîΩis the characteristic of the enjoyment body,

original: longs spyod rdzogs sku'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs sku'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: which arises from the power of the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: mi rtag pa min rtag pa'ang min //
analyzed: mi rtag pa min rtag pa'ang min //
translated: Not impermanent, not permanent,

original: gcig min du ma'i mtshan nyid min //
analyzed: gcig min du ma'i mtshan nyid min //
translated: not one, not of the nature of many,

original: dngos min dngos po med pa'ang min //
analyzed: dngos min dngos po med pa'ang min //
translated: not a thing, not a non-thing,

original: 'di ni rten bral chos sku'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rten bral chos sku'o //
translated: this is the dharmakƒÅya free from support.

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med cing //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med cing //
translated: Emptiness and compassion are inseparable,

original: chags dang chags bral rnam par spangs //
analyzed: chags dang chags bral rnam par spangs //
translated: and attachment and non-attachment are completely abandoned.

original: shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min //
analyzed: shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min //
translated: Neither wisdom nor method.

original: 'di ni ngo bo nyid sku gzhan //
analyzed: 'di ni ngo bo nyid sku gzhan //
translated: This is the svabhƒÅvikakƒÅya.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo zhes grags pa //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo zhes grags pa //
translated: The one renowned as KƒÅlacakra,

original: sku bzhi'i bdag nyid zhi ba la //
analyzed: sku bzhi'i bdag nyid zhi ba la //
translated: the peaceful one who is the nature of the four kƒÅyas,

original: dngos po kun gyis phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyis phyag 'tshal te //
translated: is bowed to by all things.

original: sgrub thabs le'u'i rgya cher 'grel //
analyzed: sgrub thabs le'u'i rgya cher 'grel //
translated: The commentary on the chapter on the sƒÅdhana

original: 'jam pa'i dpal gyis bskul gyur pas //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i dpal gyis bskul gyur pas //
translated: was requested by Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.

original: 'jig rten dbang po chu skyes 'dzin //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang po chu skyes 'dzin //
translated: I, Loke≈õvara, the lotus holder,

original: sprul pa'i skur ni gyur pa bdag / pad ma dkar pos bri bar bya //üîΩ'dir dpal ldan ka l'a pa'i grong gi lho //
analyzed: sprul pa'i skur ni gyur pa bdag / pad ma dkar pos bri bar bya // 'dir dpal ldan ka l'a pa'i grong gi lho //
translated: will write it with a white lotus.üîΩHere, at the end of the eastern door of the palace of the ma·πá·∏çala of the glorious KƒÅlacakra in the pleasure grove of MƒÅlava to the south of the glorious city of KalƒÅpa, the blessed Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, the emanation body of the lord of men, Ya≈õas,

original: ma la ya'i skyed mos tshal gyi dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i shar sgo'i mthar rin po che'i sgo khyams na seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku mi'i dbang po grags pa la nyi ma'i shing rtas
analyzed: ma la ya'i skyed mos tshal gyi dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i shar sgo'i mthar rin po che'i sgo khyams na seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku mi'i dbang po grags pa la nyi ma'i shing rtas
translated: sat on a lion throne in a jeweled portico, and was requested by S≈´ryaratha to compose a commentary on the chapter on the sƒÅdhana of the glorious KƒÅlacakra.

original: gsol ba btab par gyur pas mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las sgrub thabs kyi le'ur zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gyi gsung tshigs su bcad pa dang pos 'khor chen po la rab tu bstan par gyur @29b pa rgyal bskyed mdzad bdag gis dbang bskur bdun po rnams dang bum pa dang ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur dang //
analyzed: gsol ba btab par gyur pas mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las sgrub thabs kyi le'ur zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gyi gsung tshigs su bcad pa dang pos 'khor chen po la rab tu bstan par gyur @29b pa rgyal bskyed mdzad bdag gis dbang bskur bdun po rnams dang bum pa dang ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur dang //
translated: The seven empowerments, the vase and secret empowerments,

original: shes rab ye shes dbang bskur srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa rnal 'byor rnams kyi bgrod bya ba zhi pa thob //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes dbang bskur srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa rnal 'byor rnams kyi bgrod bya ba zhi pa thob //
translated: the wisdom-knowledge empowerment, the conqueror's destruction of the fears of existence, the path to be traversed by yogis, and the attainment of peace,

original: slar yang rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa sna tshogs gtso bo'i sgrub thabs yang dag par ni bdag gzhu'o //
analyzed: slar yang rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa sna tshogs gtso bo'i sgrub thabs yang dag par ni bdag gzhu'o //
translated: and again, the means of accomplishment of the supreme conqueror and the various chief ones, I shall compose.

original: zla ba bzang po'i tshig gsan nas ni rgyal ba'i bdag pos rdo rje can dag gi yang sgrub thabs gsungs zhes pa ste 'dir tshig su bcad pa'i rkang pa gsum gyis sgrub thabs kyi le 'u bstan pa'i slad du zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i tshig gsan nas ni rgyal ba'i bdag pos rdo rje can dag gi yang sgrub thabs gsungs zhes pa ste 'dir tshig su bcad pa'i rkang pa gsum gyis sgrub thabs kyi le 'u bstan pa'i slad du zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: Having heard the words of Sucandra, the Lord of the Victorious Ones, the Blessed One ≈öƒÅkyamuni, having entered the meditative absorption of KƒÅlacakra, spoke the means of accomplishment of the Vajra Holder, the Blessed One ≈örƒ´ KƒÅlacakra. The word also indicates that he spoke the means of accomplishment of the other deities as well.

original: de nas rkang pa bzhi pa nas brtsams te ji srid le'u yongs su rdzogs pa de srid ni bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gyi gsung ngo //
analyzed: de nas rkang pa bzhi pa nas brtsams te ji srid le'u yongs su rdzogs pa de srid ni bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gyi gsung ngo //
translated: Then, from the fourth verse up to the end of the chapter, that is the Blessed One's reply.

original: da ni zla ba bzang po'i tshig gsan nas ni rgyal ba'i bdag go bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa dus kyi 'khor lo'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas rdo rje can bcom ldan 'das dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i sgrub thabs gsungs te yang yig gis mi

translated: Now, having heard the words of Sucandra, the Lord of the Victorious Ones, the Blessed One ≈öƒÅkyamuni, having entered the meditative absorption of KƒÅlacakra, spoke the means of accomplishment of the Vajra Holder, the Blessed One ≈örƒ´ KƒÅlacakra. The word also indicates that he spoke the means of accomplishment of the other deities as well.

original: bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa lha mo rnams dang phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa yul gyi lha mo rnams dang

translated: The shaking and so forth of the Tathagatas, the goddesses such as Vajradhatvi≈õvarƒ´, the Bodhisattvas such as VajrapƒÅ·πái, the goddesses of the objects such as ≈öabdavajrƒÅ,

translated: the great wrathful kings such as U·π£·πáƒ´·π£a, the wrathful goddesses such as K·πõ·π£·πáapƒ´·∏çƒÅ, the mƒÅt·πõkƒÅs such as Caurƒ´, the gods such as Vi·π£·πáu, the nƒÅga kings such as Tak·π£aka,

original: rnams dang khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rab gtum ma rnams dang gzhan rnams kyi yang so so'i sgrub thabs rgyal ba'i bdag pos gsungs te gzugs kyi sgom pas 'og min gyi srid pa'i mthar thug pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i ched du'o zhes pa ni
analyzed: rnams dang khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rab gtum ma rnams dang gzhan rnams kyi yang so so'i sgrub thabs rgyal ba'i bdag pos gsungs te gzugs kyi sgom pas 'og min gyi srid pa'i mthar thug pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i ched du'o zhes pa ni
translated: the very wrathful ones such as ≈övƒÅnavaktrƒÅ, and others are taught in the respective sƒÅdhanas of the Victorious One. The purpose of the meditation on their forms is to accomplish mundane feats up to the peak of existence in Akani·π£·π≠ha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the Bhagavat.üîΩNow, the Bhagavat's form is taught in brief by the purity of the times, beginning with the line, The body of the moon.

original: da ni dus rnams par dag pas bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs brtags pa mdor bstan pa gsungs pa zla ba'i sku zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dus rnams par dag pas bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs brtags pa mdor bstan pa gsungs pa zla ba'i sku zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the Bhagavat has said in the Adibuddha:

original: nyin mo nyi ma rdul rdo rje //
analyzed: nyin mo nyi ma rdul rdo rje //
translated: The sun is the day, the dust-vajra,

original: bsam pa'i dbye @30a * //
analyzed: bsam pa'i dbye @30a * //
translated: the division of thought.

original: bas mtshan mo zla //
analyzed: bas mtshan mo zla //
translated: The moon is the night,

original: khu ba padma de dag gcig //
analyzed: khu ba padma de dag gcig //
translated: the semen, the lotus, the one.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo bde chen po //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo bde chen po //
translated: The wheel of time is the great bliss.

original: zhes pa dang / de bzhin du rgyud gzhan dang gzhan dag las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis spyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / de bzhin du rgyud gzhan dang gzhan dag las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis spyir gsungs pa /
translated: And similarly, the Bhagavat has said in other tantras in general:

original: nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can //
analyzed: nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can //
translated: The day is the Bhagavat, the vajra-holder,

original: mtshan mo shes rab rab tu grags //
analyzed: mtshan mo shes rab rab tu grags //
translated: the night is known as wisdom.üîΩJust as the sun is the hot one,

original: ji ltar nyi ma drag po dang // de bzhin zla ba au mar 'dod ces pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma drag po dang // de bzhin zla ba au mar 'dod ces pa'o //
translated: so the moon is desired as the female.

original: de ltar nyi ma dang zla ba dang nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dbye bas nyin mtshan ni dus zhes gsungs te de'i 'khor lo ni dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi bdag nyid dang rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid khyim
analyzed: de ltar nyi ma dang zla ba dang nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dbye bas nyin mtshan ni dus zhes gsungs te de'i 'khor lo ni dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi bdag nyid dang rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid khyim
translated: Thus, day and night are called time, by the division of day and night, month and year.

original: gyi 'khor lo ste sems can thams cad kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyur gyur pa 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis so //
analyzed: gyi 'khor lo ste sems can thams cad kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyur gyur pa 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis so //
translated: Its wheel is the wheel of the zodiac, which is the cause of the birth and destruction of all sentient beings, in terms of mundane surface-level reality.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /üîΩdus kyis 'byung po rnams spro zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa / dus kyis 'byung po rnams spro zhing //
translated: And so it is said:üîΩTime expands all beings,

original: dus kyis rtag tu sdud par byed //
analyzed: dus kyis rtag tu sdud par byed //
translated: and time always contracts them.

original: dus ni bcom ldan rdo rje can //
analyzed: dus ni bcom ldan rdo rje can //
translated: Time is the Blessed One, the Vajra,

original: nyin mtshan rang bzhin can yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan rang bzhin can yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: having the nature of day and night.

original: de ltar dus kyi 'khor lo 'di'i sgrub thabs ni skye ba dang 'jig pa rnam par nyams pa'i don du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dus kyi 'khor lo 'di'i sgrub thabs ni skye ba dang 'jig pa rnam par nyams pa'i don du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the means of achieving this Wheel of Time is to be performed by yogins and yoginis in the sequence that will be explained, for the sake of overcoming birth and destruction.

original: gzugs brtags pa'i nges pa ni zla ba'i sku zhes pa las sogs pa ste dus sbyor bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi nyin mtshan ni sku gcig go //
analyzed: gzugs brtags pa'i nges pa ni zla ba'i sku zhes pa las sogs pa ste dus sbyor bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi nyin mtshan ni sku gcig go //
translated: The certainty of the imagined form is from the statement ‚Äúthe body of the moon,‚Äù and so on. The body is the day and night that have the nature of the twelve signs.

original: de'i dus sbyor drug drug gi bdag nyid g-yon dang g-yas pa'i zhabs te zung gi zhabs zhes so //
analyzed: de'i dus sbyor drug drug gi bdag nyid g-yon dang g-yas pa'i zhabs te zung gi zhabs zhes so //
translated: The left and right feet have the nature of the six signs each, and so they are the two feet.

original: dus sbyor bzhi bzhi'i bdag nyid ni g-yon dang g-yas dang dbus kyi mgrin pa ste me yi mgrin pa zhes pa mgrin pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dus sbyor bzhi bzhi'i bdag nyid ni g-yon dang g-yas dang dbus kyi mgrin pa ste me yi mgrin pa zhes pa mgrin pa gsum mo //
translated: The three necks are the three fire necks, the left, right, and middle necks that have the nature of the four signs each.

original: de bzhin du dus sbyor gsum gsum gyi bdag nyid ni shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi zhal bzhi ste chu gter zhes pa zhal bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus sbyor gsum gsum gyi bdag nyid ni shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi zhal bzhi ste chu gter zhes pa zhal bzhi'o //
translated: Similarly, the four faces are the four oceans, the east, south, west, and north faces that have the nature of the three signs each.

original: sna tshogs mdog ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs mdog ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The multicolored is explained below.

original: de bzhin du dus sbyor gnyis gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni g-yon dang g-yas su yang shar dang nub dang dbus kyi phrag pa ste phrag pa drug ces so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus sbyor gnyis gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni g-yon dang g-yas su yang shar dang nub dang dbus kyi phrag pa ste phrag pa drug ces so //
translated: Similarly, the six shoulders are the two left and right shoulders that have the nature of the two signs each.

original: de bzhin du zla ba so so'i bdag nyid ni dpung pa rnams te dpung pa de rnams kyis nyi ma'i dpung ba zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba so so'i bdag nyid ni dpung pa rnams te dpung pa de rnams kyis nyi ma'i dpung ba zhes so //
translated: Likewise, the shoulders are the individual natures of the months, and with those shoulders, the shoulders of the sun.

original: dus sbyor phyed pa so sor phyogs kyi dbye bas phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste rgyal ba'i phyag gi padma zhes so //
analyzed: dus sbyor phyed pa so sor phyogs kyi dbye bas phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste rgyal ba'i phyag gi padma zhes so //
translated: The twenty-four hands are the divisions of the directions of the individual half-periods, and the lotuses of the hands of the Victor.

original: de bzhin du dbugs drug cu drug cu'i bdag @30b nyid dang nyin zhag so so'i dbye bas sor mo'i tshigs sum brgya drug cu ste phyag re re la sor mo lnga lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbugs drug cu drug cu'i bdag @30b nyid dang nyin zhag so so'i dbye bas sor mo'i tshigs sum brgya drug cu ste phyag re re la sor mo lnga lnga'o //
translated: Likewise, the three hundred and sixty joints are the individual divisions of the days, which have the nature of sixty-six breaths. There are five fingers for each hand.

original: tshigs gsum gyi dbye bas tshigs bcva lnga ste phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams la sum brgya drug cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshigs gsum gyi dbye bas tshigs bcva lnga ste phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams la sum brgya drug cur 'gyur ro //
translated: The fifteen joints are the divisions of the three joints. There are three hundred and sixty for the twenty-four hands.

original: de ltar stong pa drug dang me yi tshigs zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa drug dang me yi tshigs zhes so //
translated: Thus, the six zeros and the joints of fire.

original: zhabs dag gis ni zla ba nyi ma bsreg za'i dkyil 'khor rnams la bdud dang drag po zhes pa phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu ni bdud do //
analyzed: zhabs dag gis ni zla ba nyi ma bsreg za'i dkyil 'khor rnams la bdud dang drag po zhes pa phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu ni bdud do //
translated: With the feet, the moon, sun, and the circle of the fire are the demons and Rudra. The aggregates, afflictions, lord of death, and son of god are the demons.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang nga rgyal gyi bdag nyid ni drag po ste skrag bzhin du dus kyi 'khor lo gang gis rol pas mnan cing srid med srid pa mnyam pa ni sgrib pa med pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba gcig
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang nga rgyal gyi bdag nyid ni drag po ste skrag bzhin du dus kyi 'khor lo gang gis rol pas mnan cing srid med srid pa mnyam pa ni sgrib pa med pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba gcig
translated: The nature of desire, anger, ignorance, and pride is Rudra, who is pressed down by the mandala of the Kalachakra, who is terrified, and who is the equality of existence and nonexistence, since nirvana and samsara are one due to the absence of obscurations.üîΩ

analyzed: tu 'dres par gyur pa ste de ltar dus kyi 'khor lo gcig pu de ni bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //üîΩda ni 'di bsgrub pa'i don du gnas rnams gsungs pa /üîΩskyed mos tshal zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir 'jig rten pa'i las bsgrub pa'i rjes su mthun pas gnas su 'gyur ro //üîΩskyed mos tshal du dbang dang dgug pa'i don du sngags pas bsgrub par bya'o //üîΩri bor rengs pa dang rmongs pa dang phur bus gdab pa'i don du'o //

original: rgyal ba mchog gi gnas te byin brlabs dang bcas pa'i mchod rten chen por dngos grub chen po brgyad kyi don du'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba mchog gi gnas te byin brlabs dang bcas pa'i mchod rten chen por dngos grub chen po brgyad kyi don du'o //
translated: In the abode of the Victorious One, in the great st≈´pa endowed with blessings, for the sake of the eight great accomplishments.

original: lha yi gnas stong par bskrad pa dang dbye ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: lha yi gnas stong par bskrad pa dang dbye ba'i don du'o //
translated: In the empty abode of the gods, for the sake of expulsion and separation.

original: dang gi yi ges rgya mtsho chen po'i ngogs su yang ngo //
analyzed: dang gi yi ges rgya mtsho chen po'i ngogs su yang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù indicates also on the shore of the great ocean.

original: grub pa'i gnas su las kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub kyi don du'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i gnas su las kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub kyi don du'o //
translated: In the abode of accomplishment, for the sake of the accomplishment of the karma consort.

original: dru khrod du gsad pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dru khrod du gsad pa'i don du'o //
translated: In the charnel ground, for the sake of killing.

original: mtsho dang bzang po'i gnas su zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i dpon du'o //
analyzed: mtsho dang bzang po'i gnas su zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i dpon du'o //
translated: In the lake and the good abode, for the sake of pacifying and enriching.

original: sbas pa'i sa bzhes pa phug gi gnas sum sa'i khang par 'jig rten gsum gyi rgyal srid bsgrub pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sbas pa'i sa bzhes pa phug gi gnas sum sa'i khang par 'jig rten gsum gyi rgyal srid bsgrub pa'i don du'o //
translated: In the hidden place, in the cave abode, in the earth house, for the sake of accomplishing the kingdom of the three worlds.

original: de ltar las kyi rjes su mthun pas yul gang du sems ni rab tu tshim par 'gyur pa der ni bsgrub par bya'o mi yi bdag po kye zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar las kyi rjes su mthun pas yul gang du sems ni rab tu tshim par 'gyur pa der ni bsgrub par bya'o mi yi bdag po kye zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, in whatever place the mind is satisfied, in that place the practice should be done, O Lord of Men.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: gang na sa skyong chos ldan zhing //
analyzed: gang na sa skyong chos ldan zhing //
translated: Where the king is righteous,

original: gang zhig kho nar skye dgu rnams //
analyzed: gang zhig kho nar skye dgu rnams //
translated: And who is the only one to be born among all living beings.üîΩ

original: bder gnas sa 'dzin rtsod @31a * //
analyzed: bder gnas sa 'dzin rtsod @31a * //
translated: Where the people are happy, the earth is stable, and there is no quarrel,

original: med pa // der ni rnal 'byor brtsam par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: med pa // der ni rnal 'byor brtsam par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: there the yogi should begin.

original: nges par 'jam pa'i mal cha dag dang gdan la nye bar 'dug nas sngar brjod bsrung ba byas nas ni zhes pa ni dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i bsrung ba byas nas zhes pa ste gnas kyi nges pa'o //üîΩda ni kha dag pa la sogs pa gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rnal 'byor pas sngar gsungs pa'i bsrung ba dang bdud bskrad pa byas te de nas sgrub thabs kyi le'u las gsungs pa'i cho gas bdag nyid skad cig gis lha'i gzugs
analyzed: nges par 'jam pa'i mal cha dag dang gdan la nye bar 'dug nas sngar brjod bsrung ba byas nas ni zhes pa ni dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i bsrung ba byas nas zhes pa ste gnas kyi nges pa'o // da ni kha dag pa la sogs pa gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rnal 'byor pas sngar gsungs pa'i bsrung ba dang bdud bskrad pa byas te de nas sgrub thabs kyi le'u las gsungs pa'i cho gas bdag nyid skad cig gis lha'i gzugs
translated: Having definitely sat down on a soft bed or seat, and having done the protection as previously stated, that is, having done the protection as stated in the Empowerment Chapter, this is the determination of the place.

original: kyi rnam par byas nas rang gi snying khar pom yig yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: kyi rnam par byas nas rang gi snying khar pom yig yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'o //
translated: Now, having stated the purification of the mouth, and so forth, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares first, and so on. Here, the yogi, having done the previously stated protection and exorcism of demons, then, by the rite stated in the Sadhana Chapter, having made himself into the form of the deity in an instant, in his heart, from the transformation of the syllable bhr≈´·πÉ, is a red lotus with eight petals.

original: de'i steng du lte ba la aom yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i steng du lte ba la aom yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: On top of that, at the navel, the syllable o·πÉ is transformed into a moon disk.

original: de'i dbus su de nyid ces pa kun rdzob tu hum yig las skyes pa rdo rje rtse lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su de nyid ces pa kun rdzob tu hum yig las skyes pa rdo rje rtse lnga pa'o //
translated: In the middle of that, that very thing, the syllable h≈´·πÉ, which is produced from the relative, is a five-pronged vajra.

original: de'i 'od zer sna tshogs rnams te kha dog lnga rnams rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'od zer sna tshogs rnams te kha dog lnga rnams rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The yogƒ´ should meditate on its various rays, the five colors.

original: sngon du kha la sogs pa dag par byas nas te bdud rtsi lnga'i ril bu khar bcug pas kha dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon du kha la sogs pa dag par byas nas te bdud rtsi lnga'i ril bu khar bcug pas kha dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having previously purified the mouth, that is, having placed a pill of the five nectars in the mouth, the mouth is purified.

original: de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i mchog gi phyag rgyas mgo bo nas brtsams te ji srid rkang pa'i mtha' de srid du bdag nyid la yang dag par reg par bya ste de ltar na lus dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i mchog gi phyag rgyas mgo bo nas brtsams te ji srid rkang pa'i mtha' de srid du bdag nyid la yang dag par reg par bya ste de ltar na lus dag pa'o //
translated: Similarly, having begun with the head and ending with the feet, one should touch oneself with the supreme consort previously mentioned; in that way, the body is purified.

original: de ltar kha la sogs pa dag par byas nas de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdo rje'i 'od zer gyis nam mkha'i mthil du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rab tu rtogs par byas te spros pa'i rgyal ba de rnams la mchod pa'i don du 'od zer de
analyzed: de ltar kha la sogs pa dag par byas nas de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdo rje'i 'od zer gyis nam mkha'i mthil du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rab tu rtogs par byas te spros pa'i rgyal ba de rnams la mchod pa'i don du 'od zer de
translated: Having purified the mouth and so on, then the light rays of the vajra on the moon mandala fully realize the tathƒÅgatas in the expanse of space.üîΩ

original: rnams kyang bkug nas rang gi snying khar zla ba'i rdo rje la rab tu zhugs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnams kyang bkug nas rang gi snying khar zla ba'i rdo rje la rab tu zhugs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having purified the mouth and so on, then by the light rays of the vajra on the moon mandala, one should imagine that the tathƒÅgatas are summoned into the sky and that the light rays are drawn in and enter the moon-vajra in one‚Äôs heart.

original: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la mchod pa'i lha mo bcu gnyis po rnams kyi sa bon yi ge'i gong bu rnams bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la mchod pa'i lha mo bcu gnyis po rnams kyi sa bon yi ge'i gong bu rnams bsam par bya ste /
translated: Then one should imagine the seed syllables of the twelve offering goddesses on the moon mandala.

original: kkhgghnga kkhgghng'a tstshdzdzhnya tstshdzdzh'a tthndhna tthddhn'a pphbbhma pphpbhm'a tthddhna tthddhn'a spshshthka spshshthk'a zhes pa sa bon gyi yi ge 'di rnams las grub pa ni grangs bzhin du rol mo ma dang / gar ma dang / dri ma dang / phreng ba ma dang / bdug spos ma dang /
analyzed: kkhgghnga kkhgghng'a tstshdzdzhnya tstshdzdzh'a tthndhna tthddhn'a pphbbhma pphpbhm'a tthddhna tthddhn'a spshshthka spshshthk'a zhes pa sa bon gyi yi ge 'di rnams las grub pa ni grangs bzhin du rol mo ma dang / gar ma dang / dri ma dang / phreng ba ma dang / bdug spos ma dang /
translated: The seed syllables that establish these are, in order, the musical instrument, dance, scent, garland, incense,üîΩlamp, food, flower, grace, laughter, song, and desire.

original: mar me ma dang / lha bshos ma dang / ma nyams ma dang / sgeg mo dang / bzhad ma dang / glu ma dang / 'dod ma ste de dag la sogs pa @31b rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i cho gas mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: mar me ma dang / lha bshos ma dang / ma nyams ma dang / sgeg mo dang / bzhad ma dang / glu ma dang / 'dod ma ste de dag la sogs pa @31b rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dbang gi le'u las gsungs pa'i cho gas mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Having made offerings to the tathƒÅgatas with these and so forth, one should perform the consecration as taught in the chapter on consecration.

original: de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas sdig pa rnam pa mang po bsags pa dag ni dang por bshags par byas te de nas sgrub pa po yis lus dang ngag dang sems rnams dag pa yis ni gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bya zhes pa ni nges
analyzed: de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas sdig pa rnam pa mang po bsags pa dag ni dang por bshags par byas te de nas sgrub pa po yis lus dang ngag dang sems rnams dag pa yis ni gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bya zhes pa ni nges
translated: Then, having confessed the many sins that have been accumulated in the sequence that will be explained, the practitioner should go for refuge to the Three [Jewels] with a pure body, speech, and mind.

original: pa'o // da ni sdig pa bshags pa'i mjug thogs su bsod nams la rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
analyzed: pa'o // da ni sdig pa bshags pa'i mjug thogs su bsod nams la rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
translated: Now, immediately after the confession of sins, one should rejoice in merit.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'phags pa'i tshogs kyis rnam mang dge ba gang mdzad pa //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'phags pa'i tshogs kyis rnam mang dge ba gang mdzad pa //
translated: Whatever virtues have been performed by the perfect Buddhas, the Bodhisattvas, and the hosts of ƒÄryas,

original: de rnams mtha' dag la ni sdig pa rnam bral byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas pa'i sngags pa rjes yi rang //
analyzed: de rnams mtha' dag la ni sdig pa rnam bral byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas pa'i sngags pa rjes yi rang //
translated: the reciter, free from sin, should rejoice in all of them, abiding in the practice of the enlightenment of the Bodhisattvas.

original: de nas gsum la skyabs su 'gro ste sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun srid pa'i 'jigs 'phrog la yang byang chub bar du bdag ni skyabs su mchis //
analyzed: de nas gsum la skyabs su 'gro ste sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun srid pa'i 'jigs 'phrog la yang byang chub bar du bdag ni skyabs su mchis //
translated: Then, one should go for refuge to the Three [Jewels], to the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha, the protectors from the dangers of existence, until enlightenment.

original: de ltar gsum la skyabs su song ste bdag nyid kyi dngos po dbul ba byas nas de nas sems can gyi don gyi slad du smon lam bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gsum la skyabs su song ste bdag nyid kyi dngos po dbul ba byas nas de nas sems can gyi don gyi slad du smon lam bya ste /
translated: Having thus gone for refuge to the Three, and having offered oneself, one should make a vow for the sake of sentient beings.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas su bdag gyur cig ces 'dir ni smon lam sems can don gyi slad du bdag bgyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas su bdag gyur cig ces 'dir ni smon lam sems can don gyi slad du bdag bgyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: Here, the vow is May I become a perfect Buddha! I will do this for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod pa dang sdig pa bshags pa dang bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bskul ba dang gsol ba gdab pa dang bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba ste de ltar mchod pa rnam pa bdun
analyzed: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod pa dang sdig pa bshags pa dang bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bskul ba dang gsol ba gdab pa dang bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba ste de ltar mchod pa rnam pa bdun
translated: Thus, one should make the seven-fold offering: prostration, offering, confession of sins, rejoicing in merit, requesting the wheel of the doctrine to be turned, beseeching not to pass into nirvana, and dedicating merit.

original: bya'o // de nas rtsa ba gsum dran par bya ste byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yongs su spong ba'o //
analyzed: bya'o // de nas rtsa ba gsum dran par bya ste byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yongs su spong ba'o //
translated: Then, one should remember the three roots: generating the Thought of Enlightenment, purifying the intention, and abandoning the grasping of self and the grasping of self-belonging.

original: de nas bsod nams dang ye shes dang tshul khrims kyi tshogs kyi don du pha rol du phyin pa bcu bsam par bya ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang de bzhin du tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab dang
analyzed: de nas bsod nams dang ye shes dang tshul khrims kyi tshogs kyi don du pha rol du phyin pa bcu bsam par bya ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang de bzhin du tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab dang
translated: Then, for the sake of the accumulations of merit, knowledge, and morality, one should contemplate the ten perfections: the perfection of generosity, and likewise the perfections of morality, patience, effort, meditation, wisdom,

original: thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: skillful means, aspiration, strength, and knowledge.

original: de nas tshangs pa'i gnas rnams dran par bya ste byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms so //üîΩde @32a * //
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa'i gnas rnams dran par bya ste byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms so // de @32a * //
translated: Then, one should recall the four divine abodes: loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: nas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bsam par bya ste sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: nas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bsam par bya ste sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'o //
translated: Then, one should contemplate the four means of gathering: generosity, kind speech, meaningful conduct, and having the same purpose.

original: de nas mi dge ba bcu yongs su spang ba bsgom par bya ste srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang 'dod pa log par g-yem pa dang brdzun du smra ba dang tshig rtsub dang phra ma dang tshig 'khyal pa dang brnab sems dang gnod sems
analyzed: de nas mi dge ba bcu yongs su spang ba bsgom par bya ste srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang 'dod pa log par g-yem pa dang brdzun du smra ba dang tshig rtsub dang phra ma dang tshig 'khyal pa dang brnab sems dang gnod sems
translated: Then one should cultivate the avoidance of the ten nonvirtues: killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, harsh speech, slander, idle talk, covetousness, malice,

original: dang log lta'o /
analyzed: dang log lta'o /
translated: and wrong views.

original: de bzhin du 'gyod pa dang rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang the tshom ste sgrib pa lnga yongs su spang bar bya'o //üîΩde bzhin du 'dod chags dang zhes sngar dang gti mug dang nga rgyal te nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gyod pa dang rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang the tshom ste sgrib pa lnga yongs su spang bar bya'o // de bzhin du 'dod chags dang zhes sngar dang gti mug dang nga rgyal te nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should abandon the five hindrances: regret, torpor, sleep, restlessness, and doubt.üîΩLikewise, one should abandon the afflictions: desire, anger, ignorance, and pride.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i zag pa dang srid pa'i zag pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa dang lta ba'i zag pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i zag pa dang srid pa'i zag pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa dang lta ba'i zag pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should abandon the defilements: the defilement of desire, the defilement of existence, the defilement of ignorance, and the defilement of views.

original: de nas rnam par thar pa bzhi bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rnam par thar pa bzhi bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Then one should cultivate the four liberations:

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and non-conditioning.

original: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i khams gsum po tshigs su bcad pa 'dis rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i khams gsum po tshigs su bcad pa 'dis rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
translated: The three realms, along with the moving and unmoving, should be analyzed with this verse:

original: dngos po med la bsgom pa med //
analyzed: dngos po med la bsgom pa med //
translated: There is no entity, no cultivation.

original: sgom pa sgom pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: sgom pa sgom pa nyid ma yin //
translated: Cultivation is not cultivation itself.

original: de ltar dngos po dngos min pas //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po dngos min pas //
translated: Thus, due to neither entity nor non-entity,

original: sgom pa dmigs su med pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa dmigs su med pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is not apprehended.

original: 'di'i don ni 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'chad par 'gyur pa las brjod par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this will be explained later.

original: da ni stong pa zhes pa la sogs pas yang srid pa gzung ba'i slad du stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni stong pa zhes pa la sogs pas yang srid pa gzung ba'i slad du stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with emptiness, the characteristic of emptiness is stated again in order to grasp existence.

original: stong pa dngos po'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin 'gro ba mtha' dag 'di ni dngos po dag gis rnam par dman pa gang yin pa'i stong pa chen po de las kyang sangs rgyas byang chub med cing gzhan pa na snying rje dag kyang med do //üîΩde bzhin du 'gro ba la phan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas su bya'o zhes pa mtshan ma'i dam bca' med pa ste mtha' dag de ltar shes nas sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du de lta na yang mi yi bdag po sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
analyzed: stong pa dngos po'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin 'gro ba mtha' dag 'di ni dngos po dag gis rnam par dman pa gang yin pa'i stong pa chen po de las kyang sangs rgyas byang chub med cing gzhan pa na snying rje dag kyang med do // de bzhin du 'gro ba la phan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas su bya'o zhes pa mtshan ma'i dam bca' med pa ste mtha' dag de ltar shes nas sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du de lta na yang mi yi bdag po sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
translated: The nature of the essence of entities is emptiness. In this, all migrating beings are inferior to the entities. In that great emptiness, there is no buddhahood, and elsewhere there is no compassion.üîΩLikewise, in order to benefit migrating beings, one should become a buddha. There is no vow of attributes. Having understood everything in that way, the lord of humans should meditate on the mandala of the immeasurable qualities of the vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: dpag med yon tan dkyil 'khor dbang po dkyil 'khor la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya zhes pa ste 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa dang sems can thams cad la yang dag @32b par bstan pa'i slad du sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor
analyzed: dpag med yon tan dkyil 'khor dbang po dkyil 'khor la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya zhes pa ste 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa dang sems can thams cad la yang dag @32b par bstan pa'i slad du sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor
translated: In order to accomplish the mundane result and to perfectly demonstrate to all sentient beings, the bodhisattvas should meditate on the mandala of the vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: la gtso bo sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: la gtso bo sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The principal one is the meditation on the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: da ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po gzung ba dang 'khor ba pa'i phung po yongs su spang ba'i slad du ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa chu yis zhes pa la sogs pa ste mi yi 'jig rten 'dir mngal nas skyes pa rnams 'chi ba'i dus su chu
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po gzung ba dang 'khor ba pa'i phung po yongs su spang ba'i slad du ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa chu yis zhes pa la sogs pa ste mi yi 'jig rten 'dir mngal nas skyes pa rnams 'chi ba'i dus su chu
translated: Now, in order to take up the supramundane aggregates and to abandon the mundane aggregates, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares the samƒÅdhi beginning with ‚Äúwater,‚Äù and so on. In this world of humans, those born from a womb, at the time of death,üîΩwater

original: yis me rnam par nyams par byed do //
analyzed: yis me rnam par nyams par byed do //
translated: destroys fire.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyis chu yis me ni rnam par nyams pa dang por 'dir ni lus kyi dbus su sdom brtson rnams kyis bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyis chu yis me ni rnam par nyams pa dang por 'dir ni lus kyi dbus su sdom brtson rnams kyis bya /
translated: Therefore, by that very samƒÅdhi, the fire is destroyed by water. First, here, the practitioners should do this in the middle of the body.

original: phyi nas me med pa'i phyir 'dzin ma dag ni sra ba nyid spangs te lan tshva bzhin du zhu bar gyur nas chur 'gyur te chu yi dbus su rab tu zhugs so //
analyzed: phyi nas me med pa'i phyir 'dzin ma dag ni sra ba nyid spangs te lan tshva bzhin du zhu bar gyur nas chur 'gyur te chu yi dbus su rab tu zhugs so //
translated: Afterwards, because there is no fire, the earth elements abandon solidity, and, becoming like salt, turn into water and enter into the middle of the water.

original: de nas rlung ni chu de rnams mtha' dag bskams nas nam mkha' la mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rlung ni chu de rnams mtha' dag bskams nas nam mkha' la mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the wind dries up all that water and disappears into space.

original: de ltar khams kyi tshogs myur du rnam par nyams te de nas sems ni me dang mun pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: de ltar khams kyi tshogs myur du rnam par nyams te de nas sems ni me dang mun pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: In this way, the collection of elements quickly deteriorates. Then the mind is the end of fire and darkness,

original: nam mkha'i khams rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs yul dang rnam par bral ba dbus kyis la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs yul dang rnam par bral ba dbus kyis la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: the space element, the form of all aspects, free from objects and aspects, in the middle, the consciousness of the all-base should be placed.

original: de nas sngags 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sngags 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Then this mantra should be recited:

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'tma ko& ham /üîΩaom aa ni mi tta dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'tma ko& ham / aom aa ni mi tta dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: O·πÉ ≈õ≈´nyatƒÅj√±ƒÅnavajrasvabhƒÅvƒÅtmako 'ha·πÉ.üîΩ O·πÉ animittaj√±ƒÅnavajrasvabhƒÅvƒÅtmako 'ha·πÉ.

original: aom aa pra ni hi ta dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /üîΩaom aa na bhi sam sk'a ra dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom aa pra ni hi ta dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /üîΩaom aa na bhi sam sk'a ra dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: O·πÉ apra·πáihitaj√±ƒÅnavajrasvabhƒÅvƒÅtmako 'ha·πÉ.üîΩ O·πÉ abhisambodhaj√±ƒÅnavajrasvabhƒÅvƒÅtmako 'ha·πÉ.

original: zhes pa brjod nas khams gsum po rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las das pa'i stong pa nyid rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa brjod nas khams gsum po rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las das pa'i stong pa nyid rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having uttered this, one should meditate on the emptiness of the three realms, which is distinguished from the ultimate reality of the subtle particles.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the TathƒÅgata.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las gnas bsrung ba dang sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste dang pa'o /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las gnas bsrung ba dang sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste dang pa'o /
translated: This concludes the first great summary in the commentary Stainless Light on the root tantra of the king of the tantras of KƒÅlacakra, the Compendium of Reality, which is the protection of the site, confession of negativities, and so forth.

original: // / da ni smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du mngal du 'jug pa'i tshul gyis skyed pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das kyi sgrub thabs gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / da ni smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du mngal du 'jug pa'i tshul gyis skyed pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das kyi sgrub thabs gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to fulfill the aspirations and to turn the wheel of Dharma, the method of generating the Bhagavat through the process of birth by way of the creation stage is taught:

original: stong pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEmptiness,‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'dir phyi dang nang du bskyed pa'i mtshan ma ni nam mkha'i khams mtha' yas @33a * //
analyzed: 'dir phyi dang nang du bskyed pa'i mtshan ma ni nam mkha'i khams mtha' yas @33a * //
translated: Here, the outer and inner signs of generation are the infinite space element,

original: pa dang shes rab kyi chos 'byung gru gsum mo //
analyzed: pa dang shes rab kyi chos 'byung gru gsum mo //
translated: The triangle of the Dharma source is the wisdom.

original: phyi rol du mi yul la rdo rje'i rang bzhin rtsibs bcu zlum po ste nang du ma'i lus so //
analyzed: phyi rol du mi yul la rdo rje'i rang bzhin rtsibs bcu zlum po ste nang du ma'i lus so //
translated: The ten-spoked wheel is the nature of the vajra, the outer world, and the inner body of the mother.

original: de la phyi rol du yom yig yongs su gyur pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor nag po dbus su gzhu'i rnam pa thad kar dpag tshad 'bum phrag bzhi pa 'og dang steng du h'um yig yongs su gyur pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje gnyis dang bcas pa rgyal mtshanüîΩgyis mtshan pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas dang g-yon du yang dpung pa gnyis mthon mthing dang gnyis dmar po dang gnyis dkar po'o //

original: de bzhin du g-yas dang g-yon du yang phyag bzhi nag po dang bzhi dmar po dang bzhi dkar po ste de rnams kyang 'chad par 'gyur pa'i mtshon cha dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas dang g-yon du yang phyag bzhi nag po dang bzhi dmar po dang bzhi dkar po ste de rnams kyang 'chad par 'gyur pa'i mtshon cha dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the four hands on the right and left are black, red, and white, and they hold the weapons to be described.

original: de bzhin du phyag re re la sor mo lnga ste mthe bo ser po dang mdzub mo dkar po dang gung mo dmar po dang ming med nag po dang mthe chung ljang gu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyag re re la sor mo lnga ste mthe bo ser po dang mdzub mo dkar po dang gung mo dmar po dang ming med nag po dang mthe chung ljang gu'o //
translated: Likewise, each hand has five fingers, with the thumb yellow, the index finger white, the middle finger red, the fourth finger black, and the little finger green.

original: de rnams re re la tshigs gsum ste phyag gi mthil nas sor mo thams cad kyi tshigs kyi phreng ba dang po nag po dang gnyis pa dmar po dang gsum pa dkar po'o //

translated: Each of those has three joints, and the series of joints of all the fingers from the palm of the hand is black, red, and white.

original: de ltar phyag gi padma ri bong can so so la kha dog lnga ste de dag sor gdub rnams kyis 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyag gi padma ri bong can so so la kha dog lnga ste de dag sor gdub rnams kyis 'phro ba'o //

translated: Thus, the certainty of the engagement of ignorance, formation, and consciousness is the third month in the womb and the first stage.üîΩNow, the set of weapons is stated beginning with ‚Äúblack‚Äù and so on. First, in the four palms of the black one, there is a vajra, a sword, a trident, and a flaying knife.

translated: The four palms of the white right hands: in the first palm is a wheel, in the second a spear, in the third a club, and in the fourth a battle-ax. This is the set of weapons of the right hands of the sun-faced Vajrƒ´.

analyzed: zhes so // da ni g-yon pa'i nag po'i phyag gi mthil bzhi la mtshan ma gsungs te /

analyzed: dang por rdo rje dril bu dang gnyis par phub dang gsum par kha t'am ga rnam par rgyas pa'i kha can dang bzhi par khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa'o //
translated: in the first is a vajra and bell, in the second an armor, in the third a kha·π≠vƒÅ·πÖga with a full-blown mouth, and in the fourth a skull-cup filled with blood.
