translated: Similarly, the four palms of the red right hands: in the first is a bow, in the second a noose, in the third a precious jewel, and in the fourth a white lotus.

original: de bzhin du dkar po'i phyag gi mthil bzhi la dang po'i phyag gi mthil du chu na rgyu ba zhes pa dung dang / gnyis par me long dang / gsum par rdo rje lcags sgrog dang / bzhi par tshangs pa'i mgo bo zhes pa 'di ltar rig byed gdong ldan tshangs pa'i mgo bo gang yin pa padmas brgyan pa ste spras pa rgyal ba'i g-yon pa'i phyag na'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar po'i phyag gi mthil bzhi la dang po'i phyag gi mthil du chu na rgyu ba zhes pa dung dang / gnyis par me long dang / gsum par rdo rje lcags sgrog dang / bzhi par tshangs pa'i mgo bo zhes pa 'di ltar rig byed gdong ldan tshangs pa'i mgo bo gang yin pa padmas brgyan pa ste spras pa rgyal ba'i g-yon pa'i phyag na'o zhes so //
translated: Likewise, in the four palms of the white hands, in the palm of the first hand is a conch called ‚Äúmoving in the water,‚Äù in the second a mirror, in the third a vajra chain, and in the fourth a head of Brahma called ‚Äúadorned with a lotus,‚Äù that is, decorated with a lotus, in the Victor‚Äôs left hand.

original: der bdud dang drag po la yang dag par nye ba na bdud dang drag po dang gi rang gi lha mo dag ni zhabs kyi mthil la 'dzin cing gdong ni dman pa dag tu byed de bdud kyi dga' ma dang drag po'i au ma'o //
analyzed: der bdud dang drag po la yang dag par nye ba na bdud dang drag po dang gi rang gi lha mo dag ni zhabs kyi mthil la 'dzin cing gdong ni dman pa dag tu byed de bdud kyi dga' ma dang drag po'i au ma'o //
translated: There, when Mara and Rudra are truly near, the goddesses of Mara and Rudra hold his feet, and their faces are made lowly, that is, the beloved of Mara and the Uma of Rudra.

original: mi bskyod pa rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: Ak·π£obhya is fully engaged.

original: da ni sna tshogs yum gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa gser mdog ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni sna tshogs yum gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa gser mdog ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the definition of Vi≈õvamƒÅtƒÅ is stated beginning with ‚Äúgolden-colored,‚Äù etc.

original: de la ro mnyam pa gcig las zla ba dang khu ba'i rang bzhin gyis bcom ldan 'das skyed cing nyi ma dang rdul gyi rang bzhin gyis lha mo skyed do //
analyzed: de la ro mnyam pa gcig las zla ba dang khu ba'i rang bzhin gyis bcom ldan 'das skyed cing nyi ma dang rdul gyi rang bzhin gyis lha mo skyed do //
translated: In this, the Blessed One is generated by the nature of the moon and semen, and the goddess is generated by the nature of the sun and blood.

original: de la dkar po dang nag po'i chos can ni zla ba ste dmar po dang ser po'i chos can ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: de la dkar po dang nag po'i chos can ni zla ba ste dmar po dang ser po'i chos can ni nyi ma'o //
translated: Here, the moon is the nature of white and black qualities, and the sun is the nature of red and yellow qualities.

original: des na gser mdog go //
analyzed: des na gser mdog go //
translated: Therefore, he is golden-colored.

original: rig byed zhal ldan ni zhal bzhi'o //
analyzed: rig byed zhal ldan ni zhal bzhi'o //
translated: He has four faces, because he has the Vedas.

original: nor gyi phyag gi padma ni phyag brgyad de mdun nas 'khyud pa dag ni sna tshogs yum mo //üîΩde'i g-yas kyi phyag dang po na gri gug dang gnyis pa na lcags kyu dang gsum pa na sgra dang bcas pa'i da ma ru dang bzhi pa na bgrang phreng ngo //
analyzed: nor gyi phyag gi padma ni phyag brgyad de mdun nas 'khyud pa dag ni sna tshogs yum mo // de'i g-yas kyi phyag dang po na gri gug dang gnyis pa na lcags kyu dang gsum pa na sgra dang bcas pa'i da ma ru dang bzhi pa na bgrang phreng ngo //
translated: His eight hands are lotus flowers of wealth. The embrace from the front is Vi≈õvamƒÅtƒÅ.üîΩIn the first right hand of him is a flaying knife, in the second is a goad, in the third is a sounding ·∏çamaru, and in the fourth is a rosary.

original: g-yon gyi phyag dang po na thod pa dang gnyis pa na zhags pa dang gsum pa na 'dab ma brgya pa'i padma dkar po dang bzhi pa na @37a * //
analyzed: g-yon gyi phyag dang po na thod pa dang gnyis pa na zhags pa dang gsum pa na 'dab ma brgya pa'i padma dkar po dang bzhi pa na @37a * //
translated: In the first left hand is a skull cup, in the second is a noose, in the third is a white hundred-petaled lotus, and in the fourth is a kha·π≠vƒÅ·πÖga.

original: mchog gi rin chen de bzhin nyid du'o //
analyzed: mchog gi rin chen de bzhin nyid du'o //
translated: The supreme jewel is suchness.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ni g-yas brkyang ste sna tshogs yum ni g-yon brkyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ni g-yas brkyang ste sna tshogs yum ni g-yon brkyang ngo //
translated: Similarly, the Blessed One is right-footed, and Vi≈õvamƒÅtƒÅ is left-footed.

original: nyi ma'i spyan ni spyan bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: nyi ma'i spyan ni spyan bcu gnyis so //
translated: The sun eye is the twelve eyes.

original: rgyal ba'i bdag po'i cod pan ni rdo rje sems dpa'i cod pan can no //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bdag po'i cod pan ni rdo rje sems dpa'i cod pan can no //
translated: The crest of the lord of victors is the crest of Vajrasattva.

original: phyag rgya lnga po rnams kyi rgya yis btab pa snyoms par zhugs pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga po rnams kyi rgya yis btab pa snyoms par zhugs pas gnas pa'o //
translated: The five mudras are marked with the mudras, abiding in union.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol du phyin pa ni sna tshogs yum de'i nang du 'dus shing pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol du phyin pa ni sna tshogs yum de'i nang du 'dus shing pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is Vi≈õvamƒÅtƒÅ, and within her are the other perfections such as generosity,

original: pha rol du phyin pa brgyad ni 'dab ma rnams la lha mo brgyad de de rnams nor gyi phyag gi padma ni phyag brgyad do //
analyzed: pha rol du phyin pa brgyad ni 'dab ma rnams la lha mo brgyad de de rnams nor gyi phyag gi padma ni phyag brgyad do //
translated: and the eight perfections are the eight goddesses on the petals. Their wealth hands are the eight hands.

original: rig byed zhal ni zhal bzhi'o //
analyzed: rig byed zhal ni zhal bzhi'o //
translated: The Veda face is the four faces.

original: nyi ma'i spyan ni spyan bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: nyi ma'i spyan ni spyan bcu gnyis so //
translated: The sun eye is the twelve eyes.

original: de dag rnams kyi nang nas bzhi ni klu yi rnga yab 'dzin te phyag brgyad kyis rnga yab brgyad 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi nang nas bzhi ni klu yi rnga yab 'dzin te phyag brgyad kyis rnga yab brgyad 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Among them, four hold the yak-tail fans of the nagas, and with their eight hands they hold eight yak-tail fans.

original: zur bzhir rgyal ba'i zhal gyi dbye bas so zhes pa ni mer nag mo dang bden bral du dmar mo dang rlung du ser mo dang dbang ldan du dkar mo'o //
analyzed: zur bzhir rgyal ba'i zhal gyi dbye bas so zhes pa ni mer nag mo dang bden bral du dmar mo dang rlung du ser mo dang dbang ldan du dkar mo'o //
translated: In the four corners, by the division of the faces of the Victor, means that in the southeast is the black one, in the southwest the red one, in the northwest the yellow one, and in the northeast the white one.

original: de bzhin du de rnams kyi rgyab tu dbang ldan du chos kyi dung dkar po dang bden bral du chos kyi gand'i dmar po dang mer yid bzhin gyi nor bu nag po dang rlung du dpag bsam gyi shing ser po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de rnams kyi rgyab tu dbang ldan du chos kyi dung dkar po dang bden bral du chos kyi gand'i dmar po dang mer yid bzhin gyi nor bu nag po dang rlung du dpag bsam gyi shing ser po'o //
translated: Similarly, behind them, in the northeast is the white Dharma conch, in the southwest the red Dharma hook, in the southeast the black wish-fulfilling gem, and in the northwest the yellow wish-fulfilling tree.

original: de bzhin du shar gyi 'dab ma la nag mo dang lhor dmar mo dang byang du dkar mo dang nub tu ser mo 'bar ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar gyi 'dab ma la nag mo dang lhor dmar mo dang byang du dkar mo dang nub tu ser mo 'bar ma'o //
translated: Similarly, on the petals in the east is the black one, in the south the red one, in the north the white one, and in the west the yellow one, the blazing ones.

original: phyogs bzhi'i dbye bas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi dbye ba ji lta ba de bzhin du lha mo rnams kyi ste sna tshogs yum gyi dang po'i zhal gser gyi mdog dang g-yas pa dkar po dang g-yon pa dmar po dang rgyab mthon mthing ste de bzhin du
analyzed: phyogs bzhi'i dbye bas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi dbye ba ji lta ba de bzhin du lha mo rnams kyi ste sna tshogs yum gyi dang po'i zhal gser gyi mdog dang g-yas pa dkar po dang g-yon pa dmar po dang rgyab mthon mthing ste de bzhin du
translated: Just as the Blessed One has four faces, so do the goddesses. The first face of the multicolored mother is golden, the right face is white, the left face is red, and the back face is dark blue.

original: lha mo ser mo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lha mo ser mo rnams kyi'o //
translated: Likewise, the goddesses who are yellow have yellow faces.

original: dkar mo rnams kyi mdun dkar po dang g-yas nag po dang rgyab dmar po dang g-yon ser po'o //
analyzed: dkar mo rnams kyi mdun dkar po dang g-yas nag po dang rgyab dmar po dang g-yon ser po'o //
translated: The white goddesses have a white face in front, a black face to the right, a red face to the back, and a yellow face to the left.

original: dmar mo rnams kyi dang po dmar po dang g-yas ser po dang g-yon mthon mthing dang rgyab dkar po'o //
analyzed: dmar mo rnams kyi dang po dmar po dang g-yas ser po dang g-yon mthon mthing dang rgyab dkar po'o //
translated: The red goddesses have a red face in front, a yellow face to the right, a dark blue face to the back, and a white face to the left.

original: nag mo rnams kyi mdun nag po dang g-yas dmar po dang g-yon dkar po dang rgyab ser po'o //
analyzed: nag mo rnams kyi mdun nag po dang g-yas dmar po dang g-yon dkar po dang rgyab ser po'o //
translated: The black goddesses have a black face in front, a red face to the right, a white face to the left, and a yellow face to the back.

original: snying po'i padma'i lha mo rnams kyi rgyan dang phyag rgya lnga po rnams ni bcom ldan 'das ma'i ji lta ba de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: snying po'i padma'i lha mo rnams kyi rgyan dang phyag rgya lnga po rnams ni bcom ldan 'das ma'i ji lta ba de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The ornaments and five symbolic implements of the goddesses of the heart lotus should be understood to be the same as those of the Blessed Lady.

original: da ni nag mo 'bar ma la sogs pa rnams kyi g-yas dang g-yon gyi phyag gi mtshan @37b ma rnams gsungs pa nag mo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni nag mo 'bar ma la sogs pa rnams kyi g-yas dang g-yon gyi phyag gi mtshan @37b ma rnams gsungs pa nag mo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now the signs of the right and left hands of K·πõ·π£·πáƒÅnalƒÅ and so forth are stated:

original: nag mo yi ni dang po'i phyag gi mthil na spos kyi snod dang gnyis pa dag na bsil ba'i snod de tsandan gyi snod dang dmar po sbyar ba gur gum gyi gsum pa na'o //
analyzed: nag mo yi ni dang po'i phyag gi mthil na spos kyi snod dang gnyis pa dag na bsil ba'i snod de tsandan gyi snod dang dmar po sbyar ba gur gum gyi gsum pa na'o //
translated: In the palm of the first hand of K·πõ·π£·πáƒÅ is a perfume vessel, in the second a cooling vessel, a sandalwood vessel, and in the third a red one, saffron.

original: myos byed dang bcas ri bong 'dzin pa zhes pa gla rtsi dang bcas pa'i ga pur gyi snod ni bzhi pa na ste g-yas kyi phyag rnams na'o //
analyzed: myos byed dang bcas ri bong 'dzin pa zhes pa gla rtsi dang bcas pa'i ga pur gyi snod ni bzhi pa na ste g-yas kyi phyag rnams na'o //
translated: In the fourth is a vessel of camphor with liquor, a vessel of camphor with musk, in the right hands.

original: g-yon pa'i dang po na dril bu dang gnyis pa na padma dang gsum pa na lha'i shing gi me tog dang bzhi pa na me tog sna tshogs kyi phreng ba rim pas so zhes pa ste shar gyi 'dab ma la'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i dang po na dril bu dang gnyis pa na padma dang gsum pa na lha'i shing gi me tog dang bzhi pa na me tog sna tshogs kyi phreng ba rim pas so zhes pa ste shar gyi 'dab ma la'o //
translated: In the first left is a bell, in the second a lotus, in the third a divine tree flower, and in the fourth a garland of various flowers, in order.

original: dmar mo 'bar ma'i g-yas kyi phyag dang po na mar me dang gnyis pa na do shal dang gsum pa na cod pan dang bzhi pa na gdu bu'o //
analyzed: dmar mo 'bar ma'i g-yas kyi phyag dang po na mar me dang gnyis pa na do shal dang gsum pa na cod pan dang bzhi pa na gdu bu'o //
translated: The first right hand of the red blazing goddess holds a lamp, the second a necklace, the third a diadem, and the fourth a bracelet.

original: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i phyag dang po na gos dang gnyis pa na ska rags dang gsum pa na rin po che'i rna rgyan dang bzhi pa na rkang gdub bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i phyag dang po na gos dang gnyis pa na ska rags dang gsum pa na rin po che'i rna rgyan dang bzhi pa na rkang gdub bo //
translated: Similarly, the first left hand holds a garment, the second a girdle, the third an earring, and the fourth an anklet.

original: de bzhin du ser mo 'bar ma'i g-yas kyi dang po na dung dang / gnyis pa na gling bu dang / gsum pa na nor bu dang / bzhi pa na da ma ru'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ser mo 'bar ma'i g-yas kyi dang po na dung dang / gnyis pa na gling bu dang / gsum pa na nor bu dang / bzhi pa na da ma ru'o //
translated: Similarly, the first right hand of the yellow blazing goddess holds a conch, the second a flute, the third a jewel, and the fourth a ·∏çamaru.

original: g-yon gyi dang po na rgyud mangs dang gnyis pa na rda dang gsum pa na sgra sgrogs pa'i khar rnga dang bzhi pa na zangs dung ngo //
analyzed: g-yon gyi dang po na rgyud mangs dang gnyis pa na rda dang gsum pa na sgra sgrogs pa'i khar rnga dang bzhi pa na zangs dung ngo //
translated: The first left hand holds a lute, the second a drum, the third a kettledrum, and the fourth a copper horn.

original: de bzhin du dkar mo 'bar ma'i dang po na'o ma'i snod dang / gnyis pa na chu'i snod dang / gsum pa na mchog gi sman dang / bzhi pa na chang gi snod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar mo 'bar ma'i dang po na'o ma'i snod dang / gnyis pa na chu'i snod dang / gsum pa na mchog gi sman dang / bzhi pa na chang gi snod do //
translated: Similarly, the first right hand of the white blazing goddess holds a vessel of milk, the second a vessel of water, the third supreme medicine, and the fourth a vessel of beer.

original: g-yon gyi dang po na bdud rtsi'i snod dang gnyis pa na grub pa'i ro'i snod dang / gsum pa na bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu dang / bzhi pa na zas kyi snod de dkar mo yi'o //
analyzed: g-yon gyi dang po na bdud rtsi'i snod dang gnyis pa na grub pa'i ro'i snod dang / gsum pa na bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu dang / bzhi pa na zas kyi snod de dkar mo yi'o //
translated: This is the white one.

original: rang gi phyag rgya dang bcas pa ste rdo rje sems dpa' rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya dang bcas pa ste rdo rje sems dpa' rdzogs pa'o //
translated: He is together with his consort, and is the perfected Vajrasattva.

original: da ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa skyed pa'i slad du 'dod chags chen pos gdul bar bya ba'i sems can gyi 'jig rten dang po'i sangs rgyas bstan par bya ba'i snod du mngon par gzigs nas shin tu dga' ba'i sgras rang gi lus la mi bskyod pa
analyzed: da ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa skyed pa'i slad du 'dod chags chen pos gdul bar bya ba'i sems can gyi 'jig rten dang po'i sangs rgyas bstan par bya ba'i snod du mngon par gzigs nas shin tu dga' ba'i sgras rang gi lus la mi bskyod pa
translated: Now, in order to generate name and form, etc., he sees the world of sentient beings to be disciplined by great passion as a vessel for the teaching of the first Buddha, and with the sound of great joy, he emanates Akshobhya from his body.

original: la sogs pa'i rgyal ba'i tshogs rnams dang nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams kyi tshogs rnams te skyes bu dang rig ma dang mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rang bzhin gyis lha'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa rnams gzhug par bya ste slar yang de @38a * //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i rgyal ba'i tshogs rnams dang nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams kyi tshogs rnams te skyes bu dang rig ma dang mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rang bzhin gyis lha'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa rnams gzhug par bya ste slar yang de @38a * //
translated: and so on, the hosts of conquerors, the hosts of the elements of space and so on, the male and female consorts, the eyes and so on, and the nature of the objects such as form and so on, having become the nature of the deity, should be introduced.

original: rnams rang gi lus las spros nas sna tshogs yum gyi nang du ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnams rang gi lus las spros nas sna tshogs yum gyi nang du ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, having emanated them from one's body, they should be meditated on just as they are within the mother, the diverse.üîΩThen, having emanated them as suchness, again the tathƒÅgatas together with the elements should be introduced into one's body in the form of the mandala circle.

original: de nas de bzhin nyid du spros nas slar yang khams dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pas rang gi lus la gzhug par bya ste zhu bzla bar gyur pa rnams rang gi rdo rje nas spros te rang gi rig ma'i
analyzed: de nas de bzhin nyid du spros nas slar yang khams dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pas rang gi lus la gzhug par bya ste zhu bzla bar gyur pa rnams rang gi rdo rje nas spros te rang gi rig ma'i
translated: Having melted, they should be emanated from one's vajra and enter one's consort's lotus.

original: padmar de rnams yongs su gyur pa las lha dang lha mo'i tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: padmar de rnams yongs su gyur pa las lha dang lha mo'i tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: In the lotus, those completely transform into the ma·πá·∏çala of the assembly of male and female deities, which has the characteristic of the support and the supported.

original: mi bskyod pa lhag pa'i bdag por bsgoms nas dang por bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa lhag pa'i bdag por bsgoms nas dang por bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having meditated on Ak·π£obhya as the dominant one, first he should be placed in the body of the Bhagavat.

original: de nas phyogs kyi padmar chu gter sangs rgyas bzhi rnams ni nges par spyan dgu pa me'i zhal zhes pa zhal gsum pa dus kyi phyag ces pa phyag drug pa rnams spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyogs kyi padmar chu gter sangs rgyas bzhi rnams ni nges par spyan dgu pa me'i zhal zhes pa zhal gsum pa dus kyi phyag ces pa phyag drug pa rnams spro bar bya'o //
translated: Then, in the lotuses of the directions, one should emanate the four buddhas of the water ma·πá·∏çala, who definitely have nine faces and fire faces, that is, three faces, and six arms, that is, four arms.

original: de la shar gyi padmar nyi ma'i steng du don yod grub pa nag po ste g-yas skor gyis nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i zhal can no //
analyzed: de la shar gyi padmar nyi ma'i steng du don yod grub pa nag po ste g-yas skor gyis nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i zhal can no //
translated: In the east, on a sun, is black Amoghasiddhi, with black, red, and white faces in order to the right.

original: lhor rin chen 'byung ldan kha dog dmar po ste g-yas skor gyis dmar po dang dkar po dang nag po'i zhal can no //
analyzed: lhor rin chen 'byung ldan kha dog dmar po ste g-yas skor gyis dmar po dang dkar po dang nag po'i zhal can no //
translated: In the south, Ratnasa·πÉbhava is red, with red, white, and black faces in order to the right.

original: byang du snang ba mtha' yas dkar po ste g-yas skor gyis dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'i zhal can no //
analyzed: byang du snang ba mtha' yas dkar po ste g-yas skor gyis dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'i zhal can no //
translated: In the north is white AmitƒÅbha, with white, black, and red faces in order to the right.

original: nub tu rnam par snang mdzad ser po ste g-yas skor gyis ser po dang dkar po dang nag po'i zhal can no //
analyzed: nub tu rnam par snang mdzad ser po ste g-yas skor gyis ser po dang dkar po dang nag po'i zhal can no //
translated: In the west is yellow Vairocana, with yellow, white, and black faces in order to the right.

original: de ltar bzhi ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ste nyin mo bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
analyzed: de ltar bzhi ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ste nyin mo bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
translated: Thus the four are on sun ma·πá·∏çalas, from the explanatory tantra known as the Vajra Lord of the Day.

original: mer sgrol ma don yod grub pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mer sgrol ma don yod grub pa lta bu'o //
translated: In the southeast is TƒÅrƒÅ, like Amoghasiddhi.

original: bden bral du gos dkar mo rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu'o //
analyzed: bden bral du gos dkar mo rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu'o //
translated: In the southwest is PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´, like Ratnasa·πÉbhava.

original: dbang ldan du m'a ma k'i snang ba mtha' yas lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du m'a ma k'i snang ba mtha' yas lta bu'o //
translated: In the northwest is MƒÅmakƒ´, like AmitƒÅbha.

original: rlung du spyan ma rnam par snang mdzad lta bu'o //
analyzed: rlung du spyan ma rnam par snang mdzad lta bu'o //
translated: In the northeast is LochanƒÅ, like Vairocana.

original: de ltar bzhi ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ste mtshan mo shes rab rab tu grags zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
analyzed: de ltar bzhi ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ste mtshan mo shes rab rab tu grags zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
translated: Thus the four are on moon ma·πá·∏çalas, from the explanatory tantra known as the Praj√±ƒÅ of the Night.

original: slar yang lha dang lha mo de dag gi bar gyi mtshams brgyad du bdud rtsi'i bum pa brgyad do //
analyzed: slar yang lha dang lha mo de dag gi bar gyi mtshams brgyad du bdud rtsi'i bum pa brgyad do //
translated: Again, in the eight intermediate directions there are eight vases of nectar.

original: de ltar lha dang lha mo nag dang dmar dang ser ba dang ni ri bong 'dzin pa lta bur dkar ba ste zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar lha dang lha mo nag dang dmar dang ser ba dang ni ri bong 'dzin pa lta bur dkar ba ste zhes so //
translated: Thus, the gods and goddesses are black, red, yellow, and white like the moon.

original: shar gyi sgor khro bo shin tu stobs te kha dog dang zhal dang phyag ni don yod grub pa lta bu nag po'o //üîΩlho'i @38b sgor rmugs byed de kha dog dang zhal dang phyag ni rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu dmar po'o //
analyzed: shar gyi sgor khro bo shin tu stobs te kha dog dang zhal dang phyag ni don yod grub pa lta bu nag po'o // lho'i @38b sgor rmugs byed de kha dog dang zhal dang phyag ni rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu dmar po'o //
translated: At the eastern gate is the wrathful one Very Powerful, whose color, faces, and hands are like Amoghasiddhi's, that is, black.üîΩAt the southern gate is Stupefier, whose color, faces, and hands are like Ratnasambhava's, that is, red.

original: nub kyi sgor rengs byed de kha dog dang zhal dang phyag ni rnam par snang mdzad lta bu ser po'o //
analyzed: nub kyi sgor rengs byed de kha dog dang zhal dang phyag ni rnam par snang mdzad lta bu ser po'o //
translated: At the western gate is Paralyzer, whose color, faces, and hands are like Vairocana's, that is, yellow.

original: byang du khengs byed de kha dog dang zhal dang phyag ni snang ba mtha' yas lta bu dkar po'o //
analyzed: byang du khengs byed de kha dog dang zhal dang phyag ni snang ba mtha' yas lta bu dkar po'o //
translated: At the northern gate is Inflater, whose color, faces, and hands are like AmitƒÅbha's, that is, white.

original: steng du gtsug tor te kha dog dang zhal dang phyag ni mi bskyod pa lta bu ljang khu'o //
analyzed: steng du gtsug tor te kha dog dang zhal dang phyag ni mi bskyod pa lta bu ljang khu'o //
translated: Above is the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a, whose color, faces, and hands are like Ak·π£obhya's, that is, green.

original: 'on kyang khro bo 'di rnams g-yas brkyang pa ste khro bo'i lha mo rnams ni g-yon brkyang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang khro bo 'di rnams g-yas brkyang pa ste khro bo'i lha mo rnams ni g-yon brkyang ngo //
translated: However, these wrathful ones are right-footed, and the wrathful goddesses are left-footed.

original: zla ba bzhi pa la ming dang gzugs skye ba'i dus su gzugs 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid dang rlung dang me dang sa dang chu'i khams kyi bdag nyid de des na khams dang phung po dang khro bo rnams spro ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba bzhi pa la ming dang gzugs skye ba'i dus su gzugs 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid dang rlung dang me dang sa dang chu'i khams kyi bdag nyid de des na khams dang phung po dang khro bo rnams spro ba'o //
translated: In the fourth month, when name-and-form arises, form is the nature of the four great elements, and the nature of the wind, fire, earth, and water elements. Therefore, the elements, aggregates, and wrathful ones are emanated.

original: de nas zla ba lnga pa la skye mched drug skye ba'i dus su nam mkha'i snying po la sogs pa spro bar bya ste mkha' snying la sogs zhes pa ni 'dir rlung las skyes pa sna ni nam mkha'i snying po dbyibs la sogs pa don yod grub pa
analyzed: de nas zla ba lnga pa la skye mched drug skye ba'i dus su nam mkha'i snying po la sogs pa spro bar bya ste mkha' snying la sogs zhes pa ni 'dir rlung las skyes pa sna ni nam mkha'i snying po dbyibs la sogs pa don yod grub pa
translated: Then, in the fifth month, when the six sense bases arise, Akashagarbha and so on are emanated. ‚ÄúAkashagarbha and so on‚Äù means that the nose, which arises from wind, is Akashagarbha, and shape and so on are Amoghasiddhi.

original: lta bu ste shar gyi sgo'i g-yas su ra ba'i rtsig pa la ste phyogs su'o //
analyzed: lta bu ste shar gyi sgo'i g-yas su ra ba'i rtsig pa la ste phyogs su'o //
translated: They are on the right of the eastern door, on the wall of the enclosure, in the directions.

original: phyogs bral du gnas ni me'i zur du rlung las skyes pa reg bya rdo rje ma ste dbyibs la sogs pa sgrol ma lta bu'o //üîΩde bzhin du lho'i sgo'i g-yas su me las skyes pa mig ni sa'i snying po ste dbyibs la sogs pa rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyogs bral du gnas ni me'i zur du rlung las skyes pa reg bya rdo rje ma ste dbyibs la sogs pa sgrol ma lta bu'o // de bzhin du lho'i sgo'i g-yas su me las skyes pa mig ni sa'i snying po ste dbyibs la sogs pa rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu'o //
translated: In the southwest corner, born from fire, is the goddess of touch, SparshavajrƒÅ, whose shape and so forth are like TƒÅrƒÅ.üîΩSimilarly, to the right of the southern gate, born from fire, is the eye, Kshitigarbha, whose shape and so forth are like Ratnasambhava.

original: de bzhin du bden bral gyi zur du me'i khams las skyes pa ro rdo rje ma ni gos dkar mo lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bden bral gyi zur du me'i khams las skyes pa ro rdo rje ma ni gos dkar mo lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, in the southeast corner, born from the fire element, is the goddess of taste, RasavajrƒÅ, who is like PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´.

original: nub kyi sgo'i g-yas su sa las skyes pa lus kyi dbang po ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba ste rnam par snang mdzad lta bu'o //
analyzed: nub kyi sgo'i g-yas su sa las skyes pa lus kyi dbang po ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba ste rnam par snang mdzad lta bu'o //
translated: To the right of the western gate, born from earth, is the body sense base, Sarvanƒ´vara·πáavi·π£kambhin, whose shape and so forth are like Vairochana.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi zur du sa'i khams las skyes pa dri rdo rje ma ni spyan ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi zur du sa'i khams las skyes pa dri rdo rje ma ni spyan ma lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, in the northeast corner, born from the earth element, is the goddess of smell, GandhavajrƒÅ, who is like MƒÅmakƒ´.

original: byang gi sgo'i g-yas su chu las skyes pa lce ni 'jig rten dbang phyug ste snang ba mtha' yas lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgo'i g-yas su chu las skyes pa lce ni 'jig rten dbang phyug ste snang ba mtha' yas lta bu'o //
translated: To the right of the northern gate, born from water, is the tongue, Loke≈õvara, whose shape and so forth are like AmitƒÅbha.

original: dbang ldan du chu las skyes pa gzugs rdo rje ma ni m'a ma k'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du chu las skyes pa gzugs rdo rje ma ni m'a ma k'i lta bu'o //
translated: In the northeast corner is the water-born goddess RupavajrƒÅ, who is like MƒÅmakƒ´.

original: 'og tu ye shes kyi khams las skyes pa yid ni kun tu bzang po kha dog sngon po zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa kha dog dus kyi 'khor lo lta bu ste shar gyi sgo'i g-yon du ra ba'i rtsig pa la'o //üîΩde bzhin du ye shes kyi khams las skyes pa sgra rdo rje ma ni kun tu bzang po @39a * //
analyzed: 'og tu ye shes kyi khams las skyes pa yid ni kun tu bzang po kha dog sngon po zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa kha dog dus kyi 'khor lo lta bu ste shar gyi sgo'i g-yon du ra ba'i rtsig pa la'o // de bzhin du ye shes kyi khams las skyes pa sgra rdo rje ma ni kun tu bzang po @39a * //
translated: Below, the mind born from the element of wisdom is Samantabhadra, who is blue, has three faces, and holds six objects. He is like KƒÅlacakra and is in the left corner of the eastern gate.

original: lta bu ste byang gi sgo'i g-yon du'o //
analyzed: lta bu ste byang gi sgo'i g-yon du'o //
translated: Similarly, the sound-born goddess ≈öabdavajrƒÅ, who is born from the element of wisdom, is like Samantabhadra and is in the left corner of the northern gate.

original: steng du nam mkha'i khams las skyes pa rna ba ni phyag na rdo rje ljang khu mi bskyod pa lta bu ste lho'i sgo'i g-yon du'o //
analyzed: steng du nam mkha'i khams las skyes pa rna ba ni phyag na rdo rje ljang khu mi bskyod pa lta bu ste lho'i sgo'i g-yon du'o //
translated: Above, the ear born from the element of space is green VajrapƒÅ·πái, who is like Ak·π£obhya and is in the left corner of the southern gate.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha'i khams las skyes pa chos kyi khams kyi rdo rje ma ni phyag na rdo rje lta bu ste nub kyi sgo'i g-yon du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha'i khams las skyes pa chos kyi khams kyi rdo rje ma ni phyag na rdo rje lta bu ste nub kyi sgo'i g-yon du'o //
translated: Similarly, the Dharma-element-born goddess DharmavajrƒÅ, who is born from the element of space, is like VajrapƒÅ·πái and is in the left corner of the western gate.

original: de ltar zla ba lnga pa la skye mched drug dang drug pa la reg pa zhes pa'i shes par byed pas reg bya la sogs pa'i yul rnams te de ltar skye mched bcu gnyis spro ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zla ba lnga pa la skye mched drug dang drug pa la reg pa zhes pa'i shes par byed pas reg bya la sogs pa'i yul rnams te de ltar skye mched bcu gnyis spro ba'o //
translated: Thus, in the fifth month, the six sense bases; and in the sixth month, contact.

original: sku rdo rje'i gnas skabs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje'i gnas skabs gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second stage of the Vajra Body.

original: 'dir shar dang byang dang steng na gnas pa'i lha dang lha mo nag po dang dkar po rnams ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la dgod par bya ste nam mkha' dang rlung dang chu'i khams rnams khu ba'i chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir shar dang byang dang steng na gnas pa'i lha dang lha mo nag po dang dkar po rnams ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la dgod par bya ste nam mkha' dang rlung dang chu'i khams rnams khu ba'i chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, the black and white gods and goddesses who dwell in the east, north, and above should be placed on moon discs, because the space, wind, and water elements have the nature of semen.

original: yang na phyogs bral du gnas pa zur gyi lha mo rnams zla ba la ste mtshan mo shes rab rab tu grags zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na phyogs bral du gnas pa zur gyi lha mo rnams zla ba la ste mtshan mo shes rab rab tu grags zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the corner goddesses who dwell in the intermediate directions should be on moon discs, because it is said that ‚Äúat night, wisdom is well known.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du lho dang nub dang 'og na gnas pa'i lha dang lha mo dmar ba dang ser ba rnams ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ste ye shes dang me dang sa'i khams rnams rdul gyi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang nub dang 'og na gnas pa'i lha dang lha mo dmar ba dang ser ba rnams ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ste ye shes dang me dang sa'i khams rnams rdul gyi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, the red and yellow gods and goddesses who dwell in the south, west, and below are on the sun mandala, because the elements of wisdom, fire, and earth have the quality of dust.

original: yang na phyogs na gnas pa'i lha rnams nyi ma la ste nyin mo bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na phyogs na gnas pa'i lha rnams nyi ma la ste nyin mo bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the gods who dwell in the directions are on the sun, because it is said that the sun is the Blessed One, the vajra holder.

original: de ltar gang zhig bcom ldan 'das la mngon du phyogs pa de ni gtso bo ste phyogs rnams su'o //
analyzed: de ltar gang zhig bcom ldan 'das la mngon du phyogs pa de ni gtso bo ste phyogs rnams su'o //
translated: Thus, those who face the Blessed One are the principal ones, in the directions.

original: bcom ldan 'das la mngon du phyogs pa'i lha mo ni gtso mo ste phyogs bral rnams su'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mngon du phyogs pa'i lha mo ni gtso mo ste phyogs bral rnams su'o //
translated: The goddesses who face the Blessed One are the principal ones, in the intermediate directions.

original: gzhan du phyogs pa ni gtso bo ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du phyogs pa ni gtso bo ma yin pa'o //
translated: Those who face elsewhere are not principal.

original: de'i phyir shes rab phang bar thabs ni gtso bo ma yin pa ste padma dang zla ba la zur gyi char phyogs bral rnams su'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab phang bar thabs ni gtso bo ma yin pa ste padma dang zla ba la zur gyi char phyogs bral rnams su'o //
translated: Therefore, the method, which is the consort, is not principal, on the lotus and moon, in the intermediate directions.

original: de bzhin du thabs kyi lha rnams kyi phang par yang lha mo gtso mo ma yin pa ste nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la phyogs rnams su'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs kyi lha rnams kyi phang par yang lha mo gtso mo ma yin pa ste nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la phyogs rnams su'o //
translated: Likewise, on the laps of the male deities, there are goddesses, but not the principal ones, on the sun ma·πá·∏çalas in the directions.

original: gnyis po dag gi rang gi phyag gi chu skyes 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rang rang mtshan mas mtshan pa dag gis phan tshun 'khyud //
analyzed: gnyis po dag gi rang gi phyag gi chu skyes 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rang rang mtshan mas mtshan pa dag gis phan tshun 'khyud //
translated: The two are embracing each other with their own lotuses, which are marked with their own individual signs, which will be explained.

original: mtshan ma gang zhig gang gi g-yas kyi dang po'i phyag mthil na de de yi phyag rgya chus skyes dman //
analyzed: mtshan ma gang zhig gang gi g-yas kyi dang po'i phyag mthil na de de yi phyag rgya chus skyes dman //
translated: Whatever sign is in the right palm of the first [hand] is the seal of that [deity], and the lotus is inferior.

original: chus skyes kyi mtshan ma dang rin po che dang ral gri ni g-yon dang g-yas su yang thun mong ngo //
analyzed: chus skyes kyi mtshan ma dang rin po che dang ral gri ni g-yon dang g-yas su yang thun mong ngo //
translated: The signs of the lotus, jewel, and sword are common to both the left and right [hands].

original: de ltar @39b shar dang nub dang g-yon dang g-yas dang 'og dang steng du shes rab thabs kyis 'khor lo mchog gi bde bar gnas pa'i rdo rje'i 'dug stangs dag gis bzhugs pa ni thabs 'dren pa ste padma'i 'dug stangs kyis bzhugs pa ni lha mo'i tshogs 'dren
analyzed: de ltar @39b shar dang nub dang g-yon dang g-yas dang 'og dang steng du shes rab thabs kyis 'khor lo mchog gi bde bar gnas pa'i rdo rje'i 'dug stangs dag gis bzhugs pa ni thabs 'dren pa ste padma'i 'dug stangs kyis bzhugs pa ni lha mo'i tshogs 'dren
translated: Thus, in the east, west, left, right, below, and above, the supreme wheel of method and wisdom abides with the vajra posture of bliss, drawing in the method, and the lotus posture, drawing in the assembly of goddesses.

original: ma'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: ma'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The word indeed is a determinative.

original: da ni nag po rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pas mtshan ma rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni nag po rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pas mtshan ma rnams gsungs te /
translated: Now, the signs of the black ones, etc., are stated.

original: 'dir rigs drug gi phung po rnam par dag pas mtshan ma drug rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir rigs drug gi phung po rnam par dag pas mtshan ma drug rnams so //

translated: in the west lƒÅsya and vƒÅditrƒ´, in the north gƒ´tƒÅ and n·πõtyƒÅ, in the sky rƒÅgƒÅ and i·π£·π≠ƒÅ, and below purƒ´ and ≈õodhƒ´.üîΩIn the case of the sand mandala, any goddesses who are located in the sky or below should be visualized below the eastern and western archways.

original: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la mkha' dang 'og na gnas pa'i lha mo gang su yang rung ba de rnams ni shar dang nub kyi rta babs kyi 'og tu blta bar bya ste phyogs skyong la sogs pa rnams bsgom pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i gnas nyid du'o

translated: The directions protectors and so on should be visualized in their respective places as taught in the tantras.

original: // sgo'i g-yon gyi kun du bzang po la sogs pa bzhi yang de bzhin no zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: // sgo'i g-yon gyi kun du bzang po la sogs pa bzhi yang de bzhin no zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The four beginning with Samantabhadra to the left of the door are also like that.

original: de ltar mchod pa'i lha mo rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du mtha' yas pa'i gzungs ma rnams ni snam bu la ste stegs bu la'o //
analyzed: de ltar mchod pa'i lha mo rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du mtha' yas pa'i gzungs ma rnams ni snam bu la ste stegs bu la'o //
translated: Just as the offering goddesses, so the infinite female consorts are on the platforms, that is, on the ledges.

original: de bzhin du gdeng sa can rigs dang bcas pa'i phyir 'dod ma rnams sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du stegs bu la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gdeng sa can rigs dang bcas pa'i phyir 'dod ma rnams sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du stegs bu la'o //
translated: Similarly, the desire goddesses are on the ledges outside the body mandala, because they are of the same class as the platform goddesses.

original: de'i phyir gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi stegs bu la 'dod ma rnams so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi stegs bu la 'dod ma rnams so ;
translated: Therefore, the desire goddesses are on the ledge of the speech mandala.

original: / de la shar du sgrol ma las skyes pa dbye bar 'dod ma dang lhor gos dkar mo las skyes pa bskyod par 'dod ma dang byang du m'a ma k'i las skyes pa rgyas par 'dod ma dang nub tu spyan ma las skyes pa rengs par 'dod ma
analyzed: / de la shar du sgrol ma las skyes pa dbye bar 'dod ma dang lhor gos dkar mo las skyes pa bskyod par 'dod ma dang byang du m'a ma k'i las skyes pa rgyas par 'dod ma dang nub tu spyan ma las skyes pa rengs par 'dod ma
translated: There, in the east is the desire goddess born from Tara, who is called the desire to separate; in the south is the desire goddess born from Pandaravasini, who is called the desire to move; in the north is the desire goddess born from Mamaki, who is called the desire to expand; and in the west is the desire goddess born from Lochana, who is called the desire to paralyze.

original: ste de ltar lha mo sgrol ma la sogs dag pa yis so //
analyzed: ste de ltar lha mo sgrol ma la sogs dag pa yis so //
translated: Thus, by the pure goddesses Tara and so on.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma las skyes pa ni srid gsum skyed ma gsod par 'dod ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma las skyes pa ni srid gsum skyed ma gsod par 'dod ma'o //
translated: Vajradhatvi≈õvarƒ´-born is the desire for the killing of the mother who gives birth to the three worlds.

original: sna tshogs yul las skyes pa ni skyed par 'dod ma'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs yul las skyes pa ni skyed par 'dod ma'o //
translated: The desire for the creation of the various objects is the desire for the mother who gives birth.

original: de bzhin du sgra las skyes pa rol mo 'dod ma dang gzugs las skyes pa rgyan 'dod ma dang / ro las skyes pa zas 'dod ma dang / dri las skyes pa dri 'dod ma dang / reg bya las skyes pa gos 'dod ma dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra las skyes pa rol mo 'dod ma dang gzugs las skyes pa rgyan 'dod ma dang / ro las skyes pa zas 'dod ma dang / dri las skyes pa dri 'dod ma dang / reg bya las skyes pa gos 'dod ma dang /
translated: Similarly, sound-born is the desire for music, form-born is the desire for ornaments, taste-born is the desire for food, smell-born is the desire for scent, touch-born is the desire for clothing,

original: chos kyi khams las skyes pa 'khrig pa 'dod ma ste /
analyzed: chos kyi khams las skyes pa 'khrig pa 'dod ma ste /
translated: and dharma-realm-born is the desire for sexual intercourse.

original: shar la sogs pa'i stegs bu rnams la rigs kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i stegs bu rnams la rigs kyi dbye bas so //
translated: These are the desires of the goddesses born from the elements on the platforms of east and so forth, differentiated by type.

original: ts'a mu na d'a las skyes pa @45a * //
analyzed: ts'a mu na d'a las skyes pa @45a * //
translated: Born from CƒÅmu·πá·∏çƒÅ is the desire to scratch the body.üîΩBorn from Vi·π£·πáu is the desire to spit in the mouth, born from VƒÅrƒÅhƒ´ is the desire for the body‚Äôs filth, born from KumƒÅrƒ´ is the desire to dance,

original: lus la 'phrug par 'dod ma dang / khyab 'jug ma las skyes pa kha na gnas pa'i mchil ma 'dor bar 'dod ma dang / phag mo las skyes pa lus kyi dri ma 'dod ma dang / gzhon nu ma las skyes pa gar 'dod ma dang /
analyzed: lus la 'phrug par 'dod ma dang / khyab 'jug ma las skyes pa kha na gnas pa'i mchil ma 'dor bar 'dod ma dang / phag mo las skyes pa lus kyi dri ma 'dod ma dang / gzhon nu ma las skyes pa gar 'dod ma dang /
translated: and born from Aindrƒ´ is the desire to urinate.

original: drag mo las skyes bstan 'dod ma dang / tshangs ma las skyes pa chu la rkyal bar 'dod ma dang / dbang po las skyes pa mal stan la snyes par 'dod ma dang / dpal mo las skyes pa rgyal srid 'dod ma ste ts'a mu na d'a la sogs pa brgyad kyi bya ba rnams so //üîΩde bzhin sa la khro skyes rnams kyi 'dod ma ste 'dir shin tu sngon mo las skyes pa kun du gdung ba 'dod ma dang / rengs byed ma las skyes pa gnyen pa 'dod ma dang / nga rgyal ma las skyes pa 'jam par smra ba 'dod ma dang /
analyzed: drag mo las skyes bstan 'dod ma dang / tshangs ma las skyes pa chu la rkyal bar 'dod ma dang / dbang po las skyes pa mal stan la snyes par 'dod ma dang / dpal mo las skyes pa rgyal srid 'dod ma ste ts'a mu na d'a la sogs pa brgyad kyi bya ba rnams so // de bzhin sa la khro skyes rnams kyi 'dod ma ste 'dir shin tu sngon mo las skyes pa kun du gdung ba 'dod ma dang / rengs byed ma las skyes pa gnyen pa 'dod ma dang / nga rgyal ma las skyes pa 'jam par smra ba 'dod ma dang /
translated: The eight activities are those of the eight goddesses born from the eight Rudras:üîΩthe goddess born from the Rudra of the east, who desires to teach; the goddess born from the Rudra of the south, who desires to swim in water; the goddess born from the Rudra of the west, who desires to lie on a bed; the goddess born from the Rudra of the north, who desires to rule; and the goddesses born from the Rudras of the intermediate directions, who desire to enjoy the five objects of desire.

original: rmugs byed ma las skyes pa skems 'dod ma dang / shin tu stobs ma las skyes pa skrod 'dod ma dang / de bzhin du rdo rje lcags sgrog ma las skyes pa reg bya 'dod ma dang / khro gnyer can las skyes pa dgug 'dod ma dang /
analyzed: rmugs byed ma las skyes pa skems 'dod ma dang / shin tu stobs ma las skyes pa skrod 'dod ma dang / de bzhin du rdo rje lcags sgrog ma las skyes pa reg bya 'dod ma dang / khro gnyer can las skyes pa dgug 'dod ma dang /
translated: Similarly, there are eight goddesses born from the eight Rudras of the directions. Here, the goddess born from the Rudra of the northeast, who desires to burn, is blue in color; the goddess born from the Rudra of the southeast, who desires to embrace, is yellow; the goddess born from the Rudra of the southwest, who desires to speak gently, is red; the goddess born from the Rudra of the northwest, who desires to dry up, is black; the goddess born from the Rudra of the nadir, who desires to expel, is white; the goddess born from the Rudra of the zenith, who desires to touch, is green; the goddess born from the Rudra of the east, who desires to summon, is red; and the goddess born from the Rudra of the west, who desires to bind, is white.

original: tsun d'a las skyes pa 'ching 'dod ma dang / 'od zer can las skyes pa phur bus 'debs par 'dod ma dang / drag spyan ma las skyes pa rgyug par 'dod ma'o //
analyzed: tsun d'a las skyes pa 'ching 'dod ma dang / 'od zer can las skyes pa phur bus 'debs par 'dod ma dang / drag spyan ma las skyes pa rgyug par 'dod ma'o //
translated: The one born from Cunda is the one who desires to bind, the one born from Marici is the one who desires to stab with a dagger, and the one born from Rudra is the one who desires to run.

original: de bzhin du lha min rigs las skyes pa rnams kyi 'dod ma rnams ni khyi gdong ma las skyes pa yan lag thams cad bskyod par 'dod ma dang / phag gdong ma las skyes pa bshang gci zag par 'dod ma dang / ce spyang gdod ma las skyes pa sems can rnams la slu bar 'dod ma dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha min rigs las skyes pa rnams kyi 'dod ma rnams ni khyi gdong ma las skyes pa yan lag thams cad bskyod par 'dod ma dang / phag gdong ma las skyes pa bshang gci zag par 'dod ma dang / ce spyang gdod ma las skyes pa sems can rnams la slu bar 'dod ma dang /
translated: Similarly, the ones born from the class of demigods are the one who desires to shake all limbs, born from the one with a dog face; the one who desires to eat feces and urine, born from the one with a pig face; the one who desires to deceive sentient beings, born from the one with a jackal face;

original: stag gdong ma las skyes pa rtsod pa mad po 'dod ma dang / bya rog gdong ma las skyes pa lhag ma za bar 'dod ma dang / bya rgod gdong ma las skyes pa g-yul 'dod ma dang / mkha' lding gdong ma las skyes pa sbrul 'ching bar 'dod ma dang /
analyzed: stag gdong ma las skyes pa rtsod pa mad po 'dod ma dang / bya rog gdong ma las skyes pa lhag ma za bar 'dod ma dang / bya rgod gdong ma las skyes pa g-yul 'dod ma dang / mkha' lding gdong ma las skyes pa sbrul 'ching bar 'dod ma dang /
translated: the one who desires to fight, born from the one with a tiger face; the one who desires to eat leftovers, born from the one with a crow face; the one who desires war, born from the one with a vulture face; and the one who desires to bind snakes, born from the one with a garu·∏ça face.

original: 'ug gdong ma las skyes pa byis pa khro bar 'dod ma ste /
analyzed: 'ug gdong ma las skyes pa byis pa khro bar 'dod ma ste /
translated: The one born from Owl-Face is the child who desires to be angry.

original: 'dod ma sum cu rtsa bdun rnams ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor la rang gi rigs kyi dbye bas rang rang gi phyogs rnams su'o //
analyzed: 'dod ma sum cu rtsa bdun rnams ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor la rang gi rigs kyi dbye bas rang rang gi phyogs rnams su'o //
translated: The thirty-seven desire goddesses are on the mandala of speech, in their respective directions, by the division of their own families.

original: de bzhin du @45b sum cu rtsa bdun phyir 'dod ma rnams zhes pa 'dod ma rnams las bzlog ba ni phyir 'dod ma zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du @45b sum cu rtsa bdun phyir 'dod ma rnams zhes pa 'dod ma rnams las bzlog ba ni phyir 'dod ma zhes brjod de /
translated: Similarly, the thirty-seven reverse desire goddesses are called reverse desire goddesses because they are the opposite of the desire goddesses.

original: de rnams sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi stegs bu la rang gi rigs kyi dbang gis rang rang gi phyogs rnams su'o zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi stegs bu la rang gi rigs kyi dbang gis rang rang gi phyogs rnams su'o zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
translated: They are on the terrace of the mandala of body, in their respective directions, by the power of their own families. This is the rule for all.

original: de ltar phyi yi dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi snam bu la gzhan yang nyin zhag so so'i dus su gang zhig cung zad sems can gyi bya ba 'dod pa de thams cad 'dir khams kyi dbang gis rnal 'byor ma yi bya ba'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o
analyzed: de ltar phyi yi dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi snam bu la gzhan yang nyin zhag so so'i dus su gang zhig cung zad sems can gyi bya ba 'dod pa de thams cad 'dir khams kyi dbang gis rnal 'byor ma yi bya ba'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o
translated: Thus, on the outer ledge of the outer mandala, moreover, whatever little activity of sentient beings is desired at each time of the day, all of that is the activity of the yoginƒ´s here by the power of the elements. This is the rule.

analyzed: pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par gsungs te /

analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi sems brtan par bya ba'i don du'o //

original: ni rdul phra rab kyi rdzas sa dang chu dang me dang rlung ste 'byung ba bzhi po rnams dang nam mkha'i khams ni zla ba dang rjes su nga ro 'am khu ba'am de bzhin du rdul lam thig le gnyis dang nyi ma yang nam mkha'i khams dang de
analyzed: ni rdul phra rab kyi rdzas sa dang chu dang me dang rlung ste 'byung ba bzhi po rnams dang nam mkha'i khams ni zla ba dang rjes su nga ro 'am khu ba'am de bzhin du rdul lam thig le gnyis dang nyi ma yang nam mkha'i khams dang de
translated: The six elements are the four primary elements of earth, water, fire, and wind, which are the subtle particles of substance, the space element, which is the moon and the semen or fluid, and likewise the two drops or vital essences, and the sun, which is the space element and the blood.

original: bzhin du sgra gcan rnam par shes pa'i khams te de ltar khams drug gi bdag nyid can skyes bu chen po'i gang zag ni dngos po'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: bzhin du sgra gcan rnam par shes pa'i khams te de ltar khams drug gi bdag nyid can skyes bu chen po'i gang zag ni dngos po'i skye ba'o //
translated: The person who is the nature of these six elements is the birth of entities.

original: dngos po'i skye ba de'i 'byung ba ni spro ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i skye ba de'i 'byung ba ni spro ba'o //
translated: The arising of that birth of entities is the emanation.

original: nyams pa ni sdud pa ste de gnyis las 'byung ba las skyes pa rnams yang dag par gnas so //
analyzed: nyams pa ni sdud pa ste de gnyis las 'byung ba las skyes pa rnams yang dag par gnas so //
translated: The dissolution is the gathering. From those two, those born from the elements abide.

original: de ltar sa'i skye ba ni ljon shing la sogs pa brtan pa rnams dang chu'i skye ba ni drod gsher las skyes pa rnams dang me'i skye ba ni mngal skyes rnams dang / rlung gi skye ba ni sgong skyes rnams dang zla ba'i skye ba ni klu dang lha ma yin rnams dang nyi ma'i skye ba ni 'byung po dang lha rnams dang sgra gcan gyi skye ba ni gzugs med rnams dang dus me'i skye ba ni dmyal ba rnams so
analyzed: de ltar sa'i skye ba ni ljon shing la sogs pa brtan pa rnams dang chu'i skye ba ni drod gsher las skyes pa rnams dang me'i skye ba ni mngal skyes rnams dang / rlung gi skye ba ni sgong skyes rnams dang zla ba'i skye ba ni klu dang lha ma yin rnams dang nyi ma'i skye ba ni 'byung po dang lha rnams dang sgra gcan gyi skye ba ni gzugs med rnams dang dus me'i skye ba ni dmyal ba rnams so
translated: Thus, the birth of earth is for those born from heat and moisture, the birth of water is for those born from heat and moisture, the birth of fire is for those born from wombs, the birth of wind is for those born from eggs, the birth of the moon is for nƒÅgas and demigods, the birth of the sun is for elementals and gods, the birth of RƒÅhu is for those in the formless realm, and the birth of time is for hell beings.

original: // @46a * //  de ltar skye ba rnam pa brgyad ni dngos po'i rang bzhin can te dngos po'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: // @46a * //  de ltar skye ba rnam pa brgyad ni dngos po'i rang bzhin can te dngos po'i skye ba'o //
translated: These eight types of birth are of the nature of entities, that is, they are the birth of entities.

original: de la rtag ba mkha' yi rdo rje zhes pa la 'dir mkha' zhes pa ni dgu pa nam mkha'i rdul phra rab kyi rdzas dang bral ba mi chos pa ste gcad du med pa dang dbyer med pa nyid phyir dang rdzas med pa'i phyir mkha' yi rdo rje
analyzed: de la rtag ba mkha' yi rdo rje zhes pa la 'dir mkha' zhes pa ni dgu pa nam mkha'i rdul phra rab kyi rdzas dang bral ba mi chos pa ste gcad du med pa dang dbyer med pa nyid phyir dang rdzas med pa'i phyir mkha' yi rdo rje
translated: The eternal is the ‚Äúvajra of space.‚Äù Here, ‚Äúspace‚Äù is the ninth, the element of space, which is devoid of the substance of the subtle particles of space, is not a phenomenon, is indivisible, and is not a substance.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni rtag pa ste nam mkha'i khams de thams cad na gnas pa nyid kyi phyir rnam gsum srid pa la gnas kyang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni rtag pa ste nam mkha'i khams de thams cad na gnas pa nyid kyi phyir rnam gsum srid pa la gnas kyang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The element of space is eternal because it is present everywhere. It is not impermanent, even though it is present in the three worlds.

original: sngar brjod pa'i 'byung po'i tshogs ni rtag pa min par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po mig 'phrul ji bzhin nyid du brtags na med pa zhes pa'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i 'byung po'i tshogs ni rtag pa min par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po mig 'phrul ji bzhin nyid du brtags na med pa zhes pa'i rigs pa las so //
translated: The collection of elements mentioned earlier are not eternal because, when examined, they are like an illusion, O Lord of humans.

original: de ltar rnam par dpyad kyang rtag pa stong pa chen po mthong zhing mi rtag pa rdul phra rab phrad pa dang 'bral ba yang mthong ste gnyi ga sangs rgyas nyid kyi sgrub thabs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dpyad kyang rtag pa stong pa chen po mthong zhing mi rtag pa rdul phra rab phrad pa dang 'bral ba yang mthong ste gnyi ga sangs rgyas nyid kyi sgrub thabs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though one analyzes in this way, one sees the great emptiness of permanence and one sees the impermanence of the separation of the conjunction of subtle atoms. Both are not a means of accomplishing buddhahood.

original: de lta na yang blun po'i blo can byis pa rnams gzhug pa dang sems ni dag pa'i don slad du kye mi'i bdag po zla ba bzang po khyod kyis sgrub thabs dag ni brjod par bya ste don dam par ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i dngos po
analyzed: de lta na yang blun po'i blo can byis pa rnams gzhug pa dang sems ni dag pa'i don slad du kye mi'i bdag po zla ba bzang po khyod kyis sgrub thabs dag ni brjod par bya ste don dam par ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i dngos po
translated: Even so, O lord of men, you, Su≈õƒ´macandra, should speak of the means of accomplishment for the sake of introducing and purifying the minds of foolish beings. Ultimately, there is nothing to be accomplished here, whether a permanent or impermanent entity,

original: snying por gyur pa 'ga' yang 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba med do //
analyzed: snying por gyur pa 'ga' yang 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba med do //
translated: or anything that has become an essence.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa de nyid ni zhes pa nges pa ste 'dir gang zhig brtags pa'i sgrub thabs de ni 'khrul pa zhes pa rdo rje can gyi sgrub thabs mtha' dag gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa de nyid ni zhes pa nges pa ste 'dir gang zhig brtags pa'i sgrub thabs de ni 'khrul pa zhes pa rdo rje can gyi sgrub thabs mtha' dag gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that very accomplishment of whatever is to be accomplished for the sake of Buddhahood is ascertained. Here, whatever is to be examined is the means of accomplishment, and all the means of accomplishment of the vajra holder are said to be deluded.

original: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba ste brtags pa dang bral ba dag ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbang por bya'o /
analyzed: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba ste brtags pa dang bral ba dag ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbang por bya'o /
translated: Therefore, O King, the pure mind, free from conceptualization, should be made the lord of the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment.

original: da ni dpal ldan zhes pa la sogs pas rten dang brten pa gsungs te sku gsungs thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dpal ldan rdo rje can gtso bo ni thugs rdo rje 'gyur te mi bdag sku gsungs thugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ni sku yi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: da ni dpal ldan zhes pa la sogs pas rten dang brten pa gsungs te sku gsungs thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dpal ldan rdo rje can gtso bo ni thugs rdo rje 'gyur te mi bdag sku gsungs thugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ni sku yi rdo rje'o //
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúthe glorious one,‚Äù the support and the supported are described. The glorious vajra holder, the principal one of the ma·πá·∏çalas of body, speech, and mind, is the mind vajra. The ma·πá·∏çala of the characteristics of body, speech, and mind of the lord of men is the body vajra.

original: lha rnams 'khor lo a'a li k'a li'i rigs skyes gsung gi rdo rje zla ba nyi ma'i steng du'o //
analyzed: lha rnams 'khor lo a'a li k'a li'i rigs skyes gsung gi rdo rje zla ba nyi ma'i steng du'o //
translated: The deities born in the family of the wheel, AlikƒÅli, are the speech vajra, on the sun and moon.

original: de ltar gsungs dang sku'i dkyil 'khor la yang lha'i tshogs ni gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsungs dang sku'i dkyil 'khor la yang lha'i tshogs ni gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: Thus, the assembly of deities in the body mandala is the vajra speech.

original: de ltar sku'i rnam pas thugs rnam par gsum dang @46b dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pas sku rnam pa gsum dang so sor brjod pas gsung yang rnam pa gsum mo zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sku'i rnam pas thugs rnam par gsum dang @46b dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pas sku rnam pa gsum dang so sor brjod pas gsung yang rnam pa gsum mo zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the body is threefold by way of the body mandala, the speech is threefold by way of the speech mandala, and the mind is threefold by way of the mind mandala.

original: 'dir padma rnams kyi rtsa ba dang sdong bu ni aa yig las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir padma rnams kyi rtsa ba dang sdong bu ni aa yig las byung ba'o //
translated: Here, the roots and stems of the lotuses arise from the letter A.

original: 'dab ma rnams dang gser rnams ni au yig las yang dag par byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma rnams dang gser rnams ni au yig las yang dag par byung ba'o //

original: dbus kyi lte ba dang zla ba'i gdan ni ma yig las so //
analyzed: dbus kyi lte ba dang zla ba'i gdan ni ma yig las so //
translated: The central hubs and moon seats arise from the letter M.

original: nyi ma'i gdan ni yang na ra yig las so //
analyzed: nyi ma'i gdan ni yang na ra yig las so //
translated: The sun seats arise from the letter R.

original: de ltar aom yig pra na ba ni snying por gsungs te padma'o /
analyzed: de ltar aom yig pra na ba ni snying por gsungs te padma'o /
translated: Thus, the syllable O·πÉ is said to be the essence, the lotus.

original: mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba 'di la dad po lha'i sku'i dbyibs rdzogs pa'o zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba 'di la dad po lha'i sku'i dbyibs rdzogs pa'o zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: This is the birth of those born from a womb in this life, the complete shape of the body of the deity.

original: de ltar ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo rdo rje sems pas dbu brgyan pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can bsgoms te /

translated: Thus, one should meditate on the BhagavƒÅn KƒÅlacakra, who is the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses, and who is crowned with Vajrasattva, and who is the nature of the utterly pure dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de nas 'gro ba drug na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad bkug nas dkyil 'khor de nyid du bcug par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'gro ba drug na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad bkug nas dkyil 'khor de nyid du bcug par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, after all sentient beings who abide in the six realms are summoned, one should meditate on them being placed in that ma·πá·∏çala.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa khams dang bcas pa rnams rang gi snying khar bcug nas byang chub kyi sems su zhu bar gyur pa rnams rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje nas spros te byang chub kyi sems des sems can de rnams thamsüîΩcad la dbang bskur bar bsgom par bya'o //

translated: After the tathƒÅgatas, such as Vairocana, together with the elements, are placed in one‚Äôs heart and melt into bodhicitta, one should meditate on all those sentient beings being empowered by that bodhicitta, which is emanated from one‚Äôs secret vajra.

original: de nas byang chub kyi sems kyi 'od zer gyis reg pa'i sems can de rnams thams cad zhal gsum pa dang zhal sna tshogs pa dang kha dog sna tshogs pa'i lha'i rang bzhin shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can mchog gi dga' ba'i bde bas gang bar
analyzed: de nas byang chub kyi sems kyi 'od zer gyis reg pa'i sems can de rnams thams cad zhal gsum pa dang zhal sna tshogs pa dang kha dog sna tshogs pa'i lha'i rang bzhin shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can mchog gi dga' ba'i bde bas gang bar
translated: Then, those sentient beings who are touched by the light rays of the Thought of Enlightenment, all of them, should be seen as having the nature of deities with three faces, various faces, and various colors, filled with the bliss of supreme joy, the nature of wisdom and means.

original: bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on them.

original: de nas de rnams kyi rang gi lus dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin du gyur par skad cig gis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de rnams kyi rang gi lus dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin du gyur par skad cig gis blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: de la sngags kyi sa bon rnams ni gsal byed sna tshogs brtsegs pa dbyangs dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: There, the seed syllables of the mantras are the various consonants, together with the vowels.

original: 'dir gsal byed thams cad kyi tshogs ni kasha yig ste shes par byed pa des gang gi ming gi gsal byed dang po gang yin pa de sa des thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gsal byed thams cad kyi tshogs ni kasha yig ste shes par byed pa des gang gi ming gi gsal byed dang po gang yin pa de sa des thams cad bya'o //
translated: Here, the collection of all the consonants is the syllable k·π£a. By that which causes understanding, whatever is the first consonant of the name, that should be done with all of them.

original: 'dir ksha kshi kshar kshu kshli zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de @47a * //
analyzed: 'dir ksha kshi kshar kshu kshli zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de @47a * //

original: de ltar phung po lnga dang khams lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang las kyi dbang po ldan dang las kyi dbang po'i yod lnga ste de ltar skyes bu zhen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis su gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par sems can thams
analyzed: de ltar phung po lnga dang khams lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang las kyi dbang po ldan dang las kyi dbang po'i yod lnga ste de ltar skyes bu zhen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis su gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par sems can thams
translated: As such, the five aggregates, five elements, twelve sense bases, five faculties of action, and five objects of action become the thirty-two marks of the attached person.üîΩ

original: cad skad cig gis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: cad skad cig gis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in the form of the ma·πá·∏çala wheel of the thirty-two marks of the embodied one, all sentient beings should be meditated on instantly.

original: yang na rgyas par te lha mo'i gsang bar sa bon so sor re res de rnams so sor rdzogs par byas nas spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyas par te lha mo'i gsang bar sa bon so sor re res de rnams so sor rdzogs par byas nas spro bar bya'o //
translated: Or, elaborately, in the secret of the goddess, each of the seed syllables should be individually completed and emanated.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, the BhagavƒÅn declares in the Root Tantra:

original: sangs rgyas zhing na sems can gang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing na sems can gang //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever sentient beings there are in the buddhafield,

original: sku gsum dam tshig bdud rtsi yis //
analyzed: sku gsum dam tshig bdud rtsi yis //
translated: generated by the pledge am·πõta of the three vajras,

original: bskyed cing rdo rje dpal gyis reg / thams cad der ni de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: bskyed cing rdo rje dpal gyis reg / thams cad der ni de bzhin gshegs //
translated: touched by the splendor of the vajra, all of them become tathƒÅgatas there.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi ye shes thob //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi ye shes thob //
translated: They attain the pristine consciousness of the three vajras.

original: 'dir ni rdzogs sangs rgyas gyur par //
analyzed: 'dir ni rdzogs sangs rgyas gyur par //
translated: Here, they become perfect buddhas.

original: bsgoms te de nas de dag rnams //
analyzed: bsgoms te de nas de dag rnams //
translated: Having meditated, then they should be

original: rang rang zhing du rab tu gzhug ces pa'o //
analyzed: rang rang zhing du rab tu gzhug ces pa'o //
translated: introduced into their own fields.

original: sems can rnams la brtse ba'i don du dbang bskur sbyin pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la brtse ba'i don du dbang bskur sbyin pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The bestowal of initiation for the sake of compassion for sentient beings is the determination.

original: da ni zla ba bcu ba srid pa'i yan lag la srog spro ba dang gsung gi rdo rje bskyed pa'i slad du btsa' ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni zla ba bcu ba srid pa'i yan lag la srog spro ba dang gsung gi rdo rje bskyed pa'i slad du btsa' ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to expand the life-force in the tenth month, the branch of existence, and to generate the Vajra Speech, the birth is taught.

original: phyi rol du yang skyed pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang skyed pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: Externally, the second generation.

original: de la lte ba dang gtsug tor du yang ho: yig ste 'di gnyis kyi dbus su chud pa'i dpral bar sku rdo rje aom mgrin par gsung rdo rje a'a: snying gar thugs rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i yi ge gsum po'i 'di ni su gsung thugs kyi mtshan nyid
analyzed: de la lte ba dang gtsug tor du yang ho: yig ste 'di gnyis kyi dbus su chud pa'i dpral bar sku rdo rje aom mgrin par gsung rdo rje a'a: snying gar thugs rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i yi ge gsum po'i 'di ni su gsung thugs kyi mtshan nyid
translated: There, in the navel and the crown, there are also the letters HO. In the middle of these two, in the forehead, is the Body Vajra, OM. In the throat, the Speech Vajra, AH. In the heart, the Mind Vajra, HUM. These three letters are the characteristics of the body, speech, and mind of all Buddhas.

original: rtsa gsum skyed par byed pa'o /
analyzed: rtsa gsum skyed par byed pa'o /
translated: The three channels generate them.

original: lte bar ho: yig ye shes kyi 'od zer gyis zhub bde mnyam padma la ni sku gsungs thugs kyi rdo rje ste de shes rab chags pas zhu ba khyab bdag rdo rje can yang zhes pa yang yig gis shes rab dang lhan cig ri bong 'dzin pa bzhin
analyzed: lte bar ho: yig ye shes kyi 'od zer gyis zhub bde mnyam padma la ni sku gsungs thugs kyi rdo rje ste de shes rab chags pas zhu ba khyab bdag rdo rje can yang zhes pa yang yig gis shes rab dang lhan cig ri bong 'dzin pa bzhin
translated: The Lord of the Vajra, with the syllable YA, together with intuition, looks like the moon,

original: du rnam par bltas nas nang du dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa'i don dang @47b phyi rol gyi yul thams cad nye bar longs spyod pa'i don dang phyir rol du lha rdzogs pa na 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don byed pa'i slad du byas /
analyzed: du rnam par bltas nas nang du dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa'i don dang @47b phyi rol gyi yul thams cad nye bar longs spyod pa'i don dang phyir rol du lha rdzogs pa na 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don byed pa'i slad du byas /
translated: and, in order to bring down the five mandalas within, in order to enjoy all external objects, and in order to go forth to perform the welfare of all transmigrators when the deity is perfected externally,

original: pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin can /
analyzed: pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin can /
translated: he is endowed with the nature of compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: sgrol ma dang m'a ma k'i dang gos dkar mo dang spyan ma ste lha mo rnams kyis glu dag mdzad pa /
analyzed: sgrol ma dang m'a ma k'i dang gos dkar mo dang spyan ma ste lha mo rnams kyis glu dag mdzad pa /
translated: The goddesses Tara, Mamaki, Pandaravasini, and Lochana sing songs:

original: bcom ldan khyod ni sems can kun la phan par mdzad pa po //
analyzed: bcom ldan khyod ni sems can kun la phan par mdzad pa po //
translated: Bhagavat, you are the one who acts for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: bdag cag srungs shig lha mi'i bla ma rdo rje ldan pa 'dod pa don gnyer rnams la 'dod pa mdzod ces pa ste /
analyzed: bdag cag srungs shig lha mi'i bla ma rdo rje ldan pa 'dod pa don gnyer rnams la 'dod pa mdzod ces pa ste /
translated: Protect us, O Vajradhara, best of gods and men!

original: byams pa'i rang bzhin sgrol mas thugs rdo rje dang / snying rje'i rang bzhin m'a ma k'is sku rdo rje dang / dga' ba'i rang bzhin gos dkar mos gsungs rdo rje dang / btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin spyan mas ye shas rdo rje skul bar byed do //
analyzed: byams pa'i rang bzhin sgrol mas thugs rdo rje dang / snying rje'i rang bzhin m'a ma k'is sku rdo rje dang / dga' ba'i rang bzhin gos dkar mos gsungs rdo rje dang / btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin spyan mas ye shas rdo rje skul bar byed do //
translated: The nature of love, Tara, impels the Vajra of Mind; the nature of compassion, Mamaki, impels the Vajra of Body; the nature of joy, Pandaravasini, impels the Vajra of Speech; and the nature of equanimity, Locana, impels the Vajra of Gnosis.

original: de ltar thugs dang sku dang gsung ye shes kyi bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can des rnams kyi glu dag gsan nas 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang mig 'phrul lta bur gzigs nas zla
analyzed: de ltar thugs dang sku dang gsung ye shes kyi bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can des rnams kyi glu dag gsan nas 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang mig 'phrul lta bur gzigs nas zla
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder, whose nature is the Vajras of Mind, Body, Speech, and Gnosis, having heard the songs of the goddesses, sees the three worlds of desire, form, and formlessness as an optical illusion, and, in order to liberate beings, he utters this song:üîΩThe three worlds are like an optical illusion.

original: ba zhu ba de la h'um yig kha dog sngon po dri ma med pa'i 'od zer 'phro ba ltas te de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ba zhu ba de la h'um yig kha dog sngon po dri ma med pa'i 'od zer 'phro ba ltas te de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'o //
translated: The syllable h≈´·πÉ is the color of the moon, and it is the source of stainless light rays. It is transformed into a vajra.

original: de las spros pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i rgyan dang ldan zhing rgyal ba'i bdag po'i cod pan can shes rab kyis 'khyud par gyur pa yang rdzogs pa'o //

translated: The completion process is free from conceptualization.

original: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba //
translated: Arisen from space, self-arisen,

original: shes rab ye shes me bo che //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes me bo che //
translated: the great fire of wisdom and gnosis,

analyzed: 'od chen rnam @49b par snang par byed //

original: ye shes snang pa lam me pa /
analyzed: ye shes snang pa lam me pa /

analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rnam pa lngas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: and so on‚Äîone should understand it through the five aspects of manifest, complete enlightenment.

original: da ni 'od zer sngon po zhes pa la sogs pas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni 'od zer sngon po zhes pa la sogs pas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, the summoning of the wheel of pristine consciousness is stated beginning with ‚Äúblue light rays,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir byis ba skyes pa'i dbu ma'i srog 'byung ba ni 'od zer sngon po ste de'i 'byung bas dbang po rnams rab tu sad cing phyi rol gyi yul rnams la rnam par shes pa drug po rnams 'jug pa ni nang du'o //
analyzed: 'dir byis ba skyes pa'i dbu ma'i srog 'byung ba ni 'od zer sngon po ste de'i 'byung bas dbang po rnams rab tu sad cing phyi rol gyi yul rnams la rnam par shes pa drug po rnams 'jug pa ni nang du'o //
translated: Here, the life-force of the central nƒÅ·∏çƒ´ of a newborn infant is the blue light rays. Since that arises, the faculties are fully activated, and the six consciousnesses engage external objects.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi lha rdzogs pa la dbu ma'i srog rnam par dag pas rdo rje shugs 'od zer sngon po 'jigs pa'i sku rab tu bzhad pa'i zhal mche ba phyed gtsigs pa sgra drag po sgrogs pa spyan bcu gnyis pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi lha rdzogs pa la dbu ma'i srog rnam par dag pas rdo rje shugs 'od zer sngon po 'jigs pa'i sku rab tu bzhad pa'i zhal mche ba phyed gtsigs pa sgra drag po sgrogs pa spyan bcu gnyis pa //
translated: Therefore, the external perfect deity is the vajra speed, the blue light rays, the terrifying body, the face with bared fangs, the loud sound, and the twelve eyes.

original: gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ste phyag nyi shu rtsa drug pa zhal bzhi pa zhabs gnyis pa shes rab dang thabs las rab tu byung ba gtso bo bzhin du mtshon cha rnams dang bcas pa glang po che'i pags pa'i gos 'dzin pa phyag rgya ldas rnam par brgyan
analyzed: gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ste phyag nyi shu rtsa drug pa zhal bzhi pa zhabs gnyis pa shes rab dang thabs las rab tu byung ba gtso bo bzhin du mtshon cha rnams dang bcas pa glang po che'i pags pa'i gos 'dzin pa phyag rgya ldas rnam par brgyan
translated: He has twenty-six arms, four faces, and two legs. He is fully ordained from wisdom and means. He holds an elephant skin and is adorned with the eight-part mudra.

original: pa mi bskyod pas dbu brgyan pa thod pa dang mgo bo'i phreng ba 'dzin pa sbrul gyis brgyan pa h'um yig rdo rje'i sprul pa rkang pa brgyad pa'i shing rta dag la gnas zhes pa sgra dang reg bya dang ro dang gzugs dang dri dang snying stobs dang
analyzed: pa mi bskyod pas dbu brgyan pa thod pa dang mgo bo'i phreng ba 'dzin pa sbrul gyis brgyan pa h'um yig rdo rje'i sprul pa rkang pa brgyad pa'i shing rta dag la gnas zhes pa sgra dang reg bya dang ro dang gzugs dang dri dang snying stobs dang
translated: He is crowned with AkÀùhobhya, holds a skull cup and a garland of heads, is adorned with snakes, and is the emanation of the syllable h≈´·πÉ. He is mounted on a chariot drawn by eight horses, which are the qualities of sound, touch, taste, form, smell, courage,

original: rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan la gnas pa rgyal ba'i dgra ni 'joms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan la gnas pa rgyal ba'i dgra ni 'joms par byed pa ste /
